"With the Dao-Transformation Stone to help you alleviate and sort out the events happening in the Xuanhuang Realm, it should make things easier for you."

"But relying solely on the Dao-Transformation Stone is not enough." The Stone Tablet's eyes narrowed slightly, waiting for the other party's next words.

"The Dao-Transcendence Sect, Fellow Daoist should be familiar with it." Li Ping asked.

Upon hearing these three words, the Stone Tablet's expression turned slightly displeased. "The True Sight Divine Eye of the Dao-Transcendence Sect has a similar effect to the Creation Stone Tablet. Combined with the endless paper figures, that Book of Dao-Transcendence can also record everything it monitors."

"The Book of Dao-Transcendence, combined with the Dao-Transformation Stone, should be sufficient to offset the side effects of the Creation Stone Tablet. As for the rest, I believe your tenacious will, cultivated over tens of thousands of years, should be able to handle it." The Faceless Saint Emperor spoke slowly.

The Stone Tablet fell silent, pondering the feasibility of the other party's suggestion.

"First, the quality of the Dao-Transformation Stone in your hand is somewhat insufficient..." After a moment, the Stone Tablet spoke.

"It's fine, I can find a better one," the Saint Emperor replied directly.

The Stone Tablet paused, then continued, "Second, the Dao-Transcendence Sect angered the Law Transmitter back then, and the entire sect was sealed away and disappeared. Due to their cultivation technique [Eternal Tribulation World], they can even interfere with Heaven and Earth's perception. Moreover, it was the Law Transmitter who acted, so..."

"I know where they are hiding," the Saint Emperor said calmly.

The Stone Tablet was astonished. "It seems this person is even stronger than I imagined."

Since the other party had said so much, the Stone Tablet naturally would not continue to stall. "Please lend me your assistance, Fellow Daoist." It spoke sincerely.

Li Ping was waiting for this sentence. "Follow me." His figure flickered, and he instantly appeared at the edge of the sky. The Stone Tablet followed suit, its figure moving swiftly.

Only Ou Shangtian was left behind, looking bewildered. He had not heard the conversation between the Saint Emperor and the Stone Tablet. Ever since Li Ping pointed towards the Fishing Pond, Ou Shangtian had lost the ability to perceive these two powerful beings. Only when they left one after the other did he react.

"Didn't Master want to deal with that Stone Tablet? Why aren't they fighting?"

"Could it be that, like the Earth Vein Ancient Tree, he's also joining our Sacred Dynasty?" Ou Shangtian immediately had a bad premonition.

At this moment, Li Ping and the Stone Tablet had already arrived outside the Dao-Transcendence Sect's sealing location. Watching Li Ping skillfully break the Law Transmitter's seal, the doubts in the Stone Tablet's heart grew.

"This is a seal left by the Law Transmitter. Even a Heavenly Dao incarnation cannot break it so easily?"

"Or perhaps, after so many years, the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao has recovered enough strength to contend with the Law Transmitter?"

Li Ping ignored the Stone Tablet's thoughts and led it all the way into the Dao-Transcendence Sect. Up the mountain, down the mountain, endless repeating courtyards... Everything transformed rapidly before his eyes, and finally, the main hall of the Dao-Transcendence Sect appeared before them.

"Enter." The Stone Tablet followed him inside and confirmed that this was indeed the former location of the Dao-Transcendence Sect. It could sense that countless lifelike and deathlike paper figures were hidden within this gloomy main hall.

"They were one of the Ten Immortal Sects of the Xuanhuang Realm, enjoying the cultivation resources generated by the Xuanhuang Realm. Yet, when disaster struck, they chose to hide and escape. They are truly like those so-called Seers of the Worlds, parasites of the Xuanhuang Realm." Li Ping's words were cold and merciless, criticizing them without reservation.

The Stone Tablet squinted its eyes, neither agreeing nor disagreeing.

"Eternal Tribulation World, cultivating through the calamities of the world. This is inherently a wicked technique that harms Heaven and Earth. If Heaven and Earth were flourishing and free from calamities, perhaps these people would stir up trouble and create calamities. Such a sect should have been exterminated long ago." Li Ping continued.

As if hearing the Saint Emperor's words, a cold wind inexplicably blew through the gloomy hall.

"Thinking they could escape everything by transforming into paper figures..." A golden chain emerged from the Saint Emperor's body. Silently, it shot into the depths of the darkness.

As if stirring up mist, the darkness within the Dao-Transcendence Sect's main hall fluctuated like water waves. The Stone Tablet observed the golden chain, a flicker of surprise in its eyes.

Then, a phantom image of a golden vortex slowly formed within Li Ping's body. Thousands of golden chains, following the rotation of the vortex, whistled out. Bang, bang... They flew into the darkness, as if colliding with something, emitting muffled sounds.

The Saint Emperor's imposing aura was too overwhelming. Even the Stone Tablet had to take a step back temporarily. The Stone Tablet couldn't help but secretly marvel, "This person's strength is indeed much greater than ordinary [Longevity Realm] cultivators."

"And..."

"It seems to be more than just the power of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao."

The sound of creaking could be heard continuously in the hall. As the golden vortex nebula within the Saint Emperor rotated in reverse, and the golden chains retracted. Something in the darkness seemed to be bound by the chains and was being forcibly dragged out.

If ordinary cultivators saw this scene, they would surely feel a chill run down their spines. However, the Stone Tablet felt a rare flicker of excitement in its heart.

When a paper figure with a somewhat terrified expression emerged from the darkness, the Stone Tablet's eyebrows couldn't help but rise. It was these bastards! The paper figures.

Chapter 1257: Stone Mother Returns Beyond the Stars

The Saint Emperor's intention was clear. With the Sacred Dynasty on the verge of war with the Myriad Immortals Alliance, it was time for the Taiyan Sect to make its final choice. When Sun Erlang found Yi Shu in Saint Capital City, Yi Shu was already prepared, waiting with a smile.

"Young Master, shall we go?"

Sun Erlang, without any pretense, cupped his hands, and the two headed straight for the Taiyan Sect.

"Senior, during your stay in our Sacred Dynasty, did you have any unique gains?" Sun Erlang asked tentatively on the journey back.

Yi Shu smiled, "The scenes of the Sacred Dynasty are different from the Myriad Immortals Alliance, and even more so from the Xuanhuang Realm's countless millennia. We have benefited immensely. Currently, the sect has reached a consensus and has also received acknowledgement from the Stone Mother. You will know when the time comes."

"By the way, perhaps this time you will have the opportunity to meet the Stone Mother."

Yi Shu's words stirred Sun Erlang's heart. When he tried to probe for more insider information, Yi Shu changed the subject, chatting about his recent experiences in Great Qi.

"The people of the Sacred Dynasty have abundant food and clothing, thus they have a higher pursuit of spiritual matters. Although their cultivation and strength are ordinary, certain ideas are truly interesting. This time, I befriended a scholar who wrote a collection of strange tales. It describes what would happen in the Xuanhuang Realm without the existence of Celestial Venerables who transmit laws…"

Sun Erlang was slightly taken aback, and then heard Yi Shu continue, "Unlike the simulated worlds you've experienced, in that novel, although the transmission of laws is not evident, calamities still befall and plague the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Three Venerables rise from humble beginnings, gaining widespread influence and standing as rivals. One, through enlightenment and nurturing the populace, becomes the [Teacher of Heaven and Earth]. One, with the pure and noble virtues of a sage, wins the hearts of those around him, forming an unshakeable alliance. This is the [Supreme Sage of the Mortal Realm]. One, with boundless might, establishes an earthly immortal dynasty. Wherever his forces point, all things submit. This is the [Grand Mystic Immortal Emperor]…"

Yi Shu paused here, and Sun Erlang's expression became very subtle.

"The three Venerables clash fiercely, battling for hundreds of years without a clear victor. The details of this conflict, deduced by personal strength, though somewhat crude and requiring refinement, are still very interesting and novel…"

Sun Erlang couldn't help but ask, "In the end, who won?"

"This 'Romance of the Xuanhuang's Three Parts' had not yet been completed when that scholar's doorstep was mobbed. Everyone claimed he was deeply disrespectful to the Saint Emperor and intended to teach him a lesson. Although the Sacred Dynasty's officials did not intervene, as the 'Grand Mystic Immortal Emperor' in the 'Romance' made some errors, the turmoil only escalated, almost resulting in a fatality."

"That scholar dared not continue writing. The plot stagnated, and I don't know who the final victor is," Yi Shu said with a half-smile.

Sun Erlang coughed lightly, "After I return, I will deal with those people and let him write with peace of mind. It's just a collection of strange tales, after all. Master wouldn't possibly find it intolerable!"

Yi Shu hinted, "Although the Saint Emperor indeed wouldn't care, the people of the Sacred Dynasty might not necessarily think so."

Sun Erlang was about to argue, but they had already arrived within the Taiyan Sect's territory.

Within the floating city inside the celestial crystal wall, Sun Erlang stepped in again. Unlike last time, the cultivators he encountered on the way all greeted him with beaming smiles. It was as if they were all very familiar with him. Sun Erlang naturally knew that the Taiyan Sect's information was shared, essentially making them a single entity. However, this feeling of the other party knowing him, while he didn't know their backgrounds, still made Sun Erlang feel a bit awkward.

Fortunately, the journey was not long, and soon Sun Erlang reached the Taiyan Sect's central hub and met Chen Tianhai. Chen Tianhai was holding a scroll and reading it intently. Yi Shu did not enter.

"Greetings, Senior." Sun Erlang bowed. Chen Tianhai remained unmoved, seemingly not having heard him. After a long silence, Chen Tianhai finally spoke, getting straight to the point, "With the impending war between the Sacred Dynasty and the Myriad Immortals Alliance, our Taiyan Sect has decided…"

"To neither side."

This answer was truly beyond Sun Erlang's expectations, leaving him stunned on the spot. Wouldn't even a token show of support be appropriate? Being a fence-sitter, watching the tigers fight, might ensure temporary peace, but after everything settled, they would surely face severe repercussions. Logically, the Taiyan Sect shouldn't make such an unwise decision. Sun Erlang looked at Chen Tianhai, full of confusion.

"We made this decision, not only after the Stone Mother's countless deductions yielded nearly identical winning outcomes…"

"But more importantly, because we've decided to temporarily leave the Xuanhuang Realm!" Chen Tianhai said, his words earth-shattering.

"What?!" Sun Erlang was utterly stunned.

"Is it because of the 'Empyrean Rainbow Light' that's causing such a stir recently?" Sun Erlang asked.

"Yes and no. In fact, our Taiyan Sect had long intended to venture into the starry sky. It's just that the sea of stars is perilous, and it was always put on indefinite hold. However, that sword message from across the sea of stars changed our minds," Chen Tianhai said with a slight smile.

"The sword message illuminated the Xuanhuang sky for seven days. During that time, we conducted a thorough analysis and achieved some minor gains. Since the sword message could traverse the sea of stars, our Taiyan Sect can trace its origin and follow its path back to find the sender," Chen Tianhai said with full confidence.

"Beyond the sea of stars, beneath the High Wall, it truly is a place to yearn for," Chen Tianhai sighed. Sun Erlang also seemed to feel the same will resonating throughout the Taiyan Sect. Knowing that this matter could no longer be stopped, Sun Erlang's thoughts raced, wanting to return quickly and inform his Master.

"Young Master, there's no need to rush. After this parting, we don't know when we'll meet again. Why not have a meeting with the Stone Mother?" Chen Tianhai looked at Sun Erlang and suggested. Sun Erlang hesitated for a moment, then finally nodded. The moment he agreed, the surrounding room vanished, as if they were suddenly in the vast, dark expanse of the sea of stars. Only a brilliant blue light, originating from the depths of the darkness, shot out like a thin line, speeding through the starry sea.

Upon seeing this blue line, Sun Erlang instantly understood. This was the Dao-Transformation Stone Mother. The original Dao-Transformation Stone.

"I was not originally from the Xuanhuang. However, by chance, while traversing the sea of stars, I arrived in this realm." A voice appeared in Sun Erlang's mind. Communication was not through the five senses or divine sense, but directly through the resonance between the Dao-Transformation Stone crystals in Sun Erlang's sea of consciousness.

Sun Erlang's expression became solemn, showing his respect. The Stone Mother continued her narration regardless, "Where I came from is now irretrievable. However, where I am going, there is an answer."

The Stone Mother's words sent shockwaves through Sun Erlang. "Where you are going? What do you mean, Stone Mother?"

"Beyond the sea of stars is not the 'beyond'. It is merely a corner of the land. If not for the High Wall blocking the way, I should have long departed ten thousand years ago. Furthermore, after being sundered and divided, I lost the ability to traverse the starry sky. Helplessly, the matter was dropped, and so many years have passed in the blink of an eye."

The scene before Sun Erlang's eyes suddenly changed. The blue line, originally flying in a straight line through the starry sea, inexplicably changed direction and plunged towards the Xuanhuang Realm. Discovered by cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm, with its assistance, the Taiyan Sect leaped to become a renowned sect in the world. The sundered entity, with no hope of recovery. Unexpectedly, the Xuanhuang Realm underwent drastic changes, and calamities descended. To resist the tribulation of 'laws cannot be cultivated simultaneously,' the Taiyan Sect cultivators proactively decided to merge with the Dao-Transformation Stone. Information immortal, Dao-Transformation reappears. After tens of thousands of years of separation and rejoining, the Dao-Transformation Stone returned to its initial state upon arriving in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Scene after scene flashed by, deeply shaking Sun Erlang. He couldn't help but ask, "Senior has been in the Xuanhuang Realm for so long, possessing near omniscience. As long as you remain in the Xuanhuang, remaining unharmed through all tribulations is not a mere illusion. Why must you leave? Outside the sea of stars, there are too many variables and unknowns. Even you, Senior, likely have no absolute certainty of survival, right?"

"Why must I leave? The answer to this question is the same as why you cultivators must cultivate." The Stone Mother's words rendered Sun Erlang speechless. "The High Wall blocks the sea of stars. But some things, it cannot stop," the Dao-Transformation Stone Mother's tone was inexplicable.

With a sense of bewilderment and an inexplicable surge of confidence, she continued, "Little one, you don't need to overthink. I'm merely planning to take a look first. If I truly cannot cross the High Wall, we might return. As for why I wanted to meet you this time…"

The illusory blue line before Sun Erlang's eyes suddenly became solidified, shooting directly towards Sun Erlang's head. Before he could react, Sun Erlang was struck by the blue beam. He inspected his body but felt no abnormality. Only the Dao-Transformation Stone crystal in his sea of consciousness seemed to have become slightly different.

"Little one, there's no need to be nervous. It's just a marker, lest we lose our way when we plan to return."

"Of course, we won't mistreat you. Concentrate…" The Stone Mother's words coincided with the flashing of the Dao-Transformation Stone. In Sun Erlang's perception, countless images surged, almost overwhelming his sea of consciousness. He quickly composed himself, slowing down the reception of the images. These numerous scenes depicted the Sacred Dynasty in bitter battles with heavy casualties, and also the Sacred Dynasty achieving victory after victory, forcing the Myriad Immortals Alliance to cling to survival in the central four prefectures. However, without exception, all were events that had not yet occurred in the real world.

"These are my deductions, presented to you as reference." Sun Erlang felt relieved and hastily thanked the Stone Mother.

"However, I must warn you, do not place too much faith in these deductions."

"This Xuanhuang Realm is like a bottomless pond. If it's calm, every ripple on the surface can be deduced. But if the ferocious beasts at the bottom all surface, churning the waters…"

"The deduction of the ripples will inevitably diverge greatly from reality. Your Master will surely understand this principle."

"So, whether our Taiyan Sect is here or not, it won't change things much." The Dao-Transformation Stone Mother's voice still echoed in his ears. Snapping back to reality, Sun Erlang found himself outside the Taiyan Sect. The previously inconspicuous crystal wall had inexplicably gained a layer of mysterious blue light. The entire Taiyan Sect became even more transparent, as if it could disappear from this world at any moment.

"Young Master, you must live well."

"Otherwise, our Taiyan Sect won't be able to find its way home," Yi Shu's voice echoed with a smile, as if a hallucination. In his bewilderment, the floating celestial city before his eyes had already vanished from Sun Erlang's senses.

"To leave just like that, it's too fast," Sun Erlang muttered, feeling a sense of wistful loss. He stood there for a long time before returning to report the entire incident to his Master in detail. Looking at the Faceless Saint Emperor seated above, silent, Sun Erlang felt a little nervous. However, the Saint Emperor's subsequent words left him somewhat stunned.

"What marker? It's merely the Stone Mother's jest. The Dao-Transformation Divine Stone is an unparalleled treasure. That Rainbow Light Sword Message, even I, couldn't decipher it for a while, yet she cracked it in such a short time…"

"She can trace its origin and traverse the sea of stars, how could she possibly lose her way?"

"Master, that…" Sun Erlang was somewhat confused, "The profound feeling when the blue line collided with the Dao-Transformation Stone in my sea of consciousness was indeed real." The Saint Emperor smiled, a rare occurrence.

"It is your good fortune."

"All Dao-Transformation Stones in the world, strictly speaking, are merely fragments separated from the Stone Mother. Although cultivators can use the Dao-Transformation Divine Method to claim them as their own, fragments are still fragments. Even the highest quality Dao-Transformation Stone cannot compare to the Stone Mother. However, that blue radial light the Stone Mother used on you is like turning stone into gold…"

The Saint Emperor's tone was somewhat peculiar, "Although its quality is currently only top-grade, it has been enlightened and now possesses infinite potential."

"Perhaps it will become another Stone Mother in time."

"This…" To think that after leaving, she would bestow such a grand fortune upon him. Sun Erlang was left stunned. "Don't overthink it. Everyone has their own fortune. Perhaps the Stone Mother simply found you agreeable," the Saint Emperor said indifferently.

"Yes…" Although Sun Erlang replied, his expression suggested he hadn't quite come to terms with it yet.

"Oh, right. Master, those thousands of deduction results from the Stone Mother…"

"Analyze and report them after you've calmed down."

"As you command." Sun Erlang left the Saint Emperor's throne in a daze. Unconsciously, he arrived at the residence of the scholar who wrote the 'Romance of the Xuanhuang's Three Parts', as Yi Shu had mentioned. He saw that a crowd was still gathered at the entrance of the house. Although they hadn't done anything excessive, they were glaring intently at the exit, as if they held an irreconcilable grudge against the scholar inside. Seeing Sun Erlang, their faces lit up, and they eagerly stepped forward, intending to recount the scholar's alleged transgressions. But Sun Erlang interrupted them with a slight frown. The crowd, understanding, dispersed. Sun Erlang strode into the house. The scholar was heavily drunk. Sun Erlang picked up the manuscript from the table and began to read.

Chapter 1258: Flowing Crystals Lead to Disputes

The handwriting was extremely hurried, with large sections even smudged and crossed out.

However, Sun Erlang could still grasp the general idea.

The Celestial Empire ruled by Emperor Taiyuan grew increasingly prosperous, with an endless stream of talented individuals. In its conflicts with the other two kingdoms, it achieved repeated victories.

The Teacher of Heaven and Earth and the Supreme Sage of Man were forced to join forces to counter the might of Taiyuan…

This plot was clearly not what the scholar truly intended.

Not only was the writing style and wording much weaker than before, but even the attitude towards writing felt perfunctory. Perhaps he couldn't bear it any longer and, unwilling to continue, spent his days drowning his sorrows in alcohol, living in a state of daze.

Sun Erlang was not surprised by this outcome.

In the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, the symbols on Emperor Taiyuan and the Faceless Saint Emperor were too similar. As long as he suffered even the slightest setback in the plot, the scholar would be subjected to widespread condemnation. Under such real-world pressure, Emperor Taiyuan could naturally only be continuously successful in the plot. Over time, his strength would far surpass that of the other two sages.

However, Sun Erlang was somewhat curious about the original direction of the plot the scholar had envisioned.

With a thought, Sun Erlang sent a strand of his divine sense into the scholar's sea of consciousness.

Before long, amidst the many chaotic thoughts, he found the content related to the "Romance of the Xuanhuang's Three Parts."

It had to be said that the scholar was, after all, a native citizen of the Sacred Dynasty. Having basked in the Saint Emperor's grace for years, his subconscious reverence for the Saint Emperor led him to envision an ending where Emperor Taiyuan, after overcoming various difficulties, suppressed the other two victors one by one, unifying the Xuanhuang Realm.

However, this would involve failures and setbacks, and at one point, he would even fall into a desperate situation, with his life hanging by a thread.

Sun Erlang had to admit that compared to the modified version seen in reality, the initial plot arrangement in the scholar's mind was more dramatic and captivating.

"As the saying goes, writing should be like appreciating mountains, not seeking flatness. In comparison, the version outside is as bland as chewing wax."

Although Sun Erlang thought this, the content of the book involved his Master, so he didn't dare to act arbitrarily.

He flashed back to the Saint Emperor's Throne and reported the matter to Li Ping.

It was merely a small matter, yet for some reason, it caused the Saint Emperor to fall into a long silence.

"Emperor Taiyuan is me, the Supreme Sage of Man is me, and the Teacher of Heaven and Earth is also me."

Finally, the Saint Emperor slowly uttered a sentence that echoed in the cold Saint Emperor's Throne.

Sun Erlang was first stunned, then suddenly enlightened.

With a look of joy, he departed.

However, Li Ping's heart, which was usually unshakeable by external matters, was stirred by this incident, creating ripples that could not be calmed.

He perhaps understood why the Law Transmitter, after establishing the Myriad Immortals Alliance, had ceased to concern himself with world affairs and did not appear in public view.

…

In the Hongze Realm.

Zhang Ming, a Golden Core cultivator stationed in this world by the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, suddenly received a report from his subordinate.

It seemed some unwelcome guests from the Myriad Immortals Alliance had intruded into this small world.

"Three Nascent Souls, seven Golden Cores."

Zhang Ming's brows furrowed tightly.

Although he had immediately sent a distress message to the Sacred Dynasty, the fact that a large-scale [Void Crystal] vein had just been discovered here made Zhang Ming's unease unbearable.

"This Hongze Realm is not large, and the breath carried by the Void Crystal is very unique. Even if I use formations to conceal it slightly, I'm afraid it will be difficult to escape their detection."

"It seems this battle is unavoidable."

Zhang Ming quickly calculated the strength he could currently mobilize.

Including himself, there were only five Golden Cores at most.

The gap in strength was undeniable, and defeat seemed inevitable.

If he chose to retreat, the Sacred Dynasty would not impose severe punishment.

However, the pride of a soldier of the Great Qi dictated that Zhang Ming would never withdraw without even the courage to fight.

Zhang Ming acted decisively and unleashed the only [Sky Shrouding Talisman].

As the name suggests, the Sky Shrouding Talisman could conceal heavenly secrets.

As is well known, after cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm perish, celestial phenomena appear in the sky. The life of the fallen cultivator, and even the specific cause of death, are displayed in great detail on the celestial screen.

Under normal circumstances, it was fine, but in a life-or-death battle like this, the occurrence of casualties on either side would be instantly transmitted, significantly increasing the difficulty of combat.

However, with the [Sky Shrouding Talisman], the situation could be reversed and even turned into an advantageous combat condition for oneself.

The Sky Shrouding Talisman could not only conceal the celestial phenomena of a cultivator's demise but also precisely identify friend and foe, treating them differently.

If our side killed enemy cultivators, no phenomena would be generated. But if one of our cultivators were killed, phenomena would still appear to remind us.

Although the specific principle of this talisman's effectiveness was unknown, there was no doubt that this single Sky Shrouding Talisman could shift the balance of advantage by a fraction.

"This talisman alone is not enough."

Zhang Ming looked at a small white jade arrow in his embrace.

"Unfortunately, given our squad's qualifications, we can only apply for one Army Annihilation Arrow each time we go out."

"If I could get more, let alone these Nascent Soul cultivators, I wouldn't fear even Soul Transformation cultivators."

The Army Annihilation Arrow was a weakened version of the Sacred Dynasty's Celestial Patrol Arrow.

Although weakened, it could cause devastating damage to cultivators at or below the Nascent Soul stage.

Furthermore, it came with tracking and aura-locking functions; once targeted, escape was impossible.

"There's only one, it needs to be utilized to its fullest."

Soon, Zhang Ming devised a plan.

"Fu Ge!"

"Reporting, sir!" A mid-stage Golden Core cultivator in a dark yellow uniform responded.

"Use the [Flowing Stream Talisman] to transport these Void Crystals to here, underground," Zhang Ming marked the specific location on the map.

Fu Ge did not hesitate and accepted the storage ring handed over by Zhang Ming.

With a flash of yellow light, he vanished from the ground.

The storage ring contained all that Zhang Ming and his team had mined, only a small portion of this giant vein.

However, if it were detonated and guided through special means, the scattered aura would be enough to attract the attention of the Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators above.

"Bing San!"

"You arrange formations along the way to impede them. Remember, do not let them have it too easy, nor should you deploy those lethal formations."

A middle-aged man with a dark yellow complexion responded and departed.

…

Zhang Ming meticulously deployed his forces in a short time.

However, even with their unique skills, they were still stretched thin in the face of absolute power disparity.

The plan encountered an unexpected hitch in the very first step.

Those Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators were not ordinary individuals. The one responsible for luring them to the ambush site was named Qiu Di.

Among this team, his遁术 (escape technique) was particularly outstanding.

Unexpectedly, after just a brief encounter, before he could even use his escape technique, he was trapped by a Cavernary Divine Domain displayed by a white-robed man from the Myriad Immortals Alliance group.

This Cavernary Divine Domain was quite peculiar. It did not manifest any specific imagery, only emitting white light rings that suppressed Qiu Di.

After trying various methods and seeing no hope of escape,

Qiu Di resolutely detonated himself, ending his own life.

Sensing the disappearance of his subordinate's life force, Zhang Ming's heart clenched, and his fists tightened.

These Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators, evidently, had not expected their opponent to be so resolute. He committed suicide at the slightest disagreement.

The atmosphere instantly turned bizarre.

"Wait, Brother Lin Bai, something's not right!"

After a while, someone among them reacted.

"Why is there no phenomenon of demise?"

"Was it a feigned death?"

"Unlikely, his soul and spirit were indeed annihilated."

Lin Bai's expression turned solemn, and he looked up at the sky.

After a while, his face grew grim. "Be careful, someone has concealed the heavenly secrets."

Despite his warning, the others did not become fearful but, instead, extremely excited.

"Concealed heavenly secrets? Even this seemingly ordinary small world has employed such methods. It seems there's a secret!"

"We've searched several places in vain, and finally, we're about to find something."

"Even if it's not Void Crystal, if we can uncover the secret of this place, perhaps this trip won't be in vain."

…

While everyone was discussing, they suddenly felt the ground tremble slightly.

At the same time, a familiar aura emanated from underground.

"This is…"

Everyone was initially stunned.

Then, with disbelief etched on their faces: "It really is Void Crystal?"

In their perception, besides the dispersed crystal aura, they also seemed to sense several figures rapidly fleeing from the underground tremors.

"They're abandoning their efforts, trying to escape now that they can't hide it?"

Everyone subconsciously thought this.

Although they desperately wanted to investigate immediately, they remained somewhat cautious and did not act rashly, instead looking to Lin Bai in unison.

Lin Bai pondered for a moment and quickly made a decision.

"Split into two groups. Brother Qian, you take three people to pursue the fleeing cultivators, the rest will go with me."

Without any further ado, the Myriad Immortals Alliance group quickly split into four, chasing towards the horizon.

Lin Bai, leading the remaining group, headed towards where the Void Crystal aura originated from underground.

Along the way, although formations blocked their path,

They were easily broken.

"These formations, at least, were set up by a Nascent Soul formation master."

"And many of these formations, I've never seen before. Interesting…"

Everyone's excitement grew.

Soon, they arrived at their destination.

A massive cavity left by an explosion, with quite a few Void Crystal fragments faintly visible.

"Damn it! That ruthless! They actually destroyed it all!"

"What a waste! A fist-sized crystal now costs fifty thousand contribution points! And it's impossible to find!"

"There are still many fragments, quickly pick them up, don't waste them!"

…

Initially, the Myriad Immortals Alliance group maintained some semblance of order.

However, upon seeing the ground covered in Void Crystal fragments, their greed was ignited, and they could no longer hold back.

Scrambling, they all flew into the cavity.

Although Lin Bai was also tempted, he habitually observed his surroundings first.

After seemingly detecting no danger, he also followed them in.

"Strange, this doesn't look like the original underground vein of the crystal. Could it be their storage depot…"

Lin Bai picked up a small crystal fragment, and this thought arose in his mind.

At that moment, his expression suddenly changed.

A small white jade arrow had, at some point, silently shot from the dark depths of the ground towards the cultivators in the cavity.

"Careful!" Lin Bai instinctively shouted.

He fully activated his Cavernary Divine Domain and deployed hundreds of command flags to protect himself.

However, the white jade arrow was faster than they expected.

An incredibly dazzling light sphere was born underground.

In an instant, it engulfed all the cultivators in the cavity.

Even their caverns completely dissipated.

Not far away, watching the deaths of the Myriad Immortals Alliance members, Zhang Ming felt no fluctuation in his heart.

"Brother Qiu Di, may you rest in peace."

Without any further delay, Zhang Ming hurried towards his subordinates who were acting as decoys.

Compared to their side, their situation was quite tragic.

Without a powerful weapon like the Army Annihilation Arrow, they could only rely on minor tricks to delay. They were quickly caught up by the Myriad Immortals Alliance group.

They fell into a bitter struggle.

By the time Zhang Ming led his group to arrive, only two were left desperately holding on.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivator named Qian was still trying to persuade them: "Two fellow Daoists, why go through all this trouble? It's just an external object, how can it compare to your own life? We also have no intention of taking your lives…"

Even as he spoke, his offensive actions did not cease.

The armor on Zhang Ming's body erupted with a crimson glow.

Transforming into a red line, it shot directly towards the Qian-named cultivator.

"Brother Qian, be careful!"

After all, the power gap was too great. Even with the protective armor, it was not enough to compensate for the difference between Golden Core and Nascent Soul.

He was still dodged.

The sneak attack failed, and instead, he was heavily wounded by the opponent.

The armor's light suddenly dimmed.

"Hm? What kind of protective magic artifact is this? It shows no signs of cracking after my full-power strike?"

The Qian-named cultivator's tone was filled with surprise, and even more so with greed.

"It seems we are destined to die here."

Zhang Ming thought to himself.

However, he had no regrets.

By delaying for so long, the Sacred Dynasty's reinforcements should arrive soon.

Before the giant Void Crystal vein was discovered by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, the Sacred Dynasty could reassert control here.

"After I die, my family will be proud of me."

"Perhaps, I'll even receive a personal commendation from the Saint Emperor."

Zhang Ming's heart was at peace. Looking at the opposing Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators, he coldly said, "Burn your soul!"

His remaining subordinates, hearing this, did not hesitate.

As their souls burned, their already weakened aura suddenly surged again.

"Are you insane?!" The Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators screamed in disbelief.

For these doomed individuals, they saw no need to engage them head-on.

Even with their superior strength, the Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators focused on ensuring their own safety and dodging.

The power-boosting effect of burning souls gradually faded.

Zhang Ming and the others finally reached the end of their lives.

Just as their consciousness was about to dissipate, Zhang Ming seemed to see a familiar figure.

"Little General Sun?"

Zhang Ming felt a sense of relief.

Boundless golden light enveloped him.

Zhang Ming seemed to see the great Faceless Saint Emperor in a swirling galaxy of stars.

…

Sun Erlang collected the remaining wills of Zhang Ming and the others, then turned his gaze towards the Myriad Immortals Alliance members.

Infinite killing intent instantly enveloped them.

Moments later, the Myriad Immortals Alliance members became his escort to the afterlife, accompanying the brave warriors of the Sacred Dynasty.

Sun Erlang's gaze turned to the quiet sky, and with a thought, he pointed towards the sky.

Phenomena of demise slowly appeared.

However, they were contrary to the truth, presenting completely fabricated information about their demise.

Chapter 1259: One Person Becomes an Army

Instantly, phenomena depicting the demise of the Myriad Immortals Alliance group appeared on the firmament of the Hongze Realm.

"Nascent Soul cultivator Lin Bai, cultivated for 165 years…"

"In the Hongze Realm, while competing for Void Crystal, was besieged by Qian Sheng, Qian Ming, and Qian Su, and died after suffering grievous injuries."

"His Dao has passed, and his essence has returned to Heaven!"

…

Although they were killed by the vanguard detachment of the Sacred Dynasty, the cause of death displayed on the firmament now was a dispute with the "Qian family."

This was Sun Erlang's first time using the [Heavenly Usurpation Talisman], and the effect seemed quite good.

Sun Erlang meticulously recorded the scene in the sky with a projection stone, a cold glint flashing in his eyes.

Afterward, he found the Void Crystal ore vein in this location based on Zhang Ming's dying message.

He carefully collected it entirely, then intentionally scattered the minor debris that had fallen from the main ore vein across various parts of the Hongze Realm. Finally, he erased all traces of the struggle.

After completing all this, Sun Erlang quietly departed.

Much later, the obscured and altered heavenly secrets of the Hongze Realm slowly returned to normal.

Myriad Immortals Alliance, Yueyang Prefecture, Qian Family.

The Qian family patriarch, Qian Wanling, a peak stage Soul Transformation cultivator, had a somber expression. Standing below him were Qian Sheng, Qian Ming, Qian Su, and others, who still seemed somewhat clueless.

"Tell me about the good deeds you've done."

"What good deeds?" Qian Sheng was instantly stunned.

"Eldest Brother, why did you suddenly summon us here and act like this? What's wrong?" Qian Su also seemed somewhat perplexed.

Qian Wanling slammed the table violently: "Are you still hiding it! The Lin family has already come knocking! That Lin Bai was the successor the Lin family placed great hope in. You killed him like this, how could they let it go?! Void Crystal is a good thing, but you need to be alive to spend it!"

"Blinded by greed! Utterly foolish!"

Patriarch Qian looked at his brothers, his eyes practically spitting fire. If not for the bond of blood, he would have wished to kill them all on the spot with a single palm strike.

"Wait a minute!" Qian Ming suddenly realized, his expression changing, and he hurriedly asked, "What Lin Bai, what Void Crystal, Eldest Brother, you must be mistaken, right? We killed Lin Bai? What a joke?"

Seeing that they still refused to admit it, Qian Wanling's heart filled with extreme disappointment. "Hiding even from me for the sake of Void Crystal? Fine, fine, fine!"

Qian Wanling, enraged, immediately took out a recording stone and released the celestial phenomenon of demise from the Hongze Realm.

Looking at the heavenly dao phenomenon before them, the three Qian brothers were instantly dumbfounded.

"That's not right, Eldest Brother! We really didn't do this!"

"Someone framed us! Eldest Brother, you must believe us!"

After a brief moment of stupor, the three brothers cried out in unison, claiming injustice.

Qian Wanling stared intently at them, but he couldn't find any flaws in their expressions that suggested pretense.

"These idiotic brats' acting skills aren't this good. Could it be…"

At this point, even Qian Wanling began to hesitate.

"Then where were you three during that time recently?"

Qian Sheng and the others hesitated upon hearing this.

However, under their elder brother's killing gaze, they had no choice but to tell the truth.

"That day, we were absorbing solar energy for cultivation in a small pavilion by Yueyang Lake. Suddenly, we sensed an anomaly in a nearby earth vein, as if some treasure was about to appear. So we went to investigate. Unexpectedly, as soon as we arrived, the earth vein's power suddenly went berserk, and we were swept into the earth vein, losing control and acting on instinct…"

"We only escaped recently," Qian Sheng said truthfully.

Seeing his elder brother Qian Wanling's increasingly somber gaze, he quickly added, "Really. If you don't believe me, look. Because we were immersed in the earth vein for such a long time, the spiritual energy within my body is inevitably stained with the strong aura of the earth vein."

Qian Wanling scanned the three of them and indeed found the clear traces of earth vein power immersion. He then fell silent.

The three Qian brothers thought their eldest brother still didn't believe them and were about to continue arguing.

Only then did Qian Wanling let out a long sigh, "Even if I believe you, what then? Will the Lin family believe it? Will the world believe it?"

"This recording stone captures images that have been authenticated and cannot be forged."

"Moreover, it also involves a treasure like [Void Crystal]…"

"Our Qian family is in trouble."

Qian Sheng also slowly came to his senses, his eyes filled with rage. "Who schemed so meticulously to frame us!"

Qian Ming's eyes were even redder. "Eldest Brother, don't worry, we won't implicate the family."

Saying this, he was about to turn and leave.

"Scoundrel! Are you trying to court death by going out now?!"

Chided by Qian Wanling, he stopped.

Looking at his three brothers' aggrieved and angry appearances, Qian Wanling sighed again.

Finally, he made the decision befitting the patriarch. "At this point, being misunderstood is unavoidable."

"We can only report this matter to Lord Fan Li first…"

Fan Li was a Harmonious Dao cultivator guarding Yueyang Prefecture. He usually disliked staying in Yueyang Heavenly City and had built a small pavilion by Yueyang Lake to reside in.

"I will make the trip myself. You three remember to stay at home and do not go out."

Qian Wanling instructed seriously, then changed his appearance and left through a secret passage at home.

The bewildered Qian Sheng and the other two were left behind.

Not long after, Fan Li, who was resting in his small pavilion by Yueyang Lake, frowned upon hearing Qian Wanling's account.

At this moment, the Lin family patriarch, Lin Yufei, also arrived.

"Lord Fan, you must uphold justice for our Lin family in this matter!"

The Lin family's spies stationed outside the small pavilion in Yueyang Lake had seen Qian Wanling appear and immediately notified Lin Yufei.

Lin Yufei hurried over and, looking at Qian Wanling sitting solemnly in the pavilion, did not hide the killing intent in his eyes.

"Your Qian family is too presumptuous! You completely disregard the laws of the Immortal Alliance!"

"Brother Lin, please calm your anger. Someone has framed us in this matter," Qian Wanling said with a wry smile and offered an apology.

"Framed?! Is that heavenly phenomenon of demise in the recording stone false? Is the image recorded by the recording stone false?!"

The more Qian Wanling said, the more it seemed like a quibble and an excuse to Lin Yufei, who was already furious.

He was about to make a move right then.

"Quiet."

Fan Li snorted coldly, suppressing the confrontation between the two.

He then carefully examined the images in the recording stone, his brow furrowed.

The images were not forged.

But he had indeed noticed the anomaly in the earth vein some time ago.

The Qian family would not dare to fool him with such a ridiculous excuse.

What exactly was going on?

For a moment, Fan Li felt a headache coming on.

He knew that if this matter was not handled properly, it could very well become public knowledge.

"You two, come with me to this Hongze Realm."

Fan Li said in a deep voice.

…

However, even with Fan Li's personal visit, he could not ascertain the truth from the lingering clues in the Hongze Realm.

It was true that there were strong traces of Void Crystal remaining there.

"Old thief Qian, Lord Fan personally cast a spell to recreate the phenomenon of demise from the heavenly dao. You saw it with your own eyes, what else do you have to say?"

"Brother Lin, is it possible that this heavenly phenomenon is fake…"

"Nonsense! From today onwards, our Lin family and your Qian family are irreconcilable enemies!"

Looking at the two families whose enmity had not only not been resolved but had deepened further, Fan Li felt a headache.

He looked up at the sky above the Hongze Realm.

"Heavenly Dao… has it changed again?"

Upon returning to Yueyang Prefecture and conducting several trials and verifications, Fan Li confirmed that the celestial phenomena of cultivator demise were still effective.

However, he still had some doubts. Furthermore, Qian Wanling insisted that his three sons were being framed. And after Fan Li personally questioned the souls of the three, he was convinced that they were not the murderers.

Helpless, Fan Li had no choice but to report the matter to the Immortal Alliance headquarters.

Unbeknownst to him, this was already the second similar report received by the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

However, due to the inherent nature of the Immortal Alliance's operational system, such matters had not yet attracted the attention of the truly high-level echelons of the Alliance.

Silently, the seeds of chaos had already been sown.

Great Qi.

Sun Erlang, combining the information gathered by various spies of the Sacred Dynasty, was quite satisfied with the effect of the Heavenly Usurpation Talisman.

Because over the past thousands of years, the accuracy of the celestial phenomena of cultivator demise had been precisely verified. The cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, who had formed a fixed mindset, naturally would not suddenly doubt it.

"However, it can only be used for surprises. If used too often, it will lose its efficacy."

"It must be used at critical moments."

Sun Erlang shook his head.

He had already truthfully reported the heroic sacrifice of the Zhang Ming squad to the Sacred Emperor.

The Sacred Emperor, in a rare move, had announced this matter to the entire world, and above the Sacred Capital City, he had used his great power to create a floating divine palace.

The divine palace shone with golden light, suspended high in the nine heavens.

From any corner of Great Qi, one could see the divine palace's brilliance, like a sun in the sky.

The Sacred Emperor declared that any soldier who sacrificed themselves for the Sacred Dynasty would have their statue formed in the divine palace after death.

Although they had lost their physical forms, they would be eternally preserved as heroic spirits.

The golden, light-emitting specters of Zhang Ming and the others, emerging from the floating divine palace, confirmed the Sacred Emperor's words.

The citizens of Great Qi cheered for the Sacred Emperor's divine grace, and their fear of death slowly transformed into a fervent desire to enter the floating divine palace and become immortal heroic spirits.

Sun Erlang knew that these so-called heroic spirits were likely remnants of will preserved by his Master with divine power.

Although it was still far from true eternal life and immortality, it was still a method of salvation after death.

Rather than having their souls and spirits completely annihilated, leaving behind a final trace in the world was still valuable.

But for Sun Erlang, the proper way was to minimize the sacrifice of soldiers.

He arrived at the secret location where the Sacred Dynasty forged weapons of war.

Both the Army Annihilation Arrow and the Heavenly Usurpation Talisman originated from here.

"Greetings, Craftsman Elder."

Sun Erlang said to the busy Craftsman Ascetic.

The Craftsman did not reply, but focused intently on the black puppets rapidly flashing in the space before him.

Sun Erlang did not mind and also looked at the puppets.

"Such speed."

The black puppet constantly teleported, its body floating, even evading Sun Erlang's divine sense lock.

"Too slow! Still too slow!"

"The Origin Force supply is limited; to unleash the potential of mass-produced models to the extent of imagination is still somewhat insufficient."

The Craftsman said with regret.

"Youngster Sun, go up and spar with him."

The Craftsman suddenly said.

Sun Erlang nodded and instantly appeared in the testing grounds.

The black puppet stopped its rapid movement and launched a full-power assault on Sun Erlang.

There were two main attack methods: one was a black death ray sprayed out, containing annihilation energy.

The other was to detonate formation modules and use standard formations to trap and injure enemies.

It was almost enough to contend with an ordinary peak Nascent Soul cultivator, but it was clearly unable to harm Sun Erlang.

While easily evading the black puppet's attacks, Sun Erlang flicked several blue light orbs.

The orbs transformed into various curves, accurately locking onto and hitting the black puppet.

A faint glow flashed on the puppet, surprisingly absorbing Sun Erlang's moves.

"Kid, you didn't see this last time you visited, did you?"

"This move is called 'using one's own methods against them'."

The Craftsman said this, and faint blue light emanated from the black puppet.

Those blue orbs were actually being reflected back.

"This is just one puppet; the advantage of mass production lies in numbers."

As the Craftsman spoke, dozens more puppets appeared in the testing space in the blink of an eye.

In the battle against them, Sun Erlang discovered that these puppets seemed to be a single entity.

Not only did they coordinate well, forming formations, but any single puppet could concentrate and reflect the attacks absorbed by the entire group.

Even with Sun Erlang's considerable strength, facing more than thirty puppets without using his killing moves, he began to struggle.

He stopped the test and returned to the Craftsman's side.

"Craftsman Elder, how many mass-produced puppets like this can be deployed at once?"

The Craftsman shrugged. "Kid, this is a secret of the Sacred Dynasty. Even as the Saint Emperor's personal disciple, I can't tell you too much detail."

Sun Erlang was rendered speechless.

The Craftsman laughed heartily. "Just joking."

"[Sacred Army Puppets], in groups of fifty, require manipulation by special cultivators to exert their greatest strength."

"They should be sufficient to deal with Soul Transformation cultivators."

A glint flashed in Sun Erlang's eyes upon hearing this.

"Is there an upper limit to the number of Sacred Army Puppets that can be controlled?"

"Upper limit?" The Craftsman was slightly taken aback and then understood.

"You want to try?"

Sun Erlang nodded.

The Craftsman pondered for a moment and handed over a black jade disk.

"Don't push yourself."

Sun Erlang took the disk, and in his sea of consciousness, an image of thousands of black puppets standing neatly in formation appeared.

His thoughts became like a thread, connecting all these puppets.

Each puppet seemed to have its own consciousness.

After connecting, Sun Erlang's own soul felt as if it were tethered by something heavy, becoming somewhat sluggish.

However, it also allowed him to control the puppets as if they were his own limbs.

Sun Erlang accustomed himself to the puppet's movements. With a thought, one of the puppets flew into the testing grounds.

He began experiments on flight and attack.

After a period of adaptation, Sun Erlang felt the burden on his soul had become negligible.

He then began connecting to other puppets.

Next, the third, the tenth, the fiftieth…

Under the Craftsman Ascetic's gradually astonished gaze, the number of puppets controlled by Sun Erlang exceeded one hundred.

And judging by his expression, he still seemed to be handling it with ease.

"You kid…"

"Not bad!"

The Craftsman Ascetic suddenly had a flash of inspiration. "If you were to control the Sacred Army Puppets alone, would the effect be even better?"

Chapter 1260: Sword Pointing at the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance

Sun Erlang did not respond to Qiaogong's words, for his limits far exceeded that.

One hundred, two hundred, five hundred…

Only when the number of black puppets emerging in the testing ground exceeded a thousand, to Qiaogong Jushi’s astonished gaze, did Sun Erlang stop summoning more.

The hundreds of black puppets fought amongst themselves, each employing different combat methods, giving no indication they were being controlled by a single person.

Even having achieved this level, Sun Erlang still had the energy to chat with Qiaogong.

“Senior, you jest. I am the Saint Emperor’s first disciple, and in the future, I will conquer the Myriad Immortals Alliance. I will be a commander, not a mere general. Moreover, although these puppets are powerful…”

“I am not weak either.”

Sun Erlang’s tone was filled with confidence. “I can have my subordinates control these puppets. I refuse to believe that the Sacred Army Puppets you forged can be more numerous than our Sacred Dynasty’s soldiers.”

Qiaogong waved his hand, saying with a look of disdain, “No, no, no, you misunderstand, my boy. I’m not talking about these ordinary Sacred Army Puppets. I’m talking about this kind…”

As he spoke, with flashes of black light, the thousand-plus puppets summoned by Sun Erlang disappeared one after another from the testing ground.

A spatial rift appeared in their place, and a colossal puppet, shining with golden light like the Divine Hall of Heroes in the Sacred Dynasty’s sky, descended into their midst.

A mysterious and majestic aura swept through the entire training ground.

The surrounding seals groaned under the immense impact, as if they would shatter at any moment.

The golden puppet’s eyes, like a deity overlooking the mortal world, stared at Sun Erlang—cold and devoid of emotion.

Being locked onto by the other party, Sun Erlang inexplicably felt as if he were facing his own master.

“What is this…”

Sun Erlang looked at Qiaogong Jushi with surprise.

Qiaogong said with undisguised pride, “This is a powerful puppet that truly represents my highest craftsmanship. The black Sacred Army Puppets just now were merely common goods, expendable materials for war.”

“Think about it yourself; such high-end items, how could I possibly let you test them without any preparation?”

Sun Erlang felt a bit embarrassed at hearing this, but his attention quickly returned to the golden puppet standing silently before him.

“Senior, how is this puppet’s strength?”

Qiaogong said proudly, “Don’t take it the wrong way, young man. Although you are the Saint Emperor’s eldest disciple, if it came down to a real fight, you might not even be a match for this puppet.”

Sun Erlang narrowed his eyes but did not retort.

Qiaogong continued, “This puppet is not like the mass-produced ones. Each one is personally crafted by me, and bestowed by the Saint Emperor…”

Qiaogong paused. “Heh heh, suffice it to say, this golden puppet is extremely precious. Even with the entire Sacred Dynasty’s resources, we couldn’t forge more than ten of them.”

“Similarly, the control requirements are greatly increased. I was quite troubled before, wondering where to find suitable operators. I didn’t expect you to have such a hidden skill…”

“You can control over a thousand mass-produced puppets simultaneously, so controlling five golden puppets should be no problem.”

“The gap is that large?” Sun Erlang furrowed his brow.

“Heh heh, you’ll know once you try.” Qiaogong placed a golden sphere into Sun Erlang’s sea of consciousness.

*Boom!*

The scene before him shattered like glass. In an instant, he seemed to have transitioned from the testing ground to an endless, dark starry sea.

Before him, two gigantic cinnabar-golden spheres emitted intense heat and light.

Sun Erlang was unconsciously drawn to them, and as he approached, he realized they were the two eyes of the golden puppet!

His consciousness was instantly absorbed. When Sun Erlang regained his senses, he looked at his hands in a daze.

His original body was no longer perceptible.

His current body had somehow become that golden puppet.

And…

Sun Erlang could clearly feel the surging, unknown power flowing and operating within him.

“This is…”

As he stood there in a daze, Qiaogong’s voice echoed from beside him, “I will teleport you to a special hunting ground outside the Great Qi small world. You can test this puppet body to your heart’s content there.”

The surrounding space distorted, and Sun Erlang instantly found himself in a dark void.

Faintly, he could see the scene of the Sacred Dynasty surrounded by numerous small worlds in the distance.

“Roar!”

A silver-scaled giant python, tens of thousands of feet long, suddenly appeared from nowhere, opening its gaping maw.

In the next moment, it was about to swallow the golden puppet controlled by Sun Erlang whole.

However, Sun Erlang made no defensive move. He simply allowed a faint halo to emanate from the puppet’s surface.

The silver-scaled python, as if ignited by flames, let out a mournful howl and turned into ashes, dying in agony.

The python’s death was like a stone dropped into a pond, creating ripples.

Hundreds of unknown ferocious beasts emerged from the darkness, seemingly devoid of any reason, and attacked Sun Erlang.

Sun Erlang could clearly feel that these ferocious beasts, specially cultivated by the Sacred Dynasty, each possessed a strength no less than that of a Nascent Soul cultivator.

But facing their encirclement…

Sun Erlang extended his left hand and gently brushed it as if plucking a zither.

The space rippled.

The ferocious beasts, brimming with killing intent, still retained their expressions from before death. However, their bodies were instantly torn into countless fragments, raining down like drops of water.

“Law power.”

“Spatial Law.”

Sun Erlang quietly looked at his left hand, a sense of enlightenment dawning upon him.

Concurrently with this epiphany, he seemed to glimpse a figure hidden within his own body.

“Heaven and Earth Essence?”

Even after unleashing a killing move, Sun Erlang, while controlling the golden puppet, felt no fatigue.

The puppet’s energy seemed inexhaustible.

“A puppet stronger than Dao Integration?”

Sun Erlang was certain that the move he just executed so effortlessly could heavily wound a Dao Integration cultivator of the Xuanhuang Realm.

And this was far from the golden puppet’s combat limit.

“No wonder Senior Qiaogong said I’m not its match.”

While his heart was filled with disbelief, Sun Erlang also felt a sense of loss.

As the Saint Emperor’s first disciple, he enjoyed countless resources. Moreover, he had the fortuitous encounters from the Taiyan Sect…

Yet, in the end, he was still inferior to a casually crafted puppet?

What was the meaning of his cultivation then?

As he was lost in thought, the golden puppet flickered, and it returned to the testing ground.

Sun Erlang also detached himself from the puppet’s body, returning to his original self.

Fragile.

An extreme sense of contrast immediately arose within Sun Erlang.

“Heh heh, you’re feeling discouraged, aren’t you? Actually, there’s no need for that.”

“The resources we spent on the golden puppet could have, if simply piled up, trained a normal cultivator to the Dao Integration stage.”

Qiaogong patted Sun Erlang’s shoulder. “You must have also felt it, right? Each puppet contains the power of a Heaven and Earth Essence. With such an Essence as its core, these puppets, when fighting in the Xuanhuang Realm environment, are like fish in water, gaining nearly a third of their combat strength.”

“Furthermore, if the same person controls multiple puppets…”

Qiaogong’s tone suddenly became somewhat excited. “The puppets can lend each other the Law power of their respective Essences!”

“Their burst combat power in a short period can increase severalfold!”

Sun Erlang looked at the golden, majestic puppet standing like a deity in the testing space, speechless.

“There will be a war between the Sacred Dynasty and the Myriad Immortals Alliance in the future. What will truly determine the course of the war is high-end combat power. How many Dao Integration cultivators does the Myriad Immortals Alliance have? At least nearly a thousand. And how many disciples does the Saint Emperor have?”

“Besides, you are all still too young. Compared to the veteran Dao Integration cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, you might not gain the upper hand. You can’t expect the Saint Emperor to personally intervene against these Dao Integration cultivators, can you?” Qiaogong Jushi’s tone was melancholic.

“At the highest realm, whoever reveals themselves first means they are the first to expose their weakness. Kid, you need to prepare yourself psychologically. In the future war, the Saint Emperor might not act easily.” Sun Erlang nodded. “I understand this principle, of course.”

“With these golden puppets, we can significantly alter the power gap between us. Sun kid, do you want to give it a try?” Qiaogong asked.

“As long as you can control three of them simultaneously, annihilating a Myriad Immortals Alliance Dao Integration cultivator will be effortless,” Qiaogong guaranteed.

Sun Erlang slowly nodded.

…

In the Saint Emperor’s Throne.

The conversation between the eldest disciple and Qiaogong naturally did not escape the Saint Emperor’s notice.

The golden puppet, with Origin Force essence and Xuanhuang Heaven and Earth Essence as its core, performed miracles, turning decay into magic. It used pure resources to create puppets that could crush Dao Integration combat power.

The inspiration for this naturally came from Tianyang.

In fact, Tianyang himself, under the modification of golden Origin Force and Qiaogong, had already surpassed Dao Integration, reaching the Longevity Realm. And…

He was not far from reaching the limit of mortality.

However, regrettably, there seemed to be some kind of restraint in the dark. Tianyang’s own progress experience did not apply to other puppets.

Even with the exact same crafting plan, the later puppets were inferior to Tianyang by an entire major realm.

Besides the fact that Tianyang had merged with the puppet, a unique factor of his own, Li Ping speculated, there were more profound principles involved.

“The first to tread a path fully realizes their Dao. Just like attaining the nameless True Immortal’s Dao, one’s path cannot be trespassed upon. It is the same with these puppets.”

“However, the limitations seem even more stringent.”

But, with the help of Tianyang and these current golden puppets, Li Ping was already quite satisfied.

War, in essence, was about who had more trump cards.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance was indeed unfathomable, but the resources he could utilize were not few.

Moreover, there was one point Qiaogong had guessed wrong.

“True powerhouses do not lack weaknesses.”

“Rather, they are not afraid of others targeting their weaknesses.”

In this war against the Myriad Immortals Alliance, he would not be hiding behind the scenes the entire time.

Otherwise, how could he live up to the name of Saint Emperor?

“Transmit the Law.”

Li Ping sat calmly, his gaze piercing through the firmament, reaching beyond the Xuanhuang Realm.

In his hand, he toyed with a brilliant, seven-colored crystal.

The Void Crystal.

Through the sensory records of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, Li Ping had initially grasped the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s Rainbow Light Escape technique.

He decided to borrow the puppet’s body and travel to the depths of the starry sea before the war began.

Not to engage in an early battle with the Law Transmitter, but to comprehend the Dao in the starry sea.

“This battle, I shall surely win.”

The Saint Emperor’s conviction had never wavered.

…

Within the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

In the Derivation Law Jade space.

Sensing the faint belief emanating from his clone, Li Fan nodded slightly.

Although his perception of the Saint Emperor was growing weaker due to the Saint Emperor’s increasing strength,

The Saint Emperor’s actions were steadily progressing towards the predetermined course.

Coupled with the contingencies he had left behind, Li Fan wasn’t afraid of any unexpected turns.

Furthermore, as long as the goal of forcing out the Law Transmitter was achieved…

“One thought returns to truth, all is illusion.”

Having meditated in the Derivation Law Jade space for such a long time, Li Fan himself had greatly benefited from the continuous insights from the Saint Emperor and the Saint Embryo.

Especially after touching upon the higher laws beyond the Xuanhuang’s limits in the starry sea, Li Fan had gained thoughts on his future path.

“Although I am constrained by the new laws, I can find alternative paths.”

“The Law Transmitter’s system relies on the Xuanhuang Realm itself. If I were to start anew in the starry sea, I could avoid its restrictions.”

“However, doing so would mean I couldn’t receive the Xuanhuang’s assistance. There are pros and cons. Moreover, resources are scarce in the starry sea; to truly achieve anything, I might need to rely on the Mystic Immortal Boat.”

“And that intangible High Wall.”

“It seems to be a power completely different from the Absolute Darkness Star Sea system. However, it can restrict the power of True Immortals; its strength is beyond imagination. If I could learn from it, perhaps it could be used as a surprise tactic in future battles with the Law Transmitter.”

“The only concern is…”

Li Fan frowned slightly. “The Law Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician had left the Xuanhuang Realm much earlier than I did. Their talents must also surpass mine.”

“All the insights I have discovered so far, they must have found long ago as well.”

“So, the so-called advantage… is not an advantage at all.”

“…”

“It seems only a real battle will reveal the truth.”

As his reincarnation cycles increased, the veil of mystery surrounding the Law Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician was gradually lifted. Li Fan, who initially avoided them at all costs, now increasingly wished to test them.

Perhaps the day he can truly defeat them was not far off.

Li Fan then thought of the Cat Treasure that the Saint Emperor’s clone had found.

If there was anything he was particularly concerned about, it was this treasure from beyond the High Wall that had not been fished up before.

“The angler is also being fished…”

A strange glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

The peculiar behavior of the entire Crossing Calamity Sect towards the Cat Treasure made Li Fan ponder many possibilities.

However, this was still speculation.

The Saint Emperor’s clone had also sensed this anomaly.

Going to the First Origin Sect to collect the remnants of the wind calamity and the Great Law Master’s remains was also driven by this consideration.

…

While Li Fan was contemplating, the long-quiet Derivation Law Jade space was suddenly broken.

Someone had come to visit.

It was Sun Luyuan from the Sun family.

“Lu’er, joyous news, joyous news!”

After greeting the other two Dao Integration cultivators guarding the space, Sun Luyuan said to Li Fan.

“I know.”

Li Fan’s reaction, however, made Sun Luyuan slightly startle.

“Bloodline resonance, how could I not know?”

“How is Ningjiu?” Li Fan asked, suppressing a smile at the corner of his lips.

Sun Luyuan sighed slightly, “Ningjiu has unfortunately passed away. However, the fetus is unharmed. This is also why I’ve come to find you so late, fearing you might not be able to accept it.”

Sun Luyuan changed the subject. “Do you know how extraordinary that little one is? Born as a Dao Integration…”

Chapter 1261: Cat Treasure Triple Change

Sun Luyuan lectured on, while Li Fan seemed unable to recover from the shock and grief of learning of his wife's demise.

"Time and fate. No wonder I've been feeling uneasy for some time now."

"Trapped here, I couldn't even see her one last time," Li Fan said with a mournful expression.

"My son, does he have a name yet?"

Sun Luyuan calmly replied, "Sun Tianci. Ninglu personally gave our son that name before she passed."

After a brief silence, Li Fan spoke both sorrowfully and with a touch of comfort, "Tianci... a good name."

After discussing Sun Tianci, Sun Luyuan's expression gradually turned serious as he broached the main topic.

"Your eldest uncle, Sun Luchang, is leaving."

Sun Luyuan briefly recounted the story of the sword light appearing in the sky, bringing news from the Profound Merchant Immortal Ship from beyond the sea of stars.

Li Fan was somewhat surprised. "If that's the case, venturing beyond the starry sky is hardly a good thing. Can it be declined?"

Sun Luyuan shook his head. "The current situation is that the upper-tier families of the Immortal Alliance who know the truth are avoiding it like the plague, while those in the lower tiers who are unaware are fighting to go. To have more scapegoats, they naturally won't reveal the truth to them. It's truly ironic."

"Although eldest uncle is at the Harmonious Dao cultivation level, he's grown accustomed to a comfortable life these past few years. I'm afraid..." Li Fan said with slight worry.

"If I weren't guarding here and couldn't get away, I would have gone in place of eldest uncle to explore beyond the stars."

Li Fan's words were spoken with finality, fitting Sun Ang's previous demeanor.

Sun Luyuan didn't doubt him, merely showing displeasure. "Our Sun family is attracting too much attention: guarding the Derivation Law Jade, venturing beyond the stars... these arrangements are hard to say don't carry the implication of deliberate suppression by the Immortal Alliance."

"Don't overthink it. Just live your days here with peace of mind."

Without revealing to Li Fan that the Sun family had already pledged allegiance to the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, Sun Luyuan merely cautioned Li Fan to prioritize prudence in all matters.

"I've already spoken to Elder Xu."

"Perhaps you won't have to stay the full three hundred years to succeed and get out."

Sun Luyuan said this before his departure.

"Patriarch, you are too thoughtful," Li Fan replied with gratitude.

"Oh, right. I've been meditating here for several years, summarizing my lifelong studies, and have made some progress."

"Patriarch, perhaps you could pass this piece, 'Righteous Law Ascendant,' to Tianci for me."

As he spoke, a seemingly ordinary piece of text appeared in Sun Luyuan's mind.

Scanning it, there was nothing particularly special. It was merely a common method for tempering the mind and clarifying aspirations.

Sun Luyuan nodded and immediately agreed.

He then took his leave.

Only after Sun Luyuan's figure disappeared did Li Fan sneer inwardly, "Over a hundred years, it's questionable if the Xuanhuang Realm can even survive that long."

However, he knew that countless Immortals Alliance cultivators were secretly monitoring here, so he didn't dwell on it, just a fleeting thought in his mind.

As for "Righteous Law Ascendant," it was a seed planted for Sun Tianci's future rise.

Li Fan looked at the Derivation Law Jade, which was again slacking off and feigning diligence, and could not help but earnestly exhort and admonish it.

...

In the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty.

At the Sacred Dynasty's secret military testing ground.

Li Ping, along with Qiaogong, watched Sun Erlang earnestly manipulating the third [Sacred Punishment Divine Puppet].

Sacred Punishment Divine Puppet was the name Li Ping had given to the golden puppet, to distinguish it from the ordinary Sacred Army Puppets.

"Young Master Sun truly has extraordinary talent, with terrifying adaptability. He's already got the hang of the third divine puppet this quickly. Who knows, he might even be able to control all our reserve divine puppets," Qiaogong praised without restraint.

"Compared to this, everyone in my Spiritual Yuan Sect is just trash."

"Speaking of which, you've been in the Sacred Dynasty. Is the Spiritual Yuan Sect in Nine Mountains Prefecture alright?" Li Ping asked casually, his gaze fixed on Sun Erlang in the testing ground, sweat dripping from his forehead.

Qiaogong waved his hand. "There's my puppet guarding Nine Mountains Prefecture. Those idiots, every time they see me, they're deferential and dare not look up. How could they possibly tell the difference?"

At this point, Qiaogong paused. "But if I calculate the time, the Immortal Alliance's tax collector should be arriving soon. Perhaps I'll have to go back then."

Li Ping knew that Qiaogong collecting large amounts of Origin Force in Nine Mountains Prefecture using the Myriad Beings Origin Force Technique was permitted by the Immortal Alliance. The price was that he had to hand over a portion.

A large portion.

"The Immortal Alliance shouldn't be lacking in resources, why are they so concerned about your little bit?" Li Ping asked.

Qiaogong dismissed it with a wave of his hand. "Who knows? Maybe it's something unethical they themselves find inconvenient to do openly."

"However..."

Qiaogong seemed to recall something. "Now that you mention it, I remember. When that Immortal Alliance envoy came last time, they casually mentioned that the Immortal Alliance seemed to have a significant internal deficit, and could only cut costs."

"I joked with them then, saying that the Immortal Alliance looks prosperous, but turns out to be a pauper."

Li Ping fell into contemplation upon hearing this.

"Origin Force is merely pure, masterless cultivation. Ordinary cultivators don't need it..."

"Interesting."

"When the Immortal Alliance envoy comes this time, I'll go meet them on your behalf," Li Ping decided.

"Excellent, excellent." Qiaogong, unable to break away, was overjoyed.

He immediately transmitted the details of their previous meetings to Li Ping.

"Oh, right. How about the puppet body I asked you to prepare?"

Qiaogong's face showed pride as he clapped his hands.

Then, a faceless body instantly appeared before Li Ping.

Unlike the Saint Emperor's towering three-zhang three-cun physique, this faceless body was only normal human size.

However, it could be considered a perfectly scaled-down version, its exterior almost indistinguishable from Li Ping's.

If the Saint Emperor were too suspicious, he might even accuse Qiaogong of disrespect.

But now, he merely stared at the puppet body with interest, somewhat surprised. "It's actually a genuine flesh and blood body?"

Qiaogong nodded. "Yes. Didn't you say you wanted to use it to travel to the starry sky? The sea of stars is full of dangers, and some strange places can only be sensed by a true flesh and blood body. I suffered a great loss before coming to Xuanhuang."

A flicker of pain flashed in Qiaogong's eyes, and he continued introducing the puppet to the Saint Emperor. "I referenced Tianyang's 'Body Fulfilling the Dao' and your precious disciple's flesh and blood cultivation techniques."

"This flesh and blood puppet's cultivation potential is not something to expect, but it has complete sensory perception. And like the Sacred Army Divine Puppets, it can integrate the World Essence and Origin Force essence. Although its strength will be discounted due to its naturally frail body, its strength should be sufficient for self-preservation in the starry sky as long as it's careful at the Harmonious Dao level."

"As long as it doesn't encounter the strange calamities in the void," Qiaogong said cautiously.

The Saint Emperor nodded.

A gleam of golden light shot from his fingertip, infusing into the flesh and blood puppet before him.

A sense of familiarity, like a clone, or an extension of his own arm, arose from his heart.

The Saint Emperor carefully examined the familiar yet unfamiliar sensations flowing through him, and a glimmer of understanding dawned upon him.

"I'll take this body."

With a flash of golden light, the Saint Emperor and the flesh and blood puppet body disappeared together.

Qiaogong refocused his attention on Sun Erlang in the testing ground.

In the Sacred Dynasty's treasury.

The Saint Emperor, avoiding Qiaogong, was modifying the puppet body.

His purpose in traveling to the starry sky was for enlightenment.

He had certain requirements for the aptitude of his host body. What Qiaogong couldn't accomplish...

Did not mean the Saint Emperor himself could not.

He placed his large hand on the flesh and blood puppet's head, slowly infusing the Xuanhuang Heavenly Favor into it.

Suddenly...

The Saint Emperor felt a sense of déjà vu, and the movements of his hand paused slightly.

After a moment of contemplation, he suppressed this anomaly.

The initially stiff shell gradually became more lively.

As various heavenly materials and earthly treasures in the Sacred Dynasty's treasury were refined into liquid by Origin Force essence and integrated into the puppet body...

This body became increasingly translucent and fragrant.

Even Cat Treasure, which had been sleeping soundly, was attracted. It suddenly awoke and looked around.

Upon discovering that the source of the fragrance was the body Li Ping was refining, its eyes showed a hint of disappointment.

Just as it was about to go back to sleep, it received instructions from the Saint Emperor.

Cat Treasure reluctantly shook its head but, unable to resist the temptation of the promised Origin Force essence, let out a lazy meow.

Then, with a leap, it transformed into a blue, transparent glass cover, enveloping the body Li Ping was refining.

Fine blue light was released from the container, drifting for a moment before seeping into the puppet body's interior.

At this moment, Li Ping, with a sliver of consciousness attached to the puppet body, could personally feel the changes occurring within it as it bathed in the blue light.

"Flesh and blood reorganization, sublimation of life form."

"Even without cultivation, the strength of this body already surpasses that of Nascent Soul cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm in the general sense."

"And..."

The Saint Emperor carefully sensed the differences between this body and his original body.

He couldn't yet comprehend the consequences of these differences, but he was almost certain that these changes were made to cope with some special circumstances.

As the blue light cover continuously remodeled the body, a flash of enlightenment crossed Li Ping's mind.
