He could even use Cat Treasure's function to infuse the unique abilities of the creatures Cat Treasure had previously absorbed and mimicked into this body, turning them into innate divine abilities.

However, being a man-made body, doing so might lead to unpredictable changes.

The divine abilities Cat Treasure currently possessed were all non-essential to Li Ping. With the journey to the starry sea imminent, Li Ping decided against this unnecessary step for now.

He could try it slowly in the future.

The blue light cover grew dimmer, and finally, the light completely dissipated.

Cat Treasure looked as if it had fought a three-day, three-night battle, its face haggard, and even its originally lustrous fur seemed somewhat yellowed.

Li Ping fed it a large mouthful of golden Origin Force essence, and Cat Treasure, satisfied, fell into a deep slumber.

"Item duplication, creature mimicry, this is Cat Treasure's third function."

"Marrow cleansing."

"Truly remarkable!" Li Ping exclaimed.

The puppet body had awakened from its sublimation. Li Ping sensed it, and this body felt even more suitable for his divine soul than his original one.

"Why not directly switch bodies?"

A thought irrepressibly surged from the depths of his mind, but it was quickly suppressed by the Saint Emperor.

Cat Treasure's marrow cleansing function was not a one-time affair.

If the effect was so good on the puppet body, it would naturally be even better on his original body.

There was still plenty of time, and he had opportunities.

Li Ping focused his will on the puppet body, beginning to adapt and attempt to control it.

...

Half a month later.

Before the puppet body could even fly out of Xuanhuang, it received a communication reminder from Qiaogong.

The envoy from the Immortal Alliance was about to arrive at the Spiritual Yuan Sect in Nine Mountains Prefecture.

A flash of golden light enveloped Li Ping, and he instantly transformed into the appearance of Qiaogong Jushi.

Silently, he appeared at the headquarters of the Spiritual Yuan Sect, awaiting the arrival of the Immortal Alliance envoy.

Meanwhile, the puppet body left behind by Qiaogong had already prepared the vast amounts of Origin Force that had been collected.

Li Ping disdained such low-quality energy.

Not to mention comparing it to Origin Force essence, even compared to the Origin Force generated by the citizens of the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty cultivating the Spiritual Yuan Technique, it was far inferior.

However, the Immortal Alliance envoy, after a brief inspection, was overjoyed.

"The quality of this submission seems to have improved significantly?"

"The Sect Master is thoughtful." The Immortal Alliance envoy praised, carefully collecting the sphere of light containing the Origin Force.

Li Ping, mimicking Qiaogong's tone, smiled and replied, "Recently, I've learned a profound technique that can invisibly clear the complex thoughts of the disciples, allowing them to dedicate more time to cultivating techniques."

The Immortal Alliance envoy's eyes lit up. "There's such a divine technique?"

"What? Is the Envoy also interested?" Li Ping asked.

The Immortal Alliance envoy seemed a little embarrassed. "The Immortal Alliance's deficit has grown larger recently. If it's convenient for the Sect Master..."

Li Ping waved his hand. "It's nothing, just a minor skill. If the Envoy is interested, I will explain it to you."

"Mind unclouded, spirit centered. All laws repelled, reaching the profound..."

As Li Ping spoke, he chanted, directly reciting this profound technique.

The Immortal Alliance envoy was overjoyed and listened intently.

He failed to notice that his spirit was slowly falling under the influence of the other party's gentle chanting.

When the Immortal Alliance envoy's eyes became vacant and he fell into a complete stupor, Li Ping smiled faintly and flicked a speck of golden light into the envoy's sea of consciousness.

As expected, there was a defense from the Immortal Alliance's restrictions.

However, with the Originvital Essence stealthily infiltrating, the defenses were like paper, silently breached.

Soon, Li Ping found the information he desired in the envoy's mind.

"The power of a myriad cultivators, condensed into a piercing spear."

"Directly reaching the depths of Xuanhuang, the endless Sea of Darkness..."

"As expected."

Li Ping had always been curious about how the Immortal Alliance found and maintained the entrance to the Sea of Darkness.

Because according to the confessions of the You Clan, the passage opened by the Immortal Alliance in the Sea of Darkness differed significantly from the traditional method of the You Clan's opening.

Perhaps they did not fully trust the You Clan, or perhaps the Immortal Alliance wanted to firmly control the passage to the Sea of Darkness for themselves.

In any case, the Immortal Alliance devised a method to use highly condensed Origin Force to directly open a passage between the Xuanhuang Realm and the Sea of Darkness.

"It is precisely because the Immortal Alliance covets the Nether Realm that the power of the Sea of Darkness continues to shrink."

"It seems it's time to sever some of their tentacles first."

Chapter 1262: Origin of the Star Sea

Related to the Nether Realm was a top secret of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. The envoy knew little more information beyond that. To avoid alarming them, Li Ping did not take any further action against the envoy. When the Myriad Immortals Alliance envoy, named Jia Su, gradually woke up, he was completely unaware that the secrets in his mind had already been thoroughly scrutinized by the person before him. He was still full of praise, saying, "Your Excellency's divine art is truly extraordinary. Even when I read it, I unconsciously entered a state of selflessness."

Li Ping chuckled, "It would be great if it could be useful to the Myriad Immortals Alliance. However, can the proportion of Origin Force submitted annually be discussed further?" Before he could finish speaking, the envoy's expression changed slightly. He said earnestly, "Everything can be discussed, Your Excellency. But the tasks of the Myriad Immortals Alliance cannot be taken lightly." The envoy hesitated, then lowered his voice, "To be honest, originally, higher-ups planned to collect even more..." Seeing Li Ping's extremely displeased expression, as if he might erupt at any moment, the envoy quickly tried to appease him, "But Your Excellency has made a contribution now, right? I'll try to intercede, and perhaps some can be reduced..." Without waiting for Li Ping to react, the Myriad Immortals Alliance envoy quickly bid farewell and left. The Saint Emperor's anger slowly subsided, replaced by an unfathomable calm. Leaving the puppet to continue guarding the Spiritual Yuan Sect disciples, Li Ping returned to the Sacred Dynasty. The profound art left for the Myriad Immortals Alliance was indeed a superior cultivation method that could better develop the Origin Force within cultivators, and it contained no hidden traps. After all, it concerned the Sea of Darkness, and the Myriad Immortals Alliance could not afford to be careless and would have to verify it repeatedly. Li Ping's reason for passing this method to the Myriad Immortals Alliance was that, as its creator, he could roughly sense the location of cultivators practicing this method. He could even sense the Origin Force cultivated by these cultivators under the assistance of this method. The Sea of Darkness was endless and pitch black, swallowing everything. Even the Netherworld Race only moved within their familiar territories. To find the "Piercing Spear" that the Myriad Immortals Alliance had inserted into the Sea of Darkness, some effort was naturally required. However, it would take some time for this method to be widely adopted. Li Ping decided to continue with his unfinished plan of contemplating the Great Dao outside Xuanhuang in the puppet body. After the final touches in the recent days, the puppet body had completely met the Saint Emperor's requirements. Even whenever his consciousness descended upon it, he couldn't help but feel an instinctive urge to switch bodies, and it became stronger and stronger. Li Ping thus reduced the frequency of testing this puppet body. The large amount of Empty Radiant Flowing Crystals collected in the Hongze Realm was also enough for him to break free from the suction of the Immortal Ruins and successfully fly out of Xuanhuang. Without telling anyone, under the concealment of formations and the aura of Xuanhuang's Heavenly Dao, the Rainbow Light silently flew towards the firmament. In an instant, it reached the edge of the world. Deprived of Xuanhuang's protection, the immense suction from the Immortal Ruins caused Li Ping's expression to change. Knowing about the power of True Immortals and personally experiencing it were two entirely different matters. Only when truly facing the vast and mighty power of True Immortals would one understand their own insignificance. Even though he, the Saint Emperor, was among the strongest existences in the Xuanhuang Realm, it was still the case. "The path is long and arduous." The Saint Emperor sighed inwardly, releasing Rainbow Lights one by one to counteract the suction of the Immortal Ruins. The puppet body, however, rapidly flew in the opposite direction. The light of Xuanhuang gradually dimmed, leaving only darkness all around. Unlike the darkness of the Sea of Darkness, the starry sea was utterly dead and silent. And... even though there seemed to be nothing ahead, the Saint Emperor instinctively sensed that danger awaited him there. So he decisively turned, bypassing that area. Afterward, in the deepest parts of the dark sea, whenever there was rampant residual immortal energy that threatened him, he could foresee it and preemptively avoid it. It was as if he had set foot in this starry sea before. The Saint Emperor's puppet body narrowed its eyes and continued deeper into the dark sea, following an imperceptible guidance. He could already feel that the laws in the starry sea had a higher limit than in the Xuanhuang Realm. However, his destination was not beneath the High Wall mentioned in the sword message, but where new limit laws were being gestated in this deep dark starry sea. There, the efficiency of comprehending the Dao would be the highest. The Rainbow Light shuttled rapidly, as if the concept of time had ceased to exist. The Saint Emperor gradually shed the guidance of his premonition and, following the mysterious rhythm surging in the silent starry sea, changed his direction of advance. It was like being in the ocean, finding a fierce current beneath the calm surface. His speed suddenly increased exponentially, covering millions of miles in an instant. The immense forces of tearing raged around him. Even the protective Rainbow Light was torn to shreds by this unknown great power. Li Ping, with a focused mind, ignoring the crisis of his imminent death, quietly contemplated the mysterious changes around him, something never seen in the Xuanhuang Realm. "Ruin and rebirth." "The cultivators of Xuanhuang Realm view this silent starry sky as the deep dark starry sea. But in ways unknown to them, vitality is also slowly reviving within it." "However, it is currently in its most nascent stage. And the entire process is too slow. From the perspective of 'humans,' it is naturally extremely difficult to perceive." "This has nothing to do with comprehension. It is purely a difference dictated by different scales and different life forms." "But..." A peculiar rhythm slowly awakened on the Saint Emperor's puppet body. It was the unique aura of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao! That's right, this time the Saint Emperor secretly sent the puppet body out of Xuanhuang to comprehend the Dao, without informing anyone in the Sacred Dynasty. But how could he hide it from Xuanhuang's Heavenly Dao? At its strong insistence, with the resolve of going without return, it separated a trace of consciousness and attached it to the puppet body. It left Xuanhuang together with it, venturing into the depths of the starry sea. Unlike the purpose from many years ago, this time, Xuanhuang's Heavenly Dao was also here to "learn the Dao"! The deep dark starry sea's limit laws were already exceeding Xuanhuang before its destruction. Although Xuanhuang Realm had survived to this day, its own strength had not advanced over a long period. Considering it had devoured many fragments of immortal cultivation worlds, although occupied by cultivators, it had slightly increased overall compared to before. The new Dao laws being gestured in the deep dark starry sea were naturally a level higher than Xuanhuang Realm's. Of course... For Xuanhuang Realm, observing these nascent beings in the deep dark starry sea was also a great opportunity. Previously, there was neither a trustworthy vessel to possess, nor a method to escape the suction of the Immortal Ruins. Thus, even if Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao had the intention, it could not implement it. But this time, with the existence of the chosen Saint Emperor, everything became different. Li Ping also completely handed over the control of the puppet body to Xuanhuang's Heavenly Dao. He himself merely acted as an observer, feeling and comprehending. Just this simple act was something almost impossible for any other cultivator in Xuanhuang Realm. Like a child who had been confined for a long time and saw a breathtaking view, Li Ping felt exhilaration, excitement, and anticipation from Xuanhuang's Heavenly Dao... And the deep dark starry sea became brighter and brighter. It might be an exaggeration to call it bright. It was merely occasional, scattered bursts of light. But in this originally dark and silent starry sea, they were so conspicuous. The puppet body seemed to vanish, and the perspective zoomed in exponentially. The center of the entire deep dark starry sea, not in a spatial sense but a vital sense, appeared before Li Ping. It was like a faintly beating heart, weak but undoubtedly representing life, hope, and the future. Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao and Li Ping arrived at the heart's foot. Greedily, they seized and absorbed the vital force of the starry sea that emanated outwards from the beats. Instantly, countless scenes surged into their minds. There were world destructions and the ebb and flow of the starry sea. There was the prosperity of living beings and the response of Heaven. There were also terrifying shadowy beings, like black mist, stealthily watching, ready to pounce at any moment. Amidst these countless complexities of change and constancy, the deep dark starry sea, after destruction, remained stable and persistent, attempting to burst forth with vitality again. This was indeed the fundamental Dao of this starry sea, but it was also a persistence that could bring tears to one's eyes. Unable to bear the immense and pure Origin Dao intent of the entire deep dark starry sea, the puppet body began to disintegrate inch by inch. However, Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao's consciousness and Saint Emperor Li Ping, at this moment, were carefree and fearless. "Compared to the entire deep dark starry sea, what is the tribulation that Xuanhuang Realm suffered?" "The starry sea can recover from destruction, and so can Xuanhuang Realm." The two, during their last opportunity, tried to engrave as many insights as possible. Li Ping also knew that the Origin Dao intent of the deep dark starry sea was not something he could currently comprehend. The current comprehension was more like a blind man touching an elephant. All that he saw and comprehended was merely a tiny fraction that he himself wanted to see and could feel. However, even this tiny part, insignificant to the entire starry sea, was of great significance to them. Just as the puppet body was about to completely disintegrate and vanish, the nascent revival consciousness of the starry sea seemed to have sensed the presence of Li Ping and Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao. It cast a glance of attention. But it was clear that the fragile puppet body was utterly incapable of withstanding this immense power. It was annihilated in the boundless power. However, before its consciousness disappeared, Li Ping, through Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, saw a blurry image that appeared and vanished in an instant. Li Ping couldn't be sure if it was an illusion. Immortal Dao perished, the starry sea was destroyed, and calamities spread. A figure, whose face and details were indistinct, gradually faded. It completely disappeared. Only his light laughter echoed in the starry sea where calamities were about to spread. "What does it have to do with me..." "What does it have to do with me..." "Hahahaha..." Boom! The Saint Emperor suddenly returned to reality. With a muffled groan, he spat out a mouthful of golden blood. The sleeping Cat Treasure suddenly lifted its head and with lightning speed flew to the still-floating blood. It directly swallowed the blood into its belly. "Meow! Meow meow!" Afterward, as if fearing Li Ping's scolding, Cat Treasure purred appeasingly. Circulating his golden Origin Force, Li Ping slowly healed his internal injuries and did not bother with Cat Treasure. His thoughts were entirely focused on the scene he had just witnessed. "That figure..." The Saint Emperor's heart was filled with gravity. Someone who could make this starry sea, even after being destroyed and reborn, remember so vividly, must not be a simple character. Just lingering in his mind for a short while made the Saint Emperor feel a vague sense of danger. He was immediately startled and slowly forced himself to stop thinking about it. But soon, the Saint Emperor realized he was overthinking. Because even without his conscious effort to forget, the memories of that figure were slowly fading uncontrollably. "This situation..." "It's not yet the legendary state of a 'Nameless True Immortal,' but it seems only one step away." The Saint Emperor savored the meaning that the newborn starry sea was trying to convey at that moment. "If I'm not mistaken, the culprit behind the rampant calamities in the starry sea is likely this person..." The Saint Emperor frowned slightly, trying desperately to capture the vanishing memory in his mind. Finally, all the details slowly faded. Only the four words "What does it have to do with me" remained. "He Gan Immortal." The Saint Emperor's expression was unreadable. Li Ping sat in the Saint Emperor's Throne for a long time, silent. Meanwhile, Cat Treasure also seemed to sense something, lowering its body and looking around, adopting a hunting posture. It seemed to be searching for an existence that made Li Ping extremely wary. But in the end, it found nothing. Cat Treasure became lazy again and fell asleep on Li Ping's shoulder. The Saint Emperor, however, began to digest the gains from his journey into the depths of the starry sea. It wasn't just him. Even Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao began to undergo changes after this trip, changes that had not occurred for a long time. Like the newborn deep dark starry sea, it was subtle and unknown to others. But it was indeed happening. Only a handful of people in the world could sense it. Great Qi. The Stone Tablet, chatting with someone in a teahouse in the Sacred Capital City, changed its expression and looked into the distance. In the Jianren Shou space, Ruo Mu, who was trimming its withered branches, stared blankly at the new sprouts growing on its withered branches, utterly astonished. Miles underground, the Earth Vein Ancient Tree only felt the surging power of Xuanhuang Realm's currents becoming increasingly vigorous without any warning, as if something was brewing, filling it with both anticipation and dread. ... "On the banks of the sunken boat, a thousand sails pass; before the ill tree, ten thousand trees greet the spring." In the Derivation Law Jade space, Li Fan's heart suddenly surged with these two lines of poetry. "So, it turns out that comprehending the Dao in the starry sea with the help of Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao yields the greatest rewards." "Because the perspective of a person and the perspective of Heaven and Earth are different." "Just like back then, when I used the Canghai Pearl to understand the 'Formless Killing Intent.'" "Creating the Saint Emperor clone in this life and assisting Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao was truly a fortunate coincidence." Li Fan was overjoyed inwardly. Although his connection with the Saint Emperor had become very weak, due to the immense impact of the starry sea's Origin Dao intent, he had gained some understanding of the Saint Emperor's and Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao's insights. The most crucial thing was that he had grasped the method. As long as he had the method, in the next life, he could recreate it.

Chapter 1263: Establishing the Rightful Succession of Xuanhuang

"The origin Dao intent of the Star Sea..."

Li Ping savored the insights transmitted by the Faceless Saint Emperor, replaying them in his mind.

At the same time, he vaguely sensed the Xuanhuang Realm's revival, a process unfolding from within and extending outwards.

"If there were no cultivators of new techniques who devoured the heavens and swallowed the earth within, and no Immortal Ruins without, perhaps the Xuanhuang Realm could truly be reborn."

"Alas... this is a cure that fails to address the root cause."

As he shook his head slightly, a flicker of doubt surfaced in his mind. Logically, the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao couldn't possibly be unaware of this. Instead of accumulating this power of revival for a future decisive battle, it was eagerly manifesting it now.

What was the purpose behind this?

"Heh heh, let me wait and see."

The perspective shifted back to the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty.

The Stone Tablet, upon sensing the anomaly in the Xuanhuang Realm, immediately arrived at the Faceless Saint Emperor's throne. Seeing the Saint Emperor, whose body also emanated an arcane aura, the Stone Tablet was startled.

"You already know about what happened in the Xuanhuang Realm?"

"There's no need to panic. It's beneficial, not detrimental," the Saint Emperor replied.

The Stone Tablet's expression eased slightly. "I had thought the Xuanhuang Realm was facing imminent disaster, going through a final burst of life before its demise..."

"What you said isn't entirely wrong. This surge of revitalizing power, born from a moment of enlightenment, is indeed not meant to last. However, for us, this might be an unprecedented opportunity." After a brief silence, the Saint Emperor spoke slowly.

"You mean the plan for establishing the Xuanhuang Orthodox lineage?" The Stone Tablet was slightly taken aback, then quickly understood.

"Indeed."

The Saint Emperor nodded, and a miniature projection of the Xuanhuang Realm appeared before them.

Within it was the original portion of the Xuanhuang Realm, depicted in a glowing yellow hue.

And since the collapse of the Immortal Path, the territories and worlds captured by the Xuanhuang native powers, the Xuanhuang Sect, and the Ten Immortal Sects using the 'Grand Formation for Traversing the Starry Sea' were depicted in a strange green.

After the great calamity spread and the Star Sea was shattered, the remnants of other cultivation worlds forcibly stitched together by outsiders were shown in a desolate black.

This was information transmitted from the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao.

It could be seen that the yellow color occupied less than a thirtieth of the entire miniature landscape of the Xuanhuang Realm.

The green color occupied a tenth.

As for the remainder, it was all vast swathes of black.

Visually, the Xuanhuang's yellow appeared to be the anomaly.

But unlike the green and black colors, the glowing yellow representing the Xuanhuang Realm seemed to possess a life of its own, flickering and constantly overflowing into the surrounding alien colored regions, spreading outwards.

From a direct visual perspective, the green and black regions were not pure.

They were interspersed with specks of dark yellow.

However, over the past few thousand years, this erosion, in a sense, had slowed down, even showing signs of reversal.

But...

With the recent sudden resurgence of vitality in the Xuanhuang Realm, the outward spread of the Xuanhuang's yellow hue had unexpectedly accelerated.

"The Xuanhuang Orthodox lineage..."

The Stone Tablet pondered, "The regions that originally belonged to the Xuanhuang Realm are naturally beyond question. All events that occurred within them are meticulously recorded by the Creation Stone Tablet. As for those green regions..."

The Stone Tablet carefully identified them. "Some fall within the scope of the Stone Tablet's records, while others do not."

"As for those black regions, they are pure blind spots."

Emperor Li Ping, the Saint Emperor, spoke, "If we do nothing, the ultimate fate of the Xuanhuang Realm will be to be swallowed by the black regions, which hold an overwhelming numerical advantage. In the future, this blackness will likely evolve into something else entirely."

"Therefore, we must act first and deeply infuse the Xuanhuang Orthodox lineage into these external remnants."

The Saint Emperor's voice was low, but his determination was evident.

"How do we do it?" The Stone Tablet's interest was piqued.

"Observe the Dao of Heaven, execute the actions of Heaven..."

The Saint Emperor spoke slowly, and the Stone Tablet listened carefully, occasionally nodding.

After explaining the method in detail, the Saint Emperor's tone became somewhat solemn. "When doing this, you must be cautious and discreet, lest the instigator discover your actions."

Although the Saint Emperor did not explicitly name who the instigator was, the Stone Tablet understood his meaning.

Rarely, the Stone Tablet revealed a playful smile. "As the saying goes, 'subtle influence.' This method is so secretive, and with the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao actively cooperating and concealing, even if that person possesses peerless cultivation, I doubt they can detect it."

The Saint Emperor spoke sternly, "Do not be careless. Even if they are not currently in the Xuanhuang Realm, we must guard against their residual plans."

The Stone Tablet nodded, indicating understanding.

"For this matter, the fewer participants, the better. This task should have been handled by Ruo Mu for maximum efficiency. After all, as a primordial tree spirit, its connection to the Xuanhuang Realm is far closer."

"It's not that I don't trust him, but Ruo Mu's every move is closely watched by other powerful beings in this realm. As an operative, being too conspicuous would be detrimental. Conversely, if everyone believes you are constantly oppressed by the Creation Stone Tablet, they would naturally overlook you." Perhaps due to the future of the Xuanhuang Realm being at stake, the Saint Emperor spoke with rare verbosity.

It was as if he were speaking to the Stone Tablet, or perhaps to Ruo Mu.

"This is what they call 'hiding in plain sight,' isn't it?" The Stone Tablet agreed, nodding. "Now that I am free from the Stone Tablet's burden, and with a few more transformations, I guarantee that no one in the Xuanhuang Realm will associate me with my former appearance."

"Then let us wait a few more days, until the Xuanhuang's current surge of revitalizing power reaches its peak, and then act. This will allow us to achieve twice the results with half the effort."

The Stone Tablet immediately agreed.

It did not leave but quietly stood in the main hall of the Saint Emperor's throne, observing the miniature Xuanhuang Realm projected by the Saint Emperor.

The light in the center of the Xuanhuang pulsed, like a beating heart, transporting wisps of Xuanhuang essence to all corners of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Even the green and black regions were gradually showing signs of assimilation. However, with the continuous powerful surge of revitalizing force, they could temporarily maintain their original colors. Slowly, at last, even the darkest regions at the outermost periphery of the Xuanhuang Realm were stained with an imperceptible trace of Xuanhuang.

"We can act now." The Faceless Saint Emperor said in a deep voice.

The Stone Tablet smiled slightly, its form flickering, instantly differentiating into two identical clones within the Saint Emperor's throne.

Then two became four, four became eight, and eight multiplied to sixteen.

In the blink of an eye, countless identical Stone Tablet figures filled the hall.

"Transform! Transform! Transform!"

The Stone Tablets chanted in unison.

In an instant, the Stone Tablet clones transformed into various forms of living beings from the Xuanhuang Realm – scholars in elegant white robes, hunched woodcutters, peerlessly beautiful women, nonchalant old men...

Each individual appeared incredibly lifelike, with no trace of being derived from the same being.

"I shall depart," they said.

Each of them bowed to the Saint Emperor with a smile, and their figures vanished from the Saint Emperor's throne.

Simultaneously, across various prefectures of the Xuanhuang Realm, unnoticed by anyone.

Special existences appeared.

When they were all gathered in the Saint Emperor's throne, it had seemed rather crowded. But once dispersed throughout the Xuanhuang Realm, they would not cause the slightest disturbance.

"Observe the Dao of Heaven, execute the actions of Heaven."

"Heaven and Man unite, all transformations are based on this foundation..."

They chanted softly, their feet heading towards the mortal gathering cities in each prefecture.

The Saint Emperor's plan, though seemingly simple, was in essence: to establish the foundation of Heaven through human intent.

Utilizing the Stone Tablet's ability to disguise itself as any form, countless clones were dispatched to infiltrate the mortal populace.

They would subtly propagate the existence of the "Xuanhuang Realm" to all mortal beings in the Xuanhuang.

Currently, mortals only knew the small corner of the land where they resided. They had no specific recognition of this world, the Xuanhuang Realm. The very concept of the Xuanhuang Realm did not exist in their consciousness.

The first step in establishing the Xuanhuang Orthodox lineage was to first instill in them the awareness of their existence within the Xuanhuang Realm.

Of course, this was not a task that could be accomplished in a single day; it would require years, perhaps even decades, of diligent propagation through word of mouth, integrating seamlessly into mortal communities to avoid detection.

However, with the Stone Tablet's power, even with countless clones, achieving this was not an insurmountable challenge.

A single mortal was like an ant, hence a hundred, a thousand. But when all the mortals of the Xuanhuang Realm were united, they would form an undeniable force.

Once the mortal population of the Xuanhuang Realm reached a consensus, the second stage of the plan could commence.

Using the intent of 'All Beings of Heaven and Earth,' they would launch a synchronized counterattack against the lingering consciousness of the foreign cultivation remnants, encircling and devouring them.

This step would require the assistance of Yin Shangren.

As an existence akin to a world spirit, he possessed profound knowledge of how to devour world consciousness.

After coordinating with the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao to annihilate the cultivation remnants, the final step would be to help these remnants fully integrate into the Xuanhuang.

In fact, most regions of the Xuanhuang Realm had already completed superficial integration.

Only a few isolated prefectures, due to improper integration, were still prone to strange anomalies.

These 'ulcers and sores' needed thorough surgical removal and reconstruction.

If the first and second steps could be carried out covertly, then the third step would undoubtedly alert the Myriad Immortals Alliance, and potentially even the Law Transmitter from beyond the stars.

At that point, conflict would be unavoidable.

However, according to the Saint Emperor's plan, even if they failed in the second step, the momentum would have been established, and failure would be absolute.

Unless more cultivation remnants were found, and another ten thousand years were spent to undertake another round of dissection and reconstruction.

The Stone Tablet, which had not been this excited about anything for a long time, felt a surge of passion for the Saint Emperor's plan.

Beyond saving the Xuanhuang Realm, if successful, the benefits would be self-evident.

It would gain greater control over the world's fate, becoming an existence even more powerful than longevity.

Regardless of the reason, the Stone Tablet would not refuse this plan.

Ten years would pass in the blink of an eye.

...

In the Saint Emperor's throne.

Li Ping summoned Ruo Mu.

A true wise individual never placed all their eggs in one basket.

He naturally would not entrust such a critical task as establishing the Xuanhuang Orthodox lineage solely to the Stone Tablet.

Even though the Stone Tablet was trustworthy, and the plan had low risk.

He expressed the same sentiment as he had to the Stone Tablet, albeit in different words.

The primary agent, Ruo Mu, would be responsible for the task, while the 'All Beings of Heaven and Earth' concept, to be instilled into the Xuanhuang Realm, would be achieved through the ordinary flora and fauna of the Xuanhuang Realm.

"You are the ancestor of all beings, so influencing them subtly should be something you can accomplish."

"Establish the concept of the 'Xuanhuang Realm.'"

For Ruo Mu, this was a minor task.

Furthermore, the recent development of new sprouts on its withered branches had renewed its spirit.

Rarely motivated, it readily agreed.

"Ruo Mu, Stone Tablet."

"Having only them is not enough."

"Ultimately, I will have to personally intervene."

"With triple insurance, only then can it be considered foolproof."

The Saint Emperor's thoughts flowed slowly.

"Contending with the Myriad Immortals Alliance head-on is the manifest battlefield."

"And this establishment of the Xuanhuang Orthodox lineage is the war fought in the shadows."

"Comparatively speaking, this shadow war is even more crucial. There is only one chance; if lost, it is a complete defeat."

While the Saint Emperor was contemplating, his forehead slowly bulged.

As the flesh and blood swelled, a tumor continuously grew larger.

Li Ping seemed completely unaware, remaining motionless.

Until half a day later, the flesh and blood burst open, and a mass of Xuanhuang aura emerged.

The Xuanhuang aura swirled, with a hazy image within.

It seemed somewhat like Mr. Bai, and somewhat like Li Ping himself.

"Cat Treasure."

The Faceless Saint Emperor called out to the dozing Cat Treasure.

He pinched its nape, coaxing it reluctantly to activate its replication ability.

Another identical mass of Xuanhuang aura appeared in the Saint Emperor's throne.

"Go!"

The Saint Emperor gave a soft command, and these two masses of Xuanhuang aura pierced through the void, leaving the Great Qi small world and flying towards different prefectures of the Xuanhuang Realm.

They did not directly merge with the Heavenly Dao but instead lurked in the shadows.

The Saint Emperor coughed lightly. Even with his strength, he felt a slight, temporary weakness.

The mass of Xuanhuang aura that separated from his body could, in a sense, be considered the remnants of the Xuanhuang malevolence he had previously consumed.

However, after being refined by himself, and imbued with the Sacred Dynasty's destiny from the 'Heavenly Emperor's Manual of Qi,' it had become something akin to a tangible manifestation of Xuanhuang destiny.

If not for his recent deep dive into the Star Sea and his observation of the Star Sea's origin intent, it would have been difficult for him to condense this tangible destiny.

"Each mass of tangible destiny can be integrated into, and govern, approximately three prefectures."

"Let's set aside the Five Elders Council for now. With Cat Treasure's assistance, it shouldn't take long to encompass the entire Myriad Immortals Alliance."

A few breaths later, the Saint Emperor's aura had returned to its peak strength.

But Li Ping knew this was due to the support of the Sacred Dynasty's destiny reserves and the feedback from his own enlightenment.

If he condensed this too frequently, he would not recover so quickly.

"The integration of Xuanhuang destiny into Heaven and Earth is equivalent to a reassertion of sovereignty."

"Even if Ruo Mu and the Stone Tablet fail, the Xuanhuang Orthodox lineage will still be firmly under control."

"Of course, it would be even better if they succeeded."

In Li Ping's estimations, the war against the Myriad Immortals Alliance should ideally occur after the establishment of the Xuanhuang Orthodox lineage.

Because by then, in dealing with these 'heretics' of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, he would effectively be fighting on home turf. Every thought and every intention could disregard spatial distance and summon the power of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao to unleash endless heavenly punishment.

Victory would be achieved without a single soldier.

Chapter 1264: Boundless Peeking and World Shattering

In the cultivation world, the strong reign supreme. The ultimate outcome would depend on the final battle with the Law Transmitter. The Saint Emperor, self-aware of his current limitations, understood that a significant gap remained between his strength and that of the Law Transmitter. After all, the latter had suppressed the Xuanhuang Realm for millennia and had further honed his understanding in the depths of the starry sea, making him truly unfathomable. While the Saint Emperor had reached the Xuanhuang Realm's limits and gained the fortuitous encounter with the Star Sea's Origin Dao intent, he had yet to fully translate this into tangible power.

"I need more time," the Saint Emperor thought, a sense of urgency gripping him. "Time waits for no one." Before his journey to the starry sea, he hadn't felt this way. But since his return, an inexplicable intuition told him that his time might be running out.

...

In the Sun family. Sun Luyuan, channeling his spiritual energy to ward off the biting cold, slowly stepped into the room. He looked at Sun Tianci, who sat cross-legged on the bed, not crying or making noise, but simply staring blankly, a wave of helplessness washing over him. Every family has its own burdens. Outsiders only knew of Sun Tianci's extraordinary birth, seemingly born in harmony with the Dao and possessing immense power, but they didn't know that perhaps, having witnessed his mother's death firsthand from birth, the child had become extremely indifferent to outsiders. A natural aura of frigid defense emanated from him, making it difficult for others to approach. If not for his innate Dao-integration cultivation, he might not have survived even a few days without proper care. However, no matter how extraordinary, he was still a newborn infant who required care. The several Dao integration cultivators of the Sun family could only take turns attending to him.

"Tianci..." Sun Luyuan offered a gentle smile, presenting the prepared premium spiritual liquid. "Please have some, won't you?" Sun Tianci merely shook his head, refusing. Sun Luyuan felt helpless. Then, as if struck by an idea, he spoke softly, "I'm going to visit your father this time. He learned of your birth and personally created a cultivation method for you. Take a look..." With that, Sun Luyuan transmitted Li Ping's "Righteous Law Ascendant" technique to Sun Tianci via divine sense. Upon hearing that it was created by his unseen father for his sake, the icy aura surrounding Sun Tianci showed a slight loosening. He slowly read through the text of "Righteous Law Ascendant," seeming to gain some insight, and closed his eyes. Sensing the environment around him gradually returning to normal, Sun Luyuan was overjoyed. More importantly, Sun Tianci's innate sense of sorrow was also slowly receding.

"What a truly 'Righteous Law Ascendant'!" "Our Lu is indeed resourceful!" Knowing that Sun Tianci was currently in a state of enlightenment, Sun Luyuan dared not disturb him. He gently placed the spiritual liquid aside and quietly withdrew. After sealing the room with restrictions to prevent any external disturbances, he finally felt somewhat at ease. "Tianci's temperament is good as well. If he stays indoors and out of public view, in a few years, the world will forget his existence." "In this era of great change, our Sun family should prioritize dormancy and preserving our strength."

Thinking this, Sun Luyuan recalled the mission assigned to him by the Sacred Dynasty. Since joining the Sacred Dynasty, his life had been quite leisurely, with no mandatory tasks assigned. His previous plan to lure Kongyou Immortal to the Sacred Dynasty to become a Dao companion for the Saint Emperor's disciples had been interrupted by Xuanyuan Xian's sudden commission and was now uncontactable, so it had to be set aside for the time being. This left Sun Luyuan, who was eager to contribute and increase his own capital, somewhat dejected. He had finally received a task from the Sacred Dynasty, but it was quite troublesome, and he hadn't found an opportunity to act. "The Nether Prison..." "Isn't that just a place to imprison heinous criminals? What is the Sacred Dynasty trying to achieve by meddling in it?" Sun Luyuan muttered to himself. Entering the Nether Prison wouldn't be difficult, but infiltrating it while maintaining contact with the outside world would be truly challenging. "The Nether Prison operates as a separate entity within the Myriad Immortals Alliance, exclusively managed in rotation by the Law Transmitters. To interfere..." Although the mission assigned by the Sacred Dynasty didn't specify consequences for failure, Sun Luyuan knew this was undoubtedly a test from the Sacred Dynasty. Sun Luyuan's mind conjured images of various individuals, beginning to contemplate a list of people who could assist him in this matter. After a long while, he still found no promising candidates. Habitually, he went to the underground secret chamber. His younger brother, Sun Luoyao, the spirit of the Boundless Mirror, seeing his expression, inquired about the reason.

"Brother, I found some information that might be useful." Sun Luyuan's tightly furrowed brows relaxed as he looked at the message his brother had sent. "Perhaps it's feasible." "I'll go try." As he was about to leave in a hurry, he suddenly heard Sun Luoyao ask, "Oh, right, Brother, you promised to take me out for some fresh air before. When can we set off?" Sun Luyuan paused, responding vaguely, "Wait a bit longer. Those people are still watching the Sun family. If I take you out now, who knows if the situation like last time, being ambushed by the Medicine Hall's Chen family while searching for fragments, will happen again." "Let's wait until the situation calms down." With that, he left in a hurry before Sun Luoyao could respond.

"Okay, I understand, Brother..." Before he left, he heard his brother say. However, his tone seemed a bit strange. But Sun Luyuan didn't think much of it. Sun Luoyao's information, obtained by peering through the Heavenly Profound Mirror, indicated that the Myriad Immortals Alliance had a high-ranking prisoner who was about to be sent to the Nether Prison. However, this individual had a special status, being a direct descendant of the Law Transmitter [Sun]. With such a background, he shouldn't have been sent to a place like the Nether Prison. But the crime he committed openly this time was simply too grave. As is widely known, the Myriad Immortals Alliance was organizing the second "Rainbow Light Escape" towards the depths of the starry sea. Kongming Liujing was a critical resource required for this endeavor. While previously the Myriad Immortals Alliance had tacitly agreed to distribute the slots for this "Rainbow Light Escape" equally among Dao integration cultivators of the Alliance, regardless of background, they had now used this opportunity to publicly reiterate the scarcity of Kongming Liujing under the guise of righteousness. They began to employ methods, including but not limited to fishing expeditions, to reclaim the Liujing privately hoarded by various families. And that direct descendant of the Law Transmitter, Sun Wanyun, was caught red-handed for privately purchasing large quantities of Kongming Liujing. The cultivators responsible for apprehending him were naturally aware of Sun Wanyun's identity. But in full view of the public, they had to maintain appearances. Thus, they could only grudgingly arrest him. They had originally intended to release him quietly afterward, but for some unknown reason, someone had been fanning the flames from behind the scenes. In less than half a day, the news of Sun Wanyun's relentless and uncompromising arrest by the Myriad Immortals Alliance had quietly spread. Everyone praised Law Transmitter Sun for upholding the Alliance's laws and sacrificing his own kin. With the situation having escalated to this point, the Myriad Immortals Alliance could not possibly backtrack on its decision. Moreover, Kongming Liujing was indeed too important, so Sun Wanyun was rightfully imprisoned in the Nether Prison. However, being a direct descendant of a Law Transmitter, no one knew when he might be released. Therefore, he naturally had certain privileges within the Nether Prison.

"This person should be a suitable breakthrough point." "Under the guise of visiting, I can deliver the item gifted by the Saint Emperor to him..." Sun Luyuan thought this and arrived at the temporary detention location for Sun Wanyun within the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters. Upon seeing the scene, he was somewhat stunned. It turned out that quite a few "wise people" understood the principle of sending charcoal in the snow. A crowd of cultivators had gathered at the entrance to visit him, making it quite lively. It was hardly the treatment one would expect for a major criminal about to be imprisoned in the Nether Prison. This scene was truly ironic. Although they shared the same surname, Sun Luyuan had no blood relation to Law Transmitter Sun or this Sun Wanyun, having only met them a few times. As the patriarch of the Sun family, boasting five Dao integration cultivators, who appeared incredibly glorious to outsiders, Sun Luyuan also had to obediently wait in line at the entrance.

Simultaneously, in the Sun family's underground secret chamber. Li Fan's divine sense clone was mercilessly mocking Sun Luoyao. "I told you long ago that your brother would never let you out. What do you think?" "I took you out before because you would occasionally lose control and were constantly at risk of the Boundless Mirror malfunctioning." "Now, with my help and careful management, the source of the Boundless Mirror's instability, that obliterating wind tribulation, has been gradually dispelled, and your performance has become increasingly stable." "You, young man, are now an immortal artifact, and you are the hope for the Sun family's rise. How could your brother possibly let you go easily? What if something were to happen to you, and you were abducted?" Sun Luoyao listened to Li Fan's taunts in silence, his figure in the mirror occasionally distorting, revealing his inner indignation.

"Senior..." After a long period of silence, he wisely spoke, seeking help from Li Fan. Sun Luoyao knew that this mysterious entity would not have spoken so much just to mock him. "Heh heh. You've become smarter, kid." Li Fan chuckled. As he spoke, he conjured a pair of large hands and reached for Sun Luoyao's head. Sun Luoyao was startled but endured it and did not dodge. The dark giant hand enveloped him, and the Boundless Mirror within violently shook. A phantom image was extracted by Li Fan from Sun Luoyao's body. Li Fan gently waved his hand, and this phantom image floated out of the Boundless Mirror, merging with a pile of materials that had appeared out of thin air in the secret chamber. In a short while, another "Boundless Mirror," appearing identical to the original, materialized before Sun Luoyao. As the spirit of the Boundless Mirror, Sun Luoyao was naturally extremely familiar with the immortal artifact. But even he could not distinguish the difference between the current object and the immortal artifact he inhabited! His heart filled with doubt, Sun Luoyao flew into the fake mirror, only to find it was an empty shell. He then excitedly returned.

"Senior's methods are indeed unfathomable! You can even replicate immortal artifacts, and so realistically!" Sun Luoyao flattered. "Hmph, it's merely a superficial imitation," Li Fan said coldly. "You should project another strand of your divine sense into this mirror. With my craftsmanship as the foundation, and your augmentation, it should be enough to fool your brother." Seeing freedom within reach, Sun Luoyao did not hesitate. Enduring the agonizing pain of his soul being severed, he separated a strand of divine sense. Once Sun Luoyao's divine sense entered the imitation Boundless Mirror, this counterfeit artifact became flawless. In a sense, it could be considered a clone of the true Boundless Mirror. Although it was just an empty shell, as long as the Boundless Mirror existed, it could synchronize the information detected by the main body at any time.

"Senior, can we sneak out now?" Seeing the imitation Boundless Mirror now floating quietly in the air, replacing the original, Sun Luoyao asked impatiently. "Idiot! What do you mean 'sneak out'?" "This is called 'the vast sea allows fish to leap, the high heavens let birds fly'!" Li Fan's clone laughed sinisterly, grabbing the Boundless Mirror and transforming into a black streak, ignoring the heavy restrictions and defenses personally laid out by Sun Luyuan, and instantly exited the Sun family. Seeing the blue sky above again, Sun Luoyao was filled with excitement.

"Senior, where are we going?" "As discussed before, to find the lost immortal artifacts of the Xuanhuang Realm?" Even without a physical body, Sun Luoyao deeply inhaled the air of freedom and cautiously asked Li Fan. "Immortal artifacts... no rush," Li Fan merely replied. Seeing that the other party wouldn't elaborate, Sun Luoyao dared not press further. He could only be led by the other party, speeding south towards the Xuanhuang Realm. Seven days later, sensing the surging energy fluctuations ahead, Sun Luoyao suddenly became alert.

"That is..." In the boundless ocean, turbulent currents converged towards a central point. Fierce winds howled and crackled. The torrential rain even tore through space, giving rise to streaks of lightning. Beside the immense vortex, which seemed to gather all the water in the world, lay a striking chain of islands, resembling a long dragon. This distinctive scenery immediately told Sun Luoyao where they were. "The Realm-Splitting Great Vortex!" he exclaimed. Although he had already known of this magnificent natural spectacle from countless documents gleaned through the Heavenly Profound Mirror, the experience of being there in person was vastly different.

"Such surging, turbulent currents, such ferocious, violent winds..." "How could mere informational shadows represent even a fraction of it?" From his youth, confined to a dark, sunless mirror, unable to witness the magnificent sights of the world. This grand and magnificent scene before him stirred Sun Luoyao's emotions, making him feel like the passionate youth he once was. "Making such a racket, you truly have no experience," Li Fan's discordant voice pulled Sun Luoyao out of his continuous exclamations. "After your sighing, it's time to get down to business." With a gentle flick of his finger towards the Boundless Mirror, Sun Luoyao's phantom image was instantly sucked into it. A moment later, the mirror's surface uncontrollably released a beam of ethereal light, aimed at the nearby Realm-Splitting Great Vortex. The Boundless Mirror's body trembled slightly, and countless images cascaded within it like a waterfall. Li Fan simply narrowed his eyes, quietly awaiting the changes within.

"Boundless, the primordial realm meets the square." "With this grand formation as its core, the Boundless Mirror should be able to decipher all secrets in the world." "Although it is now damaged, it should be sufficient to spy on the secrets of this [Realm-Splitting]." "After all, the power of Realm-Splitting back then was immense. Even after so much time, the wounds it left on the Xuanhuang Realm have yet to heal." ... As Li Fan contemplated, the Boundless Mirror seemed to have reached its limit. Cracks began to appear on its surface. (End of this chapter)

Chapter 1265: Prolegomenon to Xuanhuang Island

"The Origin Dao Intent of the Star Sea..." Li Fan repeatedly savored the fragments of insight transmitted from the Saint Emperor. Simultaneously, he vaguely sensed the ongoing resurgence of the Xuanhuang Realm from within. "If there were no Devouring Heaven and Earth cultivators within, and no Immortal Ruins from the outside, perhaps the Xuanhuang Realm could truly be reborn." "Unfortunately... it's destined to be a superficial fix." While shaking his head slightly, a trace of doubt surfaced in his mind. Logically, the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao must have known this. Instead of accumulating this revival energy for the decisive battle ahead, it was eagerly manifesting it now. What was its purpose? "Heh heh, I shall wait and see."

The perspective shifted back to the Sacred Dynasty in Great Qi. The Stone Tablet, having sensed the anomaly in the Xuanhuang Realm, immediately arrived at the Saint Emperor's Throne. Upon seeing the Saint Emperor, who also emanated a mystical aura, the Stone Tablet was startled. "You are aware of what transpired in the Xuanhuang Realm?" "There is no cause for alarm; it is beneficial, not detrimental," the Saint Emperor replied. The Stone Tablet's expression eased slightly. "I thought the Xuanhuang Realm was on the brink of destruction, experiencing a final surge of vitality..." "You are not entirely wrong. This revival energy, triggered by a momentary enlightenment, is not meant to last. However, for us, it might represent a once-in-a-millennium opportunity," the Saint Emperor said slowly after a brief silence.

"You mean the plan to establish the Xuanhuang's orthodox lineage?" the Stone Tablet paused, then quickly understood. "Indeed." The Saint Emperor nodded, and a miniature representation of the Xuanhuang Realm appeared before them. Within it, parts of the primal Xuanhuang Realm glowed yellow. However, since the collapse of the Immortal Path, the indigenous forces of the Xuanhuang Realm, the Xuan Heaven Cult, and the Ten Immortal Sects, in their capture of Cave-Heavens and Worlds using the [Great Ascension Star Crossing Formation], appeared in a peculiar green. After the great calamity swept through and the Star Sea shattered, the fragments of other cultivation worlds, forcibly grafted by outsiders, appeared in a deathly black.

This information was transmitted by the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao. It was evident that the yellow, representing the Xuanhuang Realm, occupied less than a third of the entire miniature landscape. Green constituted a tenth. The rest was vast expanses of black. Visually, the Xuanhuang's yellow seemed like an anomaly. However, unlike the green and black hues, the yellow light representing the Xuanhuang Realm pulsed as if possessing its own consciousness, constantly overflowing and spreading into the surrounding, alien-colored regions. From a purely visual perspective, the green and black areas were not pure, interspersed with specks of dark yellow. Yet, over millennia, this insidious erosion had slowed, even showing signs of being reversed. However... with the recent surge of vitality in the Xuanhuang Realm, the spread of the Xuanhuang color had suddenly accelerated.

"The Xuanhuang's orthodox lineage..." the Stone Tablet mused. "The regions originally belonging to the Xuanhuang Realm are naturally beyond question; all events occurring within them are meticulously recorded by the Creation Stone Tablet. As for the green regions..." the Stone Tablet carefully discerned. "Some fall within the Stone Tablet's recorded scope, while others do not." "As for the black regions, they are complete blind spots."

Li Ping, the Saint Emperor, stated, "If we do nothing, the ultimate fate of the Xuanhuang Realm will be to be swallowed by the overwhelmingly dominant black. In the future, this blackness will likely evolve into something entirely different." "Therefore, we must act first and deeply infuse the Xuanhuang's orthodox lineage into these external remnants." The Saint Emperor's voice was deep but resolute.

"How do we proceed?" the Stone Tablet asked with keen interest. "Observe the ways of Heaven, act according to Heaven..." the Saint Emperor slowly explained, and the Stone Tablet listened intently, nodding occasionally. After detailing the method, the Saint Emperor's tone grew somber. "Proceed with utmost caution when undertaking this, to avoid detection by the instigator." Although the Saint Emperor did not explicitly name the culprit, the Stone Tablet understood his meaning.

The Stone Tablet displayed a rare, playful smile. "This so-called 'silent nurturing,' carried out stealthily. With the active cooperation and concealment of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, even someone with peerless cultivation might not detect it." The Saint Emperor responded sternly, "Do not be careless. Even if they are not currently in the Xuanhuang Realm, we must guard against any contingencies they may have left behind." The Stone Tablet nodded, acknowledging this.

"It is best that the fewer people involved in this matter, the better. Ideally, Ruomu would be the most effective. After all, as a primordial tree spirit, his connection to the Xuanhuang Realm is more profound." "It's not that I don't trust him, but that every action Ruomu takes is under the observation of other powerful beings in this realm. As the executing party, he would be too conspicuous. Conversely, everyone believes you are constantly oppressed by the Creation Stone Tablet, which ironically makes you overlooked." Perhaps because it concerned the future of the Xuanhuang Realm, the Saint Emperor spoke at unusual length. It was as if he were speaking to the Stone Tablet, and also to Ruomu.

"This is the so-called 'darkness beneath the lamp,' isn't it?" the Stone Tablet agreed, nodding. "Now that I am free from the burden of the Stone Tablet, and with a few more transformations, I can guarantee that no one in the Xuanhuang Realm will associate me with my past appearance." "Then let us wait a few days. When the Xuanhuang Realm's revived energy reaches its peak, we will act. It will be twice as effective with half the effort." The Stone Tablet immediately agreed. It did not leave but stood quietly in the Saint Emperor's Throne Hall, observing the miniature Xuanhuang Realm that the Saint Emperor had conjured.

The light in the center of the Xuanhuang pulsed, like a beating heart, transmitting tendrils of Xuanhuang essence to all parts of the Xuanhuang Realm, including the green and black regions. Although they were gradually being assimilated, the powerful, continuous surge of revival energy allowed them to temporarily maintain their original colors. Slowly, even the outermost black regions of the Xuanhuang Realm began to acquire a subtle, imperceptible trace of Xuanhuang-yellow.

"We can begin now," the Faceless Saint Emperor said in a deep voice. The Stone Tablet smiled slightly, its form flickering. Instantly, within the Saint Emperor's Throne Hall, numerous identical Stone Tablet figures materialized. They transformed from two into four, four into eight, and eight into sixteen. In the blink of an eye, countless identical Stone Tablet figures filled the hall. "Change! Change! Change!" the Stone Tablets chanted in unison. In the next instant, the Stone Tablet duplicates transformed into various real beings of the Xuanhuang Realm: scholars in white robes, humble woodcutters, stunningly beautiful women, and carefree elders... Each person appeared incredibly lifelike, with no discernible resemblance to their origin, a single entity. "I depart," they bowed respectfully to the Saint Emperor, their faces beaming with smiles, and vanished from the Saint Emperor's Throne.

Simultaneously, across the various prefectures of the Xuanhuang Realm, in ways imperceptible to anyone, special presences emerged. When they had all gathered in the Saint Emperor's Throne Hall, they had seemed rather crowded. But dispersed throughout the Xuanhuang Realm, they caused not even the slightest ripple. "Observe the ways of Heaven, act according to Heaven." "Heaven and Man are one, all transformations are based on this foundation..." They chanted softly, their feet heading towards the densely populated mortal cities in each prefecture.

The Saint Emperor's plan was simple in concept. It was to establish the foundation of Heaven and Earth through human intent. Utilizing the Stone Tablet's ability to disguise itself as any form, countless duplicates were created, infiltrating the mortal populace. They would subtly propagate the concept of the "Xuanhuang Realm" to all mortal beings in the Xuanhuang Realm. Currently, mortals only knew the small corner of the world they inhabited. They had no specific understanding of this world, the Xuanhuang Realm. The very concept of the Xuanhuang Realm did not exist in their consciousness. The first step in establishing the Xuanhuang's orthodox lineage was to first popularize the existence of the Xuanhuang Realm, the world they lived in. Naturally, this was not a task for a single day, but would require years, perhaps even decades, of propagation. Moreover, to avoid raising suspicion, they needed to seamlessly integrate into mortal society, spreading the message through word of mouth. However, with the Stone Tablet's power, even with countless duplicates, achieving this was not insurmountable. A single mortal was as insignificant as an ant, but when combined with the entire mortal population of the Xuanhuang Realm, they formed an undeniable force.

Once the mortal populace of the Xuanhuang Realm reached a consensus, the second phase of the plan would commence. Using the intent of "[All Beings of Heaven and Earth]," they would launch a synchronized counterattack and containment against the residual consciousness of the externally imposed cultivation realms, devouring them. This step would require Yin Shangren's assistance. As a being existing as a world-soul, he possessed profound knowledge of how to consume world consciousness. After cooperating with the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao to purge the remnants of the cultivation realms, the final step would be to help these remnants fully integrate into the Xuanhuang Realm. In reality, the vast majority of the Xuanhuang Realm had already achieved superficial integration. Only a few prefectures experienced persistent anomalies due to improper fusion. These "ulcers" required surgical removal, a process of destruction and rebirth.

While the first and second steps might be accomplished covertly, the third step would inevitably alert the Myriad Immortals Alliance, and possibly even the Law Transmitter from beyond the Star Sea. At that point, conflict would be unavoidable. However, according to the Saint Emperor, once the second step was completed, even if they ultimately failed, the tide would have turned, and it would be impossible to reverse the situation. It would require another ten thousand years of dismemberment and reintegration, incorporating more fragmented cultivation realms.

For the Saint Emperor's plan, the Stone Tablet, which had not been excited about any particular matter for a long time, felt a surge of fervor. Beyond saving the Xuanhuang Realm, the benefits of success were self-evident. They would gain greater control over the world's destiny, becoming beings even more powerful than those in the Longevity Realm. For whatever reason, the Stone Tablet would not refuse this plan. The ten-plus years required would pass in the blink of an eye.

... In the Saint Emperor's Throne Hall. Li Ping summoned Ruomu. True wisdom lies in not placing all one's eggs in one basket. He naturally would not entrust such a critical task as establishing the Xuanhuang's orthodox lineage solely to the Stone Tablet. Even though the Stone Tablet was trustworthy and the plan carried minimal risk. He reiterated the same points he had made to the Stone Tablet, merely changing the wording. The primary agent responsible for achieving the goal would now be Ruomu. The concept of "Xuanhuang Realm" would be subtly implanted into the ordinary flora and fauna of the Xuanhuang Realm. "As the ancestor of all beings, you should be able to exert a subtle influence on them." "You must establish the idea of the [Xuanhuang Realm]." For Ruomu, this was a trivial matter. Furthermore, the recent event of new sprouts appearing on his withered branches had rekindled his spirit. Rare enthusiasm ignited, he readily agreed.

"Ruomu, Stone Tablet." "Having them alone is not enough." "Ultimately, I must also personally intervene." "Triple insurance is the only way to guarantee success." The Saint Emperor's thoughts flowed, and as he contemplated, a bulge slowly formed on his forehead. Amidst the swelling flesh and blood, a tumor grew larger. Li Ping seemed completely oblivious, remaining motionless. After about half a day, the flesh and blood burst open, and a mass of Xuanhuang essence emerged. Surrounded by the Xuanhuang essence, hazy images flickered within. It looked somewhat like Mr. Bai, and somewhat like Li Ping himself.

"Cat Treasure." The Faceless Saint Emperor called to the dozing Cat Treasure, rousing it. He gently squeezed its hindquarters, forcing the reluctant creature to perform its replication function. Then, another identical mass of Xuanhuang essence appeared in the Saint Emperor's Throne Hall. "Go!" The Saint Emperor commanded, and the two masses of Xuanhuang essence tore through space, leaving the Great Qi small world and heading towards different prefectures of the Xuanhuang Realm. They did not directly merge with the Heavenly Dao but instead lurked in secret. The Saint Emperor let out a slight cough. Even with his power, he felt a momentary, slight weakness. This mass of Xuanhuang essence, separated from him, could be considered, in a sense, the refined form of the Xuanhuang malevolence he had once consumed. However, after his own refinement, infused with the Sacred Dynasty's Qi Luck from the [Heavenly Emperor's Qi Canon], it had become something akin to materialized Xuanhuang Qi Luck. If not for his recent journey into the Star Sea and his encounter with the Star Sea's Origin Dao Intent, it would have been difficult for him to condense this materialized Qi Luck.

"Each mass of materialized Qi Luck can merge with and govern approximately three prefectures." "Setting aside the Five Elders Council for now, encompassing the entire Myriad Immortals Alliance with Cat Treasure's assistance should not take long." A few breaths later, the Saint Emperor's aura returned to its peak. However, Li Ping knew this was due to the reserves of Sacred Dynasty Qi Luck and the feedback from his own enlightenment. If he condensed this essence too frequently, recovery would not be so rapid. "Integrating Xuanhuang Qi Luck into Heaven and Earth is akin to reasserting sovereignty." "Even if Ruomu and the Stone Tablet fail, the Xuanhuang's orthodox lineage will still be firmly established." Of course, it would be even better if they succeeded. According to Li Ping's calculations, the battle against the Myriad Immortals Alliance would ideally occur after the establishment of the Xuanhuang's orthodox lineage. Because by then, facing the Myriad Immortals Alliance's "heretics," he would essentially be fighting on home turf, able to mobilize the power of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao and unleash endless heavenly tribulations with every thought, regardless of spatial distance. Victory could be achieved without a single soldier.

Chapter 1266: Stealing Dark Power

Naturally, in the cultivation world, strength reigned supreme. The key still lay in the final battle against the Law Transmitter. "Knowing oneself is wisdom." The Saint Emperor was acutely aware of the significant gap between his current strength and that of the Law Transmitter. After all, the latter had dominated the Xuanhuang for millennia and had also attained enlightenment in the depths of the Star Sea. Truly unfathomable. While the Saint Emperor had now reached the Xuanhuang Realm's limit and gained the fortuitous encounter with the Star Sea's Origin Dao Intent, he had yet to truly convert this fortune into power.

"I need more time." A sense of urgency settled upon the Saint Emperor. "Time waits for no one." Before his journey into the Star Sea, he hadn't felt this way. But since his return, an ethereal premonition told him that his time might be running out.

...

The Sun family.

Sun Luyuan channeled his spiritual energy, resisting the biting cold that permeated his surroundings, and slowly entered the room. He looked at Sun Tianci, who sat cross-legged on the bed, neither crying nor making noise, merely staring blankly. A sense of helplessness washed over him. Every family has its own difficult burdens. Outsiders knew Sun Tianci as a prodigy born with Dao comprehension, possessing extraordinary power. What they didn't know was that this child, having witnessed his birth mother's death from the moment he was born, had become extremely detached from others. A natural aura of frigid defense surrounded him, making it difficult for outsiders to approach. If not for his innate Harmonious Dao cultivation, he might have starved to death within days due to lack of care.

But no matter how extraordinary, he was still an infant who needed care. The Harmonious Dao cultivators of the Sun family could only take turns attending to him. "Tianci..." Sun Luyuan smiled kindly and produced the perfectly prepared high-grade spiritual fluid. "Won't you eat something?" Sun Tianci merely shook his head, refusing. Sun Luyuan felt a pang of helplessness. Then, as if remembering something, he gently said, "I'm going to visit your father this time. He learned of your birth and personally created a technique for you. See..." As he spoke, Sun Luyuan transmitted the text of [Righteous Law Ascending], created by Li Fan, into Sun Tianci's mind.

Upon hearing that it was a technique created by his father, whom he had never met, the icy aura surrounding Sun Tianci loosened slightly. He slowly read through the text of [Righteous Law Ascending], and as if suddenly enlightened, closed his eyes. Noticing the surrounding environment gradually normalizing, Sun Luyuan was overjoyed. More importantly, Sun Tianci's innate sadness seemed to be dissipating. "What a remarkable [Righteous Law Ascending]!" "Only Lu'er knows how to handle this!" Knowing that Sun Tianci was in a state of enlightenment, Sun Luyuan dared not disturb him. He gently placed the spiritual fluid aside and quietly withdrew. After sealing the room with a formation to prevent external disturbance, he felt somewhat at ease.

"Tianci's disposition is for the best. By staying secluded and out of the public eye, people will forget his existence within a few years." "In this time of great change, our Sun family should prioritize hibernation and preserving our strength." With that thought, Sun Luyuan recalled the mission assigned to him by the Sacred Dynasty. Since joining the Sacred Dynasty, he had lived a rather leisurely life. The Sacred Dynasty had never imposed any mandatory tasks on him. Previously, his plan to lure Fairy Kongyou to the Sacred Dynasty to become a Dao companion for the Saint Emperor's disciples had been interrupted by Xuanyuan Xian's sudden commission, and he could no longer contact the other party, so it had to be temporarily shelved. This left Sun Luyuan, who had always sought to contribute and increase his capital, feeling somewhat frustrated. He had finally received a task from the Sacred Dynasty, but it was indeed troublesome, and he hadn't found an opportunity to act on it.

"Abyssal Prison..." "Isn't that just a place to imprison major offenders? What does the Sacred Dynasty want with it?" Sun Luyuan muttered to himself. Entering the Abyssal Prison would not be difficult. However, to infiltrate it and maintain contact with the outside world would truly be challenging. "The Abyssal Prison operates as a separate entity within the Myriad Immortals Alliance, successively managed by the Law Transmitters. To interfere..." Although the task issued by the Sacred Dynasty this time carried no explicit consequences for failure, Sun Luyuan knew it was undoubtedly a test from the Sacred Dynasty. Sun Luyuan's mind raced, recalling faces, and he began to consider a list of individuals who might assist him with this matter. After a long while, he still had no promising prospects. Habitually, he headed to the underground secret chamber.

His younger brother, Sun Luoyao, the spirit of the Immeasurable Mirror, saw his expression and involuntarily inquired about the reason. "Brother, I've found some information that might be useful." Sun Luyuan looked at the information transmitted by his brother, and his tightly furrowed brow slowly relaxed. "Perhaps this is feasible." "I'll go try." With great haste, he prepared to depart, but then he heard Sun Luoyao ask, "Oh, right. Brother, you promised to take me out for some fresh air. When can we leave?" Sun Luyuan's steps faltered, and he responded evasively, "A little longer. The Sun family is still under scrutiny by those people right now. If I take you out now, we might encounter situations similar to the last time we were ambushed by the Chen family of the Medicine Hall while searching for fragments." "Let's wait until the storm passes." Having said that, he left in a hurry, without waiting for Sun Luoyao's reply.

"Okay, I understand, Brother..." Before leaving, he heard his younger brother say this. However, his tone seemed somewhat unusual. But Sun Luyuan didn't think much of it. The information Sun Luoyao had gleaned from the Profound Heaven Mirror indicated that a major offender from the Myriad Immortals Alliance was about to be imprisoned in the Abyssal Prison. However, this person's identity was special; he was a direct descendant of the Law Transmitter [Sun]. With such a background, he shouldn't have been sent to a place like the Abyssal Prison in the first place. But the offense he had committed publicly this time was too significant.

As is widely known, the Myriad Immortals Alliance was organizing a second expedition of Rainbow Light to the depths of the Star Sea. Empty Light Flowing Crystal was a crucial material required for this endeavor. The previous tacit agreement to distribute spots in this Rainbow Light expedition equally among Harmonious Dao cultivators, regardless of background, had been exploited. The Myriad Immortals Alliance, using this opportunity, had re-emphasized the scarcity of Empty Light Flowing Crystal in the name of righteousness. They began employing methods, including sting operations, to {reclaim/confiscate} the Flowing Crystals privately hoarded by various prominent families. Sun Wanyun, a direct descendant of the Law Transmitter Sun, was caught red-handed stockpiling a large quantity of Empty Light Flowing Crystal.

The cultivators responsible for apprehending Sun Wanyun were well aware of his identity. But under the watchful eyes of the public, they had to maintain appearances. Thus, they had no choice but to arrest him. They had initially planned to release him quietly afterward, but someone had evidently stirred up trouble from behind the scenes. In less than half a day, the news of Sun Wanyun's apprehension by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, acting impartially and ruthlessly, had quietly spread. The public praised Law Transmitter Sun for upholding the alliance's laws and sacrificing his own kin. With the situation escalating to this point, the Myriad Immortals Alliance could not possibly retract their decision. Furthermore, Empty Light Flowing Crystal was indeed too important, so Sun Wanyun was lawfully imprisoned in the Abyssal Prison. However, being a direct descendant of a Law Transmitter, no one knew when he might be released. Therefore, he naturally enjoyed certain privileges within the Abyssal Prison.

"This person should be a suitable breakthrough point." "Under the guise of visiting, I can deliver the item bestowed by the Saint Emperor to him..." Sun Luyuan thought this as he arrived at the temporary holding area for Sun Wanyun within the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters. Upon seeing the situation, he was dumbfounded. It turned out quite a few "clever" people understood the principle of "offering charcoal in snowy weather." The entrance was crowded with cultivators paying visits, making it a lively scene – hardly the treatment expected for a major offender about to be imprisoned in the Abyssal Prison. This scene was indeed ironic.

Although sharing the same surname, Sun Luyuan had no familial ties to Law Transmitter Sun or this Sun Wanyun. They had only met a few times. As the patriarch of a family boasting five Harmonious Dao cultivators, Sun Luyuan was perceived as incredibly influential by outsiders. Yet, he had to dutifully join the queue at the entrance.

Simultaneously, in the Sun family's underground secret chamber. Li Fan's clone mercilessly mocked Sun Luoyao. "I told you long ago that your brother would never let you out. What do you think?" "When I took you out before, it was because you would occasionally go mad and face the risk of losing control of the Mirror." "Now, with my help and guidance, the source of the Immeasurable Mirror's fluctuations, that Annihilation Wind Tribulation, is slowly being purged, and your performance is becoming increasingly stable." "You, my boy, are currently an Immortal Artifact, and more importantly, you hold the hope for the Sun family's rise. How could your brother possibly let you out easily? What if something were to happen to you and you were abducted?"

Sun Luoyao listened to Li Fan's taunts, remaining silent. Only the figure within the mirror occasionally distorted, revealing his inner indignation. "Senior..." After a long silence, he wisely spoke, seeking Li Fan's help. Sun Luoyao knew that this mysterious and powerful being wouldn't have spoken so much merely to mock him. "Heh heh. You're getting smarter, kid." Li Fan chuckled sinisterly. As he spoke, he conjured a pair of large hands and reached for Sun Luoyao's head. Sun Luoyao's heart skipped a beat, but he forced himself not to dodge.

The giant dark hands enveloped him, and the Immeasurable Mirror within began to shake violently. A phantom was extracted by Li Fan from Sun Luoyao's body. Li Fan waved his hand gently, and this phantom floated out of the Immeasurable Mirror, beginning to merge with a pile of materials that had materialized out of thin air in the secret chamber. A short while later, another "Immeasurable Mirror," visually identical, appeared before Sun Luoyao. As the spirit of the Immeasurable Mirror, Sun Luoyao was intimately familiar with the Immortal Artifact. But even he was unable to distinguish the replica from the genuine item.
