With his heart filled with uncertainty, Sun Luoyao flew into the replica, only to find it was merely an empty shell. He then excitedly returned.

"Senior's methods are truly inscrutable! You can even replicate Immortal Artifacts, and so exquisitely!" Sun Luoyao flattered him. "Hmph, it's merely a superficial imitation," Li Fan said coldly. "Now, separate a strand of your divine sense and hide it within this mirror. With my craftsmanship as the basis, and your augmentation, it should be enough to fool your brother." Seeing that freedom was within reach, Sun Luoyao did not hesitate. Despite the tearing pain in his soul, he separated a strand of divine sense. Once Sun Luoyao's divine sense entered the fake Immeasurable Mirror, the counterfeit artifact became flawless. For in a sense, it had become a clone of the true Immeasurable Mirror. Although it was just an empty shell, as long as the Immeasurable Mirror existed, it could synchronize information detected by the main body at any time.

"Senior, can we sneak out now?" Seeing the replica Immeasurable Mirror floating quietly in the air, Sun Luoyao asked impatiently. "Idiot! What do you mean 'sneak out'?" "This is called 'the vast sea allows fish to leap, the high heavens let birds fly!'" Li Fan's clone let out a sinister laugh, enveloping the Immeasurable Mirror and transforming into a black streak. Ignoring the multiple layers of formations painstakingly set up by Sun Luyuan, they vanished from the Sun family in an instant. Seeing the blue sky again, Sun Luoyao was greatly exhilarated. "Senior, where are we going?" "As we discussed before, searching for lost Immortal Artifacts of the Xuanhuang Realm?" Even without a physical body, Sun Luoyao took a deep breath of freedom and cautiously asked Li Fan.

"Immortal Artifacts... no rush," Li Fan replied simply. Seeing that he wouldn't elaborate, Sun Luoyao dared not press further. He could only be led by Li Fan as they sped rapidly southward across the Xuanhuang Realm. Seven days later, sensing a powerful energy fluctuation ahead, Sun Luoyao's spirits lifted. "What is that..." A vast ocean, its turbulent currents converging towards a central point. Fierce winds howled, crackling ominously. A ferocious storm even tore through space, generating bolts of lightning. Beside a massive vortex, seemingly collecting all the waters of the world, lay a striking chain of islands resembling a long, serpentine dragon. This distinctly recognizable landscape immediately identified Sun Luoyao's location.

"The Realm-Rending Vortex!" he exclaimed. Although he had already learned about this celestial wonder from countless data gleaned from the Profound Heaven Mirror, experiencing it firsthand was vastly different. "Such surging currents, such monstrously violent winds..." "How could mere holographic projections represent even a fraction of it?" Having been confined within a dark, sunless mirror since his youth, unable to witness the world's magnificent sights, this magnificent, grand spectacle of Heaven and Earth stirred Sun Luoyao's emotions, making him feel like the passionate youth he once was.

"Stop your clamoring, you truly lack discernment," Li Fan's dismissive voice pulled Sun Luoyao away from his constant exclamations. "Now that you're done marveling, let's get down to business." With a gentle gesture towards the Immeasurable Mirror, Sun Luoyao's phantom was instantly absorbed into it. Moments later, the mirror's surface uncontrollably released a beam of ethereal light, aimed at the Realm-Rending Vortex not far away. The Immeasurable Mirror's body trembled slightly, and countless images cascaded within it like a waterfall. Li Fan merely narrowed his eyes, patiently awaiting the changes within.

"Immeasurable, Primordial Vista." "With this great formation as its core, the Immeasurable Mirror should, in principle, be able to decipher all secrets in the world." "Although it is now damaged, it should be sufficient to probe the secrets of this [Realm-Rending]." "After all, the power of Realm-Rending back then was immense. Even after such a long time, the wound it left on the Xuanhuang Realm has yet to heal."

... While Li Fan was lost in thought, the Immeasurable Mirror seemed to have reached its limit. Cracks began to appear on its surface, as if it had lost its spiritual essence.

Chapter 1267: Reencountering the True Immortal Script

"Senior, I don't think I can take it anymore!" Sun Luoyao's pained voice faintly echoed from within the mirror. "Hmph, you won't die," Li Fan replied, seemingly ignoring him. Not only did he not stop the Immeasurable Mirror from probing, but he also unleashed a hand seal, controlling it to once again emit an ethereal light towards the Realm-Rending Vortex. As he spoke, intricate patterns appeared on the Immeasurable Mirror's surface, perfectly aligning with the cracks. Amidst the serene, pale green light, these fissures were slowly healed.

"Ah..." Sun Luoyao's contradictory voice, filled with both pain and pleasure, resounded. Li Fan merely narrowed his eyes, intensely focused on the fragmented images flashing within the Immeasurable Mirror's profound light. "Let me see what truly happened here back then." In fact, the Creation Stone Tablet did record the events of the Monster Race's journey to the Star Sea. However, after a cataclysmic power erupted from the Southern Nether Mountain, the Xuanhuang Stone Tablet lost its ability to monitor the area. By the time the energy subsided and the region became visible again, the former Monster Race sacred mountain and the entire Monster Race had vanished, leaving only a terrifying void, a wound that had remained unhealed for thousands of years.

Li Fan's purpose in using the Immeasurable Mirror this time, while seeking to confirm whether the Monster Race had successfully escaped through the Realm-Rending, was primarily to decipher the method of Realm-Rending itself. Space had been pierced by unimaginably powerful forces, shattering even the barrier of the High Wall and connecting to the Star Sea beyond. In that instant, it was as if a seal had been pressed into time and space, leaving an imprint. Even as millennia passed, this imprint remained within spacetime, yet to dissipate. By studying and deciphering this Realm-Rending imprint, they might be able to replicate the two instances in Xuanhuang's history where they successfully escaped the Utmost Darkness Star Sea.

Like a flickering black-and-white image with intermittent signals, Li Fan vaguely saw Emperor Yi revealing his true form and delivering a final mobilization speech to the Monster Race. He also saw many monsters watching from afar, choosing not to leave with them. The scene flashed again: the giant python coiled around Southern Nether Mountain let out a heaven-shattering roar, twisting and writhing in agony, its body emitting scorching light as if something was trying to break free from within it. Emperor Yi, the lord of all monsters, watched this with cold indifference. It was only when the python weakly crashed onto the sea's surface, stirring up colossal waves, that Li Fan clearly saw the object within its body. It was a key, magnified countless times!

A ripple spread across Emperor Yi's writhing, gray, flesh-like body. Moments later, a face devoid of any emotion, indifferent and vast, emerged from its form. This face possessed a strange, magical power. Not only did the other heads and faces on Emperor Yi's body instantly quiet down and cease their movements, but even the countless monsters who had been watching from afar around the Southern Nether Sacred Mountain involuntarily lowered their heads, avoiding its gaze. Even Li Fan, peering through the imprint across the river of time thousands of years later, felt an instinctive dread, as if facing a superior being, the moment he saw that face.

"This is..." Even though it was merely a divine sense projection, under the pressure of the Divine Visage, his form became momentarily unstable. After all, it was an illusion from thousands of years ago, and Li Fan's foundation was not comparable to ordinary individuals. After a brief period of adaptation, this invisible pressure quietly dissipated. The scene in the Realm-Rending imprint re-emerged in Li Fan's view. After Emperor Yi revealed the Divine Visage, the massive, bronze-metallic key instantly shrunk. Then, under Emperor Yi's control, it flew directly towards the towering Southern Nether Sacred Mountain. The tip of the key touched the summit of Southern Nether Mountain. Dazzling points of light appeared at the point of contact. A uniform glow instantly spread throughout the key and the Sacred Mountain. As if some form of authentication had been completed, moments later, the key and the Sacred Mountain were bathed in light, becoming ethereal and indistinct.

And then, the countless monsters around the Sacred Mountain, including Emperor Yi, were enveloped by waves of white light, transforming into threads that flew into the bronze key and the Southern Nether Mountain. Subsequently... a terrifying explosion of light, like a world-shattering cataclysm, erupted from above, obscuring all prying eyes. Even as Li Fan endured the searing white light to continue his observation, all he saw was boundless brilliance. It was at this moment that the Immeasurable Mirror truly reached its limit. In an instant, it lost its sentience, unable to even maintain its levitation, and fell from the sky. The spirit of the Immeasurable Mirror, Sun Luoyao, also completely lost consciousness, falling silent.

Li Fan pondered, collecting the Immeasurable Mirror. But in his mind, the scene he had just witnessed replayed continuously. "Previously, in the Fallen Immortal Realm, Emperor Yi explained the principle behind Southern Nether Mountain's successful Realm-Rending. He said it was the edge of Heaven and the corner of the Sea, the end of the world, thus accumulating the scattered and gathered energies of the Xuanhuang Realm since its creation..." "Now it seems it was far more complicated than he described. With only the Xuanhuang Realm's own power, it would be impossible to achieve Realm-Rending, let alone with mere scattered energy." "The Bronze Key and that Divine Visage were likely the keys to their Realm-Rending."

Li Fan suddenly recalled a secret the Saint Emperor had learned from the Crossing Tribulation Sect in this life. "The Crossing Tribulation Sect found a mystical power within the Realm-Rending fissure of the Heavenly Sword Sect, capable of monitoring the Xuanhuang Realm. Once implanted, even the Law Transmitter would be powerless against it. And here, the second location of Realm-Rending, a mysterious entity external to the Xuanhuang Realm, has appeared." "The Xuanhuang Realm is indeed unique among the ancient cultivation worlds, and these two instances seem to touch upon the crux of the matter."

As he pondered, Li Fan's flight became increasingly swift. The scattered clues from the past suddenly coalesced. "The Great Ascension Star Crossing Formation can traverse the endless void and lock onto other cultivation worlds in the depths of the Star Sea." "My formation mastery, under the augmentation of the Terminal Dissolution Disc, has already touched the limits of what is possible in the mortal realm. Furthermore, I understand three of the Nine Primordial Spirit Formations. Even with Immortal-grade formations, I have only just begun to grasp them. Yet, I am baffled as to how the Great Ascension Star Crossing Formation uses that golden chain to precisely lock onto targets in the endless Star Sea." "I previously thought it was due to my insufficient mastery of formations, causing the Terminal Dissolution Disc to fail in its deductions every time. Xuan Tianwang, being a figure of immense learning, and possessing a half-immortal body, with formation skills even surpassing the wondrous Terminal Dissolution Disc..." "Now, it seems I might have overlooked a crucial factor." A sharp gleam flashed in Li Fan's eyes. "What if those targeted cultivation worlds, and the Xuanhuang Realm, share some common factors? Based on this mutual resonance, the golden chain of the Great Ascension Star Crossing Formation could accurately lock onto them one by one." "That is, they all possess a World-Protecting Formation."

"Bai Hua once mentioned that even the primal Xuanhuang Realm was a colossal entity among many cultivation worlds. Her home, the Myriad Manifestations Realm, was only the size of a single prefecture." "If we liken the Xuanhuang Realm to an island in the Sea of Clouds, it would be like Glazed Island, a larger one. And the other worlds and cave-heavens it captured would be smaller ones in the Star Sea." "Hmm... perhaps later, as these worlds were gradually drawn into the Immortal Ruins, the Xuanhuang Realm also captured some along the way. After the Ten Immortal Sects were destroyed, the Law Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician took over, patching things up, leading to the Xuanhuang Realm's current flourishing state." "If my hypothesis is correct, then the regions initially captured by the Xuanhuang Realm must have possessed World-Protecting Formations."

Thinking of this, Li Fan's thoughts paused as if struck by realization. "Initially, the Xuanhuang Realm simply captured and annexed them, rather than dismembering and reassembling them as it does now." "Therefore, those initially absorbed regions should have been on the outer periphery of the Xuanhuang Realm." "The edge of Heaven, the corner of the Sea. The world's frontier." "Furthermore, Emperor Yi's words seemed to vaguely imply that the Xuanhuang monsters originated from the outside..." "So that's how it is." Li Fan suddenly understood. "It seems Emperor Yi's Bronze Key did not activate a World-Protecting Formation intrinsic to the Xuanhuang Realm itself..."

Li Fan's thoughts raced. The truth was, there was a simple way to verify his hypothesis. In the small world where he discovered the golden skull and the character "{没}," the golden chain of the Great Ascension Star Crossing Formation had clearly broken through the void and locked onto the world. All he needed to do was investigate that location again. With this thought, Li Fan changed course, heading directly towards his target.

Along the way, Sun Luoyao slowly regained consciousness. "Senior, where are we going?" Without any complaints about Li Fan's extreme exploitation of his labor, Sun Luoyao asked curiously. "To an interesting place. You should rest well during this interval. We might need your assistance next." Li Fan said calmly. Sun Luoyao's phantom figure within the mirror couldn't help but shake. "Senior, I feel very weak right now..." After a moment of silence, Sun Luoyao mustered his courage and said. The response was a mass of thick, golden substance. Sun Luoyao's attention was immediately captivated, as if seeing a peerless treasure. He knew this was the miraculous substance Li Fan had previously used to lure the Annihilation Wind Tribulation out of the Immeasurable Mirror. It held an irresistible, fatal attraction for him, and an inner intuition told him that this substance would be extremely beneficial. Thus, Sun Luoyao immediately shut his mouth and ravenously consumed the Origin Force essence. Moments later, his spirit rejuvenated, the feeling of weakness vanished.

"Hmph." Emerging from the delightful sensation, Sun Luoyao wanted to curry favor with Li Fan and ask for more. However, he was brought back to reality by Li Fan's cold snort. He did not dare to ask further, hoping that after completing the upcoming task, he might receive further rewards. Not long after, after traversing a long void passage, Li Fan finally arrived at the desolate world filled with ashes once more. "Go!" At Li Fan's signal, the Immeasurable Mirror once again emitted ethereal light. Compared to their previous attempt at the Realm-Rending Vortex, this probing and deciphering process was undoubtedly smoother. Effortlessly, the images within the ethereal light reconstructed the scene.

A vibrant world. A great river, nurturing countless beings. After death, beings were reborn in the river, achieving a perfect cycle. "Not this, delve deeper." Just as Sun Luoyao was immersed in the secondary scene, Li Fan's voice broke through. Sun Luoyao's concentration wavered, and he increased the Immeasurable Mirror's probing intensity. The scene of vitality became fragmented and ethereal. The river itself became dreamlike and illusory, like starlight. Beneath all appearances, intertwined lines suddenly appeared on the Immeasurable Mirror's surface.

"Ah!" However, the moment he saw these lines, it was as if an inhibition was triggered. Sun Luoyao felt an irresistible searing sensation suddenly flood him, as if being scorched by flames, threatening to melt the Immeasurable Mirror. "Senior, save me!" Sun Luoyao cried out involuntarily. Li Fan remained indifferent. He poured more golden Origin Force essence into Sun Luoyao, forcing him to continue probing despite the intense pain. Amidst Sun Luoyao's screams, the foundations hidden beneath the world's ruins began to slowly reveal themselves. Unlike the ruined small world, these lines, though intermittent and seemingly damaged, retained their original form. As more lines were probed, a rudimentary formation began to take shape in Li Fan's mind.

Concurrently, within the Derivation Law Jade space. The Terminal Dissolution Disc temporarily halted all other tasks, beginning to record and analyze these fragmented formation lines. "Save me..." However, the remnants of the formation were too vast. After probing less than a tenth of the way, Sun Luoyao was already on the verge of death, close to annihilation.

Chapter 1268: The Power of the Failed Immortal

The situation mirrored that of the first encounter with the Script of Return. The moment the True Immortal script at the center of the realm-protecting formation appeared in Li Fan's sea of consciousness, he understood its meaning.

"Return!"

It wasn't a curse like "scoff" or "chaos," but rather a command!

"A complete True Immortal script..."

Li Fan's heart trembled, but he had already silently memorized the appearance of the [Return] character.

"Return? Return to where? Or return to its original state?"

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, carefully savoring this profound power. Meanwhile, the Immeasurable Mirror Spirit had completed its investigation of all areas except the central core of the realm-protecting formation.

"Senior, that place..." Sun Luoyao stared blankly at the void.

An invisible connection was instantly formed, as if linking the [Return] character to the Immeasurable Mirror. The scene unfolding before him left Li Fan bewildered. However, from the inherent meaning of "Return" and the subsequent changes in the Immeasurable Mirror, he could infer some possibilities.

Li Fan could clearly feel the sudden surge of fear and confusion in Sun Luoyao's heart. Those "wisps of smoke" summoned by the [Return] script, destined for an unknown destination, had actually returned! It was as if time had reversed on the Immeasurable Mirror. The once thumb-sized Immeasurable Mirror, which had been shrinking before Li Fan's eyes, miraculously grew full and complete again.

Sun Luoyao, who had been wailing, believing his end was near, found his cries weakening. He stared, dumbfounded, at the restored Immeasurable Mirror, unsure of what had happened. An unexpected situation had occurred. The burnt portions, those affected by the [Return] script, vanished like wisps of smoke, seemingly disappearing to an unknown destination. It seemed that having already been subjected to a command once, the restored Immeasurable Mirror could now ignore the [Return] script's influence.

Li Fan naturally noticed the Immeasurable Mirror's transformation. His heart sank. He wanted to stop the Immeasurable Mirror's dissolution, but the power of the True Immortal script, even his main body couldn't contend with it, let alone this mere divine sense clone.

The two seemed to have no effect on each other. Just as Li Fan thought the immortal artifact, which had been so helpful, was about to perish completely, his thoughts turned to the immense cost. Not only was the Immeasurable Mirror itself beginning to "disintegrate" gradually, but even the Immortal Artifact Immeasurable Mirror itself was beginning to "disintegrate" gradually. With a touch of regret, Li Fan watched as the Immeasurable Mirror shrank further and further under Sun Luoyao's continuous wails. After a slight daze, Li Fan awoke. He looked again at the [Return] script.

"What's going on? Nowhere to return?" "Senior, save me!" Sun Luoyao instinctively cried out. The [Return] script also chose to ignore the Immeasurable Mirror, continuing to lie quietly within the void core of the formation. What had just happened felt like a dream. Even the Immeasurable Mirror's本体, the immortal artifact, began to tremble without warning. In the intensifying shaking, Sun Luoyao, the spirit of the mirror, was on the verge of being "flung out"! Without directly confronting the power of the [Return] script, merely being affected by the overflow and lock-on, the Great Formation of [Boundless, Primordial Vista], painstakingly repaired by Li Fan in the mirror, showed signs of imminent collapse. In Li Fan's perception, the entire Immeasurable Mirror was like paper catching fire; its intrinsic composition vanishing, causing it to inevitably etherealize. Li Fan was momentarily stunned, watching the Great Formation of [Primordial Vista] spontaneously reconstruct itself from the void.

"The realm-protecting formations of the lower realms are all created by the Immortal Realm and are also subject to its control. And the Immeasurable Mirror, being an Immortal Artifact, is also constrained by the Immortal Realm." "If we regard them as elite soldiers of the Immortal Realm, then the [Return] script is equivalent to the authority to command them. Whether this is a unique power of the [Return] script itself or a common occurrence in the Immortal Realm is unknown." "Under normal circumstances, upon receiving the summons of the [Return] script, they should have disarmed and returned. But now, the Immortal Realm has been destroyed, and the execution of the decree has been affected."

"It seems this [Return] script is fundamentally different from the other True Immortal scripts, perhaps even part of the operational cornerstone of the former Immortal Realm's power system." Li Fan pondered, "However, this speculation inevitably brings up a problem." "Since the [Return] script is already in a semi-invalid state, where have the cores of these realm-protecting formations gone?" Li Fan gazed at the [Return] script lying quietly in the core area. Several possibilities had already formed in his mind. The [Return] script was written by some entity and flew towards the formation cores of various realms. However, upon reaching its designated location, it found the target had already disappeared. Thus, it continued to circle there, waiting for the target to reappear. Alternatively, the [Return] script successfully acted upon the formation core, and the lower realm cores successively vanished, returning to the Immortal Realm. With the Immortal Realm destroyed, the cores would reappear. At this moment, they were intercepted by an unknown entity and carried away.

"Current conditions are too limited. The truth cannot yet be determined." "If the scope of the [Return] script is limited to the original power of the Immortal Realm, then even as a True Immortal script, its effect on me is limited." Li Fan couldn't help but shake his head slightly. "However, since this [Return] script can shake an Immortal Artifact..." "I wonder if it will work on the Profound Heaven Mirror?" Even if it wouldn't cause substantial damage to the Profound Heaven Mirror, if it could cause it to malfunction for a period, it could play a significant role at critical moments. It should be noted that the current system of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, especially the defensive measures of the Alliance headquarters, were all inextricably linked to the Profound Heaven Mirror. Once the Profound Heaven Mirror malfunctioned, the impregnable Myriad Immortals Alliance would instantly become riddled with flaws.

While Li Fan's main body, possessing the origin of the Profound Heaven Mirror, might not find it particularly meaningful, it was entirely different for Saint Emperor Li Ping. It could instantly turn the tide of battle, its might comparable to dozens of Harmonious Dao cultivators. After the main body, through a faint subconscious sense, transmitted the content of the [Return] script to Saint Emperor Li Ping, the divine sense clone in the Ash World began its next action. The [Return] script was an unexpected boon. His purpose for coming here was still to verify his previous hypothesis.

"By extension, the Xuanhuang Realm should also have a realm-protecting formation." "Moreover, the realm-protecting formation was left by the Immortal Realm and only exists in the original Xuanhuang Realm." After casually setting up a formation to seal the Ash World, preventing anyone from accidentally entering and coming into contact with the [Return] script, Li Fan's divine sense clone, carrying the Immeasurable Mirror, returned to the Xuanhuang Realm. He arrived at the central four prefectures where the Myriad Immortals Alliance was located. A miniature image of the Xuanhuang Realm appeared in his mind, representing only the original Xuanhuang. Intersecting lines appeared on the model; these were the realm-protecting formations Li Fan had deduced. Even with slight inaccuracies, their locations could be roughly pinpointed. Then, by leveraging the Immeasurable Mirror's power and spending some time, the hidden core areas of the Xuanhuang Realm's realm-protecting formation could be found. The only concern was that the commotion might be too great, alerting the Myriad Immortals Alliance. (End of this chapter)

Chapter 1269: Immortal Fold Array

With the stirring of the Abyssal Sea, the kneeling Abyssal peoples also seemed to sense something, their expressions growing increasingly ecstatic and devout. Like a gust of wind, currents swept in from all directions of the Abyssal Sea, converging near the small breach created by the Myriad Immortals Alliance. The pressure intensified, and invisible ripples spread from the opening. Under the cumulative weight of power, Li Ping perceived that the stable state near the rift was instantly shattered. The condensed Origin Force began to retreat rapidly, seemingly on the verge of being completely expelled from the Abyssal Sea.

However, at this critical moment, Li Ping witnessed the lightless sea suddenly illuminate. This was not the illusory light caused by the Abyssal Sea's own rhythms, but genuine light being born within it. A golden abacus appeared, stabilizing the overwhelmed Myriad Immortals Alliance's Origin Force. The beads of the abacus fluctuated, and the Origin Force output drastically increased, restoring the balance between the two forces. The Abyssal Sea churned violently, stirring up waves, but each surge was perfectly neutralized by the abacus's calculations, deployments, and adjustments. What truly amazed Li Ping, observing from the shadows, was that the golden abacus's function extended beyond mere regulation of Origin Force. More importantly, tendrils of golden light spread outwards with the constant movement of the beads.

The aura of a cultivator who theoretically should have long vanished from the Xuanhuang Realm emerged. The Saint Emperor's heart tightened, shielding himself and the hundred plus Abyssal peoples completely. During this time, under the diligent maintenance of the golden abacus, the Abyssal Sea returned to a state of balance and tranquility. Thinking this, Li Ping led the Abyssal peoples back to Great Qi. The Saint Emperor's heart was shadowed by a flicker of doubt. He scanned the surroundings several times, finding no suspicious presences, before slowly vanishing.

"If it were merely a similar aura, it would be understandable. But if he is still alive and hiding within the Myriad Immortals Alliance, assisting them in stealing the Abyssal Sea's power..." "Xuan Tianwang..." Scenes flashed through Li Ping's mind. He contacted the Stone Tablet through his divine sense and began to consult the information recorded by the Creation Stone Tablet. It was precisely this suspicion that caused the Saint Emperor to temporarily alter his decision. Li Ping stood near the breach, pondering for a moment, and ultimately decided to postpone his plan to destroy the Myriad Immortals Alliance's apparatus.

Perhaps it was spawned from the golden abacus, imbued with sentience, meticulously scanning the anomalies within the Abyssal Sea. "This is completely illogical." It wasn't that Li Ping feared a direct confrontation with the Myriad Immortals Alliance at this moment, but rather that he sensed a familiar aura emanating from the suddenly appearing eyeball. The unknown entity that was awakening, pacified by the golden light of the abacus, returned to slumber. The eyeball, cold and devoid of emotion, rotated and scanned, seemingly searching for the cause of the imbalance in the Abyssal power extraction. Although it didn't fly far before being completely swallowed by the darkness, under the influence of the golden light, the Abyssal Sea's fury was gradually appeased. As this change occurred, a single eyeball subtly descended above the breach in the Abyssal Sea. However, until this matter was clarified, it was best to avoid direct conflict.

Xuan Tianwang, from an ordinary cultivator to a series of unexpected encounters and transformations, eventually became the last Ascender from the Xuanhuang Realm. Shortly after his ascension, which became an eternal legend for the Xuanhuang Realm, he reappeared, shaking the world. This was followed by the founding of the Xuan Heaven Sect, and its eventual destruction by the combined forces of the Ten Immortal Sects. The records were fragmented, and crucial moments seemed deliberately erased. Yet, even this incomplete biography was incredibly dramatic and captivating. "Based on the synchronized sensory memories from the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao and the records of the Creation Stone Tablet, the eyeball that appeared in the Abyssal Sea bears an almost one-hundred percent resemblance to Xuan Tianwang." "This is where the mystery lies." The Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao itself certified that Xuan Tianwang was deceased. Yet, where did the Myriad Immortals Alliance find his eyeball? "The detailed records of the Ten Immortal Sects' siege of the Xuan Heaven Sect back then are also equally obscure. Only an existence of comparable power could conceal it from the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao's origin."

The more he pondered, the more questions arose. This nominal savior of the Xuanhuang Realm was shrouded in countless mysteries. Most importantly, his cultivation level placed him in an unprecedented position. As a half-immortal, his disappearance was abrupt. It was difficult to believe, especially now that Li Ping himself had implicitly reached the Xuanhuang Realm's limit, making him better understand the depth of Xuan Tianwang's power. Only beings of True Immortal level or higher could have possibly erased Xuan Tianwang so seamlessly. However, if such an entity had truly appeared, it would have been earth-shattering, potentially even causing the Xuanhuang Realm to be implicated and destroyed. Yet, according to the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao's memories, such an event never occurred. Perhaps the True Immortal had deliberately concealed their aura during the act... This then raised another question. To True Immortals, mortals were like ants. Even a half-immortal like Xuan Tianwang should not have necessitated such stealth. Why would a True Immortal need to conceal their presence when eliminating him?

"Perhaps clues can be found from the few surviving Dharma Kings of the Xuan Heaven Sect." The Faceless Saint Emperor flipped through the Creation Stone Tablet, searching for any minute fragments of information. Meanwhile, Li Fan's divine sense avatar in the ashes small world frowned slightly. Ever since personally experiencing the difficulty of dealing with the Xuan Heaven Sect Dharma Kings, Li Fan had intentionally blocked the Saint Emperor's memory of Mo Jubin to avoid complications in this lifetime. He hadn't expected that through a series of coincidences, the Saint Emperor would show signs of entanglement with Mo Jubin again. "Since the Myriad Immortals Alliance could pinpoint Mo Jubin's sleeping location based on various clues, the Saint Emperor should also be able to do so. This is becoming interesting."

"That eyeball from the Myriad Immortals Alliance could not possibly be Xuan Tianwang himself. Otherwise, when Mo Jubin possessed the Law Transmitter's body and learned all the Myriad Immortals Alliance's secrets, he should have discovered this." Li Fan pondered this while urging the Immeasurable Mirror to decipher the World-Protecting Formation. "However, considering his demise in the Abyssal Sea afterward, perhaps we can guess that the eyeball must have some mysterious connection to Xuan Tianwang, possibly even a part of Xuan Tianwang's divine authority?" "Mo Jubin discovered the existence of this Myriad Immortals Alliance eyeball and perceived its connection to the Abyssal Sea, which led him to venture into the perilous territory, ultimately resulting in his demise." "Divine Authority..." "Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate, World-Protecting Formation!" A brilliant light flashed in Li Fan's eyes. A point of light erupted within the incomplete formation model being deduced by the Terminal Dissolution Disc.

Even without seeing its complete form, Li Fan instantly understood the meaning represented by this point of light. "Similar to the Primordial Spirit Formation, this unknown World-Protecting Formation is composed of several subordinate formations. Each formation has its own control core." "This point of light represents the core!" As the Immeasurable Mirror's ethereal light deciphered, the pattern lines of the formation remnants hidden deep beneath the ashes small world finally revealed their corresponding "core." However, the place that should have been the densest nexus of lines was now eerily empty. It was as if it had been directly excavated. Just as the Immeasurable Mirror was about to probe the void-like core region, a sense of crisis suddenly surged into Li Fan's heart, forcing him to immediately halt the Immeasurable Mirror's actions. Li Fan narrowed his eyes, looking towards the void. An elusive and terrifying aura lurked within. It wasn't that nothing existed! Rather, its existence surpassed the scope of normal perception!

"True, Immortal, Seal, Script!" Li Fan repeated silently, word by word in his mind, raising his guard to the highest level. Unlike the inscriptions he had previously encountered—[Hunger], [Annihilation], [Chaos]—and dissimilar to the residual energies in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, it was not found in the records of the Profound Celestial Boat either. It was a completely new, unknown, mystical power that did not attack other things but targeted the core of the World-Protecting Formation. Having completed their objectives, they now lay silently upon the "corpse" of the formation's central hub.

Chapter 1270: Shaking Uniqueness

This was exactly like the situation when he first encountered the Hunger Incantation. The moment the True Immortal Seal Script, {Return}, appeared in Li Fan's sea of consciousness, he understood its meaning. It wasn't a curse like {Mock} or {Chaos}, but rather an imperial decree! "A complete True Immortal Seal Script..." Li Fan's mind trembled, yet he had already silently memorized the appearance of the character {Return}.

"Return? Return where? Or return to its original state?" Li Fan narrowed his eyes, carefully pondering this mystical power. Meanwhile, the Immeasurable Mirror's spirit had completed its investigation of the areas surrounding the World-Protecting Formation's core. "Senior, what about that place..." Sun Luoyao gazed blankly at the void. An invisible connection was instantly formed, as if tethering the character {Return} to the Immeasurable Mirror. The scene unfolding before Li Fan was utterly baffling. However, based on the inherent meaning of {Return} and the subsequent changes in the Immeasurable Mirror, he could make some inferences.

Li Fan could clearly sense the sudden fear and confusion in Sun Luoyao's heart. The "blue smoke" that had been summoned by the {Return} script, wherever it had gone, was now returning! It was as if time had reversed on the Immeasurable Mirror. The Immeasurable Mirror, now only thumb-sized, was visibly regenerating before Li Fan's eyes, becoming full once more! Sun Luoyao, who had been screaming, thinking his end was near, watched dumbfounded as the restored Immeasurable Mirror, without understanding why, stabilized.

An unexpected development occurred. The ignited portions, those affected by the {Return} script, vanished like wisps of blue smoke, their destinations unknown. As if having already received a decree, the regenerated Immeasurable Mirror could now apparently ignore the power of the {Return} script. Li Fan's heart sank. He tried to prevent the Immeasurable Mirror's dissolution, but even his true body could not contend with the power of a True Immortal Seal Script, let alone his divine sense avatar. They seemed to exist independently.

Just as Li Fan thought the Immortal Artifact, the Immeasurable Mirror, was about to utterly perish, Li Fan watched in regret as the Immeasurable Mirror, under Sun Luoyao's incessant wails, grew smaller and smaller. After a moment of stunned silence, Li Fan realized. He looked again at the {Return} script. "What is happening? Is there nothing to return to?" "Senior, save me!" Sun Luoyao cried out instinctively. The {Return} script, however, seemed to ignore the Immeasurable Mirror, continuing to lie dormant in the void core of the formation. The events that had just transpired felt like a dream. Even the Immeasurable Mirror's main body trembled uncontrollably. Amidst the escalating tremors, Sun Luoyao, its spirit, seemed on the verge of being "thrown out" of the Immeasurable Mirror!

Without directly confronting the power of the {Return} script, merely being affected by its overflow and localization, the formation [Immeasurable, Primordial Vista] that Li Fan had painstakingly repaired within the mirror began to show signs of collapse. Li Fan was momentarily dumbfounded, watching the Primordial Vista formation spontaneously rebuild itself from the void. "The World-Protecting Formations in the lower realms were all created by the Immortal Realm and are also subject to its control. The Immeasurable Mirror, being an Immortal Artifact, is also bound by the Immortal Realm's rules." "If we consider them soldiers of the Immortal Realm, then the {Return} script is equivalent to having the authority to command them. Whether this is the inherent power of the {Return} script itself, or a common occurrence in the Immortal Realm, remains unknown."

"However, with the destruction of the Immortal Realm, the execution of this decree has been affected." "Perhaps the {Return} script, unlike the other True Immortal Seal Scripts, is fundamentally different, possibly even a cornerstone of the Immortal Realm's power structure in the past." Li Fan pondered. "However, this speculation inevitably leads to a question." "If the {Return} script is already in a state of partial invalidity, then where have the core components of these World-Protecting Formations gone?" Li Fan gazed at the {Return} script lying dormant in the core region. Several possibilities arose in his mind.

The {Return} script was inscribed by someone and flew to the core of the formation in various realms. However, upon reaching its destination, it found the target had vanished. Thus, it lingered there, waiting for the target's reappearance. Alternatively, the {Return} script successfully acted upon the formation core, causing the lower-realm cores to vanish and return to the Immortal Realm. With the destruction of the Immortal Realm, the cores reappeared, only to be intercepted by an unknown entity and abducted.

"There are too few conditions available currently. The truth remains uncertain." "If the {Return} script's scope of influence is limited to powers originating from the Immortal Realm, then even though it is a True Immortal Seal Script, its effect on me will be limited," Li Fan shook his head slightly. "However, since the {Return} script can affect an Immortal Artifact..." "I wonder if it would work on the Profound Heaven Mirror?" Even if it couldn't cause substantial damage to the Profound Heaven Mirror, if it could cause it to malfunction temporarily, it could be of great use at a critical moment. After all, the Myriad Immortals Alliance's current system, especially the headquarters' defensive measures, were all inextricably linked to the Profound Heaven Mirror. If the Profound Heaven Mirror were to malfunction, the impregnable Myriad Immortals Alliance would instantly become riddled with vulnerabilities.

While Li Fan's true body possessed the origin of the Profound Heaven Mirror, perhaps it held little significance for him. But for the Saint Emperor Li Ping, the situation was entirely different. It could instantly turn the tide of battle, its power equivalent to that of dozens of Harmonious Dao cultivators! After transmitting the contents of the {Return} script to the Saint Emperor Li Ping through their subtle connection, Li Fan's divine sense avatar in the ashes small world began its next phase of action. The {Return} script was an unexpected boon. His purpose for coming here was still to verify his previous hypothesis.

"By extension, the Xuanhuang Realm should also possess a World-Protecting Formation." "Furthermore, World-Protecting Formations were left behind by the Immortal Realm and would only exist in the primordial Xuanhuang Realm." After casually setting up a formation to seal the ashes small world, preventing anyone from mistakenly entering and encountering the {Return} script, Li Fan's divine sense avatar, carrying the Immeasurable Mirror, returned to the Xuanhuang Realm. He arrived in the central four prefectures of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. A miniature representation of the Xuanhuang Realm appeared in his mind, depicting only the primordial Xuanhuang's silhouette. Intersecting lines appeared on the model; these were the World-Protecting Formation Li Fan was deducing. Even with minor errors, they could generally pinpoint its location. Then, using the Immeasurable Mirror's authority, it would only take a little time to locate the core nexus of the Xuanhuang Realm's hidden World-Protecting Formation. The only concern was that the commotion might be too significant, alerting the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Chapter 1271: True when False, False when True

With a casual wave of his hand, Li Fan eliminated Sun Luoyao. His divine sense avatar remained still in the mysterious space, his expression stern, deep in thought. "[Return to Truth], [Return to Truth], [Return to Truth]..." He repeatedly murmured the words in his mind. The surrounding scenery blurred and faded. In an instant, it lit up again. "When truth becomes falsehood, falsehood becomes truth." Seven large characters, radiating a serene, seemingly eternal brilliance, appeared before Li Fan. These were the words he saw every time he activated [Return to Truth]. Over hundreds of cycles of reincarnation, he was intimately familiar with them. But now, facing Li Fan, who had discovered the deeply hidden secret of the Xuanhuang Realm's primordial World-Protecting Formation, these seven characters took on an entirely different meaning.

"Falsehood becomes truth, falsehood becomes truth..." As if he were once again the influential Teacher Li who controlled the court, swaying the world with his mere presence. When the very foundation of reality was shaken and teetering. After a long while, Li Fan let out a sinister, low chuckle. Through repeated resets, nourished by the Xuanhuang Realm, the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, and infinite variables born beyond the Star Sea, he had cultivated himself. It was undeniable that the tip of the iceberg revealed by the primordial Xuanhuang World-Protecting Formation had shown Li Fan a possibility.

"Truth, falsehood." Regardless of whether he had truly fallen into such a predicament or not, Li Fan felt immense gratitude that the [Return to Truth] button remained eternally unchanged and firmly in his grasp. It was a chilling and unacceptable thought. The [Return to Truth] might possibly transcend the arrangements the Immortal Realm had made for the lower realms, or it might simply be a component of the Immortal Realm's remaining devices. When the boundary between reality and illusion blurred, and verification became impossible. The only course of action was to firmly grasp the constant, unwavering anchor. Therefore, to find the answer to the puzzle, the task remained the same as Li Fan's persistent pursuit of eternal freedom: longevity and逍遥.

"Who is the truth, and who is the falsehood?" But now, it seemed that the external variables beyond the High Wall might have been intentionally displayed for the reconstructed world after [Return to Truth]. The truth was elusive. But... "I am the only one!" For the current Li Fan, this was an unprovable statement. Even though he had previously attempted to guide the variables beyond the Utmost Darkness Star Sea to determine the scope of [Return to Truth]'s influence. "Yes, none of this matters. As long as I hold the sole button, I am the truth!" The madness in Li Fan's eyes gradually receded, and his once pitch-black pupils slowly regained their clarity. To achieve transcendence. If he discovered anyone capable of competing with him for the button, he would simply eliminate them. When he found the ultimate answer, the truth would reveal itself.

For now, besides the Law Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician, Li Fan had an additional presence to contend with—an existence that posed an even greater threat, an undeniable and urgent problem. That was the mysterious individual who had stolen the nine-star red bead, one of the cores of the Xuanhuang Realm's primordial World-Protecting Formation. "The nine-star red bead should contain all the characteristic information of Xuanhuang beings before the World-Protecting Formation's destruction. With the red bead in hand, it should not be difficult to deduce the same conclusion as mine." "Considering the immense power difference, and without finding a countermeasure, the wise course of action is to remain hidden." "Or perhaps, after confirming the Immortal Realm's complete destruction, with the artifact in hand, they would inevitably harbor unprecedented ambitions and make other plans." Li Fan's gaze swept across the empty core region of the formation.

"Perhaps I can find some clues by examining the other cores of the primordial formation." However, with the Immeasurable Mirror spirit now destroyed, it was impossible to continue the investigation. He would have to wait for the next lifetime. Li Fan's divine sense avatar shook his head slightly, transforming into a black streak and leaving the underground.

...

Sun family secret chamber.

Sun Luyuan, unable to suppress the sudden, overwhelming sorrow that welled up in his heart, shed tears unconsciously. He frantically returned from the outside and burst into the underground chamber. He looked at the familiar Immeasurable Mirror floating quietly before him and let out a sigh of relief. "Little brother?" Sun Luyuan called out softly. Sun Luoyao's figure immediately emerged from the Immeasurable Mirror. "Brother, are you looking for me?" "What is it?" Sun Luoyao asked curiously. Sun Luyuan's mind suddenly felt hazy. For some reason, although the image before him was identical to his memory, it felt profoundly foreign. Sun Luyuan stared blankly for a long time. After a while, he said dazedly, "Nothing. Perhaps I've been too tired lately and am becoming overly suspicious." Sun Luoyao's eyes showed concern. "Brother, you need to take care of yourself. The future of the Sun family still rests on you." Sun Luyuan smiled. After carefully instructing him, he left the underground chamber.

Unbeknownst to Sun Luyuan, Sun Luoyao did not watch his elder brother's retreating back as he always had before. Instead, the expression on his face instantly vanished. Without any lingering attachment, he retreated back into the Immeasurable Mirror. The moment the real Sun Luoyao died, the trace of his divine sense left behind lost its source. It was merged into the counterfeit Immeasurable Mirror, becoming merely a mechanical responder. While the mechanical response was somewhat lifelike, it was ultimately not true life. Not the real Sun Luoyao.

Not long after, Li Fan's divine sense avatar returned with the empty shell of the Immeasurable Mirror. "If there is no spirit, I will create one myself." Li Fan looked at the trace of consciousness left behind by Sun Luoyao, observed it carefully, and then coldly decided. This trace of divine sense contained the complete memories of Sun Luyuan's life. It encompassed his personality and way of thinking. Theoretically, it was entirely possible to "resurrect" him. "Although I lack treasures like the Indeterminate Bronze Ring and the Nine-Star Red Beads." "However, there is no need to consider the physical body. It is merely the recreation of a divine sense, which should be significantly easier." Recalling the various details of the formation, and under the continuous deduction of the Terminal Dissolution Disc, a simplified version of a part of the primordial Xuanhuang World-Protecting Formation slowly emerged.

"Simulating Life Forms, Mimicking a Hundred Appearances..." "This name is quite fitting." Li Fan named this formation according to the naming conventions of the three Immortal-grade formations he had previously mastered. He then attempted to "create" and "resurrect" Sun Luoyao. As a precaution, Li Fan first divided Sun Luoyao's residual divine sense into multiple parts for preservation. Then, he inserted one of these parts into the simplified simulation formation. An extremely mystical aura gradually emanated from the formation. As the formation slowly operated, Sun Luoyao's figure reappeared within a beam of brilliant white light. His eyes regained a sense of spark, and his communication with Li Fan was exceptionally smooth. Within moments, they had exchanged tens of millions of divine senses, without a single instance of revealing any unintended flaws.

However, Li Fan still shook his head slightly, dissatisfied, and destroyed it. "Too real. So real it feels fake."

Chapter 1272: Fabricating the Law Derivation Jue

Countless Sun Luoyao were manufactured and then destroyed. In this process, Li Fan gradually gained his own unique insights into [Creation].

"Senior..."

Until the cloned Sun Luoyao's divine sense was about to be completely depleted, a timid yet faintly greedy voice echoed again in the Sun family's underground secret chamber. It was almost identical to Sun Luoyao's own actions and words. Even Li Fan, the creator, could hardly distinguish the difference. But it was only superficial. Li Fan knew very well that the newly created Sun Luoyao acted entirely according to Li Fan's predetermined response patterns, with no process of independent thought. It was too far from genuine life. Moreover, this created sentient body was not recognized by the Immortal Artifact Immeasurable Mirror.

"Organize the existing Immortal-grade formation data, deduce their connections, and their common foundational units." Thinking of this, Li Fan's thoughts paused slightly and he looked at Yan Fa Jue, who was lying listlessly on the long table. "But to truly create life from scratch requires other means." Having confirmed this, Li Fan shook his head with some regret. Before this, Li Fan had mastered the Terminal Dissolution Disc, but to unleash its full potential required not only the amplification of the Dao-Melting Stone but also a significant portion of Li Fan's energy to personally preside over it.

"Speaking of which, this little thing's situation is similar to mine before."

"This is the crushing superiority of methodology from the Immortal Realm."

The Terminal Dissolution Disc completely stopped for a moment, then rapidly resumed operation. Just when he needed it, Li Fan found an excellent opportunity within a few days. Li Fan issued a series of commands. Li Fan did not care. As Li Fan was contemplating, the simulated personality of the Terminal Dissolution Disc was officially formed.

"In a sense, this is another kind of [Formation Forging] technique."

If a mechanized simulated personality were available, it would free up some of Li Fan's energy. As for what happened to the real Gao Yuan...

"Master, is there anything I can do for you?"

Gao Yuan said very respectfully. His appearance was that of the cultivator Li Fan found most convenient to command in his hundred reincarnations: Gao Yuan.

"It consumes almost no cost to greatly increase the power of the artifact... I can't say about the power. It will definitely be more handy, and it can be customized and trained according to one's needs."

Compared to before, it was much more orderly. The pressure in his mind was gone, but the efficiency of the Dissolution Disc's deduction increased instead of decreased.

"Based on this, perform unified improvement and deduction on the formations of the Profound Yellow Realm. All results must be recorded."

However, this did not mean Li Fan gained nothing.

"At the same time, try to find a possible way for self-advancement..."

"Before, I was like a blind person touching an elephant—only grasping a small part. Even this minuscule fragment, insignificant to the vast Star Sea, was immensely meaningful to them."

Just as the puppet body was about to completely vanish, the nascent consciousness of the Star Sea seemed to perceive the presence of Li Ping and the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, casting a mere glance their way.

"Compared to the entire Utmost Darkness Star Sea, what is the calamity that befell the Xuanhuang Realm?"

"If the Star Sea can be reborn from destruction, the Xuanhuang Realm certainly can too."

They seized their final moments to etch as much as possible into their memories. Li Ping knew that the Origin Dao of the Utmost Darkness Star Sea was beyond his current comprehension. The insights he was gaining were akin to a blind person touching an elephant—only grasping a small part. Even this minuscule fragment, insignificant to the vast Star Sea, was immensely meaningful to them.

"Let me see what truly happened here back then."

In fact, the Creation Stone Tablet did record the events of the Monster Race's journey to the Star Sea. However, after a cataclysmic power erupted from the Southern Nether Mountain, the Xuanhuang Stone Tablet lost its ability to monitor the area. By the time the energy subsided and the region became visible again, the former Monster Race sacred mountain and the entire Monster Race had vanished, leaving only a terrifying void, a wound that had remained unhealed for thousands of years. Li Fan's purpose in using the Immeasurable Mirror this time, while seeking to confirm whether the Monster Race had successfully escaped through the Realm-Rending, was primarily to decipher the method of Realm-Rending itself. Space had been pierced by unimaginably powerful forces, shattering even the barrier of the High Wall and connecting to the Star Sea beyond. In that instant, it was as if a seal had been pressed into time and space, leaving an imprint. Even as millennia passed, this imprint remained within spacetime, yet to dissipate. By studying and deciphering this Realm-Rending imprint, they might be able to replicate the two instances in Xuanhuang's history where they successfully escaped the Utmost Darkness Star Sea.

Like a flickering black-and-white image with intermittent signals, Li Fan vaguely saw Emperor Yi revealing his true form and delivering a final mobilization speech to the Monster Race. He also saw many monsters watching from afar, choosing not to leave with them. The scene flashed again: the giant python coiled around Southern Nether Mountain let out a heaven-shattering roar, twisting and writhing in agony, its body emitting scorching light as if something was trying to break free from within it. Emperor Yi, the lord of all monsters, watched this with cold indifference. It was only when the python weakly crashed onto the sea's surface, stirring up colossal waves, that Li Fan clearly saw the object within its body. It was a key, magnified countless times! A ripple spread across Emperor Yi's writhing, gray, flesh-like body. Moments later, a face devoid of any emotion, indifferent and vast, emerged from its form. This face possessed a strange, magical power. Not only did the other heads and faces on Emperor Yi's body instantly quiet down and cease their movements, but even the countless monsters who had been watching from afar around the Southern Nether Sacred Mountain involuntarily lowered their heads, avoiding its gaze. Even Li Fan, peering through the imprint across the river of time thousands of years later, felt an instinctive dread, as if facing a superior being, the moment he saw that face.

"This is..."

Even though it was merely a divine sense projection, under the pressure of the Divine Visage, his form became momentarily unstable. After all, it was an illusion from thousands of years ago, and Li Fan's foundation was not comparable to ordinary individuals. After a brief period of adaptation, this invisible pressure quietly dissipated. The scene in the Realm-Rending imprint re-emerged in Li Fan's view. After Emperor Yi revealed the Divine Visage, the massive, bronze-metallic key instantly shrunk. Then, under Emperor Yi's control, it flew directly towards the towering Southern Nether Sacred Mountain. The tip of the key touched the summit of Southern Nether Mountain. Dazzling points of light appeared at the point of contact. A uniform glow instantly spread throughout the key and the Sacred Mountain. As if some form of authentication had been completed, moments later, the key and the Sacred Mountain were bathed in light, becoming ethereal and indistinct. And then, the countless monsters around the Sacred Mountain, including Emperor Yi, were enveloped by waves of white light, transforming into threads that flew into the bronze key and the Southern Nether Mountain. Subsequently... a terrifying explosion of light, like a world-shattering cataclysm, erupted from above, obscuring all prying eyes. Even as Li Fan endured the searing white light to continue his observation, all he saw was boundless brilliance. It was at this moment that the Immeasurable Mirror truly reached its limit. In an instant, it lost its sentience, unable to even maintain its levitation, and fell from the sky. The spirit of the Immeasurable Mirror, Sun Luoyao, also completely lost consciousness, falling silent. Li Fan pondered, collecting the Immeasurable Mirror. But in his mind, the scene he had just witnessed replayed continuously.

"Previously, in the Fallen Immortal Realm, Emperor Yi explained the principle behind Southern Nether Mountain's successful Realm-Rending. He said it was the edge of Heaven and the corner of the Sea, the end of the world, thus accumulating the scattered and gathered energies of the Xuanhuang Realm since its creation..."

"Now it seems it was far more complicated than he described. With only the Xuanhuang Realm's own power, it would be impossible to achieve Realm-Rending, let alone with mere scattered energy."

"The Bronze Key and that Divine Visage were likely the keys to their Realm-Rending."

Li Fan suddenly recalled a secret the Saint Emperor had learned from the Crossing Tribulation Sect in this life.

"The Crossing Tribulation Sect found a mystical power within the Realm-Rending fissure of the Heavenly Sword Sect, capable of monitoring the Xuanhuang Realm. Once implanted, even the Law Transmitter would be powerless against it. And here, the second location of Realm-Rending, a mysterious entity external to the Xuanhuang Realm, has appeared."

"The Xuanhuang Realm is indeed unique among the ancient cultivation worlds, and these two instances seem to touch upon the crux of the matter."

As he pondered, Li Fan's flight became increasingly swift. The scattered clues from the past suddenly coalesced.

"The Great Ascension Star Crossing Formation can traverse the endless void and lock onto other cultivation worlds in the depths of the Star Sea."

"My formation mastery, under the augmentation of the Terminal Dissolution Disc, has already touched the limits of what is possible in the mortal realm. Furthermore, I understand three of the Nine Primordial Spirit Formations. Even with Immortal-grade formations, I have only just begun to grasp them. Yet, I am baffled as to how the Great Ascension Star Crossing Formation uses that golden chain to precisely lock onto targets in the endless Star Sea."

"I previously thought it was due to my insufficient mastery of formations, causing the Terminal Dissolution Disc to fail in its deductions every time. Xuan Tianwang, being a figure of immense learning, and possessing a half-immortal body, with formation skills even surpassing the wondrous Terminal Dissolution Disc..."

"Now, it seems I might have overlooked a crucial factor."

A sharp gleam flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

"What if those targeted cultivation worlds, and the Xuanhuang Realm, share some common factors? Based on this mutual resonance, the golden chain of the Great Ascension Star Crossing Formation could accurately lock onto them one by one."

"That is, they all possess a World-Protecting Formation."

Thinking of this, Li Fan's thoughts paused as if struck by realization.

"Initially, the Xuanhuang Realm simply captured and annexed them, rather than dismembering and reassembling them as it does now."

"Therefore, those initially absorbed regions should have been on the outer periphery of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"The edge of Heaven, the corner of the Sea. The world's frontier."

"Furthermore, Emperor Yi's words seemed to vaguely imply that the Xuanhuang monsters originated from the outside..."

"So that's how it is."

Li Fan suddenly understood.

"It seems Emperor Yi's Bronze Key did not activate a World-Protecting Formation intrinsic to the Xuanhuang Realm itself..."

Li Fan's thoughts raced. The truth was, there was a simple way to verify his hypothesis. In the small world where he discovered the golden skull and the character "{没}," the golden chain of the Great Ascension Star Crossing Formation had clearly broken through the void and locked onto the world. All he needed to do was investigate that location again. With this thought, Li Fan changed course, heading directly towards his target. Along the way, Sun Luoyao slowly regained consciousness.

"Senior, where are we going?"

Without any complaints about Li Fan's extreme exploitation of his labor, Sun Luoyao asked curiously.

"To an interesting place. You should rest well during this interval. We might need your assistance next."

Li Fan said calmly. Sun Luoyao's phantom figure within the mirror couldn't help but shake.

"Senior, I feel very weak right now..."

After a moment of silence, Sun Luoyao mustered his courage and said. The response was a mass of thick, golden substance. Sun Luoyao's attention was immediately captivated, as if seeing a peerless treasure. It held an irresistible, fatal attraction for him, and an inner intuition told him that this substance would be extremely beneficial. Thus, Sun Luoyao immediately shut his mouth and ravenously consumed the Origin Force essence. Moments later, his spirit rejuvenated, the feeling of weakness vanished.

"Hmph."

Emerging from the delightful sensation, Sun Luoyao wanted to curry favor with Li Fan and ask for more. However, he was brought back to reality by Li Fan's cold snort. He did not dare to ask further, hoping that after completing the upcoming task, he might receive further rewards. Not long after, after traversing a long void passage, Li Fan finally arrived at the desolate world filled with ashes once more.

"Go!"

At Li Fan's signal, the Immeasurable Mirror once again emitted ethereal light. Compared to their previous attempt at the Realm-Rending Vortex, this probing and deciphering process was undoubtedly smoother. Effortlessly, the images within the ethereal light reconstructed the scene. A vibrant world. A great river, nurturing countless beings. After death, beings were reborn in the river, achieving a perfect cycle.

"Not this, delve deeper."

Just as Sun Luoyao was immersed in the secondary scene, Li Fan's voice broke through. Sun Luoyao's concentration wavered, and he increased the Immeasurable Mirror's probing intensity. The scene of vitality became fragmented and ethereal. The river itself became dreamlike and illusory, like starlight. Beneath all appearances, intertwined lines suddenly appeared on the Immeasurable Mirror's surface.

"Ah!"

However, the moment he saw these lines, it was as if an inhibition was triggered. Sun Luoyao felt an irresistible searing sensation suddenly flood him, as if being scorched by flames, threatening to melt the Immeasurable Mirror.

"Senior, save me!"

Sun Luoyao cried out involuntarily. Li Fan remained indifferent. He poured more golden Origin Force essence into Sun Luoyao, forcing him to continue probing despite the intense pain. Amidst Sun Luoyao's screams, the foundations hidden beneath the world's ruins began to slowly reveal themselves. Unlike the ruined small world, these lines, though intermittent and seemingly damaged, retained their original form. As more lines were probed, a rudimentary formation began to take shape in Li Fan's mind. Concurrently, within the Derivation Law Jade space. The Terminal Dissolution Disc temporarily halted all other tasks, beginning to record and analyze these fragmented formation lines.

"Save me..."

However, the remnants of the formation were too vast. After probing less than a tenth of the way, Sun Luoyao was already on the verge of death, close to annihilation.

Chapter 1273: Yan Fajue's Hometown

"Hahaha..."

A hint of panic flickered in Yan Faju's eyes as she attempted to brush it off.

"Don't think you can fool me. Tell me honestly. Otherwise, I'll call for backup! Discovering Yan Faju plotting sedition must be a great merit. Maybe I can even get out early because of it." Li Fan threatened with a half-smile.

"What plotting sedition!" Yan Faju glared angrily at Li Fan.

But Li Fan's true body, outside the character light sphere, suddenly spoke: "That..."

The gazes of the Harmonious Dao guardians Zhang Xu and Hua Yueye were instantly drawn to him.

Yan Faju the little loli immediately panicked.

"No! Let's talk properly!" She took a quick step and rushed to the simulated personality, her eyes wide and pleading as she looked at Li Fan.

Meanwhile, within Yan Faju's space, Li Fan's true body paused slightly, then continued: "Fellow Daoists, I'd like to ask. Can cultivation methods derived like this by Yan Faju be passed on? I know the Immortal Alliance's laws prohibit it, but..."

Yan Faju's big eyes darted around, and she coughed lightly. "I haven't tried it yet. How efficient is this thing, really? Why don't you let me..."

Li Fan smiled and retorted, "If I were truly loyal to the Myriad Immortals Alliance, why would I use the opportunity of requesting derivations from you to pass on this method of simulated personality?"

"Whoosh..."

"Master, is there anything I can do for you?" the simulated personality asked professionally.

"I know, I must find a way to change all of this!" A hint of determination suddenly flashed in the little loli's eyes.

Yan Faju scratched her hair, her face full of worry. "I can't derive them all! There are simply too many to derive!"

But Li Fan merely showed his half-smile again, which immediately made Yan Faju falter.

"Whoosh..."

Yan Faju looked at the jade slips that appeared, and a sense of joy from effortless gain surged in her heart, making her giggle uncontrollably.

"Then, with this simulated personality helping you now, how long will it take you to achieve your goal?"

"So many years have passed, and there's still a long way to go to reach the goal! I feel like I'm reaching my limit!"

With a clap of two chubby little hands, the scene within the character light sphere abruptly changed.

Zhang Xu smiled and said, "Fellow Daoist Sun, are you perhaps looking for a cultivation method for your newborn son? Officially, this is not allowed. However... since the supervisor is one of our own from the Law Enforcement Hall, so..."

Yan Faju waved her large hand, giving the order for it to completely take over the derivation work.

Seven days passed in the blink of an eye.

Li Fan's voice suddenly rang out again.

Endless white jade bookshelves, reaching into the sky, held rows upon rows of dense jade slips.

"Back then, the Heavenly Venerable ordered me to exhaust all methods under the heavens."

The moment the simulated personality took over, the derivation process of the character light sphere was interrupted.

Zhang Xu revealed a knowing look.

"Hmph. As the young lady of this venerable grandmother, of course I have my own clever plans!" Yan Faju put her hands on her hips, looking incredibly proud.

"In short, if I'm given fifty years of free time, I'll find a way to escape this sea of suffering completely! By then, I'll definitely get a good night's sleep."

"Tell me. What exactly do you want to do?" The simulated personality extended its right hand, its finger poised to flick Yan Faju's forehead.

Li Fan peered closely and saw Yan Faju the little loli sprawled out in a 'big character stroke' posture, floating in the air, sound asleep.

Li Fan didn't press further, but repeated the number: "Fifty years."

"You scoundrel!" Yan Faju's expression changed again, and she tried to put on a fierce and intimidating demeanor.

"Fine, I'll tell you. But you have to promise me first that you will absolutely not report me to the Myriad Immortals Alliance!" Yan Faju put away her superfluous expressions and said very seriously.

Yan Faju tilted her head and pondered for a moment, knowing that Li Fan's words had reason.

Li Fan cupped his fists, indicating understanding.

Yan Faju subconsciously dodged, but quickly realized that the other party was just a simulated body and had no physical substance, so she became enraged out of shame.

After a flash of faint light, it resumed its previous mechanical appearance.

The giant character light sphere continuously rotated, and various cultivation method jade slips took shape, appearing on the white jade bookshelves.

Somehow groggy, she asked, "How many years have passed already?"

Each jade slip contained a cultivation method.

And within the character light sphere, having overheard the conversation between the three Harmonious Dao guardians, Yan Faju finally breathed a sigh of relief.

"I was too young back then and thought with my abilities, it would be a simple matter. So I happily agreed. Alas, thinking back now, it was truly foolish!" Yan Faju sighed with elderly wisdom.

"Oh? How will you change it?" Li Fan asked with interest as he examined the surrounding cultivation methods.

Finally, realizing that she was no match for Li Fan, Yan Faju admitted defeat.

"Mmm..." Li Fan called her awake, and the little loli rubbed her eyes vigorously.

Li Fan immediately agreed.

"Huh? Only seven days!"

Not long after, when Yan Faju saw the time, she instantly sobered up.

"Slept so well." She smacked her lips, looking somewhat reluctant.

"Why are you here again?" Then she looked at Li Fan and said with great disdain.

Li Fan said nothing, just looked at her quietly.

Yan Faju immediately faltered: "Okay, let me see. Hmm, it's only slightly slower than my own full derivation."

"Barely the same speed as the derivation speed I showed to those people in the Myriad Immortals Alliance."

Li Fan nodded slightly: "In other words, after another forty years, you'll successfully escape?"

Yan Faju seemed perplexed: "Escape? What escape?"

"I wanted to escape before because I didn't want to work. But now that I have such a good thing helping me work for free, why would I run away? I can just rest every day."

Yan Faju looked at Li Fan with contempt.

"Oh?"

"Then what if I occupy the simulated personality permanently, how will you deal with that?" Li Fan asked calmly.

"Hmph, that won't stop me." Yan Faju's figure suddenly retreated, and the surrounding scenery returned to its previous state.

"Change for me!" She pointed remotely at Li Fan's side.

As light converged, another figure slowly took shape.

It was, astonishingly, another simulated personality!

"A person cannot multitask! You occupy one, do you think you can occupy a second one too!"

"Then how do you know I can't?"

Unexpectedly, this second simulated personality actually spoke with Li Fan's voice.

It mocked Yan Faju.

Yan Faju's expression suddenly froze.

"Fine, fine, fine! I'd like to see how many you can multitask!"

"Change for me! Change! Change! Change! Change!..."

Yan Faju the little loli continuously tapped in the air, and phantoms of simulated personalities were generated one after another.

One hundred, five hundred, a thousand...

Faces of Li Fan, one after another, filled the entire space within the character light sphere.

They mocked in a unified voice.

"Not enough."

"Is that all you've got?" "Is that all you can do?"

"Keep going."

...

As the number of differentiated simulated personalities approached ten thousand, under Li Fan's mocking words.

The little loli's forehead was already dotted with beads of sweat.

She temporarily stopped her actions, her large eyes staring at the dense rows of Li Fans in front of her, filled with disbelief.

"You're not human?"

"What on earth are you?"

She didn't mean it as an insult, but in Yan Faju's understanding, it was indeed not something an ordinary cultivator could achieve.

Occupying a simulated personality wasn't just about splitting off a wisp of divine sense.

It was more akin to splitting one's soul in half and occupying with one of them.

Being able to control so many simulated personalities simultaneously was equivalent to dismembering one's soul, yet still being unaffected.

She had only managed this thanks to the ability of Heaven's Marvel.

And that person...

Yan Faju couldn't help but feel a sense of vigilance.

"Do you want more?"

Ten thousand Li Fans smiled simultaneously.

"Even if there were another hundred thousand, I could still handle it," Li Fan said indifferently.

The little loli carefully observed Li Fan's true body within Yan Faju's guardian space.

He indeed seemed to be under no pressure, meditating with his eyes closed, his expression serene.

Yan Faju hesitated.

It wasn't that she couldn't create ten thousand; it was already her limit.

She was simply worried that if the two continued to fight, it might be detected by the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

After all, with tens of thousands of simulated personalities, it would inevitably cause a burden on her normal derivation operations.

And Yan Faju's derivation performance was constantly monitored by the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

After careful consideration, Yan Faju ultimately compromised with resignation.

"Alright! I admit you're a bit厉害!"

The little loli uttered them one by one, reabsorbing the simulated personalities around her.

Only the initial one remained.

After a burp, Yan Faju then said, "Speak, what exactly do you want? I can see you have ulterior motives."

Li Fan shook his head: "You misunderstand me."

"I came here precisely to help you regain your freedom."

Yan Faju was dismissive: "What's so good about freedom? Besides, I've been working for the Dharma Transmission for so many years. Wouldn't it be a shame to give up halfway!"

"All I've ever wanted is to be lazy," Yan Faju reiterated.

"What benefits did Dharma Transmission promise you?" Li Fan asked.

"Hmph, hmph..." Yan Faju refused to answer the question.

"Perhaps I can help you too, and you won't have to pay any price," Li Fan said kindly.

Yan Faju's face was full of disbelief: "Is there such a good thing?"

"I just can't stand seeing Dharma Transmission exploit others," Li Fan said.

Yan Faju's eyes lit up, and then she seemed to understand, "I get it! You have a grudge against Dharma Transmission! So you came to me to undermine his foundation!"

Li Fan did not deny it: "You could say that."

Upon hearing this, Yan Faju actually began to seriously consider it.

"Hmm, Dharma Transmission said he could help me find my home. Can you?" Yan Faju tentatively asked.

"Home?" Li Fan's eyes flickered, "Tell me more details."

"Alright." Yan Faju moved closer, sitting down not far from Li Fan.

Resting her chin on her hands, she sank into memory: "Before Dharma Transmission found me and I became Yan Faju, although I was just an ordinary little girl, I vaguely had memories of my past life."

"Those scenes in my memory, that's my true homeland."

Yan Faju felt Li Fan looking at her and said helplessly, "I already said it was vague. I can't remember what it looked like specifically, but as long as I see it with my own eyes, I'll definitely be able to distinguish the truth from the falsehood."

"I have a premonition that finding information about my homeland is very important to me..."

Hearing this, Li Fan frowned slightly.

Just as he was about to speak, Yan Faju, as if sensing what he was about to say, rolled her eyes at Li Fan, "I'm not stupid. How could I be tricked by Dharma Transmission's empty words and work for so many years."

"He did show me some images of my homeland back then. But I can't show them to you..."

Yan Faju gestured with her hands.

Li Fan nodded: "I once heard that Heaven's Marvel is either the law of the world or the transformed spirit of an immortal artifact from the upper realm. Could your homeland be the Immortal Realm?"

Yan Faju's expression became somewhat dejected: "Who knows. But I don't want to come from the Immortal Realm. Otherwise, I'll have no hope of returning home."

"By the way, you said you could help me, right?" Yan Faju asked.

Li Fan shook his head: "Before I figure out the specific origin of your homeland, I can't make a conclusion."

Hearing this, Yan Faju couldn't help but be surprised: "I thought you would have directly guaranteed it and tried to trick me."

"It seems you're not that bad." The little loli re-examined Li Fan.

Li Fan chuckled: "However, give me some time, and I will let you identify all possible scenes one by one."

"Really?..." Yan Faju became suspicious.

"By the way, can you tell me about your fifty-year plan now?" Li Fan asked back, not answering directly.

After considering for a while, Yan Faju said softly: "It's nothing much, just to sleep well and then grow a bit older."

"After growing up, I'll become stronger. Dealing with these tasks will be much easier."

"Now it takes ten years of work, but then it should take less than a year to complete."

A hint of yearning flashed in Yan Faju's eyes.

Li Fan heard this, his eyes gradually narrowing.

"So you just need to sleep for fifty years? No other conditions?"
