"What do you mean 'just sleep for fifty years'? Don't make it sound so easy," Yan Faju said with a hint of displeasure.

Then she nodded and admitted: "That's right. Actually, if I hadn't been constantly lacking rest, I would have felt I could have grown a bit by now."

"After all, Dharma Derivation is equivalent to cultivation for you cultivators."

"After cultivating for so long, if there's no progress at all, wouldn't I be a big fool?"

Yan Faju said righteously.

Li Fan remained silent, but he had already guessed what her so-called growth meant from Yan Faju's words. It was similar to the Terminal Dissolution Disc, sublimation, breakthrough. Reaching the limit of the mortal realm. Even... If Yan Faju's origin was an immortal artifact from the upper realm, then restoring its former immortal artifact power was not impossible.

Chapter 1274: Heavenly Venerate's Heaven and Earth Soul

"Hahaha..." A hint of panic flashed in Yan Fa Jue's eyes as she thought of brushing it off. "Don't think you can get away with it. Tell me honestly. Otherwise, I'll call for help! If I expose Yan Fa Jue's harboring ulterior motives, it'll be a great merit, right? Maybe I can even get out early," Li Fan threatened with a half-smile.

"What ulterior motives!" Yan Fa Jue glared at Li Fan indignantly.

But Li Fan's true body outside the character light sphere suddenly spoke, "Um..." Zhang Xu and Hua Yueye, the two Harmonious Dao cultivators guarding the place, were instantly attracted. Yan Fa Jue panicked. "Don't! Let's talk properly!" She lunged in front of the simulated personality, glared at Li Fan with wide eyes, and looked at him pitifully.

In the Yan Fa Jue space, Li Fan's true body paused for a moment, then continued, "Fellow Daoists Zhang and Hua, I'd like to ask, can the cultivation techniques derived by Yan Fa Jue be publicly disclosed? I know the Myriad Immortals Alliance's regulations prohibit it, but..."

Yan Fa Jue rolled her big eyes, cleared her throat, "I haven't tried it yet, how effective is this thing? Why don't you let me..."

Li Fan smiled and retorted, "If I were wholeheartedly loyal to the Myriad Immortals Alliance, why would I use the opportunity of asking you to derive techniques to pass on this method of creating simulated personalities to you?"

"Hoo hoo..." "Master, is there anything I can do for you?" The simulated personality asked very dutifully.

"I know I must find a way to change all of this!" A determination suddenly flashed in the little girl's eyes.

Yan Fa Jue scratched her hair, her face full of worry. "I can't finish deriving it! I'll never finish deriving it!"

But Li Fan just smiled that half-smile again, which immediately made Yan Fa Jue back down. "Hoo..." Yan Fa Jue looked at the jade slips that appeared. The joy of getting something for nothing instantly filled her heart, making her giggle foolishly.

"So, with this simulated personality helping you now, how long will it take you to achieve your goal?"

"So many years have passed, and there's still a long way to go! I feel like I'm reaching my limit!" With a clap of her chubby little hands, the scene within the character light sphere suddenly changed. Zhang Xu smiled and said, "Fellow Daoist Sun, are you trying to find a cultivation technique for your newborn son? Officially, this is not allowed. However, the supervisors are all from our Law Enforcement Hall, so..."

Yan Fa Jue waved her hand dismissively, "Let's just say that with this, it's enough to save me fifty years!"

Li Fan nodded. After Yan Fa Jue finished speaking, she looked at Li Fan, her eyes shining. "In short, as long as you give me fifty years of free time, I can find a way to completely escape this苦海! Then, I'll definitely have a good sleep."

"Fifty years of savings..."

"What does that mean?" Just then, Li Fan's voice suddenly rang out, causing Yan Fa Jue's expression to freeze.

"You!" She pointed her chubby finger at the simulated personality, her face full of disbelief. "How is it possible? How can you have intelligence? You're just a mechanical version of me..."

"It's just a trivial loophole." Li Fan made a very polite gesture and explained, "You don't need to worry. The simulated personality truly won't have independent thoughts. The reason it's like this now is because I've temporarily taken over its personality to communicate with you."

Li Fan slowly said, "What do you want to do?"

Yan Fa Jue's big eyes seemed to well up with tears, looking pitiful. "I warn you, don't do anything rash! I'll call for help!"

Li Fan ignored Yan Fa Jue's clumsy acting. He brought the conversation back to the "ten-year savings."

"Ah! I understand. Actually, every time you complete a derivation, the time required is a little less than what you claim. Every time you complete a derivation task, you save a little spare time. This is your savings." As Li Fan's words continued, Yan Fa Jue's face gradually turned pale. "I've accumulated so much without realizing it."

"It will take fifty years in total..."

"This is no longer a matter of being lazy." Li Fan stared straight at Yan Fa Jue. "What exactly do you want?"

Chapter 1275: The Scenery of the Immortal Realm in the Past

Countless mirrored surfaces appeared, along with Mo Rubin’s myriad faces, each with a different expression. They hid behind the shadowy, indistinct mirrors, collectively scrutinizing the Faceless Saint Emperor in the center of the arena. With Li Ping as the focal point, pairs of mirrors corresponded. Points of light shot out from one mirror and projected onto the opposite. The resulting lines of light, like tangible shackles, were imposed upon Li Ping. As strands of light manifested in the mirror world, they acted like heavy chains, accelerating Li Ping’s progress in being pulled into the “real” world.

The Faceless Saint Emperor, now fully corporeal and enveloped by layers of mirrors, did not show much panic. He looked at the “lines” on his body, which were both formless and tangible, and reached out as if to touch them. But they passed through his hand like illusory bubbles, re-binding and entangling him. Like a raging inferno, the vortex seemed to have been fed a great deal of fuel, radiating a soul-stirring brilliance. And from the black chains being burned, countless faces of Mo Rubin emitted malicious curses in unison. His body slowly began to expand, his features becoming increasingly blurred. This sentence seemed to have touched a raw nerve for Mo Rubin; his form instantly became as dark and profound as if it had been stained with thick ink.

“So these are the cultivator souls you devoured.”

A vortex suddenly formed in his chest. “What is evil? What is righteousness? Neither exists, only the Immortal endures!”

“Heretical ways? Truly ignorant and fearless!” Mo Rubin roared with laughter, filled with mockery. “Let me become you!”

Mo Rubin and Li Ping faced each other from opposite ends of the mirrors. Golden light protected him, blocking all erosion from the black chains. The objects on both sides of the mirrors became increasingly similar. Beneath the surface of the armor, a golden glow continuously flowed, as if possessing its own sentience.

A seemingly unfathomable power locked Li Ping and Mo Rubin together, preventing them from escaping no matter how he shifted his position. “You, who cultivate the good [Nine Revolutions Immortal Soul], turned to this sort of heresy instead!” Li Ping shook his head with a hint of regret. Li Ping tore off a black chain and stuffed it into the vortex. Boom! But soon, the Saint Emperor discovered a profoundly bizarre sight before him. Meanwhile, Mo Rubin continued to grin ferociously, coldly watching him from the other side of the mirror. “How can you judge the [Myriad Tribulations Indestructible Demonic Heart Immortal Technique]!” The moment this fissure appeared, Li Ping suddenly had a premonition. Mo Rubin on the “other side” seemed to have vanished. The image before him was merely a projection formed on the other end of the mirror, based on his own existence. The fissure before him had also teleported, its relative position to himself unchanging.

Li Ping extended his right hand, grabbed the chain wrapped around him, and yanked it fiercely. Hissing sounds… Just as he was about to completely slide to the other side of the mirror, Li Ping suddenly removed his golden armor. The sound of shattering mirrors echoed continuously. “I am the Saint Emperor appointed by Heaven.” “Just you?” Scurrying whispers emanated from these black chains. One could even vaguely see faces resembling Mo Rubin’s, crawling and wailing on their surfaces. “Utterly foolish!” What was even more chilling was that Li Ping vaguely felt that Mo Rubin’s appearance and aura on the other side of the mirror were subtly changing.

The black chains possessed a dark, corrosive ability. In the blink of an eye, Li Ping’s clothes were dissolved. Just as they were about to touch Li Ping’s skin, a radiant golden light erupted. The distance between the Saint Emperor and Mo Rubin was steadily closing. Mo Rubin was transforming into the Faceless Saint Emperor. These were mirrors that reflected both reality and illusion. He coldly gazed at Mo Rubin not far away: “Become me?”

The angular golden armor suddenly manifested, completely enveloping the Saint Emperor’s colossal, three-zhang-three-cun tall body. This action, for some unknown reason, seemed to enrage Mo Rubin. A fissure was born between him and Li Ping. He roared, and the lines that had been like bright light suddenly turned pitch-black. As the vortex in his chest continuously swallowed the black chains, the Saint Emperor, through the images flooding his mind, understood the origins of these resentful faces. With a thought, Li Ping, protected by the golden armor, instantly appeared a hundred miles away, leaving the ruins of the Zixiao Sect. Purple-gold destiny emerged from the void, weaving itself into a祥云龙袍 like a dreamlike veil and adorning Li Ping’s body.

The Saint Emperor’s voice, like thunder from the nine heavens, reverberated from one end of the mirrors. Roaring echoes reverberated, causing ripples even in the fissure that separated reality from illusion. “I am also the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao!” “The survival of billions of beings hinges on it, the source of the Utmost Darkness Star Sea’s resurgence!” “You want to become me?” With every sentence the Saint Emperor spoke, it was like a tidal wave, fiercely striking the mirror fissure. Cracking sounds could be faintly heard, and the world on the other side of the mirrors began to show cracks. It seemed on the verge of shattering at any moment. “Do you deserve it?!” Li Ping asked coldly. A single stone stirred a thousand ripples. Mo Rubin’s expression changed for the first time, deviating from his imitation of the Faceless Saint Emperor. Behind Li Ping, he seemed to see a miniature image of the entire Xuanhuang Realm. Even beyond that mass of Xuanhuang light, a more brilliant galaxy seemed to be hidden! In a turn of thought, heaven and earth were overturned. The weight of the world pressed down on him. Ding! The fissure mirror shattered, and in a chain reaction, the countless mirrors sealing the surrounding space instantly exploded into myriad fragments.

Mo Rubin spat out a mouthful of blood, but his reaction was swift. Using the disturbance caused by the shattering mirrors, his form became illusory, and in an instant, he appeared miles away. “Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao?” “How is this possible?” Mo Rubin’s face was filled with disbelief. His expression suddenly changed: “The damned Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao is truly unreliable; I need to hurry.” While he was muttering to himself, a tall figure appeared before him, quietly blocking his path. “You intend to leave before answering my question?” Mo Rubin’s eyes flashed with caution, and he snorted, “What Celestial Fate Saint Emperor, what Heavenly Dao avatar, they are all just pawns!”

“If you don’t want to die, why don’t we cooperate? How about it?” “Although you are strong, you are still inferior to Brother Xuanyuan. Even he was ambushed and met misfortune; you will surely not avoid it…” Mo Rubin’s words stirred something in Li Ping’s heart, causing him to pause his attack. But after Mo Rubin finished speaking, Li Ping’s expression suddenly changed. He reached out to grab the Mo Rubin before him, but that figure exploded like a phantom bubble, scattering in the air. It was clearly just a diversion. The true Mo Rubin had, when Li Ping wasn’t looking, escaped to an unknown location. The Saint Emperor, however, was not angered by being toyed with. “Truly remarkable, the genuine Immortal Art.” “The [Myriad Tribulations Indestructible Demonic Heart Immortal Technique]…” “No.” After pondering for a moment, Li Ping looked at Cat Treasure, who was sleeping on his shoulder. During the brief battle with Mo Rubin, the beast had apparently not noticed Cat Treasure’s presence. Furthermore, that move capable of replication and substitution had not registered Cat Treasure’s existence.

“It couldn’t pique Cat Treasure’s interest. It seems this so-called Immortal Art is somewhat undeserved of its name.” Although Mo Rubin had escaped for now, he had not truly escaped Li Ping’s control. While Mo Rubin was attempting to replace Li Ping, Li Ping was slowly drawing him into the net of Origin Force Essence. Even if he broke free for a moment, as long as he followed the broken, still-existing golden threads in the air, Li Ping could track him down. Within his senses, Mo Rubin was still fleeing rapidly. Li Ping did not rush to pursue, intending to play the long game. “What he said just now is difficult to discern truth from falsehood. However, one thing is certain: he will definitely go searching for Xuan Tianwang.” “Or perhaps something related to the Xuan Tian Sect from back then.” “I will wait and see.” Li Ping knew that to deal with an ancient being like Mo Rubin, who had survived since antiquity, one must possess ample patience. Moreover, the battle with Mo Rubin had given the Saint Emperor a substantive understanding of the Xuan Tian Sect’s devious techniques. With preparation, their next encounter would not result in such an easy escape.

The fluctuations from the recent battle seemed to have attracted the attention of other powerful beings. Perhaps people from the Myriad Immortals Alliance would arrive soon to investigate, so Li Ping decided to leave the area first. “I never expected Mo Rubin to be hiding in the ruins of the Zixiao Sect.” “According to the Stone Tablet’s records, after the Ten Immortal Sects destroyed the Xuan Tian Sect, they scoured the world to eliminate any future troubles. This Zixiao Sect was thoroughly investigated back then, yet he still managed to hide there.” “Regardless of the power of the Xuan Tian Sect’s techniques, they are quite cunning and difficult to guard against…” “Not like the orthodox Immortal path.” Li Ping commented inwardly. His divine sense swept over the Zixiao Sect ruins miles away, and the Faceless Saint Emperor’s figure slowly vanished into the air. However, the next moment, Li Ping reappeared. “Hmm?” Because just as he was contemplating, Li Ping discovered something strange. His perspective suddenly rose, and a miniature landscape of the Xuanhuang Realm appeared before him. “This place is Linlang Prefecture in the Myriad Immortals Alliance. A thousand years ago, it was part of the primordial Xuanhuang Realm.” “The Xuanhuang Realm was dismembered and reformed; this Linlang Prefecture was merged with other cultivation worlds.”

“But…” Li Ping’s expression gradually became solemn. “A piece of the primordial Xuanhuang Realm is missing.” Possessing the information from the Creation Stone Tablet and being closely connected to the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, Li Ping vaguely sensed during the process of restoring the primordial Xuanhuang Realm’s dismemberment and reassembly that a large area around the former Zixiao Sect had vanished from the new Xuanhuang Realm’s map. Or rather, it hadn’t disappeared. It still existed somewhere in the current Xuanhuang Realm. “But some power has influenced it, causing me to subconsciously ignore its existence.” After reaching this conclusion, Li Ping’s demeanor became solemn. The maps of the primordial Xuanhuang Realm and the current Xuanhuang Realm separated and recombined in his sea of consciousness, allowing for comparison. After a long while, he finally found another area of the former Zixiao Sect. It was the Taihua Prefecture and Mount Taixu area. “What is there…” Li Ping did not investigate immediately but first contemplated the power that could influence him. Past events flashed through his mind. The Saint Emperor had a vague premonition. However, Li Ping hesitated uncharacteristically. He stood motionless in the air for a long time, and only after much deliberation did he make a decision. “No matter what the truth is, if one lacks the courage to face it…” “How can one save the Xuanhuang Realm?” The Saint Emperor shook his head slightly and his figure flickered. Not long after, he arrived at Mount Taixu. However, the secret discovered here was somewhat different from his expectations. A deep valley beneath Mount Taixu. Li Ping discovered an underground secret chamber buried by mud. The aura emanating from the chamber made even him, an avatar of the Heavenly Dao, feel uncomfortable. What concerned him even more was that Cat Treasure, who had been sleeping on his shoulder, suddenly woke up and looked around. As if finding a delicious meal, Li Ping could sense extreme excitement from it. But after locking onto the target, Cat Treasure suddenly deflated like a balloon, losing all its drive, and lazily fell back asleep.

However, Li Ping’s attention remained fixed on his target. “What is this…” A statue. Like him, it had no face. Although it appeared ordinary, without any spiritual energy fluctuations, Li Ping felt an unprecedented pressure from the stone statue. He hadn’t even felt this way when facing the residual calamities in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea. The Faceless Statue seemed to possess a magical power. Li Ping slowly approached it. Two formless faces faced each other across the void… For some reason, Li Ping suddenly felt an impulse. He wanted to communicate with this statue.

…In the space of the Derivation Law Jade. Li Fan’s aura faltered slightly. The images he could sense from the Saint Emperor’s clone had become extremely faint. But after the Saint Emperor unexpectedly discovered the statue of the Faceless True Immortal buried beneath Mount Taixu, influenced by an instinctual sense of mortal danger, the connection became clear again. Li Fan closed his eyes and concentrated, attempting to alter his clone’s intentions. Although he could escape the True Immortal Net once, repeating it would be troublesome. It was best to avoid it if possible. However, the Saint Emperor’s will was unexpectedly firm. Perhaps sensing something in the similarly void faces, he continued to walk slowly towards the statue of the Faceless True Immortal. Standing before the statue, he remained motionless. At this moment, even though the Saint Emperor was his clone, Li Fan could not understand what the Saint Emperor was thinking.

“So, this is the Xuanhuang Immortal.” After a long time, Li Ping discovered the origin of this statue in the Creation Stone Tablet’s records. The Faceless True Immortal worshipped by the Xuan Tian Sect. Li Ping touched his own void face, his aura fluctuating continuously. “Interesting.” Li Fan could not determine if there was a genuine connection between himself and this Faceless True Immortal. However, he could vaguely sense the extraordinary nature of the statue. Very cautiously, he did not choose to touch it himself. Li Fan summoned an ordinary Sacred Army puppet and moved the statue into the dark void outside the Great Qi small world. He set up layers of formations to seal the statue. Only after the sense of crisis in his heart gradually faded did he stop. He was so cautious because, after interacting with the statue during this period, he had developed a sense of familiarity. And the source of this familiarity was not just because the statue was mysteriously faceless like himself. More importantly, it came from an image. The image he had sensed from the vast will within the Star Sea’s core in the center of the Utmost Darkness Star Sea.

“What does it have to do with me! What does it have to do with me!” That unrestrained laughter, the gradually disappearing body. It was remarkably similar to the statue and his own feelings. “Is it the same person? Or not?” However, it was merely a fleeting glimpse, and Li Fan could not confirm. “If I have the chance, I will go to the center of the Star Sea again.” “If the vast will of the Star Sea personally authenticates it, then perhaps it can be clarified.” This thought flashed through Li Fan’s mind. “Perhaps I can try again. However, the supply of Empty Light Flowing Crystal has been almost depleted from the last operation. And…” Li Fan looked again at the Faceless Statue sealed by formations in the void. Although it had no eyes, it seemed to be watching him. “If the true culprit back then was indeed this Faceless True Immortal, and it was implicated by the enraged Star Sea will, then even a puppet body sent there might affect the main body here.” “Compared to the entire Utmost Darkness Star Sea, the Xuanhuang Realm is truly like a drop in the ocean…” Li Fan’s mind flashed with images of the Xuanhuang Realm being torn apart by violent energy. He suppressed his previous thoughts. After a long silence, the Saint Emperor’s figure disappeared. When he reappeared, he placed another item beside the statue of the Faceless True Immortal. It was the ruins of the Yishi Sect, sealed beneath the great rift in Guāngzhōu Prefecture, which he had collected earlier.

The ruins were ordinary, but the remains of a Grand Mage within and the hidden Annihilation Wind Tribulation forced even the Saint Emperor to treat them with caution. The Yishi Sect ruins and the statue of the Faceless True Immortal faced each other in the void. Li Ping had a premonition. If there were no formations sealing them… A catastrophe of unimaginable horror would erupt on the spot. “Immortal…” The arrogant laughter of “What does it have to do with me” echoed faintly in Li Ping’s ears. He snorted coldly and cast thousands of formations with his hand. Reinforcing the cages containing both items. These unstable factors buried in the Xuanhuang Realm would not provide him any peace anywhere else. Only under his personal watch would they be truly secure. Li Ping thought this and continued tirelessly reinforcing the formation seals. On his shoulder, Cat Treasure had woken up at some point. Its clear eyes stared into the void ahead, its claws reaching towards its mouth, licking them.

…On Li Fan’s main body, he couldn’t help but breathe a sigh of relief. As the statue of the Faceless True Immortal was sealed, the connection between him and his clone became faint again. In fact, it was even weaker than before. “Is the Saint Emperor’s clone becoming more vigilant?” Li Fan shook his head, not particularly concerned. “However, this matter also reminds me.” “Although I myself am hiding here, observing the changes in the Xuanhuang world, the Saint Emperor, as the protagonist of this lifetime, is bound to confront those transcendent existences.” “He might not necessarily find me by following the connection between the clone and the main body, just like the True Immortals in the Immortal Ruins before.” “Hmm… I still need to make some preparations.” However, being in the heart of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, his actions were not completely free, and he would need to plan carefully.

“Big idiot!” As he was contemplating, he vaguely sensed the little loli from Yan Faju constantly calling out to the simulated personality. With a movement of his mind, he re-entered the character light sphere and manifested again. “Seriously, I’ve been calling you for so long and only now you respond.” Yan Faju pouted, looking very displeased. “Are you done sleeping?” Li Fan didn’t respond directly, but asked with some surprise. Yan Faju put her hands on her hips, “How could I be done sleeping so quickly! But I remembered some things from before while I was dreaming. See if it’s helpful to you!” The little loli clapped her hands, and the scene within the light sphere suddenly changed. A boundless grassland with a lone stone standing isolated. Suddenly, the ground began to shake. Large patches of green grass seemed stimulated by something and began to grow frantically, instantly reaching over a person tall. They even pushed the lone stone on the grassland up from the ground. An arc of light appeared in the sky. The seven-colored arc of light, within which lightning and storm elements were focused. The space around the seven-colored arc of light would occasionally distort strangely, as if an invisible transparent object was present.

More and more invisible things gathered around the arc of light, as if waiting for something. The wind and thunder grew more violent, and the rolling black clouds even seemed to be penetrating the arc of light. Although the storm appeared terrifying from outside the arc of light, its true horror manifested when it spread beyond. A bolt of pitch-black lightning struck the ground violently from the arc of light. Boom! Boom! Boom! The world was split in two, and the space was torn by deep fissures that remained unhealed for a long time. On the grassland, the continuous green grass was ignited, and the raging flames spread rapidly. But then, an even stranger sight appeared. The embers from the burning fell and became nourishment for the green leaves. The green grass grew again, its growth rate offsetting the burning speed. The grassland trembled, and beneath the raging flames, something seemed to be awakening. And high in the sky, the invisible beings around the arc of light ignored everything happening below. They gathered more and more towards the interior of the arc of light. They even quarreled over positions, causing conflicts. Continuous loud roaring and colliding sounds echoed. The storm, having reached its peak, suddenly came to a standstill. The rolling black clouds vanished in an instant. Within the seven-colored arc of light, under a clear sky for thousands of miles, a profoundly mystical character was present! The moment the character appeared, the sounds of the highest Dao resonated through heaven and earth. Colorful auspicious clouds continuously arrived from the horizon, converging towards the character. Drizzling raindrops fell from the sky. The raindrops, like the auspicious clouds in the sky, were of a captivating seven-colored hue. The fissures in heaven and earth were repaired. The flames on the grassland were extinguished by the falling raindrops. The continuous green grass greedily absorbed the heavenly dew, but their bodies began to shrink. Seven-colored light brightened, and figures of various shapes began to form within. However, the sounds of fighting in the sky seemed to grow louder.

But Yan Faju’s memory was nearing its end. The surrounding scenes gradually blurred, and only the lone stone on the grassland could be seen dissolving under the raindrops.

…The scene faded, and Li Fan returned to Yan Faju’s character light sphere. He was immersed in the scene he had just witnessed, unable to extricate himself. “How is it? Have you figured anything out?” Yan Faju asked expectantly. After savoring the scene for a long time, Li Fan finally asked, “That raindrop, could it be the Immortal Melody Jade Dew you mentioned?” Yan Faju stood with her hands on her hips, declaring righteously, “It should be. I’ve had this memory in my mind since I was born. But as I grew older, I forgot it. Thankfully, I had a good sleep earlier, otherwise, who knows when I would have remembered it!” “I have a feeling that if I could have some more of this stuff…” Li Fan interrupted Yan Faju’s reverie. “What about the characters in that seven-colored arc of light?” “Why can’t I see them clearly at all?” Yan Faju pouted, “I already told you it was from a dream. It’s already difficult enough for me to recall this, let alone remember the characters clearly?!”

Li Fan stared at Yan Faju, trying to discern the truth in her words. “You don’t believe me?” Yan Faju said, feeling extremely wronged. Li Fan chuckled, “You’re not stupid. I don’t believe you haven’t realized that the scene you just showed has a high probability of being a legendary Immortal Realm scene. Characters that even Immortals are fighting over… It’s natural for you to hide something.” Yan Faju’s expression became even more wronged upon hearing this. “I really can’t remember. You know they are Immortal characters, they aren’t easily remembered. Besides, I was so young back then…” Yan Faju gestured, tears welling up in her eyes. “How can I recall it?” Li Fan didn’t believe the little loli’s excuses and directly stated his condition. Yan Faju’s tears stopped instantly. Her big eyes darted around, as if deep in thought. After a moment, she whispered, “Hmm, maybe if I eat my fill, I can remember some things.” Yan Faju licked her lips and looked at Li Fan. “Eat?” Li Fan lowered his head, “You can eat too?” Yan Faju said indignantly, “What kind of question is that? I’m a person too, you know.” “It’s been thousands of years since I tasted good food.” “I tasted it again in my dream and got cravings…” Li Fan conjured a crispy roasted pigeon exuding an enticing aroma in his hand. “Is this acceptable?” Yan Faju rolled her eyes, “I want the real thing, not a fake. I can have as many of these as I want.” As she spoke, the little loli waved her hand, and the surroundings were instantly filled with all sorts of delicacies. “Even if it looks similar, a fake is still a fake and can never become real…” Yan Faju shook her head, filled with regret. “Oh?” For some reason, Yan Faju suddenly felt Li Fan’s expression change slightly at that moment. “Then take a look at this dish. What do you think?” In Li Fan’s hand appeared a seemingly ordinary fried rice. Yan Faju initially dismissed it, but at Li Fan’s subtle gesture, she took it and tasted it.

Chapter 1276: Arrest Mo Ruibin

Initially, Yan Faju was somewhat cautious. But the moment she tasted it, her expression became incredibly vivid. She then began to devour it with large mouthfuls. "Wuwu... so delicious... wuwu..." In a flash, she finished the entire plate of fried rice. Afterward, she patted her slightly full stomach with a lingering sense of satisfaction, her face full of amazement. "Your fried rice is just like the real thing! How did you do it?" With that, Yan Faju let out a satisfied burp.

Li Fan smiled and replied, "When the fake becomes real, the real also becomes fake. When the real becomes fake, the fake also becomes real. Truth and falsehood, how can they be so easily distinguished?" "As long as you have sufficient understanding of the essence of things, you too can create things that are incredibly lifelike." Yan Faju plopped down on the ground. "Fried rice, I've only ever eaten it, never made it! Delicious food in general, it seems there's no hope of self-sufficiency. But..." She eyed Li Fan. "Were you perhaps a chef before?" Li Fan’s face twitched. He avoided the question and changed the subject. "Are you full yet? Have you remembered those immortal characters?" Yan Faju quickly shook her head. "Just one dish, it's not enough! Can I have some more!"

"From the clues we have now, True Immortal Seal Scripts can be divided into three major categories. The first is the 'Chaos' script, which brings all sorts of disasters and destruction. The second is the 'Return' script, which is a decree from the Immortal Realm. And the last is this..." As he sensed it, Mo Rubin, who had been fleeing rapidly before, had been motionless for a long time. Li Fan's thoughts churned, and he couldn't help but try to piece together the missing Dao inscription characters again. Li Fan responded indifferently, "It was just a small trade I did with that skill when I was a mortal. Not worth mentioning." "However..." Li Ping pondered for a moment, not pursuing directly. Instead, he summoned the Master Craftsman.

Just as Li Fan's true body gained insight from Yan Faju's recounting of the Immortal Realm's secrets, the Faceless Saint Emperor Li Ping finally completed the final sealing of the Faceless True Immortal statue and the First Origin Sect ruins.

"But everything is afraid of comparison." And as the strokes in the character light sphere moved, a giant character, occupying the entire sky, was formed. Li Fan snorted coldly, but still waved his hand gently. A stove, cooking utensils, and ingredients appeared before him. But Li Fan discovered that this gap only appeared when he presented and compared the two simultaneously in his mind. "You know, although you're not very good-looking, your cooking skills are really superb," Yan Faju praised. "The difference between the original and the replica is truly immense." Amidst the dancing cooking flames, various delicious dishes emitting fragrant aromas were continuously served. "The structure of the strokes, the style of the turns, and all sorts of pen tip details are extremely similar to what I saw before with 'Hunger' and 'Chaos,' but it's even more beautiful, even more naturally integrated." He then said, "Hmm, I'm a little sleepy, I'm going to take a nap. You can look yourself." Yan Faju, who had just eaten her fill, her stomach round like a ball, ungracefully lay directly on the ground.

"It's a pity that this 'Inscription Dao Immortal' original is incomplete. And after being passed through Yan Faju's memory, it's still a little distorted." Imitating the 'Inscription Dao Immortal' original, Li Fan re-examined the True Immortal Seal Scripts like 'Hunger' and 'Chaos' that he had mastered. Saying that, Yan Faju was already snoring loudly and had fallen into a deep sleep. Yan Faju squinted contentedly, savoring the taste lingering on her tongue. As expected, the effect was excellent. Although at first glance, they still looked the same as before, Li Fan was very sure that these True Immortal Seal Scripts, improved based on the original, had their power increased by at least one-third. The profound Daoist sounds he had vaguely heard in the illusion before seemed to ring out again. Li Fan looked up at the character, motionless, and only after it slowly dissipated did he show a thoughtful expression.

"Where is this place... According to legend, it's the heart of that giant beast transformed after death, where the Qi of the Nine Mountains Prefecture converges. I went there once, but found nothing special," the Master Craftsman said, shaking his head slightly while sensing the image transmitted by the Saint Emperor. The location pointed out by the Saint Emperor was a swamp in the Nine Mountains Prefecture, the stronghold of the Spiritual Yuan Sect. "It's just that the spiritual energy is denser than in other places, there's nothing else special about it," the Master Craftsman concluded. "What do you know about that [Tian Beast]?" Li Ping asked again. The Master Craftsman shrugged. "If it weren't for some local cultivators from the Nine Mountains Prefecture in my sect, I probably wouldn't even know the legend that the Nine Mountains were formed from the corpse of a dead giant beast. So that thing is called a Tian Beast, I've learned something new." "However, if you're interested in that place, I have an Nascent Soul cultivator in my sect named Shen Yurou. You can summon him to ask." The Master Craftsman explained the reason to Li Ping. It turned out that Shen Yurou's family had been making a living by excavating underground objects in the Nine Mountains Prefecture for generations. In the chaotic land of the Nine Mountains, countless cultivators had been buried since ancient times. It could even be traced back to the era when the Ten Immortal Sects ruled. Relying on this craft, the Shen family had accumulated considerable wealth. However, it was ultimately a shady business. Since Shen Yurou joined the Spiritual Yuan Sect, he had abandoned this ancestral skill.

"I think I heard him mention before that Shen's ancestor once dug up a peculiar building near that swamp. But inside, it was empty, with only some strange statues placed there. After his ancestor left in disappointment, he fell gravely ill and almost died." Li Ping's heart stirred, and he flipped through the Creation Stone Tablet. Indeed, he found information about this Shen family ancestor, but there was no record of discovering ruins in the Nine Mountains Prefecture swamp. Li Ping then left Great Qi and went to the Spiritual Yuan Sect. Still disguised as the Sect Master of the Spiritual Yuan Sect, he summoned Shen Yurou to inquire about the details. Shen Yurou was somewhat taken aback by the summons from the Sect Master who had not appeared for a long time. He said nervously, "This matter is indeed somewhat strange. After my ancestor accidentally entered that place, he contracted some strange illness." "For example, the scene of that underground building often reappears in his dreams, and also..." "Since then, all members of our Shen family have become like men when they are women, and like women when they are men. The balance of yin and yang is reversed," Shen Yurou said, seemingly having accepted reality.

Li Ping scanned Shen Yurou's body with his divine sense, but found no influence of any foreign power. It was as if it was meant to be like this. "Is the specific location of that building still preserved?" Li Ping asked. Shen Yurou's face showed distress. "My ancestor, to prevent any clan member from accidentally entering again, did not reveal its specific location. However, the scene of that building has been preserved through paintings and calligraphy." With that, Shen Yurou conjured a painting in the air. At the four corners, there were stone statues. It depicted a headless person in different postures, as if praying. In the center of the four stone statues stood a bare, smooth pillar. The surface of the pillar was smooth, without any carved patterns. Strangely, the shadow cast by the pillar on the ground seemed to be that of a ferocious beast, baring its fangs and claws, as if it would come alive with the change of light and shadow.

"According to my ancestor, inside this building, there was a constant, intense heartbeat sound. And if you looked up along the pillar, it was like suddenly falling into an abyss, surrounded by endless darkness..." Shen Yurou added. Li Ping stared at the headless figures in the painting. Even without heads, they vaguely resembled the style of the Faceless True Immortal statue he had encountered beneath Mount Taixu. It was undoubtedly a product of the Xuan Heaven Sect. "Borrowing its image, yet severing its head." "This pillar..." The smooth pillar was undoubtedly the core of this strange building. But from the image alone, no clues could be discerned. After Li Ping dismissed Shen Yurou, he quietly arrived at the Great Marsh in the Nine Mountains Prefecture. The presence of such a vast swampland in the continuously rolling Nine Mountains was theoretically highly unreasonable. Many cultivators had explored this area, hoping to uncover some secrets, but all had found nothing. Li Ping stood in the center of the Great Marsh, only sensing a foul and decaying odor. He did not detect anything unusual. If it weren't for the clear sensation that Mo Rubin was hiding here. Mo Rubin had seemingly not yet detected Li Ping's approach. Although he had been moving within the depths of the swamp in a small area, he had never left this region.

Setting up formations around, Li Ping infiltrated the underground of the swamp, slowly approaching the sensed location. "Gulp..." Suddenly, his movements halted abruptly. Just now, Li Ping vaguely heard a squirming sound. With his current cultivation level, it was almost impossible to dismiss it as an illusion. So... Li Ping looked around. The viscous, foul-smelling swamp mud was rhythmically churning, as if alive. Li Ping suddenly had a feeling that the entire swamp had suddenly come alive. "A trap?" The thought flashed through Li Ping's mind, but he quickly dismissed it. The attention of this swamp was not on him. The Saint Emperor continued to conceal his tracks, following the internal sensation, which was also the source of the swamp's life-like movement. Before long, he discovered the strange building that Shen Yurou's ancestor had encountered. Viewed from a macroscopic perspective, this building resembled a blank face. And the tall, smooth pillar was located at the position of the eyebrows of the blank face, as if a third eye protruding from the ground, gazing at the sky. This bizarre sight made Li Ping's heart tighten. The building isolated him from peering inside, so he could only rely on the imprint he had left on Mo Rubin to confirm that he was currently busy doing something inside. The Saint Emperor did not rashly enter. Instead, from the periphery, he silently laid out a net of Origin Force Essence. Combined with layers of formations to completely seal the area, and summoning the power of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao to seal the surrounding earth veins... Even after taking so many precautions, Li Ping inexplicably felt uncertain. After pondering for a moment, Li Ping awakened Cat Treasure on his shoulder and retrieved an item from its belly. It was obtained from the fishing pond, a treasure that could seal space. The treasure looked unremarkable, just a simple ring. But the golden-white light flowing on it subtly revealed the terrifying power hidden within. "Void Binding Ring." "It was forged by integrating a ring-shaped world, extinguishing all life within it, and incorporating it into the ring. Not only does it possess the weight of the entire world, but also the weight of billions of lives. Once bound, even I would be greatly affected in my movements." Although the forging method could be considered a downright evil method, Li Ping was not a pedantic person, so he had no psychological burden in using it.

He gently tossed it out, and the Void Binding Ring flew towards the top of the void-faced building. In the blink of an eye, it expanded several times, enveloping the entire surrounding area. Watching the gradually disappearing golden-white ring, the Saint Emperor pondered for a moment, then laid down a final measure. With everything ready, Li Ping flew into the building. "You've arrived." "I've been waiting for you for a long time." As soon as he entered, Mo Rubin's voice echoed in his ears. Li Ping focused his gaze, unable to see his person. But the shadow lingering at the base of the smooth pillar in the center of the building seemed to take on a humanoid form. Facing Li Ping, it appeared to wear a mocking expression. "I've been by Brother Xuanyuan's side for so long, even if I haven't reached the Half-Immortal realm, I wouldn't know nothing about him. Moreover, you're using a plan that my brother discarded and rejected..." "Mortal Immortal Force, powerful though it may be, is ultimately harmful and not beneficial," Mo Rubin taunted. Li Ping knew that the Mortal Immortal Force Mo Rubin spoke of was the Origin Force Essence he had condensed from the faith of the You Clan. Taking shortcuts would surely come at a price. But what he sought was not ascension to immortality, but the Xuanhuang Heaven and Earth. Within the scope of what he could achieve, finding the most powerful force was not inappropriate.

Ignoring Mo Rubin's words, the Saint Emperor examined the details of the building. "A relic of the Xuan Heaven Sect?" he asked. Mo Rubin seemed to be waiting for something and did not attack. He replied, "Hehehe, rather than saying it's a relic of the Xuan Heaven Sect, it's more like my personal backup plan." "Brother Xuanyuan is too idealistic, and too confident in himself." "I am different." The shadow beneath the pillar seemed to be stimulated by something and began to circle more rapidly. "I once had the same mindset as Brother Xuanyuan, thinking I was the destined protagonist and that failure was impossible as long as I acted. But later, I was severely struck, and my cultivation regressed daily. I even had to face ridicule from those I previously disdained..." "I realized!" Mo Rubin's shadow suddenly surged from the ground, floating in mid-air, glaring fiercely at Li Ping. "I am not some protagonist. I am merely an insignificant figure flowing through the river of history in this world. Small figures naturally need to pave the way for failure. That's why I secretly built this place behind Brother Xuanyuan's back!" Mo Rubin manifested shadowy arms and pointed at the four headless stone statues around him, laughing sinisterly. "Look at these statues." "They are True Immortals, and they even saved Brother Xuanyuan's life. The people in the sect, including Brother Xuanyuan himself, admired them greatly, yet I still severed their heads!" Mo Rubin's maniacal laughter echoed throughout the secret chamber.

Li Ping calmly said, "Aren't you afraid of retaliation from the True Immortals?" Mo Rubin laughed even more fiercely. "You completely misunderstand! Let alone severing their heads, even if I urinated and defecated on their statues, the True Immortals wouldn't care!" "Mortal affairs, how can they enter the eyes of True Immortals?! Immortal..." "They only care about what they care about!" Li Ping just listened silently, neither agreeing nor refuting. "I know that immortal power, as if the True Immortals themselves have descended, is indeed immense, but even True Immortals do not have infinite power. Why would they waste their power on such a small statue?" Mo Rubin laughed heartily, then slowly calmed down. "Unless..." "Something that True Immortals care about appears around the statue." Before he finished speaking, the shadow Mo Rubin transformed into retreated back into the smooth pillar. The ground of the building vibrated slightly, and the pillar began to emit a faint glow, as if something was gestating within.

"I don't know who you are. But I'll give you a piece of advice..." Mo Rubin's voice came from within the pillar, becoming unclear as if passing through layers of obstruction. "Unless absolutely necessary, do not enter the True Immortal realm!" Li Ping vaguely sensed that the four headless statues around him seemed to have come alive. Even though their heads were severed, they could still gaze at the scene. However, their gazes were not on Li Ping. They were all focused on the glowing pillar. Logically, even if it wasn't the True Immortals' power directly descending, but merely a gaze transmitted across countless space-time distances, mortal cultivators should not be able to bear it. But the Faceless Saint Emperor, within the four statues, felt no pressure at all. "Is the power being drawn and absorbed?" Li Ping's heart trembled slightly. In his sight, four streams of power of the same nature were intertwined into threads, all circling the smooth pillar, wrapping around it layer by layer. Energized by this great power, the pillar's light grew brighter and brighter. Its surface seemed to melt away, revealing its true form. "This is..." A bare flagpole. The banner had long since disappeared, leaving only a white jade pole carved with complex patterns. "An item from the Immortal Realm." Feeling the increasingly violent energy fluctuations around him, Li Ping retreated slightly, but his gaze remained firmly locked on the white jade flagpole.

"Not only the gaze of the True Immortal statues, but even the Mortal Immortal Force, the Origin Force Essence I laid out, are being subtly manipulated by this flagpole..." At this moment, Mo Rubin's voice sounded again. "Back then, when Brother Xuanyuan returned from the Immortal Realm, he brought back quite a few good things." "Not to mention those cultivation techniques, even Immortal Artifacts were plentiful..." "It's a pity that they said they were tainted by calamity, and most of them were sealed, preventing us from using them." Energy formed a tangible vortex around the spirit banner, and amidst continuous tremors, the flagpole seemed as if it would break through the void and depart at any moment. "Alright, I haven't spoken to anyone in many years, and I've finally felt comfortable speaking so much." "We'll see each other again if there's a chance." "I have important business to attend to." Mo Rubin's words slowly faded. Brilliant light erupted from the flagpole, obscuring all prying eyes. The next moment, the spirit banner was about to escape this place. But Li Ping, who had been tracking for so long, naturally wouldn't let him leave just because of a few words. The formations and the net of Origin Force Essence exploded, and golden interweaving threads appeared from the void, forming a tight, inescapable net before the flagpole, completely sealing off space.

"Mortal Immortal Force, dare to contend with true immortal power?!" Mo Rubin's mocking voice echoed. Under the scorching light at the front of the white jade flagpole, the golden Origin Force slowly melted like snow. Li Ping remained unfazed, using his remaining Origin Force Essence like moths to a flame, while activating the formations to intercept. "Mortal formations, do they deserve..." "Huh?!" Mo Rubin's voice showed surprise for the first time. Because the formations Li Ping displayed had far surpassed his understanding. They were even slowly pulling back the white jade flagpole, which was about to pierce through the void. In Mo Rubin's senses, the surroundings were filled with obstructive media, hindering the flagpole's progress. "The formations of the Xuanhuang Realm have developed to this extent?" "The level of refinement is actually not inferior to the Great Ascension Star Crossing Formation!" Although shocked, Mo Rubin did not slow down his departure. A beam of white light erupted again from the flagpole. The white light swept across, and everything in front of it was dissolved. The flagpole then easily broke free from the heavy obstructions. And for some reason, Mo Rubin stopped his mockery and remained silent as he wanted to leave.

"Command!" At this moment, Li Ping's cold voice rang out. The Void Binding Ring manifested in the void, firmly locking the white jade flagpole. "Useless! Useless! Useless! Just a mere world artifact!" "Damn it! You're like a fly, so annoying!" Mo Rubin's tone was clearly different from before. He rambled on, even seeming a bit deranged. For the first time, something other than white light appeared from within the white jade flagpole. It was a human silhouette. The figure held a long saber and elegantly slashed towards the Void Binding Ring. *Clang!* The golden-white ring, containing the weight of billions of lives and an entire cultivation world, cracked from the middle. However, releasing the white figure had clearly consumed a lot of the white jade flagpole's energy. Its radiance dimmed considerably. "Damn it, damn it, damn it..." Mo Rubin's poisonous curses echoed. But he did not stay to trouble Li Ping. Instead, he resolutely continued towards his predetermined destination. "I told you, you can't stop me!" With a flash of light, the white jade flagpole transformed into a fine thread, breaking free from all restraints and was about to leave. At this moment, an ancient song suddenly rang out. The sound was not loud, but it suppressed the vibrations of Mo Rubin and the white jade flagpole. A pitch-black gate quietly opened in the path of the white jade flagpole. And Li Ping, who had not acted personally, also appeared at the tail of the white jade flagpole at this moment. Protected by golden armor, the phantom image of the Xuanhuang Realm also appeared behind the Saint Emperor. "Go in!" *Boom! Boom! Boom!* Li Ping fiercely kicked the tail of the white jade flagpole, causing the flagpole, which was already in a hurry to leave, to shoot forward. Unable to dodge, it flew directly into the pitch-black gate. Li Ping also flew in immediately afterward, closing the passage. He even casually brought along the few loyal You Clan members who had risked their lives to perform the ritual and open the passage to the Dark Sea.

Within the Dark Sea. It was pitch black and silent. Even in the outside world, the white jade flagpole, which shone like the sun, could only illuminate a small, limited area here. And Mo Rubin, who had been so noisy before, was now as silent as a mute. After a long pause. "Wait, where is this..." "This place..." After a long time, he finally spoke dazedly. "Now, we can talk." The radiance of the white jade flagpole slightly dispelled the darkness of the Dark Sea, allowing Li Ping and Mo Rubin to communicate verbally for the time being. Mo Rubin, however, seemed to have not heard Li Ping's words at all. He emerged from the white jade flagpole, looking around with disbelief. His expression was a mixture of anticipation and fear. "Is there the aura of Xuan Tianwang here?" After a brief silence, Li Ping spoke. The words "Xuan Tianwang" seemed to have triggered a switch. Mo Rubin suddenly snapped back to reality. He stared at Li Ping. "How did you know about this place?" "And how can you open the passage here?" Mo Rubin's tone was very dangerous, as if if Li Ping's answer was slightly wrong, he would fight to the death. "Nearly ten thousand years have passed since you fell into slumber. Nothing is impossible." Li Ping's attitude was very calm. "Not only me, but even the current largest cultivation organization, the Myriad Immortals Alliance, has mastered the method of opening passages here." "And they are stealing power here." "Don't you feel it?" Li Ping asked. As soon as these words were spoken, Mo Rubin's expression changed again. He looked towards the distance, his aura fluctuating violently. "How dare they?!" "It deserves death! Kill! Kill!" Mo Rubin roared in rage.

Chapter 1277: The Dark Sea Hides a True Immortal

A killing intent, as tangible as substance, swept towards the Saint Emperor, only to be dissolved into nothingness by the faint golden threads before him. Once Mo Rubin's rage subsided somewhat, Li Ping spoke calmly, "I can tell your inner heart isn't truly angry." "Are you still acting before me? Or once you get into character, even you can hardly distinguish?" "Look, true anger is like this..." The Saint Emperor took a sudden step forward, powerful energy erupting from his toes and sweeping outwards. The radiance of the white jade flagpole swayed precariously in the wind. But this surging energy, once it left the confines of the light sphere and entered the murky depths, rapidly weakened. The silent Dark Sea rippled faintly, smoothing out all disturbances. As if comforting the enraged Saint Emperor. "I don't need you to teach me! I understand this place better than you!" Mo Rubin's figure suddenly flickered behind Li Ping. A shadow hid beneath the white light of the white jade flagpole, like a venomous snake, baring its fangs at Li Ping's neck. The chattering of the demonic face continued. "I once tried to harness the power of the Dark Sea to close that gap, but was blocked by an eyeball..." "With such a group of insects dragging me down, how can I succeed?" "Is the owner of that eyeball Xuan Tianwang?" "Would Brother Xuanyuan do such a thing?" Their tone varied, but without exception, after speaking their lines, they spontaneously dissolved into the Dark Sea. "Those who act, let them act. Those who are extremely terrified, let them be deterred to the end. Those who are utterly wicked, let them wallow in the mire." He suddenly stopped and looked up at the distant sky. "Damn it." "Don't I know that the Dark Sea encompasses everything, that even a cultivator's emotions will create ripples that are then covered by the darkness?" "Daring to speak so boldly with just some opportunistic method?" Li Ping looked at the shadow bound and writhing in his hand, and said coldly, "Another personality? This one... is very much like you." Li Ping also didn't get angry and followed his words, asking, "Then why could that eyeball mobilize the power of the Dark Sea?" Since these demonic faces did not attack, Li Ping directly ignored them and their taunts, quickly approaching Mo Rubin. Mo Rubin's direction of travel seemed to be the rift through which the Myriad Immortals Alliance was drawing power from the Dark Sea. The Saint Emperor came to Mo Rubin's side, placed his hand on his shoulder, and transmitted his voice. His gaze seemed to pierce through layers of darkness. Not far ahead, on Mo Rubin's true face, there was a calmness identical to his own. The waves of the Dark Sea blocked Mo Rubin's progress. "As expected, how foolish." Mo Rubin sneered. "The formation is just a facade. What truly makes this darkness gather, allowing the Xuanhuang Realm to resist the suction from the ruins of the ascension passage, is..." "Wield the demonic face with an immortal heart, and display the appropriate demeanor for whatever you encounter!" However, Mo Rubin himself discarded the immortal artifact, the white jade flagpole. Taking advantage of this moment of conversation, he had already vanished from his original spot. Mo Rubin did not look back, but a face suddenly appeared on the back of his head, looking at Li Ping with utter contempt. Then, the Saint Emperor showed no emotional fluctuation. Another shadow face appeared above Li Ping. This time, the words were no longer like the previous mad ramblings. However, Li Ping could hear true killing intent hidden within the calmness. Li Ping shook his head slightly; that kick he gave earlier was not for nothing. "What is the true me again? I am the number one genius of the Nine Revolutions, the first person to achieve immortality who carries the hopes of all. I am also one of the Twelve Dharma Kings of the Xuan Tian Sect, assisting Xuanyuan Hong in building the great cause of the Xuan Tian Sect and unifying the Xuanhuang Realm." Li Ping's golden armor suddenly showed cracks, and a black line shot out from the central hole, heading straight for Li Ping's neck. *Whoosh...* Mo Rubin's face on the back of his head disappeared: "Do you know what the essence of this Dark Sea is?" "You see through my heart too?" But just as it was about to succeed, Li Ping blocked it with his palm. A gap rhythmically spewed dark energy outwards. The intermittent muffled sounds were like a heavy heartbeat. After saying this, instead of crushing this sneak attack directly, he let it return to Mo Rubin's side. Dozens of Mo Rubin's faces hid in the darkness, occasionally floating over and mocking Li Ping. "Who do you think you are?! You haven't even entered the Immortal realm, and you dare to dream of saving the world?!" "Wrong, wrong, wrong! Laughter and scolding are me, arrogance and unrestrainedness are me, wildness is also me!" "As for pedantic good people like you, they should be scathingly awakened!" "Formation?" After pondering for a moment, Li Ping replied. Dozens of faces differentiated around him, unleashing a torrent of extremely unpleasant words upon the Saint Emperor. "Even so, must I always show the same face? The chief genius should always be steady? The Twelve Dharma Kings should always plan and then move?" Following the residual senses, he rapidly advanced through the Dark Sea, chasing Mo Rubin. At a crucial point, Mo Rubin suddenly stopped. "Do you want to know?" he asked teasingly, his tone frivolous. "Yes." Li Ping replied frankly. Seeing Li Ping so serious, Mo Rubin suddenly seemed to lose interest. His tone instantly returned to normal. "Only the power of a True Immortal can contend with Immortal power." "The one who caused the cataclysm of the Utmost Darkness Star Sea was a True Immortal who attained enlightenment. Then, the one who could generate enough momentum for the Xuanhuang Realm to escape..." "Naturally, it must be another True Immortal." As soon as these words were spoken, they struck Li Ping's mind like thunder. The surrounding darkness seemed to come alive in an instant, all peering at him. "True Immortals are indeed True Immortals." "But they are dead True Immortals. Correct?" However, the Saint Emperor, who had suddenly learned such a secret, seemed to have already anticipated it. He calmly retorted, "Mo Rubin shrugged: "Talking to smart people like you is really boring." "The foundation of the entire Dark Sea is the corpse of a True Immortal." "It's amazing, isn't it? Such a lower realm actually has a True Immortal who died here. But fortunately, the Xuanhuang Realm hid the corpse of a True Immortal, otherwise, even Xuanyuan wouldn't have had any good methods to save the Xuanhuang Realm if he had no ingredients for a clever cook." Mo Rubin sighed with emotion. Li Ping, however, introduced the existence of the Fallen Immortal Realm to Mo Rubin. "Oh. I didn't expect there to be a successor Heavenly Venerate willing to share the legacy of a True Immortal with the world." Mo Rubin's aura became unstable again after hearing this. "Hard to imagine there are people in this world even more foolish than Brother Xuanyuan. Truly..." "He has already perished." Li Ping added. Mo Rubin turned around and stared blankly at Li Ping. "You ask me, who should I ask? Probably not dead. I'm also looking for him. Brother Xuanyuan, who is so powerful, even if ambushed by a villain, he wouldn't just die like this." Saying this, without giving Li Ping a chance to communicate further, he turned back. "The Dark Sea is built upon the corpse of a True Immortal, gathering Dark Immortal power to resist the Immortal Ruins." "However, it is merely a dead object. Once the core manipulator is gone, it has become nourishment for others." "So, don't die. Even if you were a True Immortal in life, what good is it after death? Ants can still trample on you." Mo Rubin looked again at the Myriad Immortals Alliance's device drawing power from the Dark Sea, his tone mocking. "The First Generation Grand Heavenly Venerate's bloodline?" Li Ping's mind flashed with the strange appearance of the You Clan, and his heart stirred. "No wonder, only these people can communicate with the Dark Sea. But..." The direct bloodline of a True Immortal, without thinking, one knew how noble it was. But now they had become like this, neither human nor ghost. Mo Rubin seemed to have seen through Li Ping's thoughts and said coldly, "There's no need to pity these people. If you had lived in that era and personally experienced how the Grand Heavenly Venerate bloodline enslaved others..." "You would probably be the first to rise up in rebellion." "If Brother Xuanyuan hadn't intervened back then and wiped out all their claws and teeth, who knows how long these 'superior' beings would have continued to act atrociously. It can be considered their good fortune to have become this way now." Mo Rubin sneered coldly. Li Ping did not bother to argue with him on this issue. "The Dark Sea is actually using the corpse of a True Immortal to condense Dark Immortal power and resist the Immortal Ruins. Then, what is that eye held by the Myriad Immortals Alliance?" he asked softly. "Immortal Ruins..." As if disagreeing with this term, Mo Rubin let out another cold laugh. However, he did not dwell on these minor details this time and directly answered Li Ping's question: "That's just a magical artifact refined by Brother Xuanyuan back then to control the Dark Sea. After all, he couldn't possibly watch over this place all the time, and the Dark Sea was too important in the overall escape plan, so he asked us to assist. There were three in total, each given to different Dharma Kings." "I just don't know whose it is in the hands of the Myriad Immortals Alliance." A murderous intent flashed in Mo Rubin's words. Li Ping nodded slightly: "Is there a way to influence the eye artifact's control over the Dark Sea?" "If your formation mastery is even higher than Brother Xuanyuan's..." "Huh?" Mo Rubin was about to speak mockingly, but suddenly remembered the formation level displayed by the Saint Emperor during their previous encounter. He swallowed the words he was about to say. "Perhaps we can try in the core center of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation." Mo Rubin said. He shifted his gaze from the rift in the Dark Sea to another direction. Li Ping followed his gaze and sighed with emotion, "This formation is truly wondrous. I consider my formation skills to be extraordinary, but in this darkness, I cannot discern any trace of formation." "That's the effect of the True Immortal's corpse." Mo Rubin bluntly pointed out Li Ping's mistake: "Without the dispersing power of the True Immortal's corpse, you should be able to do it." The Saint Emperor was speechless. "Follow me." Mo Rubin beckoned, then vaguely oriented himself and disappeared into the darkness like a black line. Li Ping followed closely. As they got closer to the core of the so-called Dark Sea, Li Ping inexplicably felt a sense of unease. Vague images even flashed through his mind. Among them, Mo Rubin's empty shell lay quietly in this Dark Sea. "Wait!" A shiver ran down Li Ping's spine, and he called out to Mo Rubin. "Huh?" Although unhappy, Mo Rubin still stopped for the time being. "You better have a real reason. " Li Ping ignored his attitude and pondered for a moment, then said, "What kind of power can instantly kill you?" As if hearing an extremely funny joke, faces flew out from Mo Rubin's body and came before Li Ping, shouting loudly. "Instantly kill me? As long as the Demonic Heart is not destroyed and the Immortal Body is not extinguished, as long as one personality remains, I will not truly die!" "Even a True Immortal..." "A True Immortal should be able to do it." Mo Rubin's true body suddenly spoke, and the noisy faces instantly quieted down. "Actually, with Brother Xuanyuan's strength, under a planned ambush, he could also achieve it." Mo Rubin's true body analyzed rationally. "I feel like the formation ahead is a bit off." After hearing Mo Rubin's conclusion, Li Ping directly expressed his worry. Unexpectedly, this time Mo Rubin did not refute. He suddenly said something seemingly irrelevant: "The entire Dark Sea is built on the corpse of a True Immortal." "In our era, it was far less vast than it is now. It seems the Grand Heavenly Venerate bloodline has multiplied well over the years." "Hmm... although it has shrunk a bit recently, it doesn't affect the overall situation." "To gather spirits to ascend, and ascend to gather spirits. In fact, this place can also be seen as the masterless corpse of a True Immortal that has been cultivating for nearly ten thousand years. It's filled with pure True Immortal power." "It's just that... these True Immortal powers were cultivated from the remains of a True Immortal. So theoretically, only that deceased True Immortal can use them." "Theoretically." Mo Rubin repeated these three words. "But there are countless miraculous techniques in the world, who knows if there's a method to break this restriction." The Faceless Saint Emperor gazed into the boundless Dark Sea: "Such immense power, if it could be controlled. It might instantly erupt with power comparable to a True Immortal." "A child carrying a cauldron, and the result will be crushed to death by the cauldron." Mo Rubin shattered Li Ping's fantasy. He continued walking towards the core of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation. "I'm wondering if it's possible that Brother Xuanyuan hid here after being severely injured." "If there is anyone in the Xuanhuang Realm who is most likely to absorb the power of this Dark Sea, it would undoubtedly be him." As if talking to himself, or explaining to Li Ping why he insisted on going there despite the danger. "It's fine, with me by your side, the two of us working together, even if we encounter danger, escaping will not be a problem." Li Ping said frankly, following closely behind. "What an idiot. So I say, good people die quickly." Mo Rubin ridiculed Li Ping's good intentions as if he didn't appreciate them. Li Ping's attention was focused on his surroundings. The darkness gathered here, becoming thicker and thicker. Knowing that this darkness was the power of a True Immortal's corpse, Li Ping felt a completely different sensation than before while being within it. However, what surprised him was that Cat Treasure, who was usually very greedy for immortal-grade energy, seemed to not sense such immense power at all. It was still sleeping soundly on his shoulder. It hadn't even opened its eyes. "Interesting." Li Ping increased his vigilance in his heart. Not long after, Mo Rubin stopped. "It should be here." He looked around and said. "Should be?" Li Ping was a little confused. Such indecisive words should not have come from Mo Rubin, a Dharma King of the Xuan Tian Sect. "Someone has been here before. And modified the formation." Mo Rubin's tone became unprecedentedly solemn. Li Ping also heard a hint of anticipation and excitement in it. However, after looking around, he looked back at Li Ping. "This formation is a bit complex." The implication was that he needed the Saint Emperor's help. Li Ping shook his head slightly: "The power of the True Immortal's corpse permeates everywhere, I cannot sense any trace of the formation." Mo Rubin snorted: "Watch this!" A shadow face instantly flew out from him and towards Li Ping. Li Ping felt no malice, so he did not dodge. This shadow demonic face of Mo Rubin moved maliciously and attached itself to Li Ping's blank face. Before he could express his displeasure, Li Ping was attracted by the spectacular scene that suddenly lit up before him. The dark and silent Dark Sea suddenly shed its mysterious veil. Revealing its true appearance. Like thick clouds accumulated in the sky, evolving into different forms. The dark power gathered piece by piece. Li Ping and Mo Rubin seemed to be in the sky, in a kingdom of clouds. The aggregates of dark power moved slowly yet very quickly. As they approached each other, they swallowed one another and transformed into new shapes. And in the very center of this Dark Sea, the oldest dark clouds that had been settling for tens of thousands of years emitted an aura that made Li Ping's heart tremble. These ancient aggregates were like terrifying ancient beasts, quietly residing in the depths of the Dark Sea. "As expected of the power of a True Immortal. The energy contained in each of these cloud clusters, if unleashed, would far exceed the full power attack of a Lifespan realm cultivator." "What greatness!" Li Ping exclaimed in admiration. Li Ping also noticed that the Myriad Immortals Alliance's device for drawing power from the Dark Sea was actually absorbing the scattered clouds floating in various parts of the Dark Sea. Moreover, the Myriad Immortals Alliance seemed to be able to distinguish between the sizes of the clouds, not daring to provoke the larger aggregates. Their targets were mostly small, scattered individuals. "Now you can see it clearly, right?" Mo Rubin's voice interrupted Li Ping's thoughts. Li Ping snapped back to his senses and looked around again. Indeed, traces of formations were found around these aggregates. However, before he could start deciphering them, Li Ping asked a question. "The Great Ascension Star Crossing Formation, in my previous deductions, was composed of four sub-formations." "The golden chain used to lock onto and capture cultivation worlds outside the Star Sea; the Eye of the Sky Beast acting as an observation post; the Dark Sea used to escape the suction of the Immortal Ruins, which is the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation. What is the last one?" Using Mo Rubin's demonic face, Li Ping stared intently at Mo Rubin's true form. Mo Rubin shrugged: "How would I know? The Grand Ascension Formation was almost entirely built by Brother Xuanyuan himself. We only had the chance to closely examine it after he completed its construction. Different Dharma Kings were responsible for different areas. I'm just somewhat familiar with this place." Li Ping found no flaws in Mo Rubin's words. However, he did not easily believe him. Putting aside this issue for now, Li Ping focused on analyzing the formation here. After all, he truly wanted to meet the legendary Xuan Tianwang himself. "The formation is old, and its style differs from those passed down in the Xuanhuang Realm." "It seems there are traces of it being activated. Did a battle occur here?" "It can only be considered an anomaly. It's not particularly complex, not even close to the threshold of immortal-grade formations." Li Ping concluded after observing for a while. "Will casting spells here cause the dark power to riot?" Li Ping asked Mo Rubin cautiously before breaking the formation. Mo Rubin, as expected, sneered: "Are you already at the True Immortal realm? Don't worry about these trivialities." "If you could cause the True Immortal power here to riot, the first thing I would do is run away immediately." With Mo Rubin's assurance, Li Ping had no more reservations. Hidden formation patterns were arranged before his eyes, interlocking and decomposing. In a short time, Li Ping found the flaw in this formation. "Go this way." Leading the way, without triggering the formation's counteraction. "So smooth, you actually have some skill." Mo Rubin also rarely praised him. The scene within the formation seemed no different from before entering. However, from Mo Rubin's expression, they had not taken a wrong turn. "This is the original core formation of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation." Following Mo Rubin's words, Li Ping scanned his surroundings. The ancient aggregates of dark power from the outside were absorbed here. They turned into wisps of blue smoke and disappeared. "No remnant True Immortal power, the essence of the energy is deeper within the formation." Li Ping mused. "The power section of the Ascension Formation, once sealed, cannot be re-entered. But the main control area is not sealed." "Be careful." Mo Rubin skillfully continued to move deeper inside. Li Ping, however, walked slowly while observing his surroundings, committing all the details of the formation to memory. Although only a small part of the formation was exposed, with his current formation level, he could infer the origin of the formation by observing a small part. "Interesting, there are traces of battle." Mo Rubin, who was leading the way, suddenly stopped. He looked at a corner of the formation. Li Ping also discerned a sword light from the slightly damaged traces of the formation. "Lifespan Realm." Li Ping judged, immediately becoming vigilant. "And not a weak Lifespan Realm." Mo Rubin added. Saying this, he quickened his pace and continued inward. From a visual perspective, their positions seemed unchanged. The ancient aggregates above, below, and all around remained still relative to them. But Li Ping could clearly feel that even with the boost from Mo Rubin's demonic face, the surrounding environment was becoming darker. "Depths of the Dark Sea." The familiar, all-encompassing darkness returned, making it more suffocating than the outer darkness. Li Ping even felt that the operation of his cultivation was being hindered, and even Origin Force Essence could not escape it. When the darkness swallowed the last trace of light, and Li Ping could only sense the surrounding scene with the help of Mo Rubin's demonic face, he suddenly felt Mo Rubin stop his actions. A cold aura was faintly transmitted. Li Ping slowly approached and discovered the reason for Mo Rubin's stillness. Not far ahead, a skeleton lay quietly. Or perhaps, a hollow shell would be a more appropriate description. I don't know how long it has been dead, but its appearance is still lifelike, and the look of horror and disbelief on its face before death can be clearly seen. And although its body seemed full, it was actually empty inside. Nothing remained. "Lifespan Realm." Mo Rubin communicated with Li Ping through the attached demonic face. "And the clothes on him look a bit familiar." Mo Rubin suddenly felt a surge of killing intent. "Dao Sect's Fang Dingge." After observing carefully for a while, Li Ping identified the person from the records of the Creation Stone Tablet. "So it's here." Li Ping suddenly realized. At the same time, his vigilance rose to an unprecedented level. "Who is it?" Mo Rubin asked concisely. "The Sect Master of the Great Dao Sect during the great calamity thousands of years after your era." "In pursuit of the Law Transmitter, the creator of the current Myriad Immortals Alliance, six Lifespan Realm cultivators attacked together, but their whereabouts and lives are unknown. The Law Transmitter, however, survived." "At that time, the Law Transmitter was only at the Harmonious Dao realm." Li Ping simply explained the cause and effect to Mo Rubin. "Six Lifespan Realm cultivators died here?" Mo Rubin was no longer calm. He retreated slightly, his expression solemn. "I hope it's not what I'm guessing." After a long while, Mo Rubin murmured. "The Law Transmitter used the power of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation to kill those six Lifespan realm cultivators?" Li Ping asked. "If that's the case, it would be the best outcome." Mo Rubin's voice was faint. "I only fear that the True Immortal's remains will revive."

Chapter 1278: Destroying the World to Survive

"I only fear that the True Immortal's remains might awaken."

As Mo Ru Bin spoke these words, Li Ping felt, whether it was his imagination or not, that the depths of the dark sea seemed to grow colder. It was as if some unknown entity had suddenly fixated on him, and a chill coursed through him. The Saint Emperor surveyed his surroundings with great solemnity but found no lurking presence. His gaze returned to the husk of Fang Ding Ge, the sect leader of the Great Dao Sect, and Li Ping asked, "It has already become this way, can it still be revived?" Li Ping was naturally not asking about Fang Ding Ge, but about the True Immortal whose celestial body had transformed into the vast dark sea, and whose consciousness turned into the Immortal Extermination Realm.

Mo Ru Bin also studied the corpse not far away and said softly, "Let me tell you a story."

"Our Nine Refinements Sect once enshrined an ancestor's stone statue, which was said to have been personally crafted by the Nine Refinements Ancestor, the Venerable Wonderful Law, for himself. This statue has been worshipped for thousands of years, and whenever disciples of our sect had doubts on their cultivation path, as long as they prayed to it with sincerity, they would most often receive a response from the netherworld. Thus, the incense has never ceased through the years.

Then one day, tribulation clouds suddenly shrouded the sky above the Nine Refinements Sect, and streaks of divine lightning struck down, targeting the ancestor's stone statue! A figure, breaking through the stone statue, soared straight into the heavens! This person's strength was terrifying; the nine heavens divine lightning, capable of instantly destroying cultivators at the Harmonious Dao realm, could not harm him. He laughed unceasingly amidst the lightning, on the verge of withstanding the Heavenly Tribulation and ascending..."

Li Ping frowned again, "And who was the figure within the stone statue?"

The scene before him suddenly changed, and the towering observation deck seemed to be rapidly descending.
