"Look at this dark sea, and you can imagine how powerful the 'Immortal' was in life. To put it bluntly, do not try to fathom the methods of an 'Immortal' with our mortal cultivators' eyes. The difference is truly worlds apart!"

Mo Ru Bin let out a cold laugh, "You'll understand when you see it."

After hearing this rather mystical story, Li Ping couldn't help but frown slightly.

Boom!

The surrounding scenery changed, as if they had left the dark sea and arrived in a completely new, unknown place.

Mo Ru Bin asked, "Guess, between these two who ascended together, who is our Nine Refinements Sect's ancestor?"

The scene of the dark sea below rapidly approached and magnified.

"Are we still going to proceed further? Fang Ding Ge's tragic death is not something an ordinary cultivator could accomplish," Li Ping changed the subject.

"The Venerable Wonderful Law ascended to immortality merely a year ago, and hardly possessed deep foundations. Yet, he could be reborn through the stone statue. Not to mention that True Immortal."

Mo Ru Bin chuckled, "He was the third-generation sect master of our Nine Refinements Sect. This person defied the ancestor's dying instructions and wanted to establish his own rules. After a period of internal strife, he failed and was heavily injured, disappearing thereafter. Who would have thought he had been hiding within the ancestor's stone statue all along, cultivating all the way to the ascension realm!"

After waiting for a long time and receiving no urging from the Saint Emperor, he could only suppress his breath and continue to speak, "The fragmented pieces of the ancestor's stone statue that had scattered on the ground actually gathered together silently. They approached the person undergoing tribulation. Taking advantage of his unpreparedness, he was swallowed back into the stone statue!"

Mo Ru Bin's voice echoed in his mind. Li Ping felt somewhat at ease and surveyed his surroundings.

As Mo Ru Bin reached a critical juncture, he paused again.

The control center, while located at the deepest part of the dark sea, appeared like a transparent observation deck.

He felt that there were still inaccuracies in Mo Ru Bin's account of the Venerable Wonderful Law's rebirth through the stone statue, and the connection between the third-generation sect master of the Nine Refinements Sect.

Mo Ru Bin smiled slightly, "You are wrong!"

Under the combined efforts of Li Ping and Mo Ru Bin, after considerable effort, they finally reached the control center of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Array.

"I have good news and bad news. Which do you want to hear first," Mo Ru Bin asked.

"The Nine Refinements Sect's ancestor, the Venerable Wonderful Law, ascended to immortality before countless witnesses, as clearly recorded. However, only the successive sect masters of the Nine Refinements Sect know that the Venerable Wonderful Law died for unknown reasons in his second year after entering the Immortal Realm!"

Li Ping pondered for a moment and replied, "The figure within the stone statue had to face the tribulation of ascension. It should be him, right? He couldn't ascend in life, so he used the stone statue as a medium, worshipped by his disciples, accumulating millennia of power, aiming to ascend..."

"Now, no matter how that figure struggled, it could no longer escape the confines of the stone statue. And the stone statue, along with that figure, soared through the void!"

Passing through three stages of formation, some belonging to the Spirit Gathering Ascension Array, and others set up by later arrivals.

"Let's go in and take a look first. If the True Immortal has truly not been reborn, after so many years, he certainly wouldn't still be in the same spot," Mo Ru Bin said, bypassing Fang Ding Ge's remains and continuing to descend into the darkness.

Mo Ru Bin continued with satisfaction, "However, the stone statue he personally crafted holds a backup plan. Even if his soul were annihilated in the Upper Realm, he could still be reborn through this stone statue!"

Through this panoramic view, like fully transparent glass formations encircling them, Li Ping and Mo Ru Bin could see the entire dark sea.

Suddenly flooding their vision, reaching directly into the depths of their souls.

"The good news is that the fallen True Immortal did not get reborn using his remains," Mo Ru Bin's voice was melancholic.

Along the way, they did not find the corpses of the other four fallen Longevity realm cultivators.

His expression slightly changed.

But after all, this was an ancient secret. It was not the time to delve deeply into such matters while in this dangerous place.

"Yet, it was all in vain, serving as a stepping stone for someone else."

Li Ping remained silent.

"And the bad news?"

Perhaps because they had communicated with each other for some time, Mo Ru Bin's emotions had stabilized considerably. He spoke with feeling.

Li Ping was stunned.

After a moment of silence, Li Ping finally responded, "Let's hear the good news first."

Li Ping walked slowly to where Mo Ru Bin stood.

Even after being magnified countless times, it was still possible to discern the human-like outline of the dark sea.

"Don't move."

Mo Ru Bin had clearly been here before and was not distracted by the magnificent scene. He walked to the center of the observation deck.

He saw the corpses of the other four fallen Longevity realm cultivators.

They were frozen in their final moments, but unlike Fang Ding Ge, their faces were covered in a gray sheen, and their features were indistinguishable.

Only a vague impression remained of their desperate struggle against the terrifying force that was devouring them.

Li Ping tried to find the culprit responsible for the demise of these five Longevity realm cultivators.

Gray vine-like matter, extending from beneath the feet of the four Longevity cultivators and entwining together, attracted Li Ping's attention.

In Li Ping's observation, these gray vines were purely aggregates of energy, devoid of life force, mere dead things.

But for some reason, when he was close to them, Li Ping felt as if he were being targeted by a venomous snake.

"What is this?" Li Ping, without any psychological barriers, asked.

"This is the 'Will to Survive'. The True Immortal's remains' Will to Survive."

After a considerable pause, Mo Ru Bin slowly answered Li Ping's question.

"True Immortals cannot be judged by ordinary standards. When Brother Xuanyuan was modifying the True Immortal's remains back then, he had this concern. To prevent its resurrection, he made many arrangements. Who would have thought..."

Although Li Ping could not see Mo Ru Bin's figure, he could sense him staring intently at the gray 'Will to Survive' covering the area.

"Normally speaking, the True Immortal's remains, already transformed into this dark sea, should not be able to generate such a strong Will to Survive."

Hearing Mo Ru Bin's words, Li Ping pondered, "Unless someone deliberately provoked it."

"Precisely. This person is no simple feat," Mo Ru Bin commented.

"First, he was able to circumvent Brother Xuanyuan's imposed restrictions, which is not simple. Second, he could incite the True Immortal's remains' consciousness, which is also not simple. Third, after inciting the Will to Survive, he was able to retreat completely... Remarkable," Mo Ru Bin praised without any trace of admiration in his tone.

"Don't underestimate these things. Even if you and I were to be targeted by them inadvertently, we might not be able to escape death. We would only end up like these five empty husks."

Li Ping frowned slightly, he still had some confidence in his own strength.

Mo Ru Bin did not argue with Li Ping, but continued to explain in a hushed voice, "A person who has already died, yet their Will to Survive is reignited. It's like grasping the last straw of hope, and the power that erupts suddenly..."

"Instinctively devours everything living it can come into contact with, converting it into sustenance for its own rebirth. Only someone of Brother Xuanyuan's caliber could barely resist. Although we appear strong, we are still far from it."

Li Ping fell silent.

Mo Ru Bin continued, "Fortunately, the one who incited this back then did not destroy Brother Xuanyuan's arrangements. This 'Will to Survive', after draining these four Longevity cultivators, could no longer find any objects to absorb and thus fell into a silent state again."

"If it had escaped the dark sea..."

"The entire Xuanhuang Realm would probably have become its meal."

Li Ping's expression immediately became extremely solemn.

"But, to put it another way, Brother Xuanyuan's methods are not so easily broken. The one who incited this, whom you referred to as the transmitter of the law, did not directly destroy the restrictions of the dark sea. He did not even alter them, but added his own methods."

"However... possessing the array control artifact and being fully aware of the restrictions here, making progress with ease." Mo Ru Bin seemed to realize something, and his condensed aura suddenly became unstable.

"Let's get to work first." Just as Li Ping was worried that Mo Ru Bin would become hysterical and uncontrollable, Mo Ru Bin instantly calmed down.

He transmitted a large amount of information into Li Ping's mind.

"This is... the Spirit Gathering Ascension Array?" Li Ping recognized the mystery within at a glance.

"Strictly speaking, it's the Spirit Gathering Ascension Array modified by Brother Xuanyuan. The original version of the Ascension Array was created by a great demonic cultivator. Heh heh, this one was a true peerless ferocious demon. He was born from humble beginnings, and his own cultivation talent was insufficient, reaching the Golden Core stage was his limit. Yet, he managed to create this terrifying array. Once the array covered an area, everything within it would be refined into the purest energy."

"He first started with mortal worlds, from weak to strong, exterminating countless beings in countless worlds before finally ascending to the Immortal Realm. After arriving in the Immortal Realm, the first thing he did was to improve the array, still thinking of repeating his actions in the Immortal Realm. Humph, even such a person, during the calamity of the Immortal Realm, died like a fly, instantly. All his life's accumulated treasures went to Brother Xuanyuan. However, Brother Xuanyuan found his inheritance to be very distasteful..." Mo Ru Bin sneered.

"Such a wrathful and ferocious being could also attain Dao and ascend? Was the Heavenly Tribulation in his world different from that of the Xuanhuang Realm?" Li Ping frowned and asked. In Li Ping's memory, in the Xuanhuang Realm, the Heavenly Tribulation faced by such malevolent cultivators during their tribulation was dozens of times more difficult than usual. It was almost impossible to successfully overcome the tribulation, hence his question.

"No matter how strong the Heavenly Tribulation is, it has its limits in the lower realms. As long as it is stronger than it, that's enough. Moreover, good and evil are not absolute..."

Li Ping could clearly feel that as Mo Ru Bin spoke, he was falling into a state of confusion again.

"What do you need me to do?" Li Ping, at the opportune moment, diverted Mo Ru Bin's attention.

"Your formation mastery should not be much weaker than Brother Xuanyuan's. The control center of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Array here cannot be moved rashly. If possible, reinforce it with another layer of formations, and push this place further into the depths of the dark sea. Then, sever the connection between the Myriad Immortals Alliance's control artifact and the grand array." Mo Ru Bin said after regaining his composure.

Li Ping nodded, observing the details of the surrounding formations while comparing them with the ascension array diagrams appearing in his mind.

"As expected of Xuan Tianwang, truly the most astonishing genius of the Xuanhuang Realm in ten thousand years."

As fellow formation masters, Li Ping felt a sense of camaraderie upon perceiving the exquisiteness of this array.

The essence of Origin Force, prayed for by the Abyssal race, after being absorbed and transformed by the dark sea (the True Immortal's remains), condensed in the depths of the array.

It appeared to be an accumulation without order, but Li Ping vaguely sensed that through some means, this power, capable of contending with a True Immortal, could be unleashed instantly.

To push the Xuanhuang Realm, escaping the control of the True Immortal from the Fallen Immortal Realm.

"Using mortal formations to manipulate True Immortal power, remarkable."

Li Ping did not find the shadow of the Xuanhuang Realm's original grand array within the formations of the dark sea. This array was likely created solely by Xuan Tianwang. Even the fallen True Immortal attested to Xuan Yuanhong's transcendent formation attainments.

"Reinforcing the array requires some supplementary materials..." Li Ping mused after observing for a while.

"I have them here," Mo Ru Bin said immediately.

As if prepared long ago, by the time they returned from the hiding place of the 'Will to Survive' to the formation center, he had already taken out a pile of materials.

Li Ping quickly counted them – all were necessary for reinforcing formations.

"Don't look at me like that. Your face is also borrowed from me." "As the Dharma King of the Xuan Heaven Sect, it's normal for me to carry resources for a comeback even while fleeing for my life, right?"

"Speaking of which, why are you also faceless? Could it be that you have something to do with that True Immortal who saved Brother Xuanyuan back then? I'm timid, don't scare me..."

Li Ping ignored Mo Ru Bin's nonsensical rambling and began to focus on setting up the formation.

With Xuan Tianwang's precedent as a reference, Li Ping only needed to follow suit. It was not a difficult task for him.

As the formation gradually took shape, the "observation deck" they were in also seemed to rise higher and higher.

Mo Ru Bin nodded with great satisfaction. After Li Ping finished, he took out another pile of materials.

"Deepen it further. Completely suppress the True Immortal's 'Will to Survive' in the depths of the dark sea."

Li Ping agreed with this sentiment. Without complaint, he continued his work.

After the materials were consumed, the view of the dark sea was only half the size it was initially.

"This should be safe enough. Unless someone deliberately disturbs it," Mo Ru Bin stood beside Li Ping, looking down at the dark sea, and said softly.

"This concerns the safety of Xuanhuang, so it's best to be cautious. I will set up an additional defensive formation here." This was not asking for Mo Ru Bin's opinion but a notification of a decided course of action.

Mo Ru Bin shrugged, "Suit yourself. So many years have passed, and besides us, no one else has come to this cursed place. Who are you setting up formations to defend against? If that Will to Survive truly breaks free, your formations won't be enough."

Li Ping ignored Mo Ru Bin's sarcasm and very seriously added his strongest sealing formation, achievable with his current capabilities, on top of it.

"Alright, next is to sever the Myriad Immortals Alliance's grasping hand," Mo Ru Bin urged after he finished.

"Currently, the amount of dark energy being extracted is limited. If the dark sea shrinks to a certain extent, perhaps the 'Will to Survive' will sense the vibrant Xuanhuang Realm outside. The scene at that time is truly unimaginable."

When Li Ping was reinforcing the formations here, he had already sensed two intermittent, thin thread-like existences extending from the formation center.

Their destinations were unknown.

"Sever the connection between both control artifacts and the center?" Li Ping looked at Mo Ru Bin.

"The other one, he is probably already dead. So be it," Mo Ru Bin was silent for a moment, then nodded.

Li Ping then proceeded to modify the formation center.

The process went very smoothly. The Spirit Gathering Ascension Array let out a soft hum, and then seemed to restart.

It first dimmed slightly, and then brightened again.

Li Ping stood in the formation center, sensing the opening in the dark sea that had been cut by the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Boom! Boom!

Clouds rolled, stirring up invisible waves. They swept up the dispersed "clouds" within the dark sea, growing larger and larger. By the time they reached the gaping rift, they had already transformed into a colossal tidal wave.

It fiercely struck the Myriad Immortals Alliance's device.

Dozens of diligent Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators, who were supervising the extraction of dark energy, were silently swallowed.

Vanished into thin air.

And amidst the violent tremors, the rift also began to close.

Despite the dramatic upheaval, the Myriad Immortals Alliance did not intend to give up. Within the closing rift, the eye-shaped control artifact reappeared.

The golden abacus rapidly swayed, attempting to salvage the situation.

However, this time, it had no effect whatsoever. They could only watch as the rift in the dark sea sealed itself.

Dust settled.

Li Ping and Mo Ru Bin both watched this scene, speechless.

Although it took some effort, they finally achieved their goal of severing the Myriad Immortals Alliance's extraction of dark energy. Furthermore, they learned many secrets of the ancient Xuan Heaven Sect.

Li Ping felt a sense of tranquility in his heart. He felt that his connection with the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao was becoming increasingly close.

However, he also understood clearly that such an easy manipulation of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Array's power was not solely due to his profound formation attainments. It was largely thanks to Mo Ru Bin's help.

Without the array diagrams he transmitted, it would not have been possible to decipher Xuan Tianwang's forbidden techniques in a short period.

More critically, Mo Ru Bin's separated and attached demonic face on his own.

It was precisely because of this face that he could move unimpeded in the deepest part of the dark sea. Even when altering the critical structures of the array, he did not suffer attacks or backlash from the grand array.

In a sense, Mo Ru Bin's face held a higher authority than the two eye-shaped control artifacts.

"Back then, among the Twelve Dharma Kings of the Xuan Heaven Sect, what was your rank in terms of strength?" Li Ping suddenly asked.

Mo Ru Bin was stunned.

Then he let out a mocking laugh, "To be honest, among the twelve, my strength was considered the weakest. Although you can barely defeat me, you wouldn't be able to defeat the others."

Li Ping naturally did not believe him.

Mo Ru Bin let out a cold snort, "In our era, talented individuals emerged in large numbers. Peerless heavenly prodigies were like schools of fish, countless. It was an undisputed era of cultivation!"

"If the immortal path hadn't suddenly been severed, and a large number of ascenders had appeared densely in a short period, it wouldn't have been impossible."

Li Ping fell silent.

According to the records on the Creation Stone Tablet, all information related to those who ascended to immortality had been erased, so he could not verify the truthfulness of Mo Ru Bin's words. However, judging from the various performances of the Twelve Dharma Kings before joining the Xuan Heaven Sect, Mo Ru Bin's words might be exaggerated, but they were consistent with certain facts.

"If all of you were so strong, how did the Ten Immortal Sects win back then?"

"Even without Xuan Tianwang, with the twelve of you united, the Ten Immortal Sects would still have been difficult to defeat, right?" Li Ping asked the question that had been weighing on his mind for a long time.

"Hmph." Mo Ru Bin let out a cold snort.

After a long silence, he finally spoke somewhat vaguely, "In short, we lost, and we lost. I won't deny it. Those people from the Ten Immortal Sects were not just eating dry rice either."

"And..."

Mo Ru Bin's tone suddenly turned extremely cold.

"Someone feigned a fight to the death and suddenly defected. We didn't know who the traitor was, so we couldn't trust anyone. Coupled with Brother Xuanyuan's inexplicable disappearance..."

"Each of them believed their talent was no less than that of Xuan Yuanhong, merely unfortunate in not ascending at the right time. When the real crisis arrived, they realized that without Brother Xuanyuan leading them, they were just a mob."

"Conversely, the Ten Immortal Sects fought desperately, because they knew that if they failed, death awaited them."

"..."

Mo Ru Bin suddenly burst into laughter, "But I have let it go now. As they say, the Heavenly Dao is fair. The Ten Immortal Sects were also annihilated by this... Myriad Immortals Alliance, weren't they? Hahahaha! Well deserved!"

"Well done, Xuanhuang Realm!"

Mo Ru Bin patted Li Ping's shoulder and praised him.

"Actually, the core figures of the Ten Immortal Sects are probably all still alive." Li Ping suddenly said.

"They are merely living in seclusion and not showing themselves to the world."

Mo Ru Bin's hand gripping Li Ping's shoulder suddenly tightened with force.

"Hmph, hmm hmm..." Upon suddenly hearing this news, Mo Ru Bin not only didn't rage but instead began to laugh more and more wildly.

"So they are not dead? Even better."

"This way, I can personally take revenge. So many years have passed, they should no longer be as united as they were back then."

Mo Ru Bin flashed away from Li Ping's side, his figure suddenly darkening considerably.

"It's time to go."

"I originally planned to find Brother Xuanyuan, but by chance, I ended up here first. But it's fine, at least one wrong answer has been eliminated."

Li Ping felt that the demonic face on his blank face was showing signs of detachment.

The darkness surrounding them began to encroach irrepressibly.

Whispers from the depths of his soul arose, corroding Li Ping's consciousness.

Knowing that this was not a place to linger, Li Ping followed Mo Ru Bin and returned from the deepest part of the dark sea.

"Speaking of which, where was your original destination? It required the use of that Immortal Artifact banner?" Li Ping asked.

Mo Ru Bin remained silent.

Passing by the ethereal corpse of Fang Ding Ge, the sect leader of the Great Dao Sect, he suddenly said to Li Ping, "Go and search him. Perhaps you can pick up some treasures."

Li Ping stared at Mo Ru Bin.

Mo Ru Bin rolled his eyes at Li Ping, "This person could withstand the devouring of the Will to Survive and only died after escaping all the way here, which is enough to prove his strength. High-level experts' bodies must contain good things. This is something Brother Xuanyuan taught me."

"Moreover, if he truly had any relics that could survive the erosion of the True Immortal's Will to Survive, they must be extraordinary treasures. Aren't you going to try?" Mo Ru Bin tempted him.

Li Ping looked again, and finally shook his head slightly.

"The deceased deserves peace. There are so many treasures in the world, should we plunder them all? Greed leads to downfall."

"Calling you stupid, and you really are stupid," Mo Ru Bin sneered.

However, he did not search Fang Ding Ge's corpse either, and simply let it lie there quietly.

After a period of travel, the two returned to where they had come from.

The White Jade flag pole was still planted there.

However, eroded by the dark energy, the range of its emitted light had shrunk by a full circle compared to before.

"As expected of a second-hand item that was reforged, truly worthless," Mo Ru Bin criticized without politeness.

"With your disruption, I'll have to go find other arrangements left behind from back then. I don't know if they are still there after so many years. If not, I'll come back to trouble you!" Mo Ru Bin said coldly, looking at Li Ping.

Li Ping summoned the Abyssal people and reopened the portal to the outside world.

"I can help you search for Xuan Tianwang."

"I need his help," Li Ping said very sincerely.

Mo Ru Bin flew into the passage first, laughing heartily, "Do you really think that after a trip to the dark sea with me, I would completely trust you?"

"Back then, the other eleven brothers and sisters, didn't we all go through life and death together?"

"Facts tell me that no one can be fully trusted!"

Mo Ru Bin's icy voice gradually softened.

By the time Li Ping returned to Nine Mountain Prefecture, Mo Ru Bin's trace was nowhere to be found.

However, the Saint Emperor did not pursue him further.

This Dharma King of the Xuan Heaven Sect was not his enemy.

Chapter 1279: Ants Who Harmonize With The Way Die

Regardless of Mo Ru Bin's character or that of the Xuan Heaven Sect cultivators, they were ultimately beings born from the Xuanhuang Realm.

The primary conflict in the Xuanhuang Realm now was the dispute over sovereignty between the indigenous Xuanhuang Realm cultivators and those from other cultivation worlds absorbed due to various reasons since the great calamity of the Immortal Realm. The key to resolving this conflict lay with the two individuals, the Law Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician.

"As for Mo Ru Bin, he might even offer assistance at a critical moment. As for Xuan Tianwang..."

From the current clues, Xuan Tianwang, Xuan Yuanhong, and Li Ping shared the same objective: to save the Xuanhuang Realm from peril. If Xuan Tianwang was truly not dead, Li Ping would not object to returning the position of Xuanhuang Heavenly Venerate to him.

This journey with Mo Ru Bin was undoubtedly highly rewarding for Li Ping. Besides unexpectedly mastering an Immortal-grade formation, the Gathering of Spirits for Ascension Formation, he had more importantly severed the Myriad Immortals Alliance's clandestine operations for extracting power from the Abyssal Sea. Without the control artifact, the Myriad Immortals Alliance, with its current overt strength, would be absolutely incapable of manipulating the Abyssal Sea again. Although the Myriad Immortals Alliance's purpose for stealing Abyssal power was unclear, this plan was undoubtedly crippled by disrupting it.

As for deepening his connection with the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, it now seemed like a trivial advancement for Li Ping.

Upon returning to the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, Li Ping first went to the treasury. He instructed Cat Treasure to replicate every treasure using the original body of the Skybinding Ring, ensuring three copies of each item were preserved.

"Although the efficacy of the Ascension Formation will be greatly reduced due to missing materials, it should not be difficult to eventually condense a power equivalent to that of Origin Essence." Thus, Li Fan was privy to their entire operation.

This formation shared similarities with the myriad beings' spiritual refinement formation. Modified by Xuan Tianwang, its bloody and malevolent aura was significantly reduced. Li Ping did not reject it.

"Even if it's an exaggeration, the strength of the Dharma Kings is indeed terrifying. After all, they have the heritage of the Immortal Realm as their foundation." Li Ping believed that on this matter, the Law Transmitter would reach a consensus with him. After all, after patching things up for thousands of years, the Law Transmitter would certainly not wish to see the Xuanhuang Realm destroyed.

"Not only that, with this great formation, we no longer need to rely too much on the Abyssal race." Let them fight over who the orthodox Xuanhuang lineage is. The problem was whether the Xuanhuang Realm could survive at all.

"Perhaps it can solve the problem of insufficient Origin Essence." The connection between the Saint Emperor's clone and Li Fan's true body became close again. He would discuss it in the next life.

The Saint Emperor returned to his throne and sat in contemplation.

"It can delay the Faceless True Immortal's actions by a full three times!" Whereas the myriad beings' spiritual refinement could merge consciousnesses, condensing energy capable of resisting True Immortals.

"Gathering spirits for ascension is powerful, but the efficiency of extracting energy is too low. Completely refining a realm into nothingness only adds a little immortal power. But if it is integrated into the myriad beings' spiritual refinement formation..." In reality, someone had already moved ahead and deduced the envisioned formation.

"The Supreme Sect's highest cultivation technique, the Supreme Primordial True Scripture, was forcefully borrowed by him. The Ten Sects' collections must have also fallen into the Law Transmitter's hands. Not to mention the Profound Heaven Mirror, a powerful artifact that even the Ten Sects couldn't find, and which he now controls. The Law Transmitter's strength surpasses that of the Xuan Heaven Sect's Dharma Kings." As for the entangled grievances with Mo Ru Bin, if the two were combined...

Beneath the dark sea, Li Ping constantly faced the threat of annihilation. However, before this, Li Ping focused his attention on the Gathering of Spirits for Ascension Formation. If he were to provoke the Law Transmitter, a battle would inevitably ensue. Li Fan held no ill will towards the Law Transmitter. A question was placed before the Saint Emperor.

Gathering spirits for ascension could extract matter and transform it into transcendent immortal power. Various formation patterns were dissected and merged in his mind. Especially after Mo Ru Bin placed that demonic mask on the Saint Emperor, the images perceived by Li Fan's true body became unprecedentedly clear.

"The future battlefield will surely be in the void outside the Xuanhuang Realm," Li Ping thought to himself. Li Fan's mind rapidly deduced: "If I had used this formation before to sacrifice the beings of a small world..." It was purely a difference in their stances. The Saint Emperor's execution speed was beyond question. As soon as the idea arose, he began deducing on the spot.

"It can be called making the best use of everything! Matter transformed into energy, divine sense merged and sublimated. Wonderful!" The phrase "Mortal world immortal power is harmful and useless," and "Do not become a True Immortal unless absolutely necessary," Li Fan had taken to heart.

"It seems I still have to personally visit the void outside the realm to familiarize myself with the battlefield environment," Li Ping thought. The Saint Emperor's actions and gains in this trip were immense for Li Fan's true body. Not only did the Immortal-grade formation, the Gathering of Spirits for Ascension Formation, personally set up by Xuan Tianwang, provide a large amount of data supplements for the Dissolution Disc, but also the True Immortal's Will to Survive in the depths of the Abyssal Sea and the dark energy condensed over millennia, which Li Fan coveted. Compared to them, who could only live one life, Li Fan had ample time and sufficient trial-and-error costs in the future to assimilate all these hidden treasures. The prerequisite... was to survive successfully.

"Mo Ru Bin, although somewhat repulsive, his words are very reasonable." Confined in the Derivation Law Jade space in this lifetime, he had ample time to digest these gains.

...

The person who could determine the fate of the Xuanhuang Realm had undergone earth-shattering changes in these past few days. However, the common people within the Xuanhuang Realm remained completely unaware. The same was true within the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

The secrecy level of the Abyssal Sea was too high, with only a few Law Transmitters aware of the matter. They were currently gathered, discussing countermeasures.

The most talked-about topic among the Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators now was the interstellar rainbow light messages. More than three months had passed since the rainbow light carrying dozens of Harmonious Dao cultivators from the Myriad Immortals Alliance had left the Xuanhuang Realm. Initially, cultivators worldwide assumed that this group of Harmonious Dao cultivators would disappear without a trace. Unexpectedly, the Myriad Immortals Alliance possessed the means for long-distance communication and periodically released messages from the departing rainbow light!

Originally, the Myriad Immortals Alliance could not achieve this. It was thanks to a beam of sword light communication from the depths of the Star Sea. After analysis, the Immortal Alliance successfully replicated this communication technology and applied it to the departing rainbow light. Because the Immortal Alliance members had the fortune to witness the scenery beyond the Xuanhuang Realm.

"What is all this? Why is it so dark?"

"Is the Myriad Immortals Alliance trying to fool us? This looks no different from ordinary spatial rifts."

"Where is the Xuan Merchant Immortal Boat from the other side of the Star Sea?"

"Fortunately, I didn't choose to go back then, otherwise, I would be bored to death watching this every day!"

"Without reaching the Harmonious Dao, one is not qualified to board that interstellar rainbow light. May I ask your current cultivation level?"

"I have only cultivated for a hundred years and have already reached the Golden Core Dao. Reaching Harmonious Dao should be easy!"

...

For the images released by the Myriad Immortals Alliance for unknown reasons, most cultivators adopted a spectator's attitude, offering their judgments. However, some individuals could discern clues from these fleeting glimpses. Outside the Chizha Abyss, in the Broken Palm Immortal City. Shang Shaojun had repeatedly watched these images of the void outside the realm dozens of times. Besides those publicly released by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, he had also obtained some top-secret versions through certain special channels. Cold sweat beaded on his forehead as Shang Shaojun staggered, withdrawing from his contemplation.

"How do you feel, Young Master?" The one who spoke was Di Yi Jing Lun. He coughed lightly, observing Shang Shaojun with a look of schadenfreude.

"The void outside is perilous. I consider my strength considerable, but if I encountered these calamities, I probably wouldn't be able to escape death," Shang Shaojun said, full of lingering fear.

"It's alright, I'm the same," Di Yi Jing Lun smiled. "That's why I'm increasingly curious about the White-robed Sword Immortal you mentioned." Di Yi Jing Lun's smile faded. "Not only could he traverse the void unharmed, but he could also send back such crucial information from the other side of the Star Sea... Such a peerless prodigy, I've never heard of him before?"

Shang Shaojun also sighed, "It was only after that day that I realized how many extraordinary people there are in the world. I no longer dare to look down upon any hero."

"No, no, you misunderstand me," Di Yi Jing Lun shook his head. "I mean, such a figure appearing completely defies logic." Shang Shaojun was stunned. Di Yi Jing Lun suddenly stood up, lightly fanning himself with his feather fan, and slowly said, "Under the current circumstances where cultivation techniques cannot be mutually practiced, not only are cultivation techniques strictly controlled, but even the resources required for advancement are constantly monitored by us."

"Even if rogue cultivators have heaven-defying luck, their cultivation will be limited to the Nascent Soul stage. To advance further, they would inevitably fall into our Myriad Immortals Alliance's sight before this. However, this White-robed Sword Immortal you mentioned..."

"It's as if he sprung from a rock; no matter how we investigate, we find no trace of him." Shang Shaojun, hearing Di Yi Jing Lun's serious tone, was somewhat dismissive. "How many hidden powers are there in the Xuanhuang Realm? Can the Myriad Immortals Alliance know all of them?"

Di Yi Jing Lun gently fanned himself again, and a light image appeared before the two of them. It was precisely the scene where Li Fan's Saint Embryo had displayed his divine power outside the Chizha Abyss, breaking through the demonic sound.

"Young Master, what do you think of this swordsmanship?" Di Yi Jing Lun asked.

"Exquisite and natural, as if born from the heavens," Shang Shaojun replied without hesitation.

"This sword is the Sword of Xuanhuang." Di Yi Jing Lun imitated the Saint Embryo Li Fan in the image, then a beam of sword light actually flew out from the tip of his feather fan.

"Sword of Xuanhuang..." Shang Shaojun savored the four words. "There are not a few cultivators who practice swordsmanship in the Xuanhuang Realm. Among them, there are also geniuses. So, naturally, one can discern the subtleties of the swordsmanship displayed by this White-robed Sword Immortal."

As the Saint Embryo Li Fan in the image swung his sword, Di Yi Jing Lun also followed suit with his feather fan. Similar miniature sword lights echoed the image.

"Jing Lun, what exactly do you mean?" Shang Shaojun asked, frowning.

"Does Young Master know about the Heaven Overseeing Hall?" Di Yi Jing Lun evaded the question and retorted.

"Of course, I know. The Immortal Alliance, through the Heaven Overseeing Hall, constantly monitors the principles of heaven and earth. Besides observing the essence of heaven and earth, most importantly, it can preemptively sense traces of rebellion against these principles," Shang Shaojun replied quickly.

"But what does this have to do with the Xuanhuang Sword you mentioned?" "This sword is a wonder of heaven, directly pointing to the principles of heaven and earth," Di Yi Jing Lun said solemnly.

Upon hearing this, Shang Shaojun seemed to understand something, and a spark flashed in his eyes. "The anomaly in swordsmanship was also observed by the Heaven Overseeing Hall before, but it lasted for a very short time, less than half a month, and then returned to normal. It did not involve the anomaly of a Heavenly Venerate's rebellion, so the Heaven Overseeing Hall merely reported it as usual, filed it, and sealed it. I also saw this record at the time, but I didn't pay much attention to it. It wasn't until you mentioned this White-robed Sword Immortal that I connected them." Di Yi Jing Lun slowly said.

"Half a month?" Shang Shaojun was somewhat incredulous. At this point, if Shang Shaojun still didn't understand the other party's meaning, he wouldn't be worthy of guarding the Chizha Abyss.

The sword dao had not been completely reversed, indicating that the previous anomaly was a reflection of Harmonious Dao. And the fact that it lasted only half a month from the anomaly to its occurrence indicated that the White-robed Sword Immortal he encountered... was not a strong cultivator who had been Harmonious Dao for a long time. But a lucky individual who had just stepped into that realm. But, was this possible? Realms could be broken through by chance and luck, but the comprehension of swordsmanship, and the ease and fluidity of wielding a sword, required accumulation over time. The image of the Saint Embryo Li Fan traveling with him reappeared in Shang Shaojun's mind.

"Perhaps... this person is a divinely gifted prodigy?" he said uncertainly. Di Yi Jing Lun replied noncommittally, "Perhaps there is such a possibility. But I am more inclined to believe that an outsider infiltrated our Xuanhuang Realm, used the Sword Dao of Heaven's Wonder to break through to the Harmonious Dao realm, and then lured us to the depths of the Star Sea..." Shang Shaojun interrupted Di Yi Jing Lun's words.

"Jing Lun, is this not a bit too absurd?" Di Yi Jing Lun smiled. "It is merely the most reasonable explanation after eliminating all impossibilities."

"This person completely lacks background and appeared abruptly." "After reaching Harmonious Dao, he could completely integrate and comprehend... especially the Sword Dao, one of the most complex among the principles of heaven and earth. If this person truly achieved all this through his own efforts without any foundation, I would call him the most talented person in history, second only to the Law Transmitter." "Moreover, based on your description of him, he easily subdued the morale of the Broken Palm Immortal City with just a few words..." Di Yi Jing Lun let out another cold laugh. Shang Shaojun thought of more.

There were disloyal individuals within the Immortal Alliance. Someone wanting to correct the wrongs. This was the repeated plea. After being guided, he had indeed developed such suspicions and even planned to unite his friends to investigate the truth. But what if that person's intentions were malicious from the start? If he caused internal strife within the Immortal Alliance because of this, and was taken advantage of by others, wouldn't he become a traitor to the Xuanhuang Realm? Thinking of this, Shang Shaojun couldn't help but break out in a cold sweat.

At this time, Di Yi Jing Lun also said, "When you first found me, I was indeed somewhat persuaded. But after some investigation, I found something amiss." "Young Master, you are an important minister of the Immortal Alliance. Every word and deed must be cautious." Shang Shaojun nodded slightly and fell into thought. "Before the truth is understood, do not act rashly. If that person contacts you again, report it immediately. I will handle it." After giving instructions, Di Yi Jing Lun gracefully left the Chizha Abyss shrouded in white mist. It was only after a long time that Shang Shaojun reacted. Originally, he wanted to incite Di Yi Jing Lun to rebel, but unexpectedly, he was so easily swayed by the other party. He was indeed worthy of the name "First."

"Who exactly are you?" Shang Shaojun gazed at the starry sky, and the figure of the white-robed Sword Immortal, like a celestial being, reappeared before his eyes. Setting aside the Xuan Merchant Immortal Boat beyond the Star Sea for now. Let's talk about the departing rainbow light, en route to the Xuan Merchant Immortal Boat. After transmitting the recorded influences of the rainbow light to the Myriad Immortals Alliance, Lan Yu intently scrutinized the path ahead. The surroundings were pitch black, appearing serene. In fact, to his senses, it was fraught with peril, filled with killing intent.

"Brother Lan Yu, we've been out for so long, have we gained anything?" Jin Ri's voice came from behind. Lan Yu had always had a poor impression of this Harmonious Dao cultivator who enjoyed joining in the fun. At this moment, he merely responded indifferently, "It can be considered a small gain." Jin Ri sneered and transmitted his voice, "Brother Lan Yu, you mentioned that here in the Star Sea, we are no longer bound by the power of Heavenly Venerates. Doesn't that make it easier to break through?" "I heard your cultivation technique is the direct lineage of the Great Law Master from the past, possibly from the Immortal Realm. And I saw that you seem to have become younger in a short period..." "Jin Ri, you've crossed the line," Lan Yu said sternly, interrupting Jin Ri. Jin Ri was not embarrassed either. He cupped his hands and smiled as he left.

Lan Yu turned around and continued to monitor the darkness in the direction the rainbow light was advancing. He sighed inwardly. The atmosphere on this flying boat, internally named "Revering the Venerable," was somewhat subtle. The protective rainbow light had been largely depleted when escaping the Immortal Ruins, yet the flying boat continued to speed towards the Star Sea without slowing down. However, in just a few months, three Harmonious Dao cultivators had already died bizarrely. If they died from strange disasters outside the Star Sea, it would be one thing, but crucially, these three Harmonious Dao cultivators had all died inexplicably. Everyone had personally investigated, and no one could figure out the truth behind their sudden deaths. The three corpses still lay in the flying boat, their faces ruddy, as if they were merely asleep. But internally, their entire souls had been hollowed out without them realizing it.

"This is Harmonious Dao," Lan Yu's heart was heavy. Among the three who perished, one named Qing Yan was an old Harmonious Dao cultivator like himself, and his strength was not much inferior to his. Yet, he died so inexplicably. Lan Yu even missed the fallen anomalies in the Xuanhuang Realm. At least, even if they fell, they could understand the cause of death. "However, I heard that before we departed, those anomalies also showed signs of abnormality? What an eventful period." Lan Yu, who had survived since the great calamity, instinctively felt a sense of unusualness. Just as his thoughts were drifting, a shrill scream suddenly awakened him. Lan Yu's expression changed. Realizing something was wrong, he rushed towards the source of the sound. By the time he arrived, four Harmonious Dao cultivators had already gathered around. The focus of their horrified gazes was on another corpse lying on the ground. Lan Yu's pupils constricted, because this time, the deceased was none other than Immortal Venerable Jin Ri, who had been trying to ingratiate himself with him earlier! Looking at Jin Ri's ruddy face and lifeless body, Lan Yu couldn't help but feel a chill run down his spine.

Not long after, the survivors on the flying boat had all assembled. "Old Guan, you should go first." Guan Xing Xiu walked out slowly from the crowd, his expression solemn. After carefully examining Immortal Venerable Jin Ri's corpse, he concluded, "The same method of death." A commotion erupted among the crowd. "Who the hell is it?" "It's too stifling, too stifling! We are all Harmonious Dao cultivators who once shook one side, yet we are being slaughtered and butchered so inexplicably on this small boat!" "We... should we go back? It's not that Old Xu is afraid of death, but if we see the legendary Xuan Immortal Boat and attain enlightenment, then death would be acceptable. What is this now? If we return, won't we lose all face?"

... "Quiet!" Guan Xing Xiu impatiently interrupted the crowd's discussion. "From now on, act together. Do not separate." "It's not a calamity from the void, but someone has attained enlightenment and is committing murder." Guan Xing Xiu's words stirred up a thousand waves. "What did you say?" "Old Guan, are you crazy? Although you are the head of the Garrison Hall and specifically responsible for this area, this is too absurd?" Guan Xing Xiu waved his hand, suppressing the voices of the crowd. "I have my reasons for saying this." Behind Guan Xing Xiu, a small golden sword rose into the air. After circling once, it instantly aimed at the corpse of Jin Ri lying on the ground. A faint black thread was cut off from the corpse by the golden sword. Guan Xing Xiu held the thread, and it seemed to have its own life, struggling frantically.

Lan Yu observed for a moment and said incredvtimidly, "Xing Xiu, are you saying that the murderer easily killed those people with this thread?" Guan Xing Xiu, who had respect for Lan Yu, nodded. "From the looks of it, yes." "If any of you don't believe it, you can try the power of this black thread yourself." "I will!" Sun Lu Chang volunteered. Soon, the experiment ended with him having several holes poked in his body. This was even after the black thread was suppressed by the Golden Falling Star Divine Sword. "How is this possible? Just a thread, how can it be so strong?" Sun Lu Chang said, somewhat dejected. The other Harmonious Dao cultivators also looked incredulous.

Guan Xing Xiu swept his gaze across the crowd and said loudly, "Everyone, I know you all hold important positions and are highly respected in the Immortal Alliance. But don't forget, we are now in the Star Sea!" "I believe everyone can feel that the laws of the Star Sea are far superior to the Xuanhuang Realm. Moreover, without the constraints of Heavenly Venerates, the long-suppressed breakthroughs have finally come, and it is not impossible for realms to advance by leaps and bounds!" Sun Lu Chang said unconvincingly, "But even so, how can the gap be so large? It's one thing to be inferior, but not even being able to struggle or make a sound... If he truly had such power, why wouldn't he just kill us all?" Sun Lu Chang's words were echoed by the crowd.

Lan Yu said at this moment, "Perhaps, it's because this person's cultivation technique is very special. It's not outright power suppression, but the battle takes place within the soul and consciousness, without causing any energy fluctuations." "As for this black thread, it is the medium for launching the attack." Lan Yu was the most senior among them, and his words gradually gained their trust. "Since that's the case, let's follow the thread and find that bastard!" Under the crowd's suggestion, Guan Xing Xiu came into contact with the black thread of each surviving Harmonious Dao cultivator. He found no connection to anyone.

"The murderer is cautious and cunning, and would certainly not leave such an obvious clue. In my opinion, this was intentionally left behind to mislead us," said a Harmonious Dao cultivator named Zi Mu. "It may not be so. He certainly didn't expect Brother Guan's cultivation to advance so rapidly and be able to discover his trace," argued another cultivator. "Brother Guan, how exactly did you attain enlightenment? In this vast dark Star Sea, I feel nothing." "Yes, Old Guan, tell us. Now that a hidden murderer is watching us menacingly, only by each of us attaining enlightenment and increasing our strength can we avoid being defeated one by one." The crowd chattered endlessly. Guan Xing Xiu helplessly recounted his sudden enlightenment.

Chapter 1280: Blue Feather Heavenly Capital Secret

Guan Xing Xiu spoke eloquently on the flying boat. Initially, his words were somewhat hesitant, but as he continued, his conviction grew, as if the principles he spoke of were inherent truths of the Star Sea.

"The laws of the Star Sea can be considered a higher-level replacement for the laws of Xuanhuang. Therefore, the key to our breakthrough is to find the 'Star Sea Path' corresponding to our cultivated Dao within this silent Star Sea. All of you who have achieved the Harmonious Dao undoubtedly possess strong innate qualities. As long as you cast aside your fear of the Star Sea and instead approach it with a bình thường mindset, just as you did in the Xuanhuang Realm, focusing your hearts and sensing, I believe this will not be too difficult."

Guan Xing Xiu then detailed how he sensed his own Star Sea Path. As he spoke with enthusiasm, a voice filled with extreme panic suddenly interrupted him.

It was Zi Mu, one of the survivors. "Old Guan, if... I mean, if the Dao that I cultivate no longer exists in the Star Sea, what should we do?"

Zi Mu stared intently at Guan Xing Xiu. "Does this mean our path forward is severed, and we can no longer progress further?"

Guan Xing Xiu fell silent.

The other Harmonious Dao cultivators present also displayed varied expressions upon hearing this.

Some turned pale, while others felt a sense of relief.

This was because they too had discovered that perhaps due to the cataclysms that had destroyed the Immortal Realm, the laws of the Star Sea were shattered and incomplete.

He knew of Tiandu, the Grand Magus's palace. But what was this Origin Dao Palace?

"You don't even know of the Origin Dao Palace? What kind of bumpkin are you! The source of myriad laws, the head of all Daos. Even the direct disciples of the Ten Immortal Sects would have to queue up obediently here!"

In those prosperous times of the Immortal Dao, the Ten Great Sects stood tall. He was merely one of the countless ordinary cultivators under their rule. His innate talent was mediocre, and he had no great fortuitous encounters. Originally, the Golden Core realm should have been his limit.

After some inquiries, he learned that this so-called "Master Appreciation Ceremony" was a grand event held every hundred years by the Ten Immortal Sects to express their gratitude for the benevolent teachings of the Grand Magus Tiandu. Important figures from the Ten Great Sects would all attend.

Lan Yu himself did not refute this point either.

The reverent and awestruck gazes of others made Wu Fu Qiu even more curious.

Lan Yu was momentarily stunned.

Heading towards the legendary Tiandu.

Instead, the Dao had vanished from the Star Sea.

After repeated deliberation, he ultimately could not shake off the demonic thoughts that lingered in his heart.

"If I am fortunate enough to gain his favor..."

Lan Yu's expression was solemn, but he casually brushed off the crowd. Yet, in his heart, he was truly puzzled.

The crowd reacted differently for a moment.

"Oh! I seem to recall."

"So it seems, among us, who has the highest potential for achievement, it would likely be Brother Lan Yu." A Harmonious Dao cultivator named Qing Shuang suddenly said inexplicably.

It was none other than because among all the Harmonious Dao cultivators present, or even in the entire Xuanhuang Realm, he was the most unique.

A full half a day later, the grand fleet of the Ten Great Sects finally passed, and the aerial passage reopened.

It wasn't that their innate qualities were insufficient to sense their corresponding Star Sea Dao.

"Fellow Daoist, what's happening ahead with such a large commotion?" Wu Fu Qiu looked at the blocked aerial passage and the flying boats, each resembling a city in size, flying overhead, and curiously asked.

"Congratulations in advance, Fellow Daoist Lan!"

"I, Wu Fu Qiu, seem to have truly poor aptitude."

Meanwhile, at the foot of the mountain, countless young cultivators, just like him, filled with a sliver of hope after enduring hardships, had come seeking fortuitous encounters.

Because he had not sensed the Star Sea Dao in the void.

Wu Fu Qiu's heart trembled. At the same time, an unprecedented ambition suddenly arose in his heart.

"I say, Brother Lan Yu, you've been slow to break through. Is it possible you've been overwhelmed by too many choices?"

It was the only Harmonious Dao cultivator of the ancient methods.

But he was refuted without mercy: "If it were below the Harmonious Dao realm, or cultivators from other worlds, perhaps. But we Harmonious Dao cultivators of Xuanhuang have already devoured the essence of heaven and earth, our bodies merging with the laws. Humph, how can changing to another Dao path be easy?"

Wu Fu Qiu became somewhat confused at once.

But Wu Fu Qiu watched the direction the Ten Great Sects departed and was unwilling to leave for a long time.

"Think carefully! Who is the Grand Magus? How can mortals like you easily meet him? If you wish to see the Grand Magus's visage, you must first enter the Origin Dao Palace and pray devoutly. If you can catch the Grand Magus's eye, he will naturally guide you to Tiandu."

"What, you want to go in too? No problem, just pay one thousand high-grade spirit stones, and you can queue up there!"

Wu Fu Qiu, dejected, was squeezed out by the subsequent crowd.

One thousand high-grade spirit stones were enough to buy a decent Nascent Soul cultivation technique. If he had that many spirit stones, why would he travel thousands of miles to seek an opportunity?

Although his purse was meager, Wu Fu Qiu was not going to leave.

Because he discovered that there were many others who, like him, could not afford the money and were unable to go up the mountain.

After spending half a month getting acquainted with them, Wu Fu Qiu obtained an important piece of information.

The so-called Origin Dao Palace was merely built by the Ten Great Sects later on. It had no actual connection to the true Tiandu.

The true Origin Dao land referred to the entire area below Tiandu. It was just that the Ten Great Sects had cordoned off a large portion to build the Origin Dao Palace.

But they hadn't been completely ruthless, leaving this area at the foot of the mountain.

"The Grand Magus hasn't appeared for who knows how many years. Saying it's easier to catch the Grand Magus's eye on the mountain is just to comfort oneself."

"Yes, the Grand Magus hangs high above, in his eyes, what difference is there between the mountain and the foot of the mountain?"

From the words of those huddled on the ground, Wu Fu Qiu also settled down at the foot of the Origin Dao Palace.

He stayed there for a full twenty years.

Some came anew, some left. Some died with regret, others, filled with resentment, cursed the Grand Magus to death and were summarily executed.

Wu Fu Qiu also transformed from a young lad into a middle-aged man.

He didn't know what it was that allowed him to persist in guarding here.

Perhaps for a mediocre talent like him, it didn't matter where he went.

During these years, while guarding, he had not neglected his cultivation. However, without a source of spirit stones, he could only live off his savings. Although the Origin Dao land had dense spiritual energy, it couldn't sustain so many people absorbing it simultaneously.

Not only was there no progress, but there were even signs of regression.

Things had reached this point, and Wu Fu Qiu accepted his fate, no longer harboring any unrealistic fantasies.

Since he was an orphan from childhood, drifting and without support, after staying at the foot of the Origin Dao Palace for over twenty years, he had become accustomed to the scenery. He had subconsciously regarded this place as his homeland.

Every time young people arrived with hope, begging for the Grand Magus's blessings, he would just smile without comment.

As if seeing himself in the past.

However, he didn't shatter the illusions of these young people.

Because anyone who did so was cleared out by the people of the Ten Great Sects.

However, the wonders of the world lie precisely in this.

Just when Wu Fu Qiu had completely put the Grand Magus's blessings out of his mind...

One day, the sky suddenly bloomed with ten thousand feet of colorful auspicious light.

Thousands of cultivators below the Origin Dao Palace were stunned on the spot.

Not knowing who first shouted, "The Grand Magus has manifested!"

Then, in a state of extreme excitement and trepidation, the crowd on the ground knelt down in unison.

Only Wu Fu Qiu, his mind a blank, stood frozen on the spot.

"Bold! How dare you disrespect the Grand Magus!"

A sword light, accompanied by an angry shout, flew from afar.

Just as Wu Fu Qiu was about to be beheaded, a blue feather slowly floated down from the sky.

The white sword light, arriving first. Flying at extreme speed.

The blue feather, falling later. Drifting slowly, abnormally slow.

However, a bizarre scene occurred. Under the eyes of all, this blue feather actually landed on Wu Fu Qiu's body before the white sword light.

The sword light arrived late but did not behead Wu Fu Qiu. It merely passed through him, killing three kneeling cultivators behind him on the spot.

As for Wu Fu Qiu himself...

Under the light of Lan Yu, he uncontrollably began to rise.

Amidst the gasps of the crowd, he ascended higher and higher.

Surpassing the summit of the Origin Dao Palace, flying through the clouds, and in an instant, arriving before a purplish-gold dojo.

Wu Fu Qiu felt as if he were in a dream, standing there for a long time before regaining his senses.

It was different from the sacred Tiandu he had imagined. The place was empty.

Quiet and deathly still.

Only a faint chanting sound came from within.

Wu Fu Qiu cautiously followed the direction of the sound to the deepest part of the dojo.

The purplish-gold wooden building, with its ancient design, exuded a faint fragrance.

Wu Fu Qiu knelt and paid his respects. After a long time without a response, he boldly pushed open the door and entered.

The scene inside the wooden building unfolded before his eyes.

A blurry figure sat cross-legged, muttering incantations.

Behind him stood a young boy in a blue and white robe, eyes closed.

The boy had rosy lips and white teeth, with a delicate face, making it impossible to tell if he was male or female.

However, Lan Yu noticed that this boy seemed to have just fought a battle, as his robe was slightly tattered and had faint traces of blood.

Wu Fu Qiu dared not act presumptuously and bowed his head again.

But neither the figure nor the boy showed any reaction.

"This figure must be the Grand Magus Tiandu."

After a long while, Wu Fu Qiu dared to get up, and mimicking the phantom, he also sat cross-legged.

Carefully listening to the incessant chanting.

Gradually, he seemed to understand something.

The blue feather, which had appeared and then vanished on him earlier, suddenly reappeared in his dantian.

"Feather Transformation Technique..."

"The heavens and earth have infinite epochs, countless worlds are born and perish, like feathers falling in the void."

"Transforming the body into a feather, synchronizing with the world, one can follow the flow of epochs, remain alive through calamities, and achieve eternal transcendence..."

Wu Fu Qiu listened entranced, sometimes frowning, sometimes rejoicing.

This "Myriad Tribulations Feather Transformation Technique" was too profound for a mere Foundation Establishment cultivator like him.

But even glimpsing a corner of it gave him a profound realization, and his cultivation realm within his body surged continuously.

Wu Fu Qiu became immersed in it, losing track of time.

Suddenly, he felt the light and shadow shift before his eyes, startling him awake.

He saw the boy who had been sitting with his eyes closed waving at him.

Although no words were spoken, Wu Fu Qiu understood that he was being asked to leave.

Even with countless regrets, Wu Fu Qiu had no choice but to silently withdraw.

Before leaving the purplish-gold wooden building, he politely closed the door.

As the door closed, a stream of light flew out from within.

Wu Fu Qiu instinctively caught it and found it to be a miniature building shaped like a ring.

"Magic artifact, a training ground."

"It also has storage functions."

After a brief inspection, Wu Fu Qiu's face lit up with joy. He bowed three more times towards the inside and then left Tiandu.

Only then did he realize that after he left the purplish-gold wooden building, he could no longer hear the voice of the sitting phantom.

A sense of loss welled up in his heart, and Wu Fu Qiu even suddenly felt an urge to return.

But after all, he was the Grand Magus of the Ten Immortal Sects; he ultimately dared not act presumptuously and left the Heavenly Capital.

When he returned to the mortal world, he was shocked to find that the Origin Dao Palace at the foot of the mountain had inexplicably disappeared.

Even the surrounding terrain had changed dramatically, as if a great battle had erupted here.

After searching for a long time, Wu Fu Qiu finally found a living cultivator in the vicinity.

From the cultivator's respectful and subservient attitude, Wu Fu Qiu was horrified to realize that he had unknowingly become a top-tier cultivator in the Xuanhuang Realm, a Harmonious Dao realm cultivator!

And several centuries had passed.

The rule of the Ten Immortal Sects was no longer as absolute, and an organization called the Myriad Immortals Alliance had risen.

"Fellow Daoist Lan Yu?"

Guan Xing Xiu's voice pulled Lan Yu from his memories.

"Yes, I was originally a mediocre person who only achieved Harmonious Dao through sheer luck."

"So many years have passed, and the flattery from my disciples and subordinates has almost made me forget this fact."

Lan Yu felt a sense of relief.

"If my innate talent were truly so poor, I wouldn't have only cultivated the dignified 'Myriad Tribulations Feather Transformation Technique' to the Harmonious Dao realm."

"Without the Grand Magus's teachings, after thousands of years, I still haven't made any further progress."

Lan Yu shook his head secretly, his thoughts returning to reality, and looked at Guan Xing Xiu. "I believe your judgment. Since the culprit is hidden among us, as long as we gather together and wait for him to reveal a flaw, it will be enough."

Lan Yu paused, then added, "This person just broke through and eagerly committed murder. If it's not for psychological reasons, it must be because his cultivation technique requires him to blood sacrifice other cultivators after breaking through. He definitely won't stop next."

Everyone present nodded in agreement with his judgment.

For self-preservation, these Harmonious Dao cultivators from the Myriad Immortals Alliance remained in the main hall of the "Revering the Venerable" flying boat, watching each other.

However, the killer's cunning completely surpassed their imagination.

Nine days later, as the flying boat successfully navigated through a surviving calamity in the void, another corpse was found on board.

Lan Yu and Guan Xing Xiu exchanged glances, confirming the demise of "Zi Mu."

The pressure in their hearts immediately increased.

"Old Guan? We were all together just now, right? You have the highest cultivation among us, did you perceive who the devil did it?!"

Facing the expectant gazes of everyone, Guan Xing Xiu could only shake his head helplessly.

The hall erupted in an uproar.

"Everyone, calm down. We were all focused on dealing with the void calamity just now, so we were inadvertently careless and were ambushed by the killer."

"What do we do now? To not evade this calamity is death, but to evade it means being assassinated..."

"Hmph, in my opinion, we don't need to bother hiding from this calamity anymore. At worst, we can all die together!"

"Brother Xu, don't speak in anger. We still have so many people!"

"No, I want to leave this boat!"

As everyone was discussing, a sharp scream suddenly suppressed all other noises.

Lan Yu and the others looked over and saw that Qing Shuang, the Harmonious Dao cultivator who had been relatively calm before, suddenly seemed to have a psychological breakdown.

His expression became demonic, his eyes gleamed with madness.

Muttering to himself, he was about to rush out of the main hall and leave the flying boat.

"Stop him!" Guan Xing Xiu roared.

Only Lan Yu and a few others made a move.

Being inside the flying boat, fearing damage to it, everyone was restrained in their actions.

For a while, they were unable to do anything to the crazed Qing Shuang.

Just as the stalemate was about to be broken, Qing Shuang's actions suddenly stopped.

His expression froze, and he stood there blankly.

Before the others could react, Guan Xing Xiu's expression changed, and he immediately flew forward to check.

"He's dead."

A moment later, he turned back with an extremely grim expression and said.

A chill instantly enveloped everyone.

Compared to the initial murders, the killer's methods seemed to be becoming more skilled.

While dealing with the void calamity could be an excuse, this time it was undeniably happening while everyone was focused and watching.

And yet the killer still acted with impunity...

How could they defend against this?

A deathly silence fell within the flying boat.

"I actually think what Qing Shuang said before was not without reason," Sun Lu Chang said, breaking the silence.

"From the current situation, this killer's strength is growing too rapidly. Perhaps in a while, after killing a few more, he won't need to act stealthily anymore. He'll just appear directly and kill us one by one. Staying on the boat is definitely a dead end. It's better to abandon the ship and seek survival in the void separately."

"That's right. The 'Revering the Venerable' flying boat travels extremely fast. As long as we leave separately at intervals, our relative distances in the Star Sea will be very far apart. The Star Sea is vast; even if he has heaven-defying abilities, he absolutely cannot capture us all!"

"Moreover, this area is still within the suction range of the Immortal Ruins. As long as we follow the direction of the suction, we can return to the Xuanhuang Realm. Coupled with the "Empty Light Flowing Crystal" artifacts distributed by the Immortal Alliance, returning safely is not an issue."

...

With each person speaking their piece, they slowly reached a consensus.

Finally, more than half of them chose to give up and disembark midway.

Guan Xing Xiu looked at Lan Yu, seeking the opinion of this most senior Harmonious Dao cultivator.

Lan Yu sighed softly, "Heaven and earth are vast, and life is paramount. Their choice is understandable."

"To avoid further casualties, let it be decided this way."

"Elder Lan, aren't you leaving?"

Lan Yu shook his head. "My lifespan is nearing its end. Returning would only be waiting for death. It's better to seek a sliver of hope in the void."

Everyone present was greatly shocked upon hearing this. They expressed their blessings and then successively left the flying boat, returning to the Xuanhuang Realm.

Dying ignominiously during the exploration of the Star Sea was perhaps undignified.

But it was still better than losing one's life.

After all the commotion, only five people remained on the flying boat.

Lan Yu, Guan Xing Xiu, Sun Lu Chang, Xu Guan Hai, and Zi Mei.

Guan Xing Xiu looked at Xu Guan Hai with some surprise. "You didn't leave?"

Xu Guan Hai chuckled, "I actually feel that with a large group leaving, it might be safer on the boat now."

"Besides, no matter what, I still want to see that legendary Xuan Merchant Immortal Boat with my own eyes."

Xu Guan Hai looked at Sun Lu Chang. "Brother Sun, you're the odd one out. You were the loudest person demanding to leave when everyone was arguing. Why did you stay?"

Sun Lu Chang looked somewhat embarrassed. "My cultivation is too weak. If I leave the flying boat, I doubt I can return to the Xuanhuang Realm with my own strength. Staying here is actually safer."

Everyone present was rendered speechless.

They could see that what Sun Lu Chang said was indeed true.

Unlike their voluntary decision to stay, Sun Lu Chang was forcibly assigned to the flying boat by the Immortal Alliance. His strength was the weakest among everyone.

Sun Lu Chang moved closer to Guan Xing Xiu and Lan Yu. "Lords, do you think the killer is among us?"

The other four looked at each other, their expressions somewhat subtle.

Until the killer's identity is revealed, no one can be absolutely sure.

"Since everyone has decided to stay, then our original route remains unchanged," Guan Xing Xiu said loudly after a period of silence. "We can shrink the space of the 'Revering the Venerable' flying boat to accelerate the travel time."

"Oh, by the way, Xing Xiu. Why is this flying boat called 'Revering the Venerable'? I always feel like the name is somewhat ominous," Lan Yu asked, frowning, as if remembering something.

Guan Xing Xiu paused slightly, then replied, "I don't know. It was a decree from the Law Transmitters themselves. I can only guess it means 'paying homage to the Heavenly Venerate'."

Upon hearing this, Lan Yu's frown deepened.

He looked up at the flying boat and posed a question that sent chills down the spines of the other four. "Are there any others on the 'Revering the Venerable' flying boat besides us?"

"Shouldn't be... no," Guan Xing Xiu replied somewhat hesitantly.

At this moment, Zi Mei, who had been silent all along, suddenly spoke. "Perhaps? This flying boat... is alive?"

Sun Lu Chang was startled and quickly asked, "Fellow Daoist Zi, what makes you say that?"

Zi Mei spoke softly, "I sensed the Dao of the Star Sea, and I observed the Harmonious Dao cultivators on the flying boat perishing like ants. Thus, I had a breakthrough."

"In my perception, this flying boat..."

"It's like it has its own life."

Zi Mei's words sent shivers down everyone's spines.

Guan Xing Xiu said hesitantly, "If that's true, then the Immortal Alliance must have surely..."

At this point, Guan Xing Xiu abruptly stopped.

The Golden Falling Star Divine Sword above his head erupted with golden light. Guan Xing Xiu gathered all the black threads he had extracted from the assassinated Harmonious Dao cultivators.

Like living worms, the threads merged together, becoming thicker.

He had already allowed everyone present to come into contact with this murder weapon before, and no one had sensed any connection.

But he had overlooked the boat itself.

The last five people on the flying boat exchanged glances and instantly reached a consensus.

The five Harmonious Dao cultivators worked together to trap the black thread in the center.

"Old Guan, go to the flying boat's control center," Xu Guan Hai said in a deep voice.

This sentence seemed to enrage the black thread, which violently slammed against the seal trapping it.

The five Harmonious Dao cultivators worked in unison, locking it firmly.

They moved to the center of the "Revering the Venerable" flying boat.

Guan Xing Xiu took a deep breath and opened the flying boat's main control formation.

In the center of the formation, the phantom image of the "Revering the Venerable" flying boat floated.

As if guided by an unseen force, the black thread, confined by the crowd, floated uncontrollably towards the phantom image within the main control formation!

All five of them turned pale simultaneously.

*Boom!*

At this moment, the flying boat suddenly trembled violently.

The thick black thread suddenly unleashed an impact force several times greater than before, instantly breaking free from everyone's restraint.

It returned to the phantom image of the flying boat.

Thus, the truth was revealed!

The perpetrator of the murders of several Harmonious Dao cultivators was none other than the flying boat they were traveling on!

This conclusion was simply unimaginable.

Even though the facts were now before them, Guan Xing Xiu still found it difficult to believe.

"Why..." he gritted out.

As the commander appointed by the Immortal Alliance, nominally in control of the "Revering the Venerable" flying boat,

This creation, originally under his control, had, right under his nose, slaughtered his colleagues!

It was simply a blatant humiliation!

*Clang!*

The Falling Star Divine Sword was unsheathed, pointing directly at the phantom image of the flying boat.

In the next moment, Guan Xing Xiu was about to cleave the flying boat in two.

Just then, a cold voice suddenly echoed in the space.

"Final mission objective: Meet the Heavenly Venerate."

"Probability of mission success, low."

"Searching for solutions..."

"Based on calculations, transforming each Harmonious Dao cultivator on the flying boat into the flying boat's energy will increase the mission success rate by one..."

The flickering voice of the flying boat sent everyone into a state of icy dread.

And the dozens of corpses that subsequently appeared in the projected image sent them into utter fury!

They were precisely the Harmonious Dao cultivators who had "disembarked" earlier!

Chapter 1281: Reunion in the Sea of Stars

Countless Harmonious Dao corpses, like kites with strings, drifted haphazardly. The expressions on their faces still held the joy of escaping calamity.

"Damn it..."

Li Ping watched as these once-vivid faces turned utterly frozen. Guan Xing Xiu could no longer restrain himself. The Falling Star Divine Sword transformed into a golden streak of light and slashed straight ahead.

A cyan figure suddenly appeared, blocking the sword light.

Ice crystals bloomed like flowers at his fingertips, the surrounding air seemed to freeze, and the Falling Star Divine Sword was suspended in mid-air.

"This is... Qing Shuang?"

Xu Guan Hai looked at the familiar yet strange figure and exclaimed in disbelief.

The one casting the spell to block the Falling Star Divine Sword was none other than Qing Shuang, who had been drained of his essence and supposedly perished not long ago. However...

The five surviving Harmonious Dao cultivators suddenly tensed their nerves again.

"This place is not suitable for lingering. How about we rest for a while and then break out together?"

Guan Xing Xiu narrowed his eyes, unable to conceal his shock.

Guan Xing Xiu's eyes flashed with a hint of determination. "Then let's destroy this monster first!"

Xu Guan Hai gave a wry smile. "Old Guan, it seems we are beyond saving this time. One or two Heavenly Souls, perhaps I wouldn't fear them. But so many... and this terrifying flying boat..."

...

Familiar faces seemed to drift from the shadows.

"It's still inside the flying boat! We're imprisoned!"

"If we don't resist, we'll surely die. Let's go all out!"

Lan Yu strode forward, blocking the path of the Heavenly Souls, and said solemnly, "Inquire about the current mission completion probability."

But just like the real Star Sea void, this place seemed boundless. The light of the Falling Star was like a firefly, extinguished in an instant.

What made them even more terrified was that a thin thread extended from behind the new Heavenly Soul, Qing Shuang, and stretched into the void.

All the floating Heavenly Souls fell into a stupor. After a moment, the cold voice of the Revered Venerable Flying Boat echoed: "Current mission feasibility, extremely high."

Surrounding the five survivors.

Sun Lu Chang's face turned pale, his body trembling. "How is this possible? Killing them is one thing, but to extract and refine Heavenly Souls like this? What kind of heretical art is this..."

"Old Guan, be careful, this Qing Shuang is not Ji Wan Tao himself, but a Heavenly Soul!" Xu Guan Hai also saw the truth and shouted a warning.

Only Xu Guan Hai showed a wry smile. "I didn't expect to live a little longer, consider it a gain. Everyone, relax. This fellow has swallowed so many Harmonious Dao cultivators at once, perhaps he can last until we see the Heavenly Venerate himself?"

Meanwhile, Zi Mei remained pensive. "This place is far from the Xuanhuang Realm, and the laws of returning to heaven naturally no longer apply. If some special means are employed, it might be possible to disguise oneself as the Heavenly Dao and receive these Heavenly Souls."

As they communicated with each other, time slowly passed.

"He's... out?" Sun Lu Chang was stunned.

When they had all recovered to their optimal state and acted, their movements were smoother than they had imagined.

This seemingly desperate crisis had suddenly vanished into nothingness.

"Energy replenishment plan aborted."

"Wrong!" Guan Xing Xiu's expression was stern as he looked at the surrounding void.

Sun Lu Chang touched the cold sweat on his forehead and let out a long sigh of relief. He still found it hard to believe. "It's... it's resolved just like that?"

"Wait!" Just as the Falling Star Divine Sword was about to pierce the deck of the flying boat, Lan Yu suddenly shouted to stop him.

"Go!" Guan Xing Xiu was still unwilling to give up. He summoned the Falling Star Divine Sword and flew rapidly towards the darkness.

After careful observation, they discovered that the appearance of this Heavenly Soul, Qing Shuang, was no longer the blurry face from before. It was very similar to the appearance of Immortal Venerable Ji Wan Tao in his lifetime.

Lan Yu's expression did not ease at all. "It's only temporary. It seems that with sufficient energy, as long as we don't escape, it won't attack us."

Zi Mei remained silent, her expression also solemn.

The thin threads were the same as the deadly weapons they had discovered earlier, used by the flying boat to slaughter Harmonious Dao cultivators.

The Falling Star Divine Sword instantly erupted with incomparably dazzling light, attempting to illuminate this dark space.

"Besides, they were ambushed before. The five of us working together, perhaps we can successfully escape this hellish place," Xu Guan Hai transmitted telepathically.

"Current energy reserves: abundant."
