Voices echoed continuously. The drifting, expressionless Heavenly Souls were once again dragged back into the void by those thin threads.

Not only did no Heavenly Souls come out to obstruct them, but the Revered Venerable Flying Boat itself was like paper, easily torn to shreds.

As they confronted the flying boat, large numbers of thin threads extended from the void.

...

"I have the Tiandu Martial Arts Arena. If I unfold the Martial Arts Barrier, it should be able to delay for a considerable amount of time," Lan Yu said.

Guan Xing Xiu nodded and said coldly, "However, once its energy is insufficient, it will inevitably hunt and absorb us again. Hmph, to think that we, the important ministers of the Immortal Alliance, would now be reduced to food for a mere artifact in this cold void. How ironic..."

However, the five Harmonious Dao cultivators were not only filled with despair but also a renewed sense of determination.

"Old Guan, it seems we are trapped," Xu Guan Hai said with a bitter smile. "One or two Heavenly Souls, I might not fear them. But so many... and this terrifying flying boat..."

The five of them were trapped in the void cage, but after a period of careful observation, they discovered that the barrier was not impenetrable.

"This place is a formation of absolute confinement; I cannot find the exit. However, if the Revered Venerable Flying Boat intends to kill us again, it will inevitably open a gap. That will be our chance."

After a while, Lan Yu suddenly said this, igniting hope in everyone.

"I will unfold my Martial Arts Arena, everyone enter and take shelter to prevent the flying boat from ambushing us again."

As he spoke, a circular building appeared in the dark void.

With no better option, everyone flew into it.

As the gap closed, the five looked at each other, and a surge of fighting spirit welled up in their hearts.

"Old Lan, can you control this magic treasure? Now is not the time for sparring! If you waste your energy, what will we do when the flying boat attacks later?"

"What, Old Guan, why are you ambushing me?" Xu Guan Hai exclaimed.

Even though they forcibly suppressed their inner turmoil, the five of them couldn't help but fight each other.

Lan Yu explained with some helplessness, "This treasure was personally passed down by the Grand Magus back then. Once entered, one will be forced to spar until they leave. It's the treasure's nature, uncontrollable. I didn't produce it before precisely because of this reason."

"But it can adjust the sparring intensity, and I've already set it to the lowest. Everyone, don't suppress your fighting spirit; just spar casually, maintaining a state of combat. With the supplies we brought, we don't need to worry about energy consumption."

After a flurry of frantic combat, the five gradually adapted.

While lightly sparring, they also communicated harmoniously.

"This kind of warm-up is good; at least it ensures that we are in peak condition whenever we need to act," Xu Guan Hai said with forced cheerfulness.

Sun Lu Chang sighed, "I haven't sparred with anyone like this in a long time. Please be gentle, fellow Daoists..."

Guan Xing Xiu returned to the main topic. "In this desperate situation, we only have one chance. Therefore, we must be aware of each other's strongest moves."

Guan Xing Xiu's words were met with everyone's agreement.

He spoke first, "My strongest strike is one I just realized in the Star Sea not long ago. It's called [Sword Splits the Galaxy]. Be careful!"

The Split Star Sword did not strike the other four, but instead fiercely struck the sky of the Martial Arts Arena.

The sky trembled, and cracks appeared, which then quickly healed.

Guan Xing Xiu exclaimed, "Good treasure!"

The other four then demonstrated their ultimate moves one after another.

As they sparred, their mutual understanding also deepened.

They even jointly deduced a combined attack technique.

Within the void confinement formation, time passed without notice.

The five Harmonious Dao cultivators seemed to be sharpening their swords, nurturing their vital energy and spirit.

Waiting for the opportune moment to unleash their strongest strike.

After an unknown period...

A massive tremor disturbed them.

It wasn't the trembling of the Martial Arts Arena, but the trembling of the entire dark void outside the arena.

Or rather, it originated from the Revered Venerable Flying Boat.

With the prolonged cooperation in sparring, the five had already achieved a certain level of telepathic understanding.

Instantly, they reached a consensus, waiting for an opening.

Without warning, the darkness disappeared, and light reappeared.

They seemed to have returned to the flying boat's cabin.

However, having suffered the consequences once, the five didn't hesitate.

They unleashed their ultimate combined attack, which they had painstakingly prepared.

"Sword Splits the Galaxy!"

"Twilight Gazing Seas!"

"Feather Annihilation!"

...

Shouts of fury echoed simultaneously, and five beams of light merged into one, fiercely striking the flying boat's wall.

However, a scene that brought them despair appeared.

A black hole inexplicably materialized on the wall, directly swallowing the immense destructive power of the five Harmonious Dao cultivators' combined attack.

The hole slowly healed, and the wall returned to its original state.

Their painstakingly practiced ultimate moves were like a joke, causing not the slightest damage.

All five turned deathly pale.

Guan Xing Xiu's Dao heart was shattered, and his figure swayed precariously.

"How is this possible?" he murmured in disbelief, unable to accept it.

With their ultimate attacks having failed, the five felt their hearts turn to ash, with little hope of resistance left.

However, the Revered Venerable Flying Boat trembled violently again, rousing them.

"Wrong? Is the flying boat being attacked from the outside?"

"Void calamity?"

The five suddenly realized, their faces filled with joy.

"We still have a chance!"

They also noticed the abnormality of the flying boat.

The Heavenly Souls that had been absorbed before had not reappeared.

The flying boat also seemed to have undergone a fierce battle, with faint cracks visible on its walls.

As the five stood in stunned silence, the cold voice of the Revered Venerable Flying Boat echoed again.

"Unknown Star Sea Civilization Battle 3."

"Stored energy depleted."

"After deduction, the probability of winning the upcoming battle is zero."

"Executing backup plan..."

"Transmitting data..."

"Initiating flying boat self-destruction..."

The flying boat's voice caused the five surviving Harmonious Dao cultivators to turn ashen.

"Not good!"

Lan Yu instinctively unfolded his Martial Arts Arena, shrouding the five of them within it again.

The other four also deployed their respective techniques to protect themselves.

"Initiating... Star... Star..."

However, something even more astonishing happened. The Revered Venerable Flying Boat's voice seemed to be interfered with, stuttering, repeating itself. But no explosion occurred.

Boom! Boom! Boom!

From above the flying boat, another massive roar echoed.

Amidst billowing dust, a circular gap suddenly appeared. More than thirty mysterious beings clad in peculiar armor entered the gap in an orderly fashion.

They were well-trained, dividing into ten to surround Lan Yu and his companions. The rest continued to explore the interior of the flying boat.

"Brother Lan Yu, you are well-traveled. What is the current situation?" Xu Guan Hai transmitted telepathically, asking.

Guan Xing Xiu said with some uncertainty, "Unknown Star Sea civilization?"

"Possibly. Let's not act rashly for now; let's try to communicate first."

After all, the Revered Venerable Flying Boat, which they were helpless against, had been easily conquered by these mysterious individuals. Their strength was evident.

It was better not to fight if they could avoid it.

After some deliberation, Lan Yu spoke first, "Fellow Daoists, we have no ill intentions..."

The response was swift, using the same language: "Enough nonsense, be quiet!"

"Brother Liu, we can't break through their protective artifacts for now. Should we use the [Immortal Talisman] again?"

"No rush, just keep them contained. We'll figure out what to do after we drag this flying boat back."

...

"Immortal Talisman?"

Lan Yu and the others exchanged glances.

Time slowly passed in the bizarre atmosphere.

The Revered Venerable Flying Boat trembled slightly, breaking the stalemate.

"Hoo... We can remove our defenses now." With a sigh of relief, another team of individuals arrived on the Revered Venerable Flying Boat and took over the area.

The leader was a long-haired man wearing a peculiar Daoist robe, with a broken black jade hairpin adorning his hair.

Although this man exuded the same Harmonious Dao realm aura as Lan Yu and the others, it was mixed with another mysterious power.

This caused the five Harmonious Dao cultivators from the Xuanhuang Realm to instinctively feel a sense of crisis.

It was as if they were facing a terrifying calamity in the endless dark void.

"Fellow Daoist..."

Lan Yu and the others attempted to communicate with the long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator.

However, he seemed not to hear them, muttering to himself, "As Brother Zhao predicted, a ship was actually captured in that direction. This is something that hasn't happened in thousands of years."

"Keep an eye on them!"

Lan Yu and the others were about to speak further when the long-haired man casually glanced at them.

A character appeared ethereally in his pitch-black eyes.

It appeared in Lan Yu and the others' minds, instantly filling their vision and senses, as if encompassing heaven and earth.

They could not see, nor could they hear.

Falling into endless darkness.

And in the eyes of outsiders, it appeared as if the long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator had merely glanced at them, and Lan Yu and the others were simply mesmerized, standing frozen in place.

Silence fell upon the scene. After the long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator left, the crowd began to whisper.

"Elder Wang is getting stronger. Did you know these few were all genuine Harmonious Dao experts?"

"What Harmonious Dao, they don't understand the power of the [Immortal Talisman], what's the difference between them and us Golden Core or Nascent Soul cultivators? Just a bit stronger."

"That makes sense."

...

The long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator returned in a hurry, and this captured flying boat would naturally be inspected by professionals.

Although the craftsmanship of this flying boat was indeed superb, it crucially lacked the power fluctuations of True Immortal Talismans.

Therefore, its true value was actually quite ordinary.

What the long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator cared about was something else.

Zhao Xian from the Dao Proving Academy, had actually predicted the arrival of this flying boat from the depths of the Star Sea...

How did he do it?

Could it be that he had secretly comprehended another True Immortal Talisman?

The long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator touched the broken black jade hairpin on his head, unable to figure it out.

"Has this 'Wang Hai' finally begun to reveal his strength after being silent for seven or eight years?"

"First, he broke through to Nascent Soul in a single day, then advanced to Harmonious Dao in the evening, completely shattering the understanding of cultivation speed within the Immortal Boat. Then, he comprehended a new True Immortal Talisman..."

The long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator hurried away from the Immortal Boat docking port and returned to the Immortal Severing Tower.

In a quiet, dimly lit secret room, the long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator met Zhao Xian, who was also disheveled.

"Brother Zhao," the long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator said softly, devoid of his former arrogance.

Zhao Xian ignored him, his eyes closed, lost in thought.

Occasionally, he would draw lines in the void with his finger, muttering incantations.

After an unknown period, Zhao Xian finally spoke, "Have you found that flying boat?"

The long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator nodded.

"This Immortal Boat comes from the other side of the Star Sea, the former location of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"The Xuanhuang Realm, like our Immortal Boat, has survived the great calamity. However, they have retained a considerable amount of resources..."

A hint of shock flashed across the long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator's face.

Zhao Xian continued, "Unfortunately, the Xuanhuang Realm is too far from us. And it's too close to the Immortal Ruins."

"Sending an Immortal Boat there would be less cost-effective. Of course, the specific decision still rests with the Elder Council."

Zhao Xian said, handing a light spot to the long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator.

After examining the information in the light spot, the long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator's breathing quickened.

"Brother Zhao, how did you perceive all this?"

Before leaving, the long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator quietly asked.

Zhao Xian smiled slightly, "The Star Sea is vast, but to True Immortals, it is seen at a glance. Brother Wang, when you comprehended the True Immortal Talismans, did not visions appear in your mind?"

Wang Hai naturally wouldn't deny it, nodding, "I see. Brother Zhao truly possesses extraordinary talent."

Zhao Xian accepted it calmly and then handed over another light spot. "This is my new insight. After you review it, submit it to the Elder Council."

Wang Hai received it like a treasure, instantly forgetting his previous displeasure and eagerly examining its contents.

"Wonderful, wonderful."

Wang Hai was engrossed, completely immersed.

Only after a long time did the broken black jade hairpin on his head tremble slightly, as if it would break free at any moment. Wang Hai finally regained his senses.

"Brother Zhao is truly a great talent!" Wang Hai bowed sincerely and then left the area excitedly.

Zhao Xian, or rather Li Fan's Saint Embryo, watched Wang Hai depart, sensing the distorted figure under the influence of the True Immortal Talisman, a subtle smile appeared.

Because of the disparity in time flow, nine years had passed since Zhao Xian broke through to the Nascent Soul realm and was taken in as a core disciple by the Dao Proving Academy.

The real Zhao Xian, influenced by the illusion created by Li Fan's Saint Embryo, remained anxious about the Xuan Merchant Immortal Boat being destroyed in the future. Even with Li Fan's help, his inner demons were rampant.

Even as the divine sense Li Fan had split off was nearing depletion, his condition did not improve.

Furthermore, due to repeated displays of abnormality, he was almost discovered by the Third Elder of the Academy, nearly exposing Li Fan's existence.

Li Fan also vaguely sensed the difference between the Xuan Merchant Immortal Boat and the Xuanhuang Realm in terms of cultivation.

Cultivators on the Immortal Boat, whether breaking through bottlenecks or cultivating daily, were extremely susceptible to inner demons.

These inner demons originated from the Dao of the Star Sea and directly afflicted the cultivators.

Each time Li Fan intercepted them for him, the inner demons appeared more frequently afterward.

And as Zhao Xian's actual cultivation realm strengthened, the power of these inner demons also grew.

Thus, Li Fan stopped wasting his efforts on him and directly used the [Dao Pill] technique learned on the Xuan Merchant Immortal Boat on Zhao Xian.

Integrating divine sense and taking his place.

Completely severing the possibility of inner demons appearing.

Zhao Xian's own talent could only be described as mediocre.

However, to Li Fan's surprise, after the Dao Pill was consumed, he, who had inherited Zhao Xian's body, also synchronously inherited the characteristics of the original inhabitants of the Immortal Boat.

Similarly, with cultivation, he would also be plagued by inner demons.

But compared to Zhao Xian, Li Fan, having experienced many lifetimes, possessed a resilient will.

Ordinary inner demons could not shake him.

Therefore, there were no obstacles to his cultivation.

According to the plan, he infiltrated the Dao Proving Academy, greedily absorbing the technological accumulation of the Immortal Boat over centuries.

Then, he volunteered to represent the Academy and came to the Immortal Severing Tower.

To learn and test the methods of harmlessly utilizing True Immortal Talismans mentioned by the Immortal Severing Tower.

What the Immortal Severing Tower said was not false.

They had indeed mastered the exquisite technique of using mortal cultivators' bodies to wield a portion of True Immortal power.

Just like the Harmonious Dao cultivator Wang Hai, who had easily subdued Lan Yu and the other four with one move.

The key lay in the broken black jade hairpin he wore.

This hairpin was a remnant artifact of world destruction collected by the Immortal Boat from vast ruins. Over many years, influenced by True Immortal Talismans, its essence retained traces of the corresponding True Immortal Dao.

Furthermore, it was constantly buffeted by the Star Force echoing in the void.

The collision of these two different True Immortal powers created the uniqueness of this black jade hairpin.

The Immortal Realm's Divine Mechanism Hall, throughout the years, had mastered methods of [Entering Dao]. Although it was also through these remnant artifacts and comprehending the residual True Immortal Talismans, they chose artifacts influenced by only a single True Immortal power. The deeper one entered Dao, the stronger the constraint of the True Immortal Talisman. Not only would their bodies undergo terrifying changes, but even their minds would be affected, driving them mad.

The Immortal Severing Tower unintentionally discovered remnant artifacts with traces of two True Immortal powers.

They utilized one of them and used the echoing Star Force attached to it as an [Anchor]. When entering Dao too deeply, they could trace back the influence of the echoing Star Force and escape the Dao-entering realm. This method, although not reaching the extreme power of the Divine Mechanism Hall, offered safety, allowing it to be promoted to most cultivators. Even at the Nascent Soul realm, with the assistance of special remnant artifacts, after a period of training, they could instantly trigger and unleash the power of True Immortal Talismans. And if fighting in the Star Sea, where the surrounding environment had residual True Immortal Talisman power, its might would be terrifying and awe-inspiring, far exceeding the limits of ordinary Harmonious Dao cultivators of the Immortal Boat. Because of the proposal of this method, the Immortal Severing Tower later surpassed the Divine Mechanism Hall, becoming the nominal ruler of the Immortal Boat. However, considering that in extreme circumstances, the strength of seasoned [Dao-entering] cultivators would still be needed, the Divine Mechanism Hall was retained. Li Fan had also personally attempted [Entering Dao] with an anchor while disguised as Zhao Xian. But having witnessed the full power of True Immortal Talismans, how could he be satisfied with this mere shortcut? What he was interested in here was the research on different True Immortal Talismans. Because Immortal Boat cultivators could only infer the origin of True Immortal Talisman power through remnant artifacts, like blind men touching an elephant. Each cultivator, based on their different perceptions, would diverge into various insights. Li Fan, having witnessed it firsthand, could select the correct versions from a pile of speculations. Naturally, he disregarded the complete characters like 'Hunger,' 'Chaos,' and 'Non-existence' that he had already seen. The [Solitary] encountered during his traverse of the Star Sea, and the [Fallen] and [Nothingness]... This truly was a treasure trove for Li Fan. True Immortal Talismans, although differing in their manifestation of power, were all created by the [Inscription Dao Immortal]. In a sense, they shared commonalities. Having mastered four or five correct answers, Li Fan could more easily find versions closer to the truth from the research of the Immortal Severing Tower. This was the fundamental reason why he could continuously submit so-called "insights" as Zhao Xian. In fact, it was not unworthy of being called True Immortal Talismans; even reverse-engineered versions could rival the killing techniques of cultivators. Li Fan's Saint Embryo practicing outside the Immortal Boat caused him to secretly marvel at the destruction. And among the vast literature of the Immortal Severing Tower, what fascinated Li Fan the most was the speculative research on the classification of True Immortal Talismans.

Chapter 1282: Secret Treasure of a Thousand Fables

In this life, Li Fan had also attempted to categorize the True Immortal script he had encountered.

However, that was from the perspective of their specific divine abilities, such as destruction, decree, augmentation, and so on.

Within the Broken Immortal Tower, beyond the Star Sea, it was from another novel perspective.

That is: whether the Dao depicted by the True Immortal script had already been occupied by a True Immortal, or had been occupied by a True Immortal in the past.

According to the descriptions in various documents within the Broken Immortal Tower, the difficulty and danger level of cultivating into the Dao using these different types of True Immortal script were entirely incomparable.

If a True Immortal had already occupied the Dao, any mortal who attempted to enter the Dao through the script would instantly turn to ash and vanish without a trace the moment they "obtained the Dao." Even the most powerful or talented individuals could not avoid this fate.

If the Dao was no longer occupied by a True Immortal, then even with some side effects, mortals could glimpse the grand Dao depicted by the True Immortal script.

Li Fan carefully pondered the scattered insights of his predecessors that he could read based on his current "contributions."

The method of replicating and attempting to depict the True Immortal script was fundamentally different. The Broken Immortal Tower and the entire Xuán Xiān Zhōu (Mysterious Immortal Boat) relied on the World-Extinguishing Artifact to trigger the residual immortal energy, rather than directly using the power of the True Immortal script.

The so-called "entering the Dao" was not truly entering the path of a True Immortal. It was more like integrating the body, divine soul, and consciousness into the World-Extinguishing Artifact, acquiring certain characteristics born from its tempering by time, and thus being able to better trigger the residual immortal energy in the Star Sea.

Undoubtedly, this was a method of taking shortcuts. If the environment changed and there were no such abundant residual immortal energy in the Star Sea, even if one could "enter the Dao," the power displayed would surely be greatly weakened. Li Fan's method of replicating the fundamental shape of the True Immortal script, regardless of the location limitations, only depended on the practitioner's own strength and understanding of the True Immortal script.

Of course, this was only Li Fan's current understanding, having personally witnessed the True Immortal script. The people of the Immortal Boat would likely never approve. Unless Li Fan was willing to share the fundamental shape of the True Immortal script. With the accumulation of the Immortal Boat over thousands of years, if they could see the true form of the True Immortal script, the overall strength of the Immortal Boat would likely leap forward in a short period of time…

However, Li Fan was not foolish enough to do so.

It was better to continue as he was, submitting "insights" from time to time in exchange for contributions, which was easier and safer. After all, these were reflections on the true 【True Immortal Script】; even if the angle was bizarre, it was absolutely correct.

"This is the essential difference that allows one to witness the true transmission. They rack their brains, trying to replicate the origin from all the external appearances of the True Immortal script. But I was fortunate enough to witness the true origin early on, and deriving from the top down is naturally smooth and effortless."

Although Li Fan firmly believed that the method of the Immortal Boat was merely a clever shortcut, it could not be denied that for ants like them below the True Immortal level, it was entirely worthwhile to be able to wield the power that originally belonged to True Immortals.

After all, in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, survival was the top priority.

If not for these research achievements on the True Immortal script, the Xuán Xiān Zhōu would have long ago become another member of the endless ruins in the Star Sea.

This time, Li Fan guided the Xuán Xiān Zhōu to capture the Myriad Immortals Alliance's flying ship, not only to accumulate some merit for this body but also, more importantly, to use the mouths of the Harmonious Dao cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance to leak the existence of the Dharma-Transmitting Heavenly Venerable.

After lurking within the Xuán Xiān Zhōu for so long, Li Fan finally understood the identity of the mysterious cultivator he encountered in the Sea of Artifacts.

They were all once members of the Xuán Xiān Zhōu, and even among its highest authorities. However, several hundred years ago, they were incited by some outsider and, without anyone knowing what secret agreement was reached, they allowed this outsider to enter the Immortal Boat's top-secret 【Hundred Revelations Immortal Record】.

This outsider claimed only to borrow ancient secret records, but after entering, they never came out until the agreed-upon time. The people of the Immortal Boat, sensing something was wrong, hastily checked and were horrified to find that many secret treasures in the 【Hundred Revelations Immortal Record】 had disappeared.

Coincidentally, the outsider and the three Harmonious Dao cultivators who were responsible for guarding the area also disappeared without anyone noticing.

The Immortal Boat was shaken, and those in authority were purged, leading to a small-scale internal conflict.

The final outcome was that a small portion of people escaped the Immortal Boat. However, these people were unwilling to give up on the Immortal Boat, and coupled with the vastness of the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, there was nowhere else to go, so they also lurked in the Sea of Artifacts, hoping to counterattack one day and return to the Xuán Xiān Zhōu.

As for the Immortal Boat, although they never stopped pursuing these fugitives, how could it be easy to capture them in the vast Star Sea?

They could only let these people exist.

Everyone on the Immortal Boat harbored resentment towards the outsider who caused this internal strife. The lost secret treasures were an eternal pain in the hearts of the people of the Immortal Boat.

However, the outsider's identity was extremely mysterious, and perhaps only those Immortal Boat rebels might know.

Since that incident, that person had never appeared again.

Although Li Fan was not certain whether this outsider was truly the Dharma-Transmitter, it did not prevent him from creating the "possibility" that they were the same person.

After all, in the current Utmost Darkness Star Sea, external resources were scarce, and there were not many living people.

Near the High Wall, and yet so mysterious…

Besides the Dharma-Transmitter, who else could it be?

Li Fan believed that if the people of the Immortal Boat learned that far away in the Sea of Remnants, a powerful being who was likely an ancient enemy was constantly hiding, they would definitely try to investigate the truth there.

After all, it was an unchanging principle that one could not tolerate others sleeping soundly beside their own bed.

And Li Fan could use the Xuán Xiān Zhōu to probe the true strength of the Dharma-Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician.

He did not expect to achieve anything substantial, but even a sliver of information would be good. Anyway, for Li Fan, it was just a casual push, with no cost at all.

"Ultimately, victory might be built upon these inconspicuous pieces of intelligence. The Immortal Boat and the Saint Emperor are both chess pieces I use for testing."

Li Fan reread a piece of literature, thinking this to himself.

As for the encounter with the Harmonious Dao cultivators of the Immortal Alliance, it was not even within his consideration. After all, in the Xuán Huáng Realm, they were also mere consumables.

But what Li Fan did not expect was that three days later, the long-haired Harmonious Dao cultivator Wang Hai returned.

He also brought back a record of interrogation.

"Brother Zhao, take a look. The events on this flying ship are truly spectacular."

Li Fan scanned it and frowned slightly: "Is this flying ship so strong? Harmonious Dao cultivators are like food dough..."

Wang Hai nodded: "We fought it three times before finally breaking through its defenses. And we consumed quite a few World-Extinguishing Artifacts."

"But it was worth it. The resources carried by each Harmonious Dao cultivator were extravagant. Not to mention, those things called 【Essence of Heaven and Earth】 stored inside the flying ship..."

Li Fan raised his eyebrows slightly, pretending to be ignorant: "What exactly is this Essence of Heaven and Earth? Is it the actualization of world laws?"

Wang Hai smiled: "If it were just that, I wouldn't be so excited or have traveled so far to bring you good news! This so-called Essence of Heaven and Earth, in addition to the power of laws in the cultivation world, also attaches a considerable portion of the fundamental power that constructs the world."

"If the cultivation world is compared to a house, then this Essence of Heaven and Earth can be seen as the main beams that build the house! And this is precisely what our Xuán Xiān Zhōu lacks! With the replenishment of these 'fuels,' our Immortal Boat can operate smoothly for another hundred years!"

From Wang Hai's voice, one could undoubtedly hear his inner joy.

He continued to ramble: "Even the flying ship itself can be dismantled and used to add bricks and tiles to our Immortal Boat. Brother Zhao's foresight this time has brought the Immortal Boat a harvest comparable to dozens of World-Extinguishing Artifacts!"

Li Fan continued to read the document with his head lowered: "I only care about the specific rewards. By the way, what did the Elder Council of that world called the Xuán Huáng Realm say? Although the fat meat is a bit far away, it can still save lives."

Wang Hai shrugged his shoulders: "You know those people from the Elder Council. They always use 'the big picture' and 'the future of the Immortal Boat' as excuses. Expeditions across the Star Sea..."

"I think we'll only do that when our Immortal Boat is truly at its last resort."

Li Fan nodded thoughtfully: "It's a pity. I vaguely saw that Harmonious Dao cultivators like the ones on the flying ship are already the peak combat power of the Xuán Huáng Realm. There are only a handful of more powerful Longevity Realm cultivators. If our Immortal Boat were to arrive, they would have no power to resist..."

Wang Hai nodded in agreement, full of disdain: "They are nothing more than parasites clinging to the surviving cultivation worlds. I think even without the full might of the Immortal Boat, just three to five Dao-Entrants would be enough to easily suppress the Xuán Huáng Realm."

Wang Hai sighed again, somewhat regretfully: "It's a pity the Elder Council doesn't allow it."

Li Fan did not respond, and asked again: "What will my reward be? Don't tell me the Elder Council won't acknowledge such a great contribution?"

Only then did Wang Hai stop beating around the bush and cautiously produced a jade slip.

The moment the jade slip appeared, Li Fan's gaze sharpened.

He keenly noticed that the half-broken jade hairpin on Wang Hai's head trembled incessantly. And the jade slip itself faintly emitted the power fluctuations of True Immortal script.

"This is..."

Li Fan quickly reacted: "The jade slip itself is a World-Extinguishing Artifact?"

Wang Hai said somewhat proudly: "That's right. This is considered the third 【World-Extinguishing Jade Slip】 our Immortal Boat has collected. Every time one observes this World-Extinguishing Jade Slip, a portion of the True Immortal power attached to it is consumed, so it is exceptionally precious. The Elder Council has really bled dry this time."

"What is recorded in this jade slip?"

"I want to know too, but I don't have the qualification. You'll know when you look at it yourself. Hurry up, after you're done reading, I need to take it back." Wang Hai looked enviously at the jade slip in Li Fan's hand and urged him.

Li Fan then solemnly separated a wisp of his divine sense and entered it.

The World-Extinguishing Jade Slip was an extremely special type of World-Extinguishing Artifact.

Unlike ordinary magic treasures, due to the constant immersion of True Immortal power over the years, although the World-Extinguishing Jade Slip itself would not be imbued with the power of True Immortal script, the True Immortal power would permeate the content recorded in the jade slip.

Causing a certain "mutation."

Or rather, sublimation.

The sublimated content, as if guided by a True Immortal, had undergone a qualitative leap.

Mortal techniques transformed into True Immortal techniques. Even a simple article, after being touched by True Immortal power, would become something from which one could gain enlightenment.

In short, the World-Extinguishing Jade Slip was currently one of the rare ways to safely and closely contact a 【True Immortal】.

As his divine sense entered the World-Extinguishing Jade Slip, the original content of the jade slip first poured in.

An ordinary technique for tempering the will. Judging by its rank, it was at most at the Nascent Soul stage.

After finishing the reading in an instant, the perception of his divine sense suddenly changed.

The originally ordinary characters instantly came alive, twisted, and mutated, transforming into new characters.

After further rearranging their positions, a brand new immortal technique instantly appeared on the "page."

"Hmm?"

Li Fan trembled inwardly and quickly read the new technique several times carefully.

A sense of familiarity and unfamiliarity gradually arose in his heart as his understanding deepened.

"Immortal Heart Curse?"

"But it's not from the Xuán Huáng Realm."

"And... there are still subtle differences. After all, it wasn't truly deduced and personally transmitted by a True Immortal, but rather derived by the jade slip itself. It can even be considered a weakened version of the Xuán Huáng Immortal Heart Curse." Li Fan thought regretfully.

However, on his face, he still maintained an appearance of excitement and immersion.

When the moving characters in his mind slowly faded and finally disappeared completely.

Li Fan reluctantly returned the World-Extinguishing Jade Slip and said, "As expected of an Immortal technique. With this method, I can be free from heart demons in the future. Even the negative influences when comprehending True Immortal script will be greatly reduced."

"And thank the elders for me!"

Hearing this, Wang Hai glanced at the World-Extinguishing Jade Slip in his hand. Then, he forcibly suppressed the urge to peek.

Setting aside the elder council's restrictions that prevented him from peeking. Stealing without permission was a major taboo of the Immortal Boat.

Even he, if he committed such an offense, would only end up as living material for studying immortal script.

"I could not have achieved this harvest without your long-term efforts in connecting me, Brother Zhao. Here are my insights. Please accept them." Li Fan saw his expression and closed his eyes slightly, concentrating, and then engraved another jade slip on the spot, handing it over.

Wang Hai was overjoyed at this: "Thank you, Brother Zhao! From now on, I'll go through fire and water for you without hesitation!"

After exchanging pleasantries, he directly took the jade slip and began to read it.

Immersed in it, his face lit up with joy.

After a long while, returning to his senses from the insights, Wang Hai crushed the jade slip engraved by Li Fan into pieces right in front of him.

This was the rule of knowledge transmission within the Immortal Boat.

Although there was no restriction on not being able to cultivate the same techniques, techniques, divine abilities, and various insights were still extremely precious resources.

Just like the World-Extinguishing Jade Slip rewarded by the Broken Immortal Tower Elder Council this time, only Li Fan was qualified to observe it; it could not be lent to others.

However, after Li Fan had finished observing, and then passed on his own insights, there were no such restrictions.

But after all, it was a second-hand transmission. The effect would definitely be far less than experiencing it firsthand. Especially when it involved True Immortal power, even if the written transmission was exactly the same, not being able to feel the evolution of profound power, the cultivation progress, or the subtlety of enlightenment would naturally be much weaker.

Unless one was a heavenly talent who could ignore this natural gap. Otherwise, those who were the second or third generation of transmitters would all be weaker than the first.

Precisely because of adhering to this rule, Wang Hai crushed the jade slip engraved by Li Fan after reading it.

After he left today, he would have the right to disseminate this technique again. However, it would be a third-generation transmission, and its effect would be further weakened.

If any interested party wished to cultivate this technique further, they would need to follow the path of transmission, go against the flow, pay a certain price, and beg the previous transmitter. Whether they could obtain the true technique would depend on their sincerity.

Li Fan had been lurking in the Xuán Xiān Zhōu for over ten years and was already well aware of its rules.

Seeing that Wang Hai had received the gift of a jade slip of insights, the two bid farewell reluctantly.

"By the way, the five living Harmonious Dao cultivators from the Xuán Huáng Realm, one of them has something strange about him. So the Elder Council, out of caution, hasn't made a move yet. If you're interested, perhaps you can go find out about him." Wang Hai left this ambiguous remark before finally departing.

Li Fan couldn't help but ponder.

According to the rules of the Immortal Boat, such a subtle suggestion would only be made when it involved the upper echelons of the Immortal Boat or the faction behind the other party.

"Survivor..."

"It should be Lan Yu! After all, he's the only one who cultivates the Ancient Law Harmonious Dao, and he's worthless to the Immortal Boat. But there's nothing strange about him at all..."

"Grand Heavenly Master Du?"

With a train of thought, Li Fan tidied his slightly messy clothes and headed towards the direction of the Broken Immortal Tower Elder Council.

The entire Xuán Xiān Zhōu was currently built on a Void Divine Tree, and after the Broken Immortal Tower gained actual control of the Immortal Boat, it moved to the top of the Void Divine Tree.

Traces of green light, like the tips of branches, connected the various buildings of the Broken Immortal Tower.

Walking on air, without needing to fly, he just needed to move his mind, and he could travel between different locations using the green light.

Looking down, one could vaguely see the Dao Proving Academy, the Star Forging Workshop, and the newly built Sin Subduing Valley below the giant divine tree.

They seemed to float in the endless void, connected by the divine tree.

The giant that Li Fan saw earlier, who had been pierced through the center of his body by the divine tree, had been completely drained. Now, a giant rabbit had taken its place.

This rabbit had a white body and black ears, with a human-like face. Although it was dead, its expression was still compassionate, as if it had witnessed something extremely heartbreaking before its demise.

This 【Human Sovereign Rabbit】, like the previous 【Path-Chaser】 giant, was a part of the Xuán Xiān Zhōu's 【Hundred Revelations Immortal Record】 secret collection.

The treasures collected in the secret collection not only came from the prosperous cultivation era before the destruction of the Star Sea, but also included many strange items collected by the Xuán Xiān Zhōu over the past thousands of years of drifting in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea.

Li Fan's gaze inadvertently swept over the drying body of the Human Sovereign Rabbit, his thoughts drifting to the Immortal Boat's secret collection.

If there was anything on the Immortal Boat worth him plotting for, it was probably this 【Hundred Revelations Immortal Record】.

"Perhaps, plus the whereabouts of the other half, the Shang Immortal Boat."

Li Fan suddenly thought this.

As a part of the former Xuán Shāng Immortal Boat, although the Xuán and Shāng had lost contact for a long time, they could still occasionally sense each other's existence.

However, any information about the Shāng Immortal Boat was the highest secret of the Xuán Xiān Zhōu. Even the Broken Immortal Tower Elder Council only had the three core members qualified to know.

Li Fan, having infiltrated for more than ten years, only managed to overhear one or two sentences during an occasional eavesdropping of an Elder meeting.

"I wonder what the specific situation of the Shāng Immortal Boat is. It's so secret that it's even more confidential than the True Immortal script..."

Just as Li Fan was pondering, he had already arrived at the very top of the Void Divine Tree, where the Broken Immortal Tower Elder Council resided.

The first thing Li Fan did was naturally to visit his "teacher."

In the Xuán Xiān Zhōu, lineage and faction were highly valued.

Wang Hai repeatedly ran errands and relayed messages for him precisely because Li Fan and Wang Hai both studied under the third elder of the Broken Immortal Tower, Ai Tian Jue.

And Ai Tian Jue's relationship with Li Fan was even closer.

Because Ai Tian Jue also originated from the Dao Proving Academy.

However, in order to research new methods of entering the Dao, he had joined the Broken Immortal Tower after leaving the academy and had kept a low profile, unknown to most people.

It wasn't until he achieved results and the Broken Immortal Tower usurped control of the Immortal Boat that Ai Tian Jue reappeared in the public eye.

"Greetings, Master." Li Fan maintained a calm expression and bowed, then truthfully explained his insights from the World-Extinguishing Jade Slip he had just received to his teacher.

Any gains made by a disciple must be reported and submitted to the teacher.

This was naturally also a rule of the Immortal Boat.

After listening to Li Fan's explanation, Ai Tian Jue nodded slightly: "I have also seen this jade slip. Your talent is indeed extraordinary; you have already grasped seven to eight tenths of its essence."

Li Fan bowed respectfully again, thanking his teacher for his praise.

"But do not rely on it too much." Ai Tian Jue's tone suddenly shifted.

"You must know that heart demons are both tribulations and opportunities. Even if you can use marvelous methods to eliminate heart demons, heart demons are endless and will reappear. Using the Immortal Heart Curse to pacify them is ultimately an inferior approach."

"It is better to transform them into resources for tempering oneself; it will be more beneficial for cultivation..."

Ai Tian Jue spoke slowly and unhurriedly.

While teaching Li Fan, he was also writing something on a piece of white paper.

As expected of one of the top powerhouses in the Broken Immortal Tower, even his mere words could inspire the current Li Fan.

Li Fan listened attentively, never once attempting to glimpse the content of Ai Tian Jue's writing.

After Ai Tian Jue finished his lecture, he still did not stop writing.

It was not until half a day later that he finally put down his brush.

"Take a look at this piece of writing. How is it?" Ai Tian Jue said to Li Fan.

Only then did Li Fan look up.

On the white paper, there was a "complete" True Immortal script.

This was Li Fan's first reaction upon seeing it.

"Fall..."

Focusing further, Li Fan felt a sense of loss: "It's not a complete True Immortal script. It only restored about eighty to ninety percent."

"However, to comprehend this level from a pile of fragments is truly extraordinary..."

Li Fan thought to himself that he, alone, would definitely not have been able to achieve this level.

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan expressed his insights on the character 【Fall】: "This 'fall' is not a fall of the heart and mind. It is the fundamental fall of all things. A descent from a higher level to a lower level."

"True Immortals become cultivators, cultivators become mortals, and mortals turn to dust..."

Just with a single character, Li Fan's insights lasted for more than half a day.

And it was still far from complete.

When Li Fan finished, Ai Tian Jue first pointed out a few fallacies in Li Fan's words, then sighed slightly: "To comprehend the words of a True Immortal is like watching a racehorse."

"This script 'Fall,' the Immortal Boat had already restored sixty to seventy percent a thousand years ago. After a thousand years, the progress has only increased by a fraction."

"The closer one gets to the true meaning of True Immortal script, the slower the progress becomes. And even if there is only a slight difference, compared to the real True Immortal script, the power is vastly different."

"One can see the path ahead, but cannot tread it. The immortal path, how difficult it is!"

Li Fan felt a sense of strangeness upon hearing Ai Tian Jue's sigh.

This did not sound like something his master, who was a research fanatic, would say.

"Master, why do you say that?" Li Fan asked directly, without concealment.

Ai Tian Jue then explained the origin of his words.

"That Harmonious Dao cultivator from the Xuán Huáng Realm, Lan Yu, cultivates a true immortal technique."

"Myriad Tribulations Feather Transformation Art..."

"I yearn for it!"

Ai Tian Jue sighed again.

As soon as these words were uttered, Li Fan was greatly shaken.

He knew how high his master's standards were. Since he called it a true immortal technique, it should be a genuine immortal-level cultivation technique, just like the Xuán Huáng Immortal Heart Curse.

But…

How is this possible?

Lan Yu?

Didn't he cultivate the 【Great Heavenly Feather Transformation Art】?

In an instant, Li Fan's eyes narrowed, and countless thoughts flashed through his mind.

However, his verbal response was not slow: "Since Lan Yu has fallen into our Immortal Boat's hands, doesn't this immortal technique essentially belong to our Immortal Boat?"

"Master, where is your regret?"

He pretended to be confused and asked.

Ai Tian Jue smiled and shook his head: "The Xuán Huáng Realm has the restriction of 'law cannot be cultivated simultaneously.' Although the Immortal Boat is far from the Xuán Huáng Realm and is not bound by this restriction, Lan Yu's immortal technique also has a similar limitation."

"To cultivate the Myriad Tribulations Feather Transformation Art, one needs the 【Feather of Myriad Tribulations】 as a guide. Without this treasure, no matter how astonishing one's talent, one cannot even begin."

Li Fan was slightly stunned.

"The Feather of Myriad Tribulations has already merged with Lan Yu; it is not something we can separate."

"Therefore, even though the immortal technique is before our eyes, we can only look, not cultivate!"

Ai Tian Jue shook his head again: "This situation is quite similar to the only record of an immortal technique in our Xuán Xiān Zhōu's secret collection."

Li Fan also put on a thoughtful expression: "Not only techniques, but True Immortal scripts, are they also like this? Occupied by a True Immortal, so others cannot cultivate..."

Ai Tian Jue waved his hand, putting away the writing on the table, his expression unreadable: "That's why that day, I suddenly had a feeling that perhaps not fully comprehending this True Immortal script was a good thing after all."

"Otherwise, within the Immortal Boat, there would inevitably be more bloodshed."

Li Fan fell silent upon hearing this.

"Speaking of which, the origin of the Xuán Huáng Realm's 'law cannot be cultivated simultaneously' rule is quite interesting." Ai Tian Jue suddenly said.

Li Fan looked at his master.

He saw that Ai Tian Jue was writing something on a white paper, muttering to himself: "This restriction should be unique to the Immortal Realm. It should not be derivable by a lower realm's Heavenly Dao..."

Chapter 1283: First Trial of the Spiritual Void Array

Li Fan's expression immediately turned astonished. "How could this be? Could it be that this Xuanhuang Realm has some connection to the mythical Immortal Realm?"

Ai Tianjue's tone was enigmatic. "Heh heh, it's hard to say, hard to say! The history of this Xuanhuang Realm is quite interesting. Once we delve deeper into Lan Yu's mind and extract more, perhaps those old fellows will change their minds." "I just don't know if it will be good or bad for our Immortal Boat."

After speaking, Ai Tianjue was silent for a moment before officially beginning his lesson for Li Fan. Li Fan's repeated calls of "Master" were not in vain. With no restrictions of "laws cannot be cultivated simultaneously," what was passed down between master and disciple here were true profound techniques.

Li Fan had been Ai Tianjue's disciple for five years and, having gained his approval, was taught the "Jade Void Inner Scenery Weeping Spirit Art." This profound technique was precisely the fundamental cultivation method that Ai Tianjue himself practiced.

"The Kan and Li reverse the Qian and Kun, the Jade Void Profound Art is miraculous. The Azure Sea refines the void, and weeping spirits transform into divine abilities…"

Li Fan nodded in agreement. The essence of the cultivation method was to construct an inner scenery world within one's own divine soul. This Jade Void Inner Scenery Weeping Spirit Art was a supreme divine ability passed down through the generations of the Profound Immortal Boat. It was said to have been exchanged by the Profound Merchant Immortal Boat from a sect in a cultivation realm with a supreme treasure during the era when the Immortal path was still open. Over time, everything within the inner scenery world would move according to one's will.

It advocated discarding all foundational cultivation techniques and directly dedicating oneself to the True Immortal script. Unlike Ai Tianjue's somewhat "traditional" approach, Elder Chi Gongdao was an undeniable radical on the Immortal Boat.

Li Fan bowed respectfully and took his leave. At the same time, he thought to himself, "A teacher treats his students with sincerity, and a student repays his teacher with honesty. This is the true inheritance that has allowed the Profound Immortal Boat to continue for thousands of years. The Immortal Pivot Hall and the Immortal Severing Tower are merely different skins. The true core remains these master-disciple lineages."

This method of teaching was actually a common teaching technique on the Immortal Boat. Cultivating within the inner scenery world, weeping spirits in cultivation. Weeping, meaning crying. Although Li Fan did not have a formal master-disciple relationship with Elder Chi, due to Li Fan's multiple submissions of unique insights on True Immortal script, he had gained his appreciation. Thus, his status within the Immortal Severing Tower and the entire Immortal Boat was extremely extraordinary.

The people of the Profound Merchant Immortal Boat, constantly traveling through the Star Sea and visiting various cultivation worlds, had no fixed abode and found it difficult to truly cultivate with a calm mind. The Weeping Spirit Art, however, perfectly solved these two pain points. Ai Tianjue held a glowing book, slowly reciting the contents of the Jade Void Inner Scenery Weeping Spirit Art. Ai Tianjue nodded slightly, his gaze filled with approval. "After you return, you must read it daily and not neglect it. Your Weeping Spirit Art has reached a critical juncture. Once the inner scenery world takes shape, with your thoughts moving instantaneously, you might catch up to me within half a year."

Ai Tianjue was one of the top experts in the Immortal Severing Tower, and his research on True Immortal script was quite profound. His capabilities were doubtless. After more than half a day, Ai Tianjue finally finished reciting the Weeping Spirit Art. He let out a long sigh, and the sweat on his forehead instantly evaporated. The teaching effect of "Sentience of All Beings" was closely related to the aptitude and comprehension abilities of the teacher and student. Moreover, Chi Gongdao had a secret technique passed down, where he could precisely locate valuable World-Extinguishing Artifacts from the vast sea of residual artifacts that contained scattered True Immortal power that was about to dissipate and could be utilized by Immortal Boat cultivators. It was said that eight or nine out of ten double-True Immortal power artifacts found by the Immortal Severing Tower were discovered by Elder Chi Gongdao.

For other cultivation methods, as one's realm increased, the cultivation speed would gradually slow down. However, the Weeping Spirit Art was slow in the early stages, requiring experience and the establishment of an emotional connection with one's inner scenery world. The later the stage, the faster the cultivation became. Although it had been countless years since Li Fan last cried, for Li Tang Master, who could turn the false into the real, recreating the emotional fluctuations of crying was not difficult. Coupled with the fact that the body Li Fan had possessed, Zhao Xian, was not lacking in aptitude, and Li Fan's vast knowledge from his many reincarnations, his progress in cultivating the Weeping Spirit Art was rapid.

Ai Tianjue further instructed, "Although the mainstream view on the Immortal Boat is that studying True Immortal script is fundamental, you must also remember that realm and strength are the basis for exploration and enlightenment. If the foundation is unstable, even if you are lucky enough to reach the heavens temporarily, you risk falling to your death at any time…" The Weeping Spirit Art did not require seclusion; even a short period could deepen the emotional connection with the inner scenery world. Furthermore, the more active one's mind and the more sensitive their emotions, the more suitable they were for cultivating it.

"Are there any unclear points?" Ai Tianjue asked. Or rather, it was more like a divine ability than a cultivation method, called "Sentience of All Beings." And Li Fan, meanwhile, kept his eyes closed, as if still immersed in Ai Tianjue's teachings. Chi Gongdao. Although he was merely reciting words, without detailed explanations, with Ai Tianjue's modulated voice, like the laws of the Great Dao, entering Li Fan's ears, Li Fan's mind naturally conjured up many of Ai Tianjue's insights into the "Weeping Spirit Art." It was said to have been scoured from the Sea of Remnants by the Immortal Boat, greatly reducing the difficulty of inheritance and teaching on the Immortal Boat. Upon its release, it was widely acclaimed and popular throughout the Immortal Boat.

According to Li Fan's assessment, among the elders of the Immortal Severing Tower, he was the one who had reproduced the True Immortal script the most, and also the one with the highest degree of accuracy. He turned to pay a visit to another elder. To be honest, Chi Gongdao's research on True Immortal script did have some aspects that were beyond others. Ai Tianjue was rambling, even seeming a bit verbose. However, this was precisely the level that every teacher on the Profound Immortal Boat strived to achieve. Weeping Spirit, not necessarily weeping during cultivation, but imitating the natural and smooth feeling that arises from the heart when one naturally cries. After leaving Ai Tianjue's room, Li Fan did not leave the Immortal Severing Tower immediately.

And Li Fan also silently recited along. "Student understands everything." Li Fan replied in a deep voice. He did not know how fast the cultivation speed of Ai Tianjue's other disciples was, but judging from the fact that he was always given private lessons each time, it was enough to show Ai Tianjue's importance to Li Fan. Hoo hoo… As soon as Li Fan pushed open the door of the small building, a gust of cold wind accompanied by low whispers met him. As if accustomed to it, Li Fan directly ignored it, walked straight to Chi Gongdao, and sat down quietly.

In front of him, a brush made of flesh and hair immediately appeared. Li Fan reached out to take the brush, and before he even got close, the hair on the brush seemed to come alive. It rapidly elongated and firmly bound Li Fan's right hand. The incomplete True Immortal script appeared in his sea of consciousness, moving with his hand. Drops of blood flowed from the tip of the brush, condensing into ink, leaving indelible marks in the air. To be honest, when Li Fan first came here, he almost revealed himself and nearly wrote the complete True Immortal script. If he hadn't reacted in time, the Immortal Boat would likely have been reduced to nothingness under the world-destroying power of the True Immortal script.

The brush moved like flying dragons and dancing snakes, spitting out red blood. Before long, a fragmented and distorted True Immortal character appeared in this place. It was the character "Hunger". "Hunger… hunger… hunger… hunger!" The brush in his hand suddenly roared, and the缠绕 hair tightened even more. Most of it directly turned into wriggling worms, trying to burrow into Li Fan's body through his hand, devouring his flesh and blood. Li Fan narrowed his eyes, not activating his physical strength or spiritual power to expel them. Instead, while his flesh was being devoured, he felt the hunger of the hair. He was not greedy; the hair merely took a cursory taste and then quickly retracted. The brush flew out of his hand and returned to the darkness.

A moment later, a strange chewing sound echoed. Occasionally interspersed with the crisp sound of chewing bones. Chi Gongdao's voice simultaneously came, "Not bad. Compared to last time, the flavor is a bit more pure." "Young Zhao, you are truly a genius. If Elder Ai were willing, how could I not take you as a disciple?" Li Fan did not reply, but said in a deep voice, "Elder Chi, I feel that my understanding of this character has reached a bottleneck. I want to try a new one." Chi Gongdao let out a sinister laugh, "Heh heh, greedy. I like it!"

Swish! Seven brushes made of flesh and hair also flew out of the darkness and appeared before Li Fan. "Choose whichever one you want!" Li Fan closed his eyes, sensing the aura emanating from the different brushes. "This one." After a long time, Li Fan decided on his target and reached out towards the leftmost brush, the one with the dimmest flesh. Flesh churned, black hair attached itself, guiding Li Fan's hand to write in the void. With flying strokes, a blood-red True Immortal character slowly emerged. Li Fan concentrated on comprehending it, while the other six brushes had already disappeared at some unknown time. "Alone." "The Myriad Ages and the Heavens, only this body is alone."

When the Saint Embryo Li Fan traversed the Star Sea, he had encountered this True Immortal script. At that time, even the Black Sword Heaven's Wonder, which had merged with his Dao foundation, had a tendency to be separated. And now, Li Fan felt that same power from the blood-red character in front of him. However, there were faint restrictions in the surrounding space, curbing the emission of power from "Alone" and other manifested True Immortal scripts. In Li Fan's perception, time passed both slowly and rapidly. After the character "Alone" was finished writing, he still felt unsatisfied. This process of inferring from the manifested power without seeing the True Immortal script itself was truly fascinating. The brush wrapped around his hand had returned to the darkness. Chi Gongdao's sinister laughter echoed in Li Fan's ears again, "Young Zhao, do you want to experience it again? If you abandon the darkness and embrace the light, and come from Elder Ai to me, I will guarantee to hand over all these True Immortal scripts that I have speculated to you hand-in-hand…" Li Fan's expression remained unchanged. "Thank you for your concern, Elder. If I have the need, I will still exchange my insights for it." Without waiting for Chi Gongdao's response, he turned and left.

The small building fell silent for a moment, and Chi Gongdao's voice rang out again, "His will is firm. I like it even more…" "Heh heh heh heh…" Chi Gongdao, who was coveting Li Fan, did not know that with just one direct experience, Li Fan's understanding of "Alone" had already surpassed his. After all, he had the advantage of having personally seen the True Immortal script and having been attacked by the residual power of the "Alone" technique. It was understandable that Li Fan had quickly surpassed him and could now derive it himself. "I'll try to see if I can reproduce it on my own. If I fail, I'll rely on these geniuses of the Immortal Boat." "After all, the more True Immortal script powers one masters, the better." Li Fan returned to his residence and tidied up the gains he had obtained from Ai Tianjue and Chi Gongdao. And waited for their next summons. His life on the Profound Immortal Boat was simple, unadorned, and monotonous.

...

Xuanhuang Realm.

The attention of the Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators on the outbound rainbow light remained high. Although the frequency had slightly decreased, the Myriad Immortals Alliance officially still released some images from the Utmost Darkness Star Sea from time to time! The various dangerous calamities made the cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm exclaim with excitement. "Just watch. They can always escape misfortune every time, which is a blessing from the Heavenly Venerate. But we might not have such luck." "No wonder the Immortal Alliance was unwilling to send people to the Star Sea before. It's too dangerous. We haven't even seen the Profound Merchant Immortal Boat yet, and several Harmonious Dao cultivators have already perished. How many will safely return in the end?" "The Immortal Boat is good, but it's not our home!"

Amidst the heated discussions, the Saint Emperor Li Ping had already spotted some clues. After all, he had truly traversed the Star Sea. The images released by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, although appearing real, still had many flaws compared to traversing the Star Sea. "The Myriad Immortals Alliance is faking it?" "It seems the true outbound rainbow light has already met with misfortune." Li Ping said with some regret. At this moment, the Sacred Dynasty had gathered enough Empty Light Flowing Crystals again. He was going to personally go outside the Xuanhuang Realm, not only to comprehend the Dao again but also to familiarize himself with the battlefield environment where he would eventually confront the Law Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician.

In the sky, unnoticed, the Saint Emperor had already flown to the borders of the Xuanhuang Realm. This time, Li Ping refused the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao's request to accompany him. After all, he would not be going far this time, only operating around the Xuanhuang Realm. As the layers of rainbow light separated, he began to break free from the Immortal Ruins' suction and fly into the dark void. "Perhaps, it is not necessary to rely on these Empty Light Flowing Crystals." "Xuanhuang creations, the embodiment of Xuanhuang laws. Its characteristics, perhaps, can be mimicked through spiritual power." Looking at the colorful, hazy light around him, Li Ping mused. The Xuanhuang Realm gradually turned into a small dot, invisible. Li Fan then turned his gaze towards the location of the Immortal Ruins. It was a place of darkness. The ruins of the former Immortal Realm passage swallowed all eyes that tried to pry.

A fleeting, blurry image flashed in his mind. For some reason, Li Ping felt a faint sense of familiarity towards the mysterious Immortal Ruins. Although it was fleeting, it was still captured by the Saint Emperor. "Immortal Ruins…" Li Ping shook his head, and after a long time, suppressed the thought. The immediate priority was to resolve the issue of the Xuanhuang Realm being "taken over" and having its landscape changed. As for how to escape the Immortal Ruins after achieving his goal…

Since that day, after learning from Mo Ru Bin about the unique nature of the Abyssal race, which originated from the bloodline of the first Xuanhuang Heavenly Venerate. Li Ping had been trying to use Cat Treasure's abilities to mass-replicate this bloodline. Currently, Cat Treasure had three discovered abilities: item replication, creature simulation, and marrow cleansing. Firstly, Li Ping, by any means necessary, had Cat Treasure simulate a member of the Abyssal race. Then, using the recorded creature data, he infused it into an ordinary human through marrow cleansing. Through this indirect method, he then replicated the flesh and blood of this infused human. Perhaps because of Cat Treasure's mediation, it bypassed certain restrictions. These replicated clones actually possessed some abilities of the Abyssal bloodline. Although the efficiency of praying to generate Origin Force essence was only about one-fifth of that of an ordinary Abyssal person, the advantage was that there were no restrictions. With the Sacred Dynasty's current powerful flesh-and-blood manufacturing technology, as long as there were enough resources, they could produce them in almost unlimited quantities. It could be said that the problem of energy shortage for the Sacred Dynasty and the Abyssal Sea had been temporarily resolved. Deep within the Abyssal Sea, the Spirit Gathering Ascension Array continued to operate, accumulating energy. It was believed that within a hundred years, enough power would be accumulated to break free from the Immortal Ruins. And before that, Li Ping's task was to first resolve the issue of "orthodoxy" in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Returning his thoughts to the present, Li Ping subconsciously looked at his shoulder. Cat Treasure was still lying there. However, it had turned its head away and was not looking at Li Ping. It seemed that replicating the bloodline of the first Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate was also a very difficult task for it. For most of this period, it had been sleeping, and besides that, Cat Treasure had also become somewhat indifferent to Li Ping. Li Ping had a premonition that if their relationship continued to weaken, Cat Treasure might leave at any moment. After all, there were no special master-servant imprints between him and Cat Treasure. It was all based on him tempting it with Origin Force essence.

He squeezed out a ball of golden light and placed it on Cat Treasure's head. Li Ping, who had delved deep into the void, began to comprehend the laws of the surrounding Star Sea. As for the calamities lingering in the Star Sea… Cat Treasure's occasionally raised tail guided Li Ping in the safe direction of travel. Coupled with his previous experience of long voyages, there were no dangers along the way. "If the decisive battle were to take place outside the Xuanhuang Realm, the assistance from heaven and earth would inevitably be reduced by more than half." "The key to victory, besides Cat Treasure's various divine abilities, might also involve utilizing the ubiquitous calamities in the Star Sea." Outside the void of the Great Qi small world, the ruins of the One Beginning Sect and the terrifying Annihilation Wind Tribulation were sealed. While sealing, Li Ping was also studying this calamity. Compared to the various calamities in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, the Annihilation Wind Tribulation was a power that purely annihilated everything. Li Ping suspected that even the calamities in the Star Sea would gradually turn to decay under the blow of the Annihilation Wind Tribulation. "Ultimately, the so-called Star Sea calamities are merely the magical means of True Immortals." "Although they are incomprehensible to mortals like us." "Since the Annihilation Wind Tribulation can eliminate them without a trace, then in a sense, this power of calamities can also be turned to our use." "However, finding the appropriate method…"

A flash of inspiration struck Li Ping's heart. Ignoring Cat Treasure's warning, he actively flew towards the dangerous area not far away in the void. Origin Force essence shielded him, and protective measures were in place. Li Ping quietly comprehended the mystical changes applied to the surface of the Origin Force essence. Under Cat Treasure's dumbfounded gaze, Li Ping felt the surroundings suddenly become dark again. Unlike the darkness in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea before, due to the lack of light and silence, the current Li Ping, feeling a gradual severance of his connection with the world and moving further away from all things in the Star Sea, felt a bone-chilling darkness. Not only was his connection severed, but even the connection within Li Ping's body to the Xuanhuang Realm, and the line connecting him to other mysterious unknown existences, were slowly fading. The Faceless Saint Emperor, who had always been concerned about the Xuanhuang Realm, suddenly felt a sense of detachment from worldly affairs at this moment. He felt that the Xuanhuang Realm, and all living beings within it, were no longer that important to him. The long-standing concern was about to be completely let go.

A slight tremor from his shoulder, however, instantly pulled Li Ping out of that state. Li Ping then realized that even when facing the calamity of the True Immortal script, and with all connections to the world gradually fading, Cat Treasure, however, remained on his shoulder. There was no sign of separation. With Origin Force essence protecting his body, his figure flashed, and Li Ping instantly escaped the area covered by the calamity. "This True Immortal script seems to be particularly effective on me." "Alone, or is it 'Sole'?" Li Ping gazed at that area and pondered silently. He conjured another ball of golden light and placed it on Cat Treasure's head. This time, Cat Treasure unceremoniously took a bite and then lazily fell back asleep.

…

Sun family, underground secret chamber.

Li Fan's divine sense sensed that the connection with the Saint Emperor's clone had completely disappeared, and he felt some regret. "The last sensation was the power of the True Immortal script?" "Alone?" "Unexpectedly, by chance, using its power, he completely broke free from me." However, after a moment, Li Fan felt relieved. With the Saint Emperor's current cultivation level, controlling him in real-time like a chess piece was unrealistic. Furthermore, he had the mysterious creation, Cat Treasure, to help him… If he still couldn't completely sever ties with Li Fan's true body, then Li Fan would have to doubt whether the Saint Emperor could truly force out the true strength of the Law Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician. As for the safety of the Saint Emperor clone, or rather, Li Ping, Li Fan did not worry. After all, the Saint Embryo had not perished under the "Alone" technique, and the Saint Emperor Li Ping, with his superior strength and numerous fortuitous encounters, naturally had no reason to be unable to escape. "In any case, the general direction has been set, and we'll just watch his performance." "No matter what, the harvest in this life has been more than enough." "It's even to the point where I'm dazzled."

Just as Li Fan's divine sense was contemplating, a somewhat familiar voice suddenly rang out. "Senior, when can we go out and see? I'm really bored being cooped up here." Li Fan shifted his gaze, his eyes dim. It was the voice of Sun Luoyao, originally. But now, his actions and expressions had reached a point where it was difficult to distinguish between true and false. After Li Fan's continuous attempts, especially thanks to the gains of the Saint Embryo on the Immortal Boat, he had finally created a somewhat qualified simulated personality of Sun Luoyao. This Sun Luoyao himself did not even realize that he was a fictional existence. His consciousness and memories were restored to the time when Li Fan had erased the wind calamity in his body, and Li Fan had promised to take him out to travel and look for other possible immortal artifacts.

"What's wrong, Senior?" Sun Luoyao's gaze at Li Fan seemed to hold a hint of fear. "Heh heh." Li Fan smiled kindly. "It's nothing, I just thought of something happy. Since you said so, let's go out today." Sun Luoyao was overjoyed. "That's great!" Following the same procedure, after creating the fake Sun Luoyao and the Immeasurable Mirror, Li Fan's divine sense took them, the "main bodies," out of the underground secret chamber. "Senior, where are we going first?" "Within the nearest vicinity, I don't seem to sense any signs of immortal artifacts potentially existing," Sun Luoyao asked after checking around. "Do some preparatory work." Li Fan answered simply. Flying rapidly, they arrived at the entrance of a small world and leaped into the spatial passage. "Eh? This small world is all plants?" Sun Luoyao said with some novelty as he looked at the scene before him. It was like a tropical rainforest, with various towering and dense vegetation vying for sunlight. Occasionally, one could see vines slithering like pythons in the shadows, quietly entangling other towering trees. Soon, the trees withered and fell with a creak, clearing a large area of space above their heads. Within moments, sunlight poured in, and other trees grew visibly, filling the gap. "Senior, this small world seems to still be in a relatively primitive stage of life. We probably won't find the immortal artifact we're looking for," Sun Luoyao said, engrossed in the scene but still dutifully offering his advice.

"We're not looking for an immortal artifact. I'll teach you a formation. After you learn it, the task of setting up the formation will be yours." Li Fan said calmly. Sun Luoyao's spirits lifted upon hearing this. "Thank you, Senior! I will not disappoint your trust!" "Watch carefully, this formation is called…" "Primordial Void Spirit Formation!" Li Fan flew into the sky above this small world. Rays of light descended, completely obscuring the sunlight from the sky. The primitive jungle small world, which already seemed somewhat dim, now entered true darkness. And in Sun Luoyao's sight, the light Li Fan sprinkled down were streams of extremely profound formation runes. Even with his foundation as an immortal artifact, it was extremely difficult to decipher. As the formation gradually took shape, a sense of familiarity, yet also inexplicable fear, arose in Sun Luoyao's heart. "This is…" Sun Luoyao's face turned pale. After a long while, he finally recalled. That was the feeling of being on the verge of death, the feeling of clinging to a thread of hope, that he experienced every time he faced the Annihilation Wind Tribulation previously! His intuition told him that if he remained here and waited for the formation to be completed, it would be the day of his doom! The Immeasurable Mirror trembled slightly, quickly transforming into a beam of light and flying to Li Fan's side. Li Fan ignored it and continued to perfect the formation. "Unfortunately, partly due to material deficiencies, and partly because it's only a divine sense projection, the full power of the Void Spirit Formation cannot be unleashed." "However, it is sufficient to condense some defensive layers." More than ten days later, the Primordial Void Spirit Formation was completed. With a beam of light that seemed capable of destroying the world, this small world completely disappeared. And Li Fan's divine sense, along with the Immeasurable Mirror, returned to the Xuanhuang Realm. "Did you learn the formation from just now?" The simulated personality of Sun Luoyao did not respond for a long time. It turned out that the structure maintaining the simulated personality of "true nature" had been destroyed by the ripple effect of the Primordial Void Spirit Formation. "What useless trash." Li Fan snorted coldly.

Chapter 1284: The Great Awakening of Qi Enlightenment (7K)

But considering this Sun Luoyao before him was actually Li Fan's own creation, scolding him as trash would be equivalent to criticizing his own craftsmanship. Thus, Li Fan swallowed the words of scolding that had reached his lips. With another cold snort, his thoughts raced. The currently ineffective "Sun Luoyao" had been destroyed. A moment later, an entirely new simulated personality was born. "Senior, that formation just now..." the new simulated personality said with a bitter tone, its face pale, clearly unaware that it had just been created. "It was too profound. This junior has not yet learned it." Sun Luoyao spoke with difficulty, fearing he would anger Li Fan. Li Fan, feeling the weight of the crystalline sphere condensed at the cost of an entire small world, revealed a gentle smile. "Don't worry. This Unbounded Spirit Void Formation is indeed a bit complex. I'll demonstrate it a few more times." His calm words sent chills down Sun Luoyao's spine, but he dared not retort, merely staring blankly as his companion continued towards their next target small world.

Bai Hua’s eyes flashed with a hint of gravity as she transformed into a golden light and flew towards the endless void opened by the Rift-Tearing Whale. After all, it couldn't be used to transcend mortal limits and ascend to True Immortalhood. Any more was useless. Before Sun Erlang could speak, Qiao Gong Jushi's voice rang out, "Whether it works or not isn't determined by boasting. Let's settle it with our skills! Young Sun, deal with her properly!" Bai Hua Daoist felt herself slowly growing listless. Sun Erlang's responding voice echoed, but didn't come from these puppets. "Senior misunderstands. These puppets are all manipulated by me alone. So, it's a fair fight..." Before he finished speaking, Sun Erlang’s figure vanished from Bai Hua’s spiritual sense. Sun Erlang admitted frankly, "This junior went back to cultivate for a while this time, and I feel I've improved again, so I've come to seek your guidance!" There were also scenes of being captured by the fishing pond, alongside the survivors of various realms. The one who arrived was the Saint Emperor's eldest disciple, Sun Erlang. The small worlds Li Fan chose were all subordinate to Da Qi, the smallest type, undiscovered by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, specifically to prevent outsiders from noticing them being approached by the Xuanhuang Realm's Immortal Ruins. Sun Erlang clasped his hands, "Senior, please be careful... This time, it's truly different from before." Bai Hua Daoist playfully remarked, "Young Sun knows he can't win, so he's changed a one-on-one fight to a group assault?" "I wonder if all these fellows are truly dead," Bai Hua couldn't help but think.
