The dark gold patterns on the puppet's body were already operating at their extreme.

Sun Erlang could faintly feel that in this high-intensity power struggle, the puppet body had reached its limit and was about to disintegrate.

The next moment, Sun Erlang's true self's eyes flashed with a cold light.

Remote power support from other dark gold puppets was instantly infused.

Bang!

Under the cover of golden light, the puppet's body instantly expanded several times over.

With the sudden surge of immense strength, the movement of the pale arm was reversed.

Capitalizing on the advantage, the energy erupted to its peak, attempting to force out the mastermind behind the scenes.

The idea was beautiful, but just as Sun Erlang felt he was about to succeed, a sudden, inexplicable chill washed over him.

Then, he felt...

As if another pale, icy arm had been placed on the puppet body's shoulder.

With a slight press, the puppet's previous extreme state was broken.

Its body staggered and lost its balance.

Before it could even adjust, Sun Erlang felt pale hands, one after another, emerging from the void.

They pressed down on the puppet body.

The strength of each hand seemed not very strong, but united, they pressed down on the puppet like a mountain and a sea.

The puppet was instantly submerged in a pile of white hands, unable to move.

Hum!

A drop of blood trickled from Sun Erlang's eye as he was forcefully pulled out of the puppet manipulation state.

He had a premonition that if he continued to manipulate the puppet and be pulled into that unknown place by those pale hands, his true self would suffer extremely severe injuries.

"Longevity Realm..." At this moment, Sun Erlang had already confirmed the opponent's strength.

It was no longer something he could handle. A trace of unwillingness flashed in his heart, but Sun Erlang did not force it.

"You can retreat now. I will handle this place," Qiao Gong's voice suddenly sounded in the puppet's ear.

"This treasure was painstakingly crafted by me. I can't just hand it over to you..." Qiao Gong muttered, and his figure immediately appeared beside the dark gold puppet.

With a sweep of his rotating blade, a simple circle was drawn on the pale arms tightly gripping the puppet.

Countless arms were torn like white paper, breaking off at the wound.

"Let's go!"

Qiao Gong patted the dark gold puppet's shoulder, and the puppet gradually returned to its normal size.

Then, with a flash of light, it teleported away from this place.

At the last moment, Sun Erlang realized that those severed pale arms were actually just sections of willow branches.

"Willow branches?"

Qiao Gong also raised the same question at the same time.

He wanted to take over the pruned willow branches, but his hand passed through empty air.

While he was stunned, the originally dense, myriad pale arms had already melted back into space and disappeared again.

"They won't even show their hands? They're really not giving me, Qiao Gong, any face."

Qiao Gong did not show any anger on his face. Instead, he took out a circular bronze plate from his embrace.

On the bronze plate, several amusingly posed small figures were placed.

The small figures were originally playing, but after being taken out by Qiao Gong, they immediately became nervous and uneasy.

They pointed towards different directions.

Without Qiao Gong making any move, a rope-like shadow flew out from his side.

It flew rapidly, concealing itself in the air.

After a while, as if colliding with something, the black rope began to sway.

The small figures on the bronze plate kept pointing, and the black shadow beside Qiao Gong continued to shoot out.

Before long, a bizarre and sinister black net was formed with Qiao Gong at the center.

The small figures on the bronze plate seemed to have completed their mission, patting their chests with relief.

Qiao Gong, however, reached out and picked up one of the small figures.

Although the small figure was very reluctant, it was helpless. With a whistle, the small figure split into two.

With a somersault, the two figures became four.

In no time, they transformed from a single small figure into an army of small figures.

Each small figure looked unhappy, jumping onto the black rope.

Then, under faint, orderly shouts, the small figures began to collectively pull the black shadow in front of them.

The giant black net instantly retracted.

The surrounding space trembled slightly, and fragments that had been restored to reality exploded again.

Something seemed to be on the verge of being pulled out from beneath the illusory surface.

Qiao Gong squinted his eyes and watched intently, muttering, "Even the Immortal Puppet [Ancestor] can be moved, how can I not deal with you?"

A sigh echoed inexplicably.

A faint zither music seemed to come from the horizon.

The originally energetic small figures instantly became listless, starting to slack off.

Qiao Gong's expression turned vigilant as he looked around.

"Why must we fight..."

A sorrowful and mournful voice echoed around Qiao Gong.

Qiao Gong looked around, then smiled and said, "You speak well! Why must we fight! Qiao Gong is not good at fighting..."

"Since neither of us is willing to fight, why don't we sit down and talk properly."

To prove his sincerity, Qiao Gong even put away the bronze plate.

The small figures cheered and stopped working. Qiao Gong smiled and looked around: "This humble one is Qiao Gong from the Heavenly Mystery Realm. May I ask your name, Daoist friend?"

The other party was indeed a Longevity Realm expert.

However, during Qiao Gong's brief exchange with him, he did not detect any trace of the Xuán Huáng Realm's Heavenly Dao being reversed.

Therefore, he judged that the other party, like him, was a survivor from another shattered cultivation realm.

After a moment of silence, the melodious and solemn voice spoke again: "I... don't remember."

"I just don't want to see fighting. I have no ill intentions."

Following the other party's words, Qiao Gong saw the scene of the cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty in the entire Luoyan Heavenly City falling into a beautiful slumber. Their lives were safe.

Qiao Gong also felt relieved.

Although he was not afraid, it was best to avoid conflict with a Longevity Realm expert if possible.

"Actually, we also have no ill intentions..."

Qiao Gong smiled and started chatting with the other party.

Sun Erlang received the message from Qiao Gong and sighed slightly in his heart: "Indeed, the difference between the Longevity Realm and the Harmonious Dao Realm is like a chasm."

"However, if all the dark gold puppets were present at that time..."

"We might have been able to fight."

...

If the Sacred Dynasty army's defeat in Luoyan Prefecture was merely an accident,

Then their encounter in Tianling Prefecture was solid proof that the Myriad Immortals Alliance did have some foundation.

After much effort, the Sacred Dynasty army conquered Tianling Heavenly City, only to discover it was an empty city. The important cultivators within the city had already been transferred. Only cultivators without background were left to resist with mechanisms and magical artifacts. The Sacred Dynasty soldiers quickly realized it might be a trap, but before they could retreat, the entire Tianling Heavenly City exploded. The giant floating city, along with nearly ten thousand cultivators from both sides, instantly turned to ash. Phenomena of death erupted all over the sky. Many strange visions intermingled and distorted, making it impossible to distinguish. In a hidden valley in Tianling Prefecture. "Fortunately, Brother Sun reminded us, otherwise our Tianling Prefecture would have encountered misfortune," said Song Mansheng, the City Lord of Tianling, stroking his beard with a smile. Sun Liancheng’s gaze remained fixed on the giant ball of fire in the sky, saying, "We still have to rely on City Lord's wisdom. If not for your decisive action, even with my suggestion, the effect of killing the enemy would not have been so good." The cultivators in the valley all echoed the sentiment: "Yes, according to our observers inside the city, at least ten thousand bandits were buried in this explosion." "Heh heh, fellow Daoist, you're mistaken. It was clearly twenty thousand!" "...Uh, yes, yes, yes. It was twenty thousand! There's video evidence to prove it!" Everyone tacitly agreed. "Speaking of which, who exactly are these people? They attacked without warning, and most importantly, they could even interfere with the teleportation array and the Heavenly Profound Mirror." Sun Liancheng interrupted the celebration. "They should not be from the Five Elders Council. I have fought with cultivators from the Five Elders Council, and the aura I sensed from them is completely different." "No matter who they are, as long as the Immortal Alliance headquarters makes a move, they will all die. For now, they are just arrogant." "Lord Song, should we take the opportunity to strike and gain merit?" Someone in the valley suggested. Song Mansheng pondered for a moment and did not make a decision, instead looking at Sun Liancheng. Sun Liancheng narrowed his eyes and remained silent for a long time. After everyone waited, Sun Liancheng finally shook his head: "The situation is unclear, and it is difficult for me to judge." Song Mansheng nodded upon hearing this: "Since that's the case, let's wait. It's not wise to act rashly when the situation is unclear." Everyone in the valley naturally agreed. Song Mansheng, however, took Sun Liancheng aside for a private conversation. "Brother Sun, you weren't telling the whole truth just now," Song Mansheng said gravely. Sun Liancheng forced a bitter smile: "I really didn't dare to say it, otherwise I fear it would affect the morale of the troops!" Song Mansheng's expression became stern: "Is it that serious?" Sun Liancheng said: "Yes. Master, you also know that I could predict the enemy's sudden attack this time entirely thanks to the sensing of our Sun family's destiny. That day, I was chatting with my nephew, but I suddenly felt that our family's destiny was like a candle in the wind, precarious..." "Extremely frightened, it took me quite some effort to determine that the reason was not from the Immortal Alliance, but from the outside. I initially thought it was an attack from the Five Elders Council, but I never expected it to be a group of unknown bandits." "Our family's future destiny has been fluctuating. Sometimes it's extremely prosperous, and sometimes it's a great omen of doom, with the bloodline severed. It's truly terrifying..." Sun Liancheng sighed. Song Mansheng's brow furrowed even deeper. Sun Liancheng advised: "Regardless, with the credit for destroying the city, you will definitely be rewarded generously during the merit awarding ceremony. You already have enough merit, so why take such a risk? I think the enemy's reinforcements will arrive soon, and those bandits are quite powerful. It's better to hide here in this valley." "With the natural concealment of the great formation, the enemy should not be able to detect us..." Song Mansheng was finally persuaded and suppressed the desire to act. Sun Liancheng's judgment seemed to be correct. Less than half a day later, Song Mansheng saw a large group of bandits swarming over. They had hateful expressions and were meticulously searching every corner of Tianling Prefecture. As they flew over the valley together, everyone in the valley held their breath and their hearts stopped. Fortunately, destiny was still on their side, and they were not exposed. "How many are there? Have we poked a hornet's nest?" "Why do we only see the enemy's reinforcements, where are our Immortal Alliance people!" In the valley, everyone was nervously looking up at the sky and whispering. The previous ease was gone. Sun Qi, however, quietly approached Sun Liancheng. "Uncle, something is wrong." Sun Liancheng's expression changed. He looked around vigilantly, ensuring no one was paying attention, and then communicated with Sun Qi via telepathy. "The fluctuating family destiny has begun to stabilize and lean towards one side. If we continue to stay here, we will only be courting death." Sun Liancheng trembled in his heart. He still trusted his nephew's words. It was precisely because of his uncanny premonition that they had set up an ambush and detonated the Heavenly City, eliminating a large group of bandits. Within the universe, "branching out and scattering" leads to the decline of a family, while "gathering and dispersing" leads to the prosperity of a family. Sun Qi's cultivation technique, the "Reverse Deduction of Heaven and Earth Record," can reverse this trend and make the family destiny more consolidated. The price is that the more prosperous the family becomes, the more the forces of decay will gather on the cultivator. Breaking through each level of cultivation is as difficult as ascending to heaven, and only those with exceptional talent can achieve it. Sun Qi is such a genius. "We must transfer immediately," Sun Liancheng made a decisive decision. "How can we leave now when everyone is watching? We have so many people in our Sun family." Sun Qi was somewhat uneasy. "I have already made arrangements." Sun Liancheng said with great confidence. Within the valley, the Sun family members quietly gathered. However, in the eyes of outsiders, they had not left and were still talking in the same place. "This 'Golden Cicada Sheds Its Shell' secret treasure was obtained during my youthful adventures. I've always been reluctant to use it, but now I have no choice." Sun Liancheng sighed emotionally. The Sun family members, without anyone noticing, had already quietly left through a secret passage known only to Sun Liancheng within the valley. "Quick, the secret treasure's concealment won't last long. Let's find another place to hide." Sun Liancheng urged. Just as they were withdrawing, several beams of white light streaked across the sky and arrived from afar. Their target was the valley they had just hidden in. Boom, boom, boom! The beams of white light hit their target squarely, and unimaginable terrifying energy exploded from the valley. The earth roared and the shockwave swept through, sending the fleeing Sun family members tumbling. Fortunately, the secret treasure's concealment was still effective, and they were not exposed. Sun Liancheng and Sun Qi looked at the valley, which had turned into a circular abyss, their bodies stiffening, their minds blank. "The full power of a Harmonious Dao attack! The explosion just now definitely contained the power of a full-force Harmonious Dao cultivator!" "That's... an arrow?" Just as Sun Liancheng was stunned, he saw several white arrow lights whistling through the sky. His head instinctively retracted. Discovering that the arrows were not directed at him, he hurriedly took his family and rushed towards the next planned hiding place. "No, the entire Tianling Prefecture is no longer safe. We shouldn't stay here for long. We need to find another place to take refuge." While trembling halfway, Sun Liancheng suddenly had an inspiration and changed their travel route at the last minute. He fled rapidly towards Shanteng Prefecture, bordering Tianling Prefecture. Just as they were about to reach the border white mist barrier, the land of Tianling Prefecture suddenly trembled violently. Immediately after, a terrifying scene that the Sun family would never forget occurred. In the sky, five rings interconnected and materialized from the void, descending into the world. From the five rings, countless tentacles extended towards the land of Tianling Prefecture below. And one of them was flying towards the Sun family. "Not good!" Sun Qi's expression changed drastically, and he quickly shouted. However, Sun Liancheng had already acted. Forgetting about his family, he alone turned into a stream of blood light and flew rapidly towards the white mist barrier not far away. However, this desperate technique of burning his soul surprisingly slowed down his speed at a visible rate, as if countless tiny tentacles in the surrounding air were dragging and obstructing him. The blood light dissipated, and Sun Liancheng revealed his true form. He even lost the ability to fly and fell heavily from the sky. The black tentacles in the sky quickly locked onto him. With a fierce thrust, they pierced through Sun Liancheng's body. Sun Liancheng frantically tried to resist, but the surrounding spiritual energy seemed to have solidified, completely unresponsive. Unable to resist at all, the black tentacles quickly passed through Sun Liancheng. Amidst the Sun family's screams, they were also captured by tentacles that differentiated from the sky. The screams only lasted for a while before Sun Liancheng's body was assimilated into the same black tentacles. Even a phenomenon of death did not appear in the sky. Sun Liancheng seemed not to have died, but merely transformed into those black tentacles. As the Sun family members were captured, only Sun Qi's heart turned cold. He dared not move. Yes, the entire Sun family, only he, Sun Qi, survived. Because at the moment he was locked onto by those terrifying tentacles, Sun Qi had a faint feeling in his heart. Faced with myriad paths of death, he found the only glimmer of hope. Therefore, without hesitation, he used the "Body Dissolution Chapter" of the "Supreme Primordial True Scripture" to dismantle his cultivation and expelled all the spiritual energy stored in his body. Thoroughly and completely, he became a mortal. A black tentacle, as thick as an arm, slowly drifted in front of Sun Qi. It circled around Sun Qi as if it had life. Only up close could Sun Qi see that these black tentacles were actually composed of countless densely packed black insects. He didn't even dare to breathe, his whole body stiff. Fortunately, after determining that Sun Qi was purely a mortal without cultivation, the black tentacles let him go. Taking the entire Sun family, who had already transformed into black flying insects, they soared away. Sun Qi remained in the same rigid posture until half a day later, when he finally collapsed to the ground, his body completely limp. "What on earth are these things..." His mind raced with countless thoughts, and it took him a long time to regain some energy. He looked at the white mist barrier not far away and the five rings in the sky that were gradually fading. Sun Qi gritted his teeth and began to cultivate again. After closing his eyes to cultivate for a while, Sun Qi opened his eyes again. He keenly sensed that the spiritual energy in the world... was different from before.

Chapter 1294: The Sacred Emperor Awakens His Lingering Thoughts

Sun Qi raised his hand, attempting to touch the sky. Without deliberate manipulation to absorb it, the surrounding spiritual energy eagerly surged into his body.

This feeling… Sun Qi had not experienced it for a long time. It was as if a towering tree that had been crushing him had been toppled, and Sun Qi felt an unprecedented sense of relief.

"Hehehehehe..." After a moment of stunned silence, a sinister look gradually appeared in Sun Qi's eyes. "As expected, family, relatives, all are burdens!" "Reversing the Eons, the Eons Reversed, the End of this Path is to be Forever Unique!" "I am the Sun family! The Sun family is me!" "The prosperity of a family, all returns to one person..." Having lived under the shadow of his family for the first half of his life, and now, by a twist of fate, all his relatives were dead. Sun Qi did not feel much sorrow, but instead felt an unprecedented joy. He even vaguely sensed that as the other bloodlines of the Sun family died off, the overall luck of the Sun family had not directly dissipated or disappeared. Instead, it was slowly converging towards him. "Give me ten years, no, five years, and I will not only recover my cultivation but might even reach the Harmonious Dao realm..." The bright future vividly predicted by his strong intuition made Sun Qi's body tremble with excitement. He even wanted to laugh out loud.

However, another silver-white arrow whistling overhead made him instantly turn pale and shudder. "Lord Heavenly Venerate! Could it be that cultivators from beyond the Xuanhuang Realm are attacking..." Sun Qi shrunk his head and glanced at the white mist barrier not far away. He gritted his teeth and deliberately accelerated his absorption of spiritual energy. "I can't stay in this Tianling Prefecture anymore. I need to leave quickly..." "It's a pity that all those burdens were captured by the tentacles. If I want to cross the white mist barrier, I still have to rely on myself."

Sun Qi, who had dismantled his cultivation and was rebuilding it, progressed extremely quickly. In just the time it takes for a cup of tea to steep, he had returned to the peak stage of Qi Refining. The bandits continuously flying in the sky grew more numerous, and Sun Qi felt increasingly pressed. "I can now control the flying magical artifact. Let's go to a safe place first." "Crossing only one prefecture's barrier won't significantly reduce my lifespan." "After returning to the Foundation Establishment stage, I can observe future fortunes. But now, I can't wait..." Sun Qi made up his mind, and a transparent sphere enveloped him, flying directly into the white mist.

Just as he was nearing the Teng Prefecture of Li Shan, Sun Qi was startled to discover some figures faintly discernible within the white mist ahead. His heart filled with dread, he immediately controlled his magical artifact to stop flying. But it was already too late. "Who goes there!" A furious roar, accompanied by colorful spell attacks, flew out from the white mist, all bombarding Sun Qi. Before he could even let out a cry of pain, Sun Qi instantly turned into ashes!

"Target eliminated, alert lifted!" Cai Yongchen, the squad leader of the Great Qi's Third Army, inspected the scene and then reported. "Only at the Nascent Soul stage. They must have been panicked cultivators from the Immortal Alliance trying to escape. How unlucky, I thought it would be a bigger catch!" "He's just an unlucky ghost, stumbling right into our alert zone..." "Stop chatting and clear out this area quickly!" Cai Yongchen snorted, cutting off his subordinates' idle chatter. He suddenly sneezed. It was as if something from the Immortal Alliance cultivator, who died without a whole corpse, had entered his body. Cai Yongchen's mind grew alert, and after a careful examination, he found nothing unusual. However, as a professional soldier of the Great Qi army, he did not simply dismiss it. Instead, he very seriously reported the origin of the matter and his own sensations through the Saint Emperor's Grand Network. After completing the report, he breathed a sigh of relief and continued to lead his subordinates in the sweeping mission.

...

...

Within Sun Erlang's sea of consciousness, similar incident reports kept appearing nonstop. They even included the Sacred Army puppets lost on the battlefield, the quantities of Sky-Patrolling Arrows, the number of Great Qi soldiers killed and injured, and even a list of forces from the Myriad Immortals Alliance who had been captured alive or surrendered... There were also lists of newly produced supplies within the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi in the rear. Sets of real-time changing massive data flashed by. Based on this, the Dao Transformation Stone, glowing blue in Sun Erlang's sea of consciousness, was constantly simulating battle scenarios and making corresponding changes. Although the Myriad Immortals Alliance's various prefectures had shown some resistance, the vast majority of their territories had already completely fallen under the control of the Sacred Dynasty. The Heavenly City's Law Transmission Altars were suppressed by the Saint Emperor's talismans, and new suppression and connection formations were rapidly established. "During the deduction, the Saint Dynasty's victory rate on the outer battlefield is getting higher and higher." "When the situation slowly stabilizes, we can focus on tackling those difficult opponents." "Currently, the number of Harmonious Dao cultivators who have appeared on the outer battlefield is thirty-four. There are still about a hundred more who should have appeared but have not shown themselves..." Thinking of this huge number, Sun Erlang couldn't help but feel a sense of heaviness. Although the Immortal Alliance had the Sky-Patrolling Arrow, a powerful weapon, Harmonious Dao cultivators were not just sitting ducks waiting to be bombarded. It required Great Qi soldiers to engage them. Casualties were inevitable. "Fortunately, the 'Leaving the Realm Rainbow Light Plan' from before has drawn away a large number of veteran Harmonious Dao cultivators from the Immortal Alliance, otherwise this war would have been even more difficult." Sun Erlang looked at the miniature map of the Immortal Alliance before him. Besides the territories of the two sides marked in yellow and purple, there was a unique gray color that indiscriminably encroached upon all areas. It was slowly spreading outwards from Tianling Prefecture. In the areas occupied by gray, the Saint Dynasty had, according to the Dao Transformation Stone's deductions, swiftly resolved the battles with absolute advantages. "Dao Yi Bug..." A scene appeared before Sun Erlang's eyes, where a Harmonious Dao cultivator from the Mountain Vine Prefecture was captured alive by a squad of Golden Core generals from the Great Qi wearing Sacred Army armor. The Immortal Alliance Harmonious Dao cultivator summoned the Heaven and Earth Essence within his body, which was named "Crimson Vine." After the Mountain Vine Heavenly City was captured by the Saint Dynasty soldiers, this Immortal Venerable Crimson Vine only arrived belatedly. Countless vines like fiery dragons erupted in the sky and on the ground, growing wildly and wantonly. The vine branches, imbued with immense power, swept madly, swatting down large numbers of Saint Dynasty soldiers like flies. Crimson Vine rooted itself in mid-air and multiplied on the ground. In the blink of an eye, it covered the entire Mountain Vine Prefecture. The originally continuous mountains and rivers had now become a dense jungle of vines. The military strength of the three legions of the Saint Dynasty, facing the ubiquitous crimson vines, each possessing its own sentience, fell into a bitter battle. Although they were protected by puppet armor, they couldn't withstand being entangled and constantly roasted and absorbed. It seemed as if this Immortal Alliance Harmonious Dao cultivator would truly rely on his own efforts to turn the tide and retake Mountain Vine Prefecture.

However, the battle situation immediately took a turn for the worse after an ominous shadow inexplicably descended and engulfed the sky. The originally vibrant crimson vines suddenly became as weak and powerless as a frostbitten eggplant, their attacks becoming feeble. Even the color of their own crimson flames inexplicably dulled slightly. In contrast, the Saint Dynasty soldiers, who had been in a bitter struggle and were exhausted, instantly regained their vigor after the arrival of the gray shadow. They even attacked more fiercely than before! A casual attack, wrapped in spiritual energy, could tear open the previously seemingly indestructible crimson vines. The wounds on the crimson vines did not heal as before, but rather grew larger and larger with continuous combat. It was as if some unseen existence was constantly devouring it! The counterattack of the Saint Dynasty lasted for only one hour. The colossal entity that occupied an entire prefecture's territory eventually became only half the size of an adult. It was captured alive by the Saint Dynasty soldiers and locked into a specially made cage for Immortal Alliance Harmonious Dao cultivators. This cage could isolate the cultivator inside from the outside world and forcibly put the power of the Heaven and Earth Essence within the Harmonious Dao cultivator into a dormant state. Once imprisoned, Harmonious Dao cultivators would be like ordinary mortals, completely unable to escape. The captured Immortal Alliance Harmonious Dao cultivators were all sent to the rear of the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty for unified imprisonment. As the Dao Yi Bug spread, the number of captured Harmonious Dao cultivators continued to climb.

As the battle situation on the outer battlefield gradually stabilized, Sun Erlang felt a slight easing of the pressure on his shoulders. He rubbed his sore forehead but did not rest. Instead, he re-examined the information exchanged from the previous battlefield. To prevent missing any details. Soon, he noticed Cai Yongchen's report. He did not believe that Cai Yongchen's feeling at that time was an illusion. Sun Erlang pondered for a moment and ordered someone to bring Cai Yongchen back from the battlefield. After isolating him, he conducted a thorough examination. The result was the same: nothing abnormal was found. However, Sun Erlang still felt a sense of unease. After thinking for a while, he finally used the Star Network to report the entire incident, along with his own feelings during Cai Yongchen's examination, to the Saint Emperor. In less than a moment, the Saint Emperor's reply came. "The abnormality within the body is likely stray [Primordial Qi of Heaven and Earth]." "Primordial Qi, is Heaven and Earth." "Qi is the source of all things." "It is a blessing, not a curse, no need to worry. However, this stray Primordial Qi of Heaven and Earth comes from a fallen cultivator. It might be accompanied by residual will of the previous life. It is not advisable to remain on the battlefield for now..." Sun Erlang suddenly understood after receiving his master's guidance. At the same time, he marveled at Cai Yongchen's extraordinary fortune. This Primordial Qi of Heaven and Earth could barely be considered half a Heavenly Marvel. Although Cai Yongchen absorbed only a portion of it, it was still infinitely beneficial, and could even directly merge with his own Dao foundation, bringing many miraculous uses. "You should return to Great Qi first and recuperate in the Sacred Heart Palace. Wait until you have completely absorbed this Primordial Qi of Heaven and Earth before returning to the battlefield!" Sun Erlang explained the origin of the Primordial Qi of Heaven and Earth to Cai Yongchen and then ordered. Cai Yongchen was overjoyed, yet also somewhat regretful. "I hope that by the time I return, the war will be over," Cai Yongchen bowed deeply and turned to leave. Sun Erlang issued personnel orders, filling Cai Yongchen's position. Although it was just a minor incident, it also demonstrated the impact of efficient communication on the overall war situation. Eliminating all potential hidden dangers. Days passed, and only a handful of prefectures remained in fierce combat on the outer battlefield. The rest had all been captured by the Great Qi army. Sun Erlang did not rush to order a final assault on the remaining Immortal Alliance territories. Instead, he ordered the various legions to establish temporary bases and build fortifications. At the same time, they systematically transferred the captured Immortal Alliance cultivators and resources to the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty. Great Qi had already prepared ample space to accommodate and imprison them during the years of preparation. Sun Erlang turned his gaze back to the central four prefectures of the Immortal Alliance. "The Myriad Immortals Alliance's true counterattack should be imminent." Faint fluctuations emanated from the sealed moonlight, and Sun Erlang made this judgment. In Tianquan Prefecture, at the border of the moonlight. Lu Xichan looked at the rising green energy that obscured the moonlight, a hint of joy flashing in her eyes. Although only eight days had passed in real time, the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters had already deduced countless times. They had finally found a possible way to break the formation. Since this formation was incomprehensibly profound, it was best to abandon the idea of "breaking the formation." Instead, they would directly use "Absolute Spiritual Energy" to corrode the formation units. Absolute Spiritual Energy could suppress all spiritual power fluctuations. Under its continuous diffusion and evaporation, it indeed yielded results. The moonlight, originally like a silver ribbon, slowly became hazy as if covered by green smoke. It seemed that the formation would be broken at any moment. However... The bright moon in the sky shone down again. In an instant, the depleted portion was replenished. Even though Lu Xichan had anticipated this and ordered everyone to resist with all their might, they were still unable to stop the moonlight from descending. Looking at the formation that had returned to its original state, Lu Xichan's face turned ashen. "Chief..." The formation masters below also turned pale, despair in their eyes. "I will go invite the Formation Breaking Discs," Lu Xichan said in a deep voice, admitting her failure to break the formation. Transforming into a rainbow light, she disappeared into the horizon. Half a day later, Lu Xichan returned, bringing with her a cultivator wearing a dark green robe, with an imprint like a mirror engraved on his forehead. His face was unrecognizable, and his gender was indiscernible. If Li Fan were present, he would have recognized this as the unique attire of the Mirror Masters lineage of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. The Mirror Master ignored all the formation masters present and first looked up at the silver moonlight enveloping the surroundings, nodding slightly. Then, he bowed slightly towards the void. The mirror imprint on his forehead emitted beams of light. A white jade disc appeared in the field under the illumination of the light. The white jade disc flew up on its own, slowly approaching the moonlight from the sky. The moonlight distorted and was absorbed by the white jade disc. The bright projections on the white jade disc seemed to show countless formations evolving. The Mirror Master observed for a moment, then frowned slightly. He then released another white jade disc. However, the effect still seemed insufficient, so he directly released all nine discs together. The nine discs orbited each other, drawing the moonlight into the center. The illusory images of the formations instantly accelerated countless times. "What is that Formation Breaking Disc? It's actually so powerful?" "According to Chief Lu, it's the 'Dissolution Disc,' a nascent form born from the Heavenly Profound Mirror." "Hiss, there's actually such a miraculous object in the world. If it can break formations so easily, what's the use of us formation masters?" ... The formation masters present communicated through telepathy, discussing amongst themselves. Lu Xichan, however, stared intently at the changing patterns in the center of the Dissolution Discs, her brow still furrowed. "Venerable, it seems..." The Mirror Master nodded, looking at the formation in the sky, his expression becoming even more solemn. Then, he paused as if he had made a decision. He flew above everyone's heads, struck a strange pose, and then bowed towards the empty space in front. With a gentle bow, the imprint on his forehead erupted with light. Then, the phantom of an item quietly appeared. The Mirror Master bowed nineteen times. Nineteen illusory objects, of various shapes, appeared in the field. Some were like the Dissolution Discs but with different colors. There were also white jade rulers and green jade slips... The nineteen objects flew to the periphery of the nine Dissolution Discs. They rotated rapidly. The already somewhat illusory images became even more blurry in the rotation. Their forms, consequently, changed. They actually became very similar to the Dissolution Discs in the inner circle. And with the help of the outer Dissolution Discs, the deduction in the center of the ring accelerated again, making it almost impossible to see clearly. The Mirror Master observed for a moment and said, "In three days, we can open a gap in this formation." "We must seize this opportunity to completely resolve the trapping formation." The Mirror Master pointed at the bright moon in the sky and said. Lu Xichan bowed her head and replied, " I will explain this to the Transmission Dharma Masters." The Mirror Master said no more, focusing entirely on the Dissolution Discs and the nineteen phantoms. The formation masters observing were stunned for a moment after witnessing this miraculous sight, and then slowly recovered. "How did nineteen Dissolution Discs appear again? The formation-breaking capability of one Dissolution Disc is already terrifying. Nineteen stacked together..." "I get it! The Profound Azure Mirror, the Heart Measuring Ruler, the Book of Heaven and Earth... these are all nascent forms of the Heavenly Profound Mirror!" A single sentence caused shock among all the formation masters present. "Nineteen items, I only knew the Heavenly Profound Mirror had nascent forms, but I never expected there to be so many!" "No, no, it's been so many years, it's understandable that nineteen items have been nurtured. But I've never heard that they can transform into each other! Doesn't that mean each nascent form can unleash more than ten times its own power?" As if sensing the murmuring of his subordinates, Lu Xichan swept his gaze coldly and then transmitted telepathically, "Stop looking and start discussing how to break the partially deciphered parts of the Dissolution Discs together." "Don't you think breaking the formation means everything is settled? If we can't redeem ourselves afterwards, then from top to bottom, our Immortal Alliance's Formation Hall will be completely replaced." Lu Xichan's words made the formation masters break out in cold sweats, and their attention shifted from the Heavenly Profound nascent forms to the flickering formation illusions.

...

At the Saint Emperor's throne.

The Saint Emperor's gaze pierced through the formation's obstruction and fell upon the twenty-eight Heavenly Profound nascent forms, including the nine Dissolution Discs.

"Heavenly Profound Mirror, conceiving itself, dividing and transforming the Dao..." The Saint Emperor nodded thoughtfully, genuinely praising, "Even in the mortal realm, it has never abandoned transcending again." "The Heavenly Profound Mirror is truly a precious artifact passed down since ancient times in the Xuanhuang Realm." The Saint Emperor placed his hand on Mao Bao, who was poking its head out curiously, seemingly about to jump off Li Ping's shoulder. Mao Bao, who seemed to be restless, was gently pressed down by the Saint Emperor. Mao Bao was slightly dissatisfied. It gently bit the Saint Emperor's finger, but after being blocked by a ball of golden Origin Force Essence, Mao Bao finally gave up and lay back on Li Ping's shoulder to rest. "Oh, great Saint Emperor, the items below are all precious treasures." Daoist Yijue, with both eyes deep in the vortex tunnel, still managed to see things in the Xuanhuang Realm below and exclaimed, "Each nascent form is equivalent to a path copied and separated by the Heavenly Profound Mirror." "Some of these paths are even ones that the Heavenly Profound Mirror itself does not possess, but were discovered by the Heavenly Profound Mirror while observing this world over the years." "If this old Daoist were still human, even at the cost of his life, he would snatch one! Using it as a foundation, even if he achieved immortality in the future, it would be of great use!" Daoist Yijue continued to brag, seemingly trying to instigate the Saint Emperor to snatch them. Li Ping, however, remained unmoved. "I can comprehend the Dao of Heaven and Earth in the Star Sea. Why would I need external objects?" "Moreover, the Dao observed by the Heavenly Profound Mirror may not be the truth." Li Ping chuckled, leaving Daoist Yijue speechless. "Great Saint Emperor, why are you just watching them break the formation? If you send someone to harass them, not to mention snatching some Heavenly Profound nascent forms, you could at least delay their formation-breaking time." After a moment of silence, Daoist Yijue spoke again. "Yijue, just do what you were tasked to do." Li Ping glanced at Yijue lightly. Yijue chuckled dryly and stopped speaking. "This old fellow was not so talkative before. It seems that the mirror below is indeed very useful to him." At this moment, Tianyang, who had been silent all along, suddenly spoke. The paper figures of the Du'er Sect below nodded slightly, not denying it. However, Daoist Yijue said nothing about its specific use. "You ten sects are still as annoying as ever." Tianyang said softly. It was as if an invisible wind swept through the Saint Emperor's throne hall, causing the paper figures of the Du'er Sect to sway. Even the mountain gate of the Du'er Sect seemed to be on the verge of being blown away. Daoist Yijue waved his hand, and the paper figures huddled together, resisting the wind. Tianyang snorted coldly and turned his gaze away. The great wind gradually subsided. "It seems you have indeed improved significantly." The Saint Emperor said with some joy. "Regaining consciousness and having new insights into the memories of [Ancestor]. Moreover, over the years of sleeping in the earth veins, although the original body has died, the puppet body's experiences are still a treasure. As time flows and the world changes, everything is like this..." Tianyang's small body spoke with a seniority far beyond his years. "Right... take a look at this." After a while, Tianyang took out a set of child's skeletal remains. "Hmm? Isn't this your body from when you were alive?" The Saint Emperor recognized the origin of the remains at a glance. "Yes..." Tianyang's expression was strange. "I can faintly sense a very peculiar power on it. It originates from the obsession I had before I abandoned my body." "It's completely different from the current methods..." Hearing Tianyang's words, the Saint Emperor also became serious. Tianyang gestured, and a crimson-gold light instantly surged onto his skin. Tianyang's body then dissolved and disappeared into the crimson-gold armor that suddenly appeared. The crimson-gold armor split into several pieces and flew to the Saint Emperor's side successively. It automatically adjusted itself to fit the Saint Emperor's physique. In a short time, a puppet battle armor, as if custom-made for the Saint Emperor, was formed, enveloping him completely, exuding a majestic and sacred aura. "Do not resist." Tianyang's voice came from his mind. "Please, witness my life..." Boom! "Tianyang, it's time for your medicine!" Countless images instantly appeared before Li Ping's eyes, depicting Tianyang's life experiences. However, transmitted voluntarily by Tianyang now, it felt as if Li Ping was truly experiencing Tianyang's life firsthand. His fellow disciples, his master, sacrificing themselves to protect him, going to battle one by one... The extremely real scenes and emotions deeply touched the Great Qi Saint Emperor's heart. "Tianyang's life was no weaker than anyone else's!" Tianyang's cry from the heart, from illusory to real, truly echoed in Li Ping's ears. Therefore... The Great Qi Saint Emperor finally began to perceive that peculiar trace of energy from Tianyang's remains, which had been silent until now. It seemed incompatible with everything in the world. Like a cold plum blossom in the snow, standing proudly alone. Although it appeared very weak, it had endured for thousands of years without fading with time. Instead, it grew stronger every day. "This is..." Li Ping seemed to recall something, his hand trembling slightly. However, an invisible existence severed this connection again. The Saint Emperor felt a sense of loss, but his extraordinary willpower quickly suppressed this anomaly. He first used Mao Bao to test it, but finding that even Mao Bao couldn't identify this peculiar energy, he then looked at the Du'er Sect below. The Du'er Sect's paper figures seemed completely unaware, still huddled together. "Yijue, do you know something?" The Saint Emperor Li Ping asked, though he was not entirely sure. Daoist Yijue actually withdrew his protruding eyes from the vortex passage. The two eyeballs, with long strips of paper attached, flew to Tianyang's remains and circled around several times. From Yijue's expression, it seemed he had indeed recognized something. "This old Daoist merely has a guess." "It cannot be considered certain." The Saint Emperor waved his hand, "Speak freely." As if afraid of being overheard, Daoist Yijue glanced back outside the Saint Emperor's throne. Then, he spoke word by word, "Regarding that Grand Heavenly Master Tiandu, our Du'er Sect has had a guess since ancient times." "The Grand Heavenly Master has already perished; what remains is but a trace of his will after death." "Adhering to the Grand Heavenly Master's will to 'pass on the Dao'." As Daoist Yijue spoke, the paper figures of the Du'er Sect embraced each other even tighter, as if a terrifying existence was approaching. "The will to pass on the Dao, it is neither a living being nor energy." "It is more like..." The Saint Emperor pondered, then continued, "Resonance of the Great Dao." Daoist Yijue clapped his hands and praised, "Saint Emperor truly has great comprehension!" "When all immortals fall, their Dao becomes empty. The Immortal Dao is everywhere; anyone who can even slightly approach its essence will create a resonance of the Dao." "Within Tiandu, it is the Dao of passing on." "And on these remains, it might be the [Dao of Contention]."

Chapter 1295: The Shadow of the Dao of Contention to Prove Immortality

Heavenly Dao Resonance… The Saint Emperor contemplated, sensing the surging energy within Tianyang’s remains. After a long silence, he let out a sigh. “The Dao can prove immortality, but it does not align with me.”

The Saint Emperor’s tone held little regret as he withdrew from Tianyang’s armor state. Returning the remains, Li Ping instructed Tianyang, “The Dao of Strife is empty, but this resonant relic is undoubtedly a rare treasure for you. Contemplate it further. Although immortal paths are not apparent now, the resonance exists, proving the Dao still endures.” “Perhaps, in time, you might truly achieve the True Immortal realm through this!”

Daoist Yijue of the Du’er Sect watched enviously as Tianyang put away the remains, then retreated back into the passage with his elongated eyeballs. “A pity, a pity…” Daoist Yijue lamented.

“What profound insights does the Sect Master of the Du’er Sect have?” Tianyang, however, was not provoked by the Du’er Sect’s taunts this time. Yijue shook his head, chuckling, “Merely lamenting that the Du’er Sect missed a rare opportunity. As the saying goes, ‘When one person achieves the Dao, their chickens and dogs ascend.’ If His Excellency the Saint Emperor contemplates this remnant knowledge, perhaps one day he will truly attain the Great Dao. We too might benefit.” “As for you…” “Perhaps there will be such a day. But our Du’er Sect will likely not live to see it.” His words unabashedly conveyed his pessimistic outlook on Tianyang’s potential to achieve immortality.

This time, however, Tianyang was not angered by the Du’er Sect's provocation. He merely sensed the unyielding thoughts within his remains, reminiscent of his human form. But perhaps due to his current state as a puppet, after much effort, Tianyang still could not rekindle the fervor in his heart. “Tianyang’s life, never inferior to others.” The words, when spoken, felt different than before.

A moment of silence descended upon the Saint Emperor’s throne hall. However, it wasn’t long before the commotion from the Myriad Immortals Alliance below captured their attention. Beams of light flashed, and a group of grim-faced cultivators dressed in black appeared at the moonlight border of Tianquan Prefecture. They first bowed slightly to the Mirror Wielder in the sky, then, with solemn expressions, prepared their techniques and formations towards the still-unbroken Bright Moon Starlight Great Formation. It was as if they were about to launch a full-scale assault on the formation at any moment.

Indeed, various techniques were unleashed, but their expressions were as if time had been paused, frozen in mid-air. Purple lances like heavenly thunder, spatial rifts that writhed, and continuous yellow talismans… All were activated and then converged. Waiting for a gap to appear in the Bright Moon Starlight Great Formation, they would erupt in unison. The black-clad cultivators of the Immortal Alliance took turns, transforming their internal power into techniques and condensing them.

After several hours, the black-clad cultivators rotated, and the accumulated techniques at the edge of the great formation reached a truly astonishing level. A flicker of solemnity crossed the Saint Emperor’s face. Undeniably, this suspended ball of light, if detonated on the surface of the Xuanhuang Realm, could easily turn several prefectures into ruins.

“I’ll go.” Tianyang was about to step forward to resolve this hidden danger when Li Ping stopped him. “Wait a little longer. I have a way to handle it,” Li Ping said in a deep voice. Tianyang nodded slightly, not daring to overexert himself.

Another half-day passed, and a total of over a thousand full-power attacks were channeled. The condensed mini light sphere was even more dazzling than the moon in the sky. Even the Mirror Wielder seemed to feel a hint of apprehension. An imprint on its forehead released a small bronze mirror, enveloping itself, nine Dissolution Discs, and other secondary phantom bodies. Within the Dissolution Discs, the light and shadow generated by analyzing the formation rapidly shifted, and feedback was finally received.

Occasionally, a strand of colored light escaped and floated towards Lu Xichan not far away. And as Lu Xichan comprehended the content of these strands, her body trembled, and she revealed an expression of entrancement. She then transmitted her insights to the formation masters present, which elicited waves of admiration. At this moment, looking at the Bright Moon Starlight Great Formation before them, their eyes held no trace of despair. Led by Lu Xichan, the formation masters began to decipher the great formation. The moonlight, originally substantial and like a silver ribbon, began to become hazy under the influence of external forces.

The Saint Emperor sensed that these Immortal Alliance formation masters were like small insects, constantly gnawing at the foundation of the Bright Moon Starlight Great Formation. Admittedly, Li Ping could fine-tune the great formation. And he was confident that the speed of decryption by the twenty-eight combined Dissolution Discs would absolutely not match his speed of changing formations. If the Immortal Alliance did not employ any special methods, he could eternally trap them with formations alone. But… his goal was never merely to trap them.

The arrangements made outside the Xuanhuang Realm informed him that the Star Sea was already in turmoil. The power of the Star Sea’s resurgence and the struggle with the residual immortal power were about to formally begin. The Saint Emperor, who had been seated throughout, slowly rose. In a single thought, his majestic figure was projected onto the Xuanhuang Celestial Curtain. As if cooperating, the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, bright as the moon, suddenly dimmed slightly, yielding the stage to the Saint Emperor of Great Qi.

The moment Li Ping’s image appeared, the generals fighting in various prefectures of the Immortal Alliance felt their blood boil, their fighting spirit soaring. They shouted in unison, “All hail the Saint Emperor!” The deafening cheers echoed throughout the Xuanhuang Realm, unwavering. The captured and besieged cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance looked fearfully at the imposing figure that filled the entire sky, their minds involuntarily recalling legends of the Dharma-Transmitting Heavenly Venerate. “At this moment, where is the Heavenly Venerate?”

And those Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators still fighting a desperate battle, witnessing this figure that filled their vision, were all stunned into a daze. “In ancient times, the Dharma Transmitter attained enlightenment, transmitted it to all living beings, and established a glorious millennium of cultivation. However, the Dharma-Transmitting method goes against Heaven. Heaven and Earth nurture cultivators. Devouring Heaven and Earth is like patricide and matricide.” “It is not the righteous path.”

… The Saint Emperor’s voice echoed throughout the Xuanhuang Realm. Amplified by the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, it clearly reached the ears of every living being. Initially, the cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance did not react to what the Saint Emperor of Great Qi intended to do. But when they heard the phrase “not the righteous path,” their expressions drastically changed. The Mirror Wielder, who was overseeing the Dissolution Discs, had a grim expression. In the central four prefectures, lights flickered continuously; these were the high-ranking officials of the Immortal Alliance headquarters who had finally been provoked.

Slandering the Dharma Transmitter was equivalent to slandering the entire Myriad Immortals Alliance. It shook the legitimacy and foundation of the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s rule. For the high-ranking officials of the Immortal Alliance, the consequences of this matter were even more severe than the loss of all their territories. After all, territories could be regained, but once the hearts of the people were lost… “Break the formation! Break the formation immediately!” Lu Xichan heard the furious roar of Transmitter Ren in her ear. The Immortal Alliance formation masters were silent as cicadas in winter, desperately trying to break the formation. However, while breaking the formation, they could not help but secretly listen to the voice from the heavens above.

Accompanied by various divine and auspicious phenomena appearing in the sky, the Saint Emperor’s words drifted to every corner of the Xuanhuang Realm. “I also possess a method, not relying on the power of Heaven and Earth, to tread the immortal path.” “It is, to establish my foundation, to achieve Primordial Golden Core, to form Nascent Soul, to transform Divine Essence…” “Star Sea Convergence of Dao…” “Resonating Dao for Longevity!” The Saint Emperor’s words struck the Xuanhuang Realm like a thunderclap, echoing between Heaven and Earth.

It had already captured the attention of all cultivators. After all, judging solely by its name, the Saint Emperor’s method seemed much superior to the Dharma Transmission method. Furthermore, with auspicious clouds and golden light filling the world, showing signs of good fortune, the cultivators were left in a state of reverie. The last time a supreme being preached the Dao in the Xuanhuang Realm was thousands of years ago, during the era of the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Venerate. After the Dharma Transmission method was verified by the world, the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Venerate, who was at the Dao Integration stage at the time, also became the Dharma-Transmitting Heavenly Venerate of the Longevity stage. If this new method proved effective, would it not mean that the Xuanhuang Realm would have another peerless expert capable of rivaling the Dharma Transmitter?

Surrendering to a bandit of unknown origin might lead to retribution from the Myriad Immortals Alliance later. But if they joined the Saint Emperor… A strange atmosphere began to circulate among the Immortal Alliance cultivators. The Saint Emperor’s sermon continued. “The path to immortality, the first step, is to establish my foundation.” “Utilizing the wonders of Heaven and Earth, one can build a foundation. Why? Because the wonders of the world are the embodiment of laws.” “However, the greatest wonder in the world is not an object, but spirit.” “To establish my foundation, one must lay down the principles of all things in the world!”

… The seemingly profound method of establishing one’s foundation, when explained by the Saint Emperor, became simple and easy to understand. At this moment, even mortals in the Xuanhuang Realm who had not yet embarked on the path of cultivation could vaguely grasp the general idea. Not to mention those Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators who had already walked the path of Dharma Transmission. The Saint Emperor’s new method was actually built upon the foundation of the Dharma Transmission method, but broke through its shackles and underwent a transformation.

The Immortal Alliance cultivators who practiced the Dharma Transmission method naturally felt an immense sense of familiarity. Even just by listening, thoughts of “So that’s how it is,” “It’s indeed feasible,” and “Marvelous” arose in their hearts, expressing their approval. Some cultivators who were at the peak of Qi Refining and were struggling to break through to the Foundation Establishment stage, lamenting the lack of Foundation Establishment wonders, suddenly had an epiphany. It was as if they had been enlightened by divine revelation. “Why bother going through all the trouble to find wonders? The Saint Emperor is right, I am the wonder myself!” “Foundation Establishment! Foundation Establishment!” They immediately entered seclusion to comprehend the method.

While the method of establishing one’s foundation was not easy to cultivate in practice, the number of Qi Refining stage cultivators in the vast Xuanhuang Realm was the largest. With such a massive base, even with a small probability, the final result would still be tens of thousands! The Saint Emperor had only reached the middle chapter of Primordial Golden Core in his sermon, and new cultivators practicing the Foundation Establishment method had already begun to emerge throughout the Xuanhuang Realm! Unlike the breakthrough treatment of those practicing the Dharma Transmission method, after the new method cultivators broke through, the spiritual energy of Heaven and Earth seemed to surge towards them spontaneously, as if they were the fated protagonists in legends, favored by the Heavenly Dao. Some even had auspicious clouds and golden light descending upon them during their breakthroughs, accompanied by celestial treasures, as if gifts from Heaven.

The stark difference in Heaven and Earth’s attitude made it impossible for other cultivators not to feel envious. Cultivators at the Golden Core stage or above might have some reservations. However, for those at the Qi Refining and Foundation Establishment stages, abandoning their old cultivation and restarting carried no burden. After all, even if this Saint Emperor’s new method proved unworkable, as long as the Foundation Establishment wonders remained, they could always try again. After abandoning their cultivation, they could temporarily store the wonders and focus on practicing the Foundation Establishment method. The number of Qi Refining and Foundation Establishment cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm far exceeded the sum of all other realms.

Even if only one out of ten chose the Saint Emperor’s new method, it would be a devastating blow to the Dharma-Transmitting Heavenly Venerate and the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Apart from Transmitter Ren, other Dharma Transmitters could no longer sit idly by. Because the Immortal Alliance headquarters had already proven the feasibility of the Foundation Establishment method through experimentation. If they allowed the Saint Emperor to continue preaching… The high-ranking officials of the Myriad Immortals Alliance could not help but shudder.

Deep within the Immortal Alliance’s Nether Prison. In the deepest part of the spatial confinement holding thousands of heinous criminals. A figure that seemed to be nothing but bones, with limbs spread wide in a cruciform shape, was nailed to the void. Upon closer inspection, every bone in the figure seemed to be perpetually burned by flames, struck by lightning, and gnawed by strange insects… The suffering was indescribable, yet the figure seemed accustomed to it, its face peaceful. Or rather, on its skeletal face, no expression could be seen anymore.

At this moment, the endless suffering of its physical form caused the figure to slightly lift its head. Its eyes, completely black, pierced through the layers of the Nether Prison’s space and gazed towards the Xuanhuang Realm’s firmament. “Establish my foundation…” “Establish my foundation…” A wisp of black flame, like a black serpent, emerged from the void and flew directly towards it, instantly piercing its chest. The black flame passed through its heart, yet some of it lingered at the wound, burning the figure’s remaining flesh and bones… and even its residual soul. Even with the figure’s immense endurance, it could not help but let out a muffled groan.

“Establish my foundation, establish my foundation…” He continued to murmur, and tiny specks of starlight began to flicker within his black eye sockets. For a long time, besides suffering, no other sensation had appeared in his heart. But now, he dimly saw a glimmer of hope. A glimmer of hope for escape. How long had he been imprisoned? In the pitch-black Nether Prison, he had almost forgotten the concept of time. But judging by the injuries to his body, it must have been a full five hundred years. After being captured and imprisoned here, he had given up all hope of escape. After all, all his abilities had been drained by the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Even if he were to escape from here by some miracle, it would be difficult to find his way back under the pursuit of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. But now, perhaps through this voice reaching the depths of the Nether Prison, he might truly escape this place.

“Every bit of pain is built upon my body.” “It is 【I】 who feels it.” “The source of the pain is 【I】.” “I establish my foundation…” Specks of golden light began to flicker as the figure spoke. These golden lights seemed to emanate from the figure’s remaining bones. Hidden all along, they were only ignited now in this desperate gamble. With creaking sounds, the golden light, like flames, baked the bones. The bones dissolved like candles, but after condensing, they formed a smaller body that had regained its normal shape.

The surrounding restrictions sensed the figure’s movement and constantly triggered chastisements, bombarding the figure. But the figure had long grown accustomed to it, even absorbing these punitive measures to condense the energy for its new body. Under the illumination of the golden light, the figure grew smaller and smaller. Eventually, it was only the size of an adult’s palm. Emerging from the original skeleton, “Establishing my foundation has actually returned me to my initial state of cultivation.” “It truly is an ultimate and profound method!” “Even if I was delayed in the High Walls for over five hundred years, it would still be worthwhile if I could bring this method back.” The tiny figure transformed into a beam of golden light and flew directly out from the deepest part of the Nether Prison. Ignoring all restrictions along the way. Even the jailers of the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s Nether Prison did not notice this escaping golden light. The golden light figure arrived on the ground, gazing at the Saint Emperor’s projection in the sky. “In desperate circumstances, true talents emerge. In five hundred years, another such figure has appeared in the world…” “Primordial Golden Core.” The tiny golden figure listened intently for a long time, its brow furrowed. “It’s a bit strange. Could it be that I’ve been imprisoned for too long and have become foolish?” “Regardless, I’ll record it first. Once I get out, there will be plenty of people to study it.”

… The Great Qi Saint Emperor was naturally unaware that he had gained another listener from outside the High Walls. At this moment, his sermon was nearing its end, reaching the final stage of “Resonating Dao for Longevity.” “Beyond the Xuanhuang, above the Star Sea, lies the great Dao of proving immortality.” “True Immortals fall, the Dao is empty.” “Reversing the Dao’s shadow, the true meaning of resonating Dao, can glimpse the realm of longevity…” The Saint Emperor preached solemnly. Even the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao itself seemed to comprehend these profound and esoteric words.

All the winds in the world stood still. The vast Xuanhuang Realm, apart from the voice of the Great Qi’s sermon, was utterly silent. Even the Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators, who had been eagerly trying to break the Bright Moon Starlight Great Formation, were now all stunned, listening to the Saint Emperor’s words in a daze. The higher their realm and strength, the greater the shock they felt.

At the Myriad Immortals Alliance Headquarters. Xu Ke and Yin Shangren, while pretending to visit and wander, suddenly sensed that the Museum of Divine Treasures seemed to have brightened slightly. The heavy feeling that had been suppressed in their hearts also suddenly disappeared. “Grandfather Sansheng has left,” Xu Ke immediately judged. “Shall we act now?” Yin Shangren was eager to try. “Let’s wait. Let’s wait for the Saint Emperor’s side…” “The breakthroughs of the Beast Taming Sect in recent years have even surprised me. They chose to go into seclusion at the time of the great calamity, preserving a large amount of talent. It was indeed useful,” Xu Ke said. “Okay, we can wait. It’s just a matter of time. By the way, let me show you this…” Yin Shangren pulled Xu Ke towards an exhibit.

Xu Ke looked closely and saw a golden tree with a peculiar shape. The leaves of the tree were all triangular, and the trunk was carved with small figures interacting in various poses. “This item isn’t an ancient artifact of the Xuanhuang Realm, is it?” Xu Ke said with a strange expression after observing it for a while. “Of course not. It comes from my hometown.” “Or rather, the part of my hometown where the residual consciousness is most complete,” Yin Shangren said leisurely. “I originally thought that place was completely gone, but I didn’t expect that the most important golden tree would be preserved in this Museum of Divine Treasures.” “This tree… is there anything special about it?” Xu Ke knew that Yin Shangren would not be sighing about past events for no reason, so he immediately asked, his heart stirred. Yin Shangren chuckled: “In my world, there is no sun or moon. The light of the entire world depends on this golden tree. Even the origin of all life originates from under this tree. You saw the carvings on the tree; they are the imprints of human interactions over the ages under the tree.” “Although the world was destroyed, as long as this tree exists, the power of the world’s origin is almost one-third preserved.” Xu Ke began to understand and then said with some surprise: “Do you have a way to detonate the energy within this tree?” Yin Shangren touched his scalp and smiled without replying. “Are you willing? That’s your hometown! If this tree is well-preserved, after the Saint Emperor conquers the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters, perhaps he can help recreate that world,” Xu Ke said. Yin Shangren snorted coldly: “Everyone is dead, what’s the point of recreating the world? Do you expect me to act as their stand-in and perform a solo play?” “Just detonate it.” Xu Ke responded with a smile.

As the two were talking, they suddenly felt the ground beneath their feet tremble slightly. They looked at each other and simultaneously looked up towards the outside of the Museum of Divine Treasures. Although their vision could not penetrate, they could vaguely feel that a major change had occurred in the Xuanhuang Realm. Their senses were not wrong. At this moment, a wondrous scene was unfolding in the sky of the Xuanhuang Realm. The originally bright sky suddenly dimmed as if night had fallen. The sun in the sky disappeared. Points of starlight lit up from various places in the sky. Amidst the shining stars, a bright moon rose. However, the Xuanhuang cultivators soon discovered that this “moon” was even brighter than the original sun. As the giant jade plate slowly approached, the Xuanhuang Realm was illuminated once more. The cultivators looked up at the sky and saw that within the bright moon, magnificent pagodas were erected. It was clearly another world!

After a brief moment of mental blankness, countless thoughts flooded the minds of the Xuanhuang cultivators. “Is this the legendary Xuanxianzhou?” “Has the Xuanxianzhou attacked?” “I heard the Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Council are at war, could it be a surprise attack by the Five Elders Council?” “Beware of vigilance!”

… When things are abnormal, there must be a demon. Now that they were in a state of wartime preparation, the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s reaction was swift. The defensive formations of the Celestial Cities in all prefectures were immediately activated, and alarms resounded through the sky. Even more cultivators transformed into beams of white light and shot straight towards the moon-like world in the sky, wanting to investigate. But even though it appeared close at hand, the investigating cultivator could never fly into it. It was as if there was a chasm between them. The Myriad Immortals Alliance stood ready, but saw several beams of bright light descend from the moon. The moonlight was like a knife, accurately striking the borders of the four central prefectures of the Immortal Alliance: Tianyu, Tianchen, Tianshu, and Tianquan. The sky of the four central prefectures of the Immortal Alliance instantly became coated with a silver sheen, becoming illusory and hazy. But apart from that, there seemed to be no other anomalies. After cautiously waiting for a long time, the cultivators of the four prefectures of the Immortal Alliance concluded that there were no other anomalies. However, they soon realized they were wrong.

“The teleportation arrays are unusable! We’ve been sealed off!” “The communication spirit talismans can’t be used either!” “We’ve lost contact with other prefectures. However, we can still contact the Immortal Alliance headquarters.” “What did they say? To act according to the situation? Everyone is already at our doorstep! Damn it!” The four prefectures immediately descended into chaos. Some hot-tempered cultivators flew directly to the border of the prefectures covered by the silver light, trying to cross the blockade. The white mist barrier under the moonlight seemed to gain a touch of sacred solemnity. A cultivator, bracing himself, charged directly into the white mist. Although he had prepared for the possibility of his lifespan being shortened by several years, the scene he saw after entering the white mist left him dumbfounded.

The moment he stepped out of the boundary, the white mist that had filled his vision instantly disappeared. It was replaced by an boundless starry sky. It was as if he had truly entered the void outside the Xuanhuang Realm, surrounded by darkness and coldness. In the distance, faint traces of countless brilliant stars could be seen, occasionally sparkling. The cultivator was stunned and wanted to return, but found that the path he came from had disappeared. He then thought it was an illusion and used sword techniques and magic spells one after another, but not a single ripple was stirred in the starry sky. Instantaneous teleportation techniques also failed. Conversely, as the spiritual power in his body was consumed, the surrounding cold starry sky environment began to erode his mind. Helpless, the cultivator could only choose a direction and fly continuously. He tried to leave the range of this starry sky. But they did not know that the star sea was boundless, and without the correct method, even if they spent a lifetime, they would not be able to leave.

Outside the great formation, cultivators continuously stepped into the moonlight boundary. The great formation was like an endless abyss, swallowing all of them. Nascent Soul, God Transformation, even Dao Integration. Regardless of their cultivation level, as long as they entered, they would never return. After a period of probing, the cultivators of the four prefectures of the Immortal Alliance were finally deterred. The Immortal Alliance headquarters also finally issued an emergency order, prohibiting cultivators in the four prefectures from acting recklessly. Several beams of rainbow light traversed the prefectures and arrived at the moonlight boundary in Tianquan Prefecture. Among them was Lu Xichan, the Chief Formation Master of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. “This formation…” Lu Xichan examined the moonlight shining on the white mist barrier, her eyes filled with shock. A young man in white robes beside her frowned and asked, “When can we break this formation? We’ve lost contact with the prefectures outside the great formation.” “Not only are the teleportation arrays malfunctioning, but even the Heavenly Profound Mirror channels are blocked,” the young man in white robes said with some worry. This young man in white robes was one of the core Law Transmitters of the Immortal Alliance, Ren, the Law Transmitter. Lu Xichan dared not delay and replied: “This formation seems to be drawing the power of the Star Sea, and then using infinite spatial transformations to generate a starry sky that resembles the real one…” Dao Transmitter Ren coldly interrupted Lu Xichan: “When can we break the formation?” Lu Xichan’s voice abruptly stopped. After a long pause, she said, “The complexity of this formation is unprecedented in my life. It should take at least fifteen days…” Dao Transmitter Ren said coldly: “I will give you ten days.” With a cold snort, Dao Transmitter Ren flashed away. Only Lu Xichan and several other formation masters from the Immortal Alliance’s Formation Hall were left behind. Lu Xichan looked up at the great star formation covering the sky, and cold sweat gradually dripped from her forehead. The more profound the formation masters present were, the more despair filled their eyes. It was not that the Immortal Alliance’s formation masters were all useless. It was simply that the formation laid down by the Saint Emperor this time far surpassed the current era. Li Fan’s hundreds of reincarnations, with constant deductions using the TERMINAL DISSOLUTION DISC, accumulated array knowledge beyond several generations of Xuanhuang. Furthermore, it incorporated insights from Li Fan, or rather, the DISSOLUTION DISC, after obtaining several immortal-level formations. After being infused with these array essentials, the Saint Emperor, relying on his enlightenment in the Star Sea, further deduced the array to a deeper level. Currently, above the Celestial Cities of the four prefectures of the Immortal Alliance, covering almost half of the sky, was the bright moon, representing the Sacred Dynasty Da Qi. Countless citizens of Da Qi gathered in the Sacred Heart Hall. Facing the Saint Emperor’s statue, they knelt and prayed devoutly. In the Sacred Capital City, below the Saint Emperor’s throne. Tens of thousands of created second-generation Abyssal people chanted praises for the Saint Emperor’s great virtue. The Sacred Dynasty’s purple-gold aura mingled with the golden Origin Force essence. Forming a faint purple-gold starlight, it left the Sacred Dynasty’s territory and maintained the operation of the great formation that trapped the four prefectures of the Immortal Alliance. This ultimate trapping formation, named the [Bright Moon Starlight Great Formation] by the Saint Emperor, was almost infinitely close to a true immortal-level formation. Li Ping believed that even a Law Transmitter would need some time to break it. As for the people in the four prefectures of the Immortal Alliance who wanted to break the formation… They would have to ask him, the Heavenly Mandate Saint Emperor, whether he agreed or not. Li Ping sat on the Saint Emperor’s throne, his gaze spanning the boundaries between two worlds, falling upon the territory of the Myriad Immortals Alliance in the Xuanhuang Realm. The Saint Emperor’s throne, or rather, the entire Sacred Capital City, fell into profound silence due to the impending war. Mao Bao was still in its usual state, lazily sleeping on Li Ping’s shoulder. It seemed that besides Origin Force essence, nothing else could move it. Besides Mao Bao, a figure resembling a child of eight or nine years old also stood beside the Saint Emperor. Gazing intently at the Xuanhuang Realm below. It was Tianyang. At this moment, his puppet body had undergone earth-shattering changes after receiving massive infusions of Origin Force essence and combat memories of the Immortal Puppet [Ancestor]. Its appearance and physique had returned to its living form. In fact, it had truly been born with the aura of life. His strength was unfathomable, gazing at the Myriad Immortals Alliance, awaiting the arrival of his opponent. And below the Saint Emperor’s throne, Yi Jue Daoist of the Du’er Sect had brought out all the paper figures of his entire sect. The paper figures recreated the mountain gate of the Du’er Sect from that year on the spot. In the center of the buildings, a passage leading to an unknown destination seemed to have opened. Although Yi Jue Daoist himself did not enter, his eyes, protruding infinitely outwards, stretched deep into the passage. “Saint Emperor, please rest assured. If anything happens in the Xuanhuang Realm, this old Daoist will definitely see it,” Yi Jue Daoist said with a chuckle. Li Ping did not respond to Yi Jue. In fact, most of his gaze and attention were focused on the starry sky outside the Xuanhuang Realm. There, he had made thorough preparations. Waiting for the Heavenly Physician and the Law Transmitter to descend.

In the Luoyan Prefecture, when the Luoyan Celestial City was breached, most of the Sacred Dynasty soldiers had already transferred to other battlefields. Only a small number were left to guard. However, from the wilderness outside Luoyan Prefecture, a large group of cultivators suddenly emerged. They did not try to recapture Luoyan Celestial City, but after a surprise attack, they quickly withdrew.

---

Chapter 1296: Preaching to Fight the Saint Emperor

"Heavenly Venerate, you have returned."

Lu Xichan, along with the formation masters present, first paused slightly upon hearing these words.

Then, inevitably, intense fear surged into their hearts as they lowered their heads.

Even their bodies trembled uncontrollably.

This was the formidable pressure of the Longevity Heavenly Venerate, who had dominated Xuanhuang for thousands of years and single-handedly created the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

As the Dharma Transmitter Ren spoke, the Saint Emperor talismans affixed to the giant Dharma Transmitter statues across all prefectures of the Myriad Immortals Alliance suddenly stirred without wind.

They fluttered continuously, as if they could be blown away at any moment.

The statues suppressed by the talismans seemed to come alive, emitting faint tremors.

The Saint Emperor talismans and the Dharma Transmitter statues emitted purple-gold starlight and white light, respectively.

The two forces continuously clashed.

The world of Xuanhuang shifted, and the heavens and earth changed color.

The Saint Emperor also seemed to sense something, and while preaching the Dao, he inadvertently glanced upwards.
