In the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters, Xu Ke and Yin Shangren prepared to retrieve Mr. Bai's skull and a mysterious golden tree. As they awaited the Saint Emperor's next move, a colossal moon-like world descended upon Xuanhuang, sealing off four prefectures under the Saint Emperor’s [Bright Moon Starlight Great Formation]. The Immortal Alliance's formation masters struggled against this impenetrable barrier, while Dharma Transmitter Ren grew increasingly enraged.

Meanwhile, in the Star Sea, the Saint Emperor confronted the Dharma Transmitter. His [Dao Annihilation, Dao Creation] technique, amplified by Xuanhuang’s power, struck the Dharma Transmitter, revealing his terrifying regenerative abilities and hinting at a strength beyond the Star Sea's current limits. The ensuing battle between these two titans promised to reshape the fate of Xuanhuang.

In the midst of this turmoil, the Xuanxianzhou, a vessel carrying ancient True Immortal script, found itself caught in a perilous situation. After being manipulated into attacking Xuanhuang, they were ensnared by an unseen entity, a mysterious shadow that phased through the Xianzhou and vanished, leaving behind a chilling aura of death. This entity, identified by Li Fan (as the Saint Emperor's clone) as a primordial guardian, posed a new and unpredictable threat. The Xianzhou, now stranded and vulnerable, faced despair as their plans were thwarted and their existence threatened.

Chapter 1300: Golden Needles Reverse Xuanhuang

"Master, does the Myriad Immortals Alliance really have this 【Eternal Immortal Wall】? It sounds too terrifying."

After a good while, Sun Tianci still asked incredulously.

"The Myriad Immortals Alliance's brutality is far from limited to this." Li Fan sneered. Li Fan first learned about the Eternal Immortal Wall in the 114th life, during the Heavenly Profound Lock Spirit and Profound Net covering the Xuanhuang Realm. He initially thought it was a unique product of the Immortal Alliance in that era. But in the 119th life, when he impersonated Sun Xingwang, the Dharma King of the Xuan Tian Sect, and refined countless will-demons within the bodies of tens of thousands of cultivators using the Three Tribulations and Hundred Tribulations Divine Manifestation Technique, the Myriad Immortals Alliance's final method of dealing with these cultivators was similar to the 【Eternal Immortal Wall】 technique. From the information revealed by Mo Ru Bin after he possessed the Dharma Transmitter, the Myriad Immortals Alliance did indeed secretly imprison many cultivators to maintain the stability of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Furthermore, they were not located in just one place. Li Fan transmitted a blurry image to Sun Tianci, and the young prodigy of the Sun family was instantly shocked by the brutal scene.

"Master, what should we do?" Not long after, he recovered from his shock and asked resolutely.

"Your 【Profound Nether Art】 is still too slow. Even if we successfully infiltrate the Immortal Wall, we won't have much time to act."

"Become faster first!" The Profound Nether Art, of course, was the profound technique taught by Li Fan, which dissolved the cultivation of cultivators and returned it to the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao.

As Li Fan's clone flew out of Sun Tianci's sea of consciousness, manifesting a phantom form. Li Fan's clone looked up at the sky and slowly whispered, "Erman Tian Di Li..."

As he chanted softly, an invisible vortex appeared above Li Fan's head. A familiar aura, belonging to the Essence of Heaven and Earth, seemed to be brewing within the vortex. Looking at the blurry humanoid figure gradually emerging from it, Sun Tianci became even more certain of his guess.

"One word to summon the essence of heaven and earth? Master's true identity is actually..."

Just as Sun Tianci was somewhat stunned by the scene before him, Li Fan's reprimand sounded in his ears: "What are you still spacing out for? Are you waiting for the essence of heaven and earth to descend?"

Sun Tianci instantly came to his senses and immediately aimed a Profound Nether Art at the blurry figure about to be born in the vortex. As if the process of descent was obstructed, a gust of wind blew, and the essence of heaven and earth, which had been summoned by Li Fan's 'ermanning,' returned to the heavens and earth. Sun Tianci did not feel his connection with the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao deepen during this process. Clearly, because the essence of heaven and earth still belonged to the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao and had not been refined and occupied by a cultivator. And due to the "erroneous descent of the essence of heaven and earth" being stopped just as it was about to be completed, the vigilance from the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao was minimal.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes and felt it again, sending out another "Erman Tian Di Li." This time, Sun Tianci reacted quickly. As soon as the blurry figure was about to take shape, it was sent back. They repeated this process hundreds of times until it was about to attract the attention of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, and only then did Li Fan stop. Sun Tianci breathed a sigh of relief, wiping the sweat from his pale forehead. Clearly, continuously casting the Profound Nether Art for a long time, "decomposing" hundreds of essences of heaven and earth, even if they were only half-formed, was a significant burden for him.

"Let's change locations and continue." Li Fan said coldly.

Since the day he defeated the Martial Maniac and displayed his true combat strength, Sun Tianci was no longer restricted by the Sun family. Even though he was actually only a little over five years old. However, Sun Luyuan constantly warned him to prioritize safety and even bestowed many magical treasures upon him for self-defense. The special training lasted for fifteen days, covering all corners of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Apart from travel time, the remaining time was almost entirely spent on decomposing the essence of heaven and earth. And Sun Tianci's progress was astonishingly rapid. Casually, he could continuously return the half-formed essence of heaven and earth back to heaven and earth.

"Hmm, that's about enough." Li Fan said, nodding slightly as he observed Sun Tianci's performance.

"What are you thinking about?" Li Fan asked, noticing Sun Tianci seemed lost in thought.

"Uh, Master, ten days ago, we came to this place. The spiritual energy concentration seemed to be lower than it is now?" Sun Tianci asked somewhat uncertainly.

Li Fan smiled: "The spiritual energy in the world is like the ebb and flow of the tide; it rises and falls, how can it be constant? Why would it be like your cave dwelling, where you've lived since childhood, always unchanging?"

Hearing Li Fan's explanation, Sun Tianci nodded slightly, but his eyes, scanning the surroundings, still held a trace of doubt.

"This little fellow has such keen observational skills." Li Fan naturally noticed the anomaly in the surrounding environment. He even detected a familiar aura within the permeated spiritual energy. "Dao Yi Worm. It seems to be the Saint Emperor's clone's method. The source should be from the 【Five Elements Great Caves】.... Is he returning the cave to the Xuanhuang Realm to create a combat environment suitable for the Great Qi soldiers? Perhaps he can even launch a fatal blow by utilizing the worm-transformed spiritual energy..." The Saint Emperor's arrangements were almost entirely derived from the main body's explorations in previous lives. Naturally, with a little thought, he could see through the mystery. But Li Fan did not expose it, merely pretending to be unaware.

Returning to Sun Tianci's sea of consciousness, they headed towards one of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's 【Eternal Immortal Walls】. In Tongyan Prefecture, amidst the mountains and cliffs, lies a cave.

"This place..." Sun Tianci looked into the distance and felt something unusual: "If it weren't for Master's guidance, even if I had seen this cave before, I would have subconsciously ignored it. I wouldn't have had the slightest desire to enter and investigate..."

"Hmph, this is what is said to be a blessed land accessible only to the predestined. A peculiar creation of the Xuanhuang, requiring no array formations for concealment, making it almost impossible for most people to spy on. There are many such hidden caves in the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Most of them have been occupied by those Dharma Transmitters as their own residences." Li Fan's mind flashed back to the hidden cave he encountered when he met Mo Ru Bin in the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters in the 119th life. It was exactly the same as this place. "Because of its natural characteristics, the stationed cultivators will certainly not have high vigilance. But still, proceed with caution..."

Li Fan's spiritual sense set up a series of formations around Sun Tianci, and then the two of them flew into the cave. After passing through a narrow, downward passage, they arrived before a deep cave, only wide enough for one person's waist, plunging straight down into the abyss. It was pitch black, and they plummeted downwards. It took a full cup of tea's time, as if they had pierced through the Xuanhuang earth and arrived at the deepest parts of the Nine Netherworld. The narrow cave passage finally began to widen. After passing through a horizontal passage, a huge cave resembling an inverted cone, located deep underground, suddenly appeared before Sun Tianci. The cliff walls of the cave were densely covered with square openings. Upon closer inspection, these openings were filled with amber-colored crystalline bodies. And within these crystalline bodies, without exception, a cultivator slept. Occasionally, one could see Immortal Alliance guards patrolling in mid-air. Sun Tianci dared not release his divine sense to investigate, but could roughly estimate that this underground cave imprisoned and sealed at least over a hundred thousand cultivators. Their faces were ruddy, and even smiles appeared on their faces, completely unaware that they were doomed to eternal slumber.

"According to Master, this is only a part of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's 【Eternal Immortal Wall】..." Sun Tianci couldn't help but feel a chill run down his spine and subconsciously clenched his fists.

"Go, the rest is up to you now." Li Fan seemed to see Sun Tianci's suppressed anger and said calmly. At the same time, he transmitted the method for breaking the seal formation of the sleeping cultivators to him.

"Master, if we were to awaken all the cultivators here, what do you think would happen?" Sun Tianci suddenly asked.

"I advise you to abandon this idea. Since the Myriad Immortals Alliance dares to do this so openly, they must have made precautions. Believe me, you will not be able to awaken them faster than the Myriad Immortals Alliance can deal with them. You must know that the Myriad Immortals Alliance possesses the means to extract and preserve a cultivator's Dao foundation." Li Fan said coldly. Sun Tianci's eyes flickered, but in the end, he had no choice but to give up. Avoiding the patrolling cultivators, he flew rapidly past these sleeping, pitiful figures. A barely perceptible breeze stirred, dissolving the Dao foundation within their bodies.

"Without their cultivation, they won't live long in their sleep... It's equivalent to me killing them with my own hands..." Sun Tianci's flying body trembled slightly.

"Killing? Or saving? Look at their current state, isn't it better than death? If they could consciously perceive everything around them, they would surely beg you to end their suffering." Li Fan said, comforting him. After another round of persuasion, Sun Tianci's hesitant actions finally became resolute. For more than five years, Li Fan had been cultivating Sun Tianci according to his ideal image of the Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate. As a result, although he was benevolent, he was not pedantic. Moreover, once he made a decision, he became extremely resolute. The Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao power, condensed from the decomposition of tens of thousands of cultivators, was gathered by Li Fan into a bright pearl of light.

When the act of "mercy killing" was one-fifth complete, Li Fan said, "That's about enough. If we continue, even I won't be able to conceal this intense energy fluctuation." Sun Tianci looked at the remaining sleeping figures with a hint of regret. But he still obeyed his master's command and quietly flew towards the exit.

"Master, is there anything wrong?" As he reached the top of the vast cave, Sun Tianci noticed that his master seemed to be still gazing at a certain spot below, and couldn't help but ask.

"It's nothing, just leave as instructed." After a brief silence, Li Fan finally responded. Sun Tianci asked no further questions and flew upwards. After leaving the terrifying dungeon, Sun Tianci took the pearl containing the Dao foundation of countless cultivators and gently crushed it. Countless rays of light instantly burst forth. In a daze, Sun Tianci seemed to see wondrous phenomena of the world, the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, and the changing landscapes of mountains and rivers. In the sky, the clouds and mist changed, as if being ground by a giant millstone, with creaking sounds echoing through the clouds. And the entire Xuanhuang Realm instantly trembled. Although the amplitude was minimal, Sun Tianci still perceived it.

"The Myriad Immortals Alliance must have sent people to investigate! Let's go!" Li Fan said. Without needing further reminders, Sun Tianci had already flown away from the site of the incident the moment he crushed the pearl. At this moment, he was immersed in the rapid increase of Xuanhuang Heavenly Favor.

And Li Fan, after ensuring that no one was tracking them, returned to the Saint Emperor's seat.

Deepest part of the Sacred Heavenly Court. The core of the Myriad Spirits Great Formation. In addition, the Soul Refining Great Formation and many other formations were superimposed. Even the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao consciousness, which was closely related to the Saint Emperor, would have its connection severed here. Ensuring that all external probing was cut off.

Lin Ling, the Saint Emperor's disciple, formerly the spirit entity of the Spiritual Wood Realm, had now revealed her original form. However, it looked quite bizarre: the tree was inverted, with its crown at the bottom. Dense roots were at the top. The buildings scattered throughout the Sacred Heavenly Court, such as the Heroic Spirit Seat, the Sacred Medical Hall, the Sacred Academy, the Sacred Heart Hall, and the Sacred Supervision Court, were all connected to the roots of the inverted spiritual tree. In the heart of the tree, all the scenes that had occurred within the Sacred Heavenly Court were synchronously displayed. After an image was played, it turned into green light and was absorbed by the inverted spiritual tree.

Li Fan looked at the inverted spiritual tree before him, a rare hint of hesitation flashing in his eyes. "To prepare for victory, one must first prepare for defeat. The Saint Emperor's actions are truly the actions of supreme wisdom!" Beside Li Fan, a yellow paper figure with a distressed face was unrestrainedly praising the inverted spiritual tree. It was Yi Jue Daoist of the Tribulation Crossing Sect. He sat on the Book of Tribulation Crossing, staring intently at the inverted spiritual tree before him.

"Moreover, the Saint Emperor's plan is for the Xuanhuang Realm, not for himself, so it cannot be said to be undermining his morale." Yi Jue Daoist continued. The Saint Emperor remained silent. However, from time to time, he would issue hand seals, causing the roots of the inverted spiritual tree to sway. And in the heart of the tree, the absorption of the Great Qi images seemed to accelerate. After a long while, the Saint Emperor stopped his movements. He suddenly spoke: "This time, the battle against the Myriad Immortals Alliance, your Tribulation Crossing Sect does not need to act."

"Just hide in the dark and watch..."

"Whether there are other prying eyes." The Saint Emperor's tone was enigmatic.

"The Sacred Heavenly Court and the Immortal Alliance are engaged in a great battle. This is a shift in the Xuanhuang Realm not seen in millennia. If that power secretly monitoring the Xuanhuang Realm is still in operation, it will surely supervise this matter and transmit information. I do not require you to find the final destination of the information. Just determine whether the event has occurred." The Saint Emperor instructed word by word. Yi Jue Daoist of the Tribulation Crossing Sect finally relaxed his tightly furrowed brow. He clapped his hands and praised: "The Saint Emperor's actions are truly in line with the Great Dao of our Tribulation Crossing Sect. If the Saint Emperor is willing, I can cede the position of Sect Master of the Tribulation Crossing Sect..."

Before Yi Jue Daoist could finish speaking, the Saint Emperor interrupted him: "Regardless of whether I or the Dharma Transmitter wins, you must inform the victor of the outcome. As for after completing the task... do as you please." Yi Jue Daoist did not show the joy of gaining freedom, but rather looked stunned. His vaguely shaped paper hands pointed at the inverted spiritual tree: "I won't go together?"

The Saint Emperor laughed lightly: "This 'Outside Wood' contains only Lin Ling, the only living being within. I have not left any escape routes for her. Do you, the Tribulation Crossing Sect, expect to follow her?" Yi Jue Daoist immediately looked dejected: "Saint Emperor, please reconsider. Can that tree spirit, which has only recently been born, achieve anything on its own? In the vast Star Sea, it might encounter some disaster and perish on the way. Won't the Saint Emperor's escape plan be abandoned midway..."

Li Ping waved his hand, interrupting him. Staring at the inverted spiritual tree, he corrected: "It is not an escape plan, but the preservation of information."

Yi Jue Daoist sighed mournfully, "What's the difference?"

Li Ping squinted his eyes, remaining silent. This 【Outside Wood】 not only preserved the image data of all events that had occurred in the Sacred Heavenly Court since its founding. Even the true spirits and memories of those who had fallen during this period, originally residing in the Heroic Spirit Seat, would be transferred here when activated. This was a backup plan conceived by the Saint Emperor, inspired by the theory of information immutability from the Great Evolution Sect, for the entire Sacred Heavenly Court. Or rather, the word "proof" was more appropriate. If Li Ping won, then naturally there was nothing more to say. The Outside Wood would not be activated. But if Li Ping lost, then this Outside Wood would, upon the destruction of the Great Qi, carry the true spirits of the Sacred Heavenly Court's subjects and fly into the depths of the void. If it were a physical entity, it would certainly not escape the Dharma Transmitter's obstruction. But if it were merely information, the Dharma Transmitter might not care. Coupled with the interference from the Tribulation Crossing Sect at that time. It was not that the Saint Emperor had wavered about the decisive battle. After all, there was no place left for any living being in this 【Outside Wood】. It was rather that the Saint Emperor wanted to leave a "proof of existence" for the countless subjects who had followed and believed in him, in the end. Li Ping knew that during the thousands of years of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's rule over half of the Xuanhuang Realm. The Sacred Heavenly Court was not the first to rebel. There had been an example of a coalition of worlds rising up in resistance five hundred years ago. But after their failure, all information about them was erased and sealed by the Myriad Immortals Alliance. It was as if these losers had never existed. Li Ping's action was to prevent such a thing from happening again.

"Even if we lose, our existence will not be erased!"

"If, after many years, the Outside Wood can return to the Xuanhuang Realm, it would be even better." Various thoughts flashed through Li Ping's mind, and he quickly suppressed them.

Chapter 1301: Xuanhuang Wind Disaster

"This formation... Who could it be?!" The Saint Emperor felt both startled and furious in his heart. The Dharma Transmitter, the Heavenly Physician, and even the Xuanxianzhou from the distant Star Sea were clearly not the ones who set up the formation. In this sea of stars, who else possessed the power to set up a grand formation that made him tremble with fear?! And what was the Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate, who had recently descended but never revealed himself, doing all this time! Countless thoughts flashed through the Saint Emperor's mind. The golden needles outside the star sea continued to fly in endlessly. Dense and fast, they alternated between substance and illusion. The Saint Emperor, who already couldn't block all these golden needles, now sensed that the Xuanhuang Realm seemed to be inexplicably in crisis. To make matters worse, the Heavenly Physician seemed completely unaware of this. "Heavenly Physician! Xuanhuang Realm!" Helpless, the Saint Emperor roared in warning towards the outside of the star sea. The continuous rain of golden needles seemed to pause slightly, but it did not stop. However, the positions where the golden needles landed on the Xuanhuang great land had indeed changed slightly compared to before. It should be that the Heavenly Physician had also perceived the hidden changes in the Xuanhuang Realm and was attempting to reverse them through the formation. But... "It's useless!" The Saint Emperor could see that it only slightly delayed the speed at which the catastrophe descended. The intangible, unknown formation was still in the process of preparing to descend. His own spiritual sense's instinctual warning made the Saint Emperor feel an inexplicable sense of dread. Suppressing his inner unease, the Saint Emperor's mind raced, and he finally decided to ignore the Heavenly Physician's golden needles for now and reluctantly returned to the Xuanhuang Realm. "Find the Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate!" The Saint Emperor's voice echoed. In the current Xuanhuang world, golden needles were everywhere. Most living beings were in a deep slumber. The Tianyang who had previously blocked the Dharma Transmitter had a body that was already heavily damaged. But he persistently stood in front of the Dharma Transmitter. However, the Dharma Transmitter also gradually sensed the imminent crisis facing the Xuanhuang Realm, and his movements gradually slowed down. Otherwise, Tianyang's immortal puppet body might have been completely destroyed. His vast divine sense swept across the Xuanhuang Realm repeatedly, but he couldn't find the trace of the Great Heavenly Venerate. "The Woood, the Earth Veins, the Stone Slabs!" The Saint Emperor tried to communicate with them through the connection of the Origin Force Essence Net. However, they all seemed to have collectively disappeared, and none of them responded. The Xuanhuang Realm before him was like water about to boil. The Saint Emperor could only watch powerlessly as everything happened, unable to find the source of the heat that was boiling the water. In the sky, the Dharma Transmitter's phantom image suddenly appeared, dispersing all the clouds. Manifesting the Dharma and heavenly form, he looked down upon Xuanhuang. His gaze was like a torch, sweeping back and forth. On the great land, golden light continuously emanated from the golden needles, spreading outwards. With each flash, the golden needles pulsed, encircling the Xuanhuang Realm. This magnificent scene was the combined effort of the Dharma Transmitter and the Heavenly Venerate, searching the heavens and earth. They aimed to find the whereabouts of the mastermind. But an unbelievable scene occurred. Despite the combined efforts of the two strongest cultivators in the star sea, and after nearly half a day, they still found no trace. It was as if the mastermind simply did not exist. ... While the three peerless powerhouses of the star sea gathered, yet were at a loss, deep beneath Tongyan Prefecture. The secret chamber, originally only measuring one zhang square, had now transformed into endless void. At the edge of the void, where the ritual to enter the Immortal Slaying Realm was located, it was now enveloped by an indescribable mystical power. This was the power that drove all cultivators to madness: the power of Immortal Essence. The power of Immortal Essence, like a gentle stream, like faint threads of light, circled the ritual, opening up endless void. The Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate, whom the Dharma Transmitter, Saint Emperor, and Heavenly Physician had searched for so hard, and the mastermind behind all the turmoil, were here! Let alone Li Fan's current avatar, even if Li Fan's true body were to personally arrive, with his current strength, he would not be able to manipulate the power of Immortal Essence. He could not even touch or comprehend it, at best he could only look at the moon and quench his thirst. The reason why the power of Immortal Essence could be integrated into the immortal formation deduced by the Terminal Dissolution Disc... In the void, Sun Tianci still maintained the posture he had before entering the Immortal Slaying Realm trial. Two vastly different auras, divine and demonic, emanated from his body simultaneously. Although the intensity of the divine aura far surpassed the gloomy demonic energy, facing the aggressive demonic energy, the divine aura could only retreat repeatedly. Even if it could unleash its power at any moment and completely sweep away the entangled demonic energy, Sun Tianci still did not do so. His brows were tightly furrowed, and his face showed sorrow. "Fortunately, I made a backup plan..." Sensing that Wu Ninglu, whom he had released, was causing chaos in Sun Tianci's sea of consciousness, Li Fan sneered inwardly. Myriad demonic thoughts constantly gnawed at Sun Tianci, while also emitting malicious curses. "I carried you for three years and gave birth to you. How did you treat me?" "Not only did you steal my Heavenly and Earthly Essence that I merged with the Dao, but you also watched me die with folded arms!" "You are truly my mother's good son!" "Everything you have now was snatched from me! You shouldn't have lived from the beginning!" "Come on! Kill me again! Let me scatter my soul and be utterly annihilated!" ... Facing his mother's revenge, Sun Tianci chose to bear it silently. He could naturally feel his mother devouring his power, but this was precisely what he wanted. In Sun Tianci's perception, although Wu Ninglu had manifested as myriad demonic thoughts, they were all chaotic consciousnesses filled with madness and destructive intent. If the subject of her vengeful desires, him, no longer existed, these demonic thoughts would dissipate into the heavens and earth before long. And if that were the case... He, Sun Tianci, would truly never see his mother again. Since childhood, Sun Tianci, who had memories since birth and witnessed firsthand how he "killed" his own mother, had always been filled with guilt. This time, he was prepared to save her. In Sun Tianci's perception, as the demonic thoughts consumed more of his energy, their chaos gradually decreased. As long as he continued to "feed" them, his mother would eventually calm down completely. It seemed like cutting flesh to nurture his mother, but it was far from exaggerated. After all, the power of the Great Heavenly Venerate was like a vast ocean, boundless and endless. Compared to it, his mother's myriad demonic thoughts were merely a school of fish in the vast sea. However, it would take some time for Sun Tianci to complete this feeding process. Sun Tianci was naturally aware of all the drastic changes happening in the Xuanhuang Realm. The Fated Saint Emperor, the Dharma Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, and the countless golden needles that appeared at the end made Sun Tianci, the newly appointed Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate, feel extremely troubled. However, due to his responsibilities, he had to save the Xuanhuang Realm. To be honest, it was somewhat difficult for him to accomplish this alone. Fortunately, he had his master's help. After experiencing the trials of the stories he had heard since childhood in the Immortal Slaying Realm, and after seeing his master's true form before sending him into the Immortal Slaying Realm, Sun Tianci naturally understood his extremely mysterious master's true identity. He was precisely the remnant wisp left behind by the previous Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate, Su Bai, after his demise. Driven by the obsession to save the Xuanhuang Realm, he attached himself to him. He had been nurturing and teaching him since childhood, and finally helped him succeed as the Great Heavenly Venerate. Although his master had not explicitly stated all of this, Sun Tianci had deduced it from the many details of his daily interactions with his master and his experience of inheriting the Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate position in the Immortal Slaying Realm. After all, besides the previous Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate, who else could be so clear about the details and answers of the inheritance trial? Although he had just succeeded and a large amount of complex memories flooded his mind, which he hadn't had time to sort through, his master could already skillfully use the power of Immortal Essence to set up formations... Sun Tianci's mind couldn't help but recall his master's words just now. It was when he successfully inherited the position of Great Heavenly Venerate and awoke from the Immortal Slaying Realm. His master looked at him with a look of relief and said, "You didn't disappoint me, good child." Then he earnestly admonished him, "Ten thousand years have passed, and the Xuanhuang Realm is no longer the Xuanhuang Realm it once was. Since the immortal path is cut off and the immortal realm no longer exists, from now on, the Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate should only be the Great Heavenly Venerate of the Xuanhuang Realm, not the Great Heavenly Venerate of the Xuanhuang Realm in the immortal world..." "Now, the Xuanhuang Realm is the only pure land in the sea of stars. Outsiders are all coveting the Xuanhuang Realm. Since you have succeeded, you must bear the responsibility of the Great Heavenly Venerate and protect Xuanhuang." "The Dharma Transmitter, the Heavenly Physician, the Xuanxianzhou... perhaps only that Saint Emperor will stand with us." "The time you've left me is too short. You've only just succeeded, and you might even struggle to deal with the Dharma Transmitter..." "The only chance to turn the tide lies in the ancient guardian formation!" Sun Tianci's mind was suddenly filled with some blurry memories. "Master, do you mean..." "After inheriting the position of Great Heavenly Venerate, you should have simultaneously inherited the power of Immortal Essence after detonating the immortal artifact?" Li Fan asked. "Yes." Sun Tianci nodded. His master was merely a remnant soul, and many years had passed. It was normal for his memory to be somewhat incomplete. Knowing about the Great Heavenly Venerate's legacy further proved his identity. Hearing Sun Tianci's affirmative answer, Li Fan looked at the Xuanhuang Realm below, his eyes flashing, "The guardian formation has been abandoned for ten thousand years. It has even been repaired by the Xuan Tian Sect..." "But even so, as long as it is activated, it can successfully block these invaders. It might even be possible to kill them." "Just mobilize a small amount of that Immortal Essence power, like this..." Sun Tianci, recalling the formation diagram he received from Li Fan, awakened some of his inherited memories. The traces of the formation in the diagram almost perfectly matched, except that, as his master said, some parts had changed over time. The mysteries of the immortal formation were endless. Sun Tianci, as the newly appointed Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate, was not yet proficient in it. Just as he was about to ponder further, Sun Tianci sensed that the Dharma Transmitter had already returned to the Xuanhuang Realm, seemingly searching for his whereabouts. Sun Tianci's heart tightened. The strength of this Dharma Transmitter was no less than his own, if not stronger. If he didn't use those immortal artifacts. But within the Xuanhuang Realm, immortal artifacts could not be easily used. Especially since he had not yet familiarized himself with the use of the four immortal artifacts inherited from the Heavenly Venerate's legacy. If he were to accidentally injure the Xuanhuang Realm... That would be a grave sin indeed. The situation was urgent, and Sun Tianci decided to follow his master's advice and activate the ancient guardian formation to deal with the Dharma Transmitter. He had almost complete trust in his master, and his own understanding of formations was not precise. Whatever Li Fan said, Sun Tianci would do. Everything was proceeding smoothly at first. Unexpectedly, just as the formation was about to take shape, his mother, who had already died, suddenly appeared in Sun Tianci's sea of consciousness for some unknown reason. Transforming into myriad demonic souls, burning with the flames of revenge, she instantly overwhelmed Sun Tianci's mind. That familiar, incredibly intimate aura, the face that only existed in memories and dreams, had now turned into vengeful spirits seeking his life. It made Sun Tianci's mind fall into utter chaos. Li Fan seemed to have sensed Sun Tianci's discomfort and quickly transmitted a serious reminder: "This is your karma and original sin. You must resolve it with your own heart." "Although you merged with the Dao at birth, you incurred a blood debt because of it. The resulting inner fear and anxiety could not be calmed even by the Immortal Heart Incantation." "It has always been hidden in the depths of your heart, growing with you. When you inherited the position of Great Heavenly Venerate and gained immense power, she also transformed because of it and finally manifested. However, for you, this is also a rare opportunity. As long as you can resolve this inner demon this time, you will have no flaws from now on..." Li Fan quickly reminded Sun Tianci while saying, "The changes in the formation should proceed as I instructed. Focus on dealing with your inner demon." It must be known that Sun Tianci was, after all, only a child less than ten years old. Although he had accidentally inherited the position of Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate through a stroke of luck, facing his longed-for birth mother, he was inevitably overwhelmed by his emotions. Li Fan's continuous teaching and guidance over the years had also made Sun Tianci subconsciously obey his orders. A terrifying immortal formation based on the Xuanhuang Guardian Formation was thus slowly taking shape. Sun Tianci, the "power source," was still unaware. He only saw that after the Heavenly Physician forcibly interrupted and restored the process of Xuanhuang's fusion with the golden needles, it further strengthened his resolve to use the immortal formation. Li Fan's avatar, with an infatuated expression, looked at the immortal formation about to take shape. There were no dark thoughts of killing or destruction in his heart, only a sense of awe and admiration at witnessing the Great Dao. "This is true formations." "What is deduced is ultimately different from what is seen in reality, with subtle differences." "Let me see if the Dharma Transmitter, Heavenly Physician, and others can survive in this immortal formation..." As the saying goes, spilled water cannot be retrieved. Once this grand formation was completed, even if Sun Tianci, as the "power source," discovered it and wanted to stop it, he would be powerless. Only he, the one who set up the formation, could make minor adjustments during the activation process, but he could not reverse the entire process. Li Fan sensed the Dharma Transmitter and others still searching for his trace in the Xuanhuang Realm, and coldly snorted. He was ready to activate the grand formation at any time. ... After searching fruitlessly several times, the Saint Emperor released the Dao Yi spiritual energy he had absorbed back into the Xuanhuang heavens and earth, pondering a solution. The unease in the Saint Emperor's heart had reached its peak. The Dharma Transmitter Heavenly Venerate was also in the same state. Finally, as if making a decision, the Dharma Transmitter's figure briefly disappeared and then reappeared. With a solemn expression, he held an ancient bronze mirror. The Saint Emperor's pupils contracted. He could sense a faint aura of Immortal Essence from this mirror. "The true form of the Heavenly Profound Mirror?" The Dharma Transmitter tossed the Heavenly Profound Mirror high into the sky. The ancient bronze mirror grew with the wind, and its ephemeral body instantly covered the entire Xuanhuang Realm. The celestial canopy disappeared, replaced by the mirror surface covering everyone's heads. Beneath the Heavenly Profound Mirror, even the Saint Emperor felt a sense of being completely exposed. Instinctively, starlight enveloped him, obscuring the Heavenly Profound Mirror's vision. Two lines, one black and one white, interwove and emitted from the surface of the Heavenly Profound Mirror. They extended infinitely, instantly encompassing the Xuanhuang Realm. Then, continuous black and white lines swept across. As the black and white lines swept across and merged into the Xuanhuang heavens and earth, the Heavenly Profound Mirror above also slowly revealed the scene of the Xuanhuang Realm. Not only mountains, rivers, lakes, and seas, but also all living beings within them. Only the Saint Emperor, the Dharma Transmitter, and others were not included. However, as the black and white lines continued to sweep, the Saint Emperor's figure also gradually appeared within the Heavenly Profound Mirror. The Saint Emperor looked up at his blurry image in the mirror. For some reason, he felt that the figure was subtly different from his real self. The Xuanhuang Realm seemed to have fallen into a state of stillness, awaiting the results of the Heavenly Profound Mirror's search. Only the Heavenly Physician's golden needles continued to move, traversing the Xuanhuang great land, as if trying to completely restore the Xuanhuang Realm to its pre-war state. The scene within the Heavenly Profound Mirror became clearer and clearer. Various locations were ruled out. The Dharma Transmitter had already begun to search the remaining areas. The Saint Emperor was also doing the same. The former enemies had now tacitly cooperated once again. After all, whether the Xuanhuang Realm evolved into the Dharma Transmission Realm or not, the existence of the world beneath their feet was the prerequisite for everything. Just as Li Fan's hiding place deep beneath Tongyan Prefecture was about to be exposed, a figure quietly appeared outside the Great Qi's small world, unnoticed by anyone. In the void, blocked by layers of formations set up by the Saint Emperor. Within it, sealed and carefully placed by the Saint Emperor, was... The ruins of the Yi Shi Sect, carrying the Mielu Wind Calamity and the remains of the Grand Master. And, a faceless stone statue. That figure was another avatar of Li Fan. Previously, after separating from the fabricated personality of the Infinite Mirror and using the Dharma Derivation Jade to deduce the Harmonious Dao cultivation technique and cause trouble within the Myriad Immortals Alliance, this avatar had been in hiding. It had been silently waiting for an opportunity. Now, he had finally waited for his chance. "After such meticulous planning for so long, how can I allow it to be disturbed at the last moment?" "Bring them back for me..." Facing the obstruction of the layers of formations, Li Fan's avatar ignored them all and flashed directly into the formation. At the same time. The Saint Emperor's expression changed drastically within the Xuanhuang Realm. He had already sensed the figure that had quietly appeared outside the Great Qi's small world. He felt a sense of familiarity that made his heart tremble! Without delay, starlight pierced the heavens and descended directly into the Sacred Chao Great Qi. Then, he urgently fled towards the void outside. However, it was already too late. In the previous moment, Li Fan's avatar had already instantly deciphered all the formations. The items placed on either side were then gathered together. The avatar detonated itself, leaving no trace. Using the last bit of power from the avatar's explosion, it fiercely swept the faceless stone statue towards the ruins of the Yi Shi Sect. Just as the stone statue was about to collide with the ruins of the Yi Shi Sect, the remaining avatar, transformed into a sharp sword, directly slashed at the head of the faceless stone statue! Boom! Boom! Boom! Although it looked like an ordinary stone statue, the moment the avatar's sword collided with the stone statue, a power descended as if instantaneously. There was no obstruction to the desecration of the stone statue, as if it had merely glanced at it casually from afar. But because of this action, it attracted the attention of... the Mielu Wind Calamity lurking within the ruins of the Yi Shi Sect. The being residing in the stone statue disappeared instantly. However, the terrifying Mielu Wind Calamity did not stop. A storm slowly began to form in the void outside the Great Qi's small world. The Saint Emperor's figure, arriving a step too late. The storm had already engulfed the entire ruins of the Yi Shi Sect. The terrifying energy fluctuations, even from afar, made this Supreme Realm expert feel an infinite sense of crisis. It was like a weak mortal facing a world-destroying catastrophe. There was nothing he could do but watch. Cold sweat dripped from his forehead, and the Saint Emperor quickly regained his senses. Without any reservations, he summoned all his golden Origin Force essence, attempting to prevent the spread of the Mielu Wind Calamity. At the same time, countless Rift Breaking Whales emerged from the Sacred Dynasty, cutting off the void where the wind calamity was located from the Sacred Chao Great Qi. The Origin Force essence, infinitely close to True Immortal power, was no match for this Mielu Wind Calamity. It shattered upon contact. The Saint Emperor could not retreat and could only continue to try and block the wind calamity with the Origin Force essence. A beam of white light also blocked the path of the spreading Mielu Wind Calamity. The one who arrived was a tall figure with a high crown and long beard, holding a bronze mirror. It was the Dharma Transmitter Heavenly Venerate. The Dharma Transmitter's expression was also unprecedentedly grim, no longer calm. And the Heavenly Profound Mirror in his hand was flashing warnings as if it had seen something extremely terrifying. The Saint Emperor transmitted the scene he had just sensed of the Yi Shi Sect ruins being triggered to the Dharma Transmitter. The Dharma Transmitter did not say much, only manipulated the Heavenly Profound Mirror to emit ancient green rays of light, attempting to seal the Mielu Wind Calamity. Even with the combined efforts of the two Supremes, they were still unable to completely block the Mielu Wind Calamity. This terrifying wind calamity seemed capable of devouring everything. Even the void was its target for annihilation. Following the loopholes in the Dharma Transmitter and Saint Emperor’s defensive line, the wind calamity, like a rolling tide, engulfed everything in its path and headed towards the Xuanhuang Realm. Once the wind calamity erupted in the Xuanhuang Realm, all living beings within, including the Xuanhuang Realm itself, would likely be destroyed by this tribulation from the immortal world. Just then, several golden needles suddenly came from afar. Like unmoving pillars, they formed an indestructible dam, firmly blocking the Mielu Wind Calamity that had slipped through the net! The wind calamity raged, and the light of the golden needles dimmed. Soon, the dam collapsed, and the wind calamity continued to surge forward. However, in front of it, countless golden needles followed closely behind, forming a continuous series of wind-blocking dams, obstructing the path of the terrifying wind calamity. A benevolent old man, with the arrival of the golden needles, also appeared in the void. As if performing a difficult medical treatment, the old man's expression was solemn, and he continuously shot needles. At the same time, he unleashed streams of light, landing within the Mielu Wind Calamity ahead. The Saint Emperor saw from afar that those lights seemed to be extremely old objects, carrying an aura of silence and coldness. After falling into the wind calamity, they seemed to attract the wind calamity, causing it to gather and surround them, forming small whirlpools. The appearance of the whirlpools absorbed most of the energy of the wind calamity. Thus, this terrifying calamity that erupted from the void outside the Great Qi's small world began to show signs of weakening. The benevolent old man did not show any signs of relief because of this; instead, he became even more cautious. The golden needles in his hand did not stop, and he continuously shot them out, completely sealing those whirlpools. With a slight force in his hand, accompanied by a pulling sound, the wind calamity whirlpools were captured by the old man along the golden threads. His mouth opened slightly, and he actually swallowed the golden needle seals containing the Mielu Wind Calamity into his abdomen! The Dharma Transmitter seemed accustomed to this. The Saint Emperor, however, showed a look of shock. It seemed that this Heavenly Physician's strength was even superior to his and the Dharma Transmitter's. In the Heavenly Physician's eyes, besides the wind calamity, there seemed to be nothing else. He completely ignored the Dharma Transmitter and the Saint Emperor. One golden needle after another fell, slowly sealing and swallowing all the Mielu Wind Calamity into his abdomen. This action was by no means an easy task for the Heavenly Physician. Every so often, he needed to take a short rest. Fortunately, with the combined efforts of the three Supremes, they finally managed to extinguish this world-ending tribulation in its infancy. Looking at the void that had returned to calm, the Saint Emperor, somewhat exhausted, still felt a lingering sense of dread. If this extermination calamity had erupted directly in the Xuanhuang Realm, rather than in the void, they might not have been able to save it in time. As the Saint Emperor was contemplating this, he suddenly noticed that the Dharma Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician, who had resolved the calamity, were still standing in the void with stern expressions. Their gaze was not directed at the Xuanhuang Realm, nor at the Saint Emperor's location. Instead, it was directed at... a blurry Dao child phantom that had appeared at some unknown time! The Dao child stood silently with his eyes closed. It seemed as if he did not see the others present. However, the Dharma Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician regarded him as if facing an extremely formidable enemy. "Grand Master Tiandu?" The Saint Emperor was startled in his heart. He recalled the remains of the Grand Master within the Yi Shi Sect ruins encountered earlier, which had now completely vanished into the Mielu Wind Calamity. He never expected... that it would attract the appearance of this legendary Grand Master! The Grand Master's realm had already transcended the current limits of the star sea. It transcended the so-called Supreme. Although it was merely a phantom, the Saint Emperor could not discern whether it was real or illusory. Judging by the expressions on the faces of the Dharma Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician, they were also greatly shaken by the sudden appearance of this Grand Master. The Grand Master remained motionless, and the Dharma Transmitter and others dared not act rashly. For a moment, a stalemate ensued. However, the Saint Emperor sensed that the progress of the formation being assembled in the Xuanhuang Realm was still continuing nearby. Just as the Saint Emperor decided to disregard the Grand Master in front of him and return to the Xuanhuang Realm to continue searching for the mastermind, a voice suddenly came from above the Grand Master's phantom. The three Supremes' hearts tightened, and they listened attentively. "Dao, ancient. Xin, annihilation." "Xing Nian Xiu, Tong Yi, Wang Shen." "..." Initially, the words sounded incomprehensible and nonsensical. But as they listened, a glimmer of understanding suddenly flashed through the Saint Emperor's heart. This was actually an immortal scripture!

Chapter 1302: Return to the Void and Finally Return to the True

Returning to Truth Ultimately Brings Reality (7K)

"A thousand lines of soul shifting, a hundred turns of spirit transmuting."

"No blame."

…

The illusory figure's transmission of the Dao continued.

Not through sound or divine sense, but directly resounding in everyone's minds.

Even the Saint Emperor, Dharma Transmitter, and Heavenly Physician present, though deeply concerned about the safety of the Xuanhuang Realm, were uncontrollably drawn into the immortal incantation spoken by the Dao child.

Only when the immortal incantation was finished and the Dao child's illusory form became even more blurred, its voice faint and indistinct, did the three regain their senses, covered in cold sweat.

They exchanged glances, tacitly flying backward, away from the Dao child's illusory form.

The Dao child's illusory form did not stop them, as if its mission had been completed, allowing the three to depart.

The voice of the Dao transmission grew weaker and weaker. Finally, it disappeared into the void along with the Dao child's illusory form.

The three watched this scene, their expressions subtle.

They pondered the reason for the illusory figure's sudden appearance to transmit the Dao, and its subsequent vanishing.

At the same time, the three were savoring the immortal incantation.

Immortal incantations differed from mortal cultivation methods, being extremely arduous and obscure. Especially since the Dao child's illusory form simply recited the incantation's content directly, without any explanation.

Although the Saint Emperor and the others could be said to have reached the pinnacle of comprehension in the mortal realm, wanting to understand an entire immortal incantation in such a short time was a bit of a stretch. They could only guess at the general idea.

"Not a cultivation method, but an incantation for avoiding disaster. Within it, there also seems to be some recording of the Immortal Realm…"

The Saint Emperor's mind raced, but his movements did not stop. He returned to the Xuanhuang Realm.

The Dharma Transmitter followed closely.

As for the Heavenly Physician, he had disappeared at some unknown time.

Casting a casual glance towards the direction of the Dao Source State of Xuanhuang Realm, the Saint Emperor did not sense the aura of Heavenly All Awakening.

"Even as Xuanhuang Realm is about to be destroyed, it remains unmoved."

"Yet it took the initiative to show itself just now…"

"Is it because of the erasure of the Wind Calamity?"

Though his heart was filled with questions, this was not the time for deep investigation. Many thoughts flashed by, and the Saint Emperor focused on the current state of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Outside Xuanhuang Realm, an endless rain of golden needles continued to fall. However, the power released after the golden needles landed had undergone a subtle change compared to before. With a glance, the Saint Emperor discerned a trace of the reason. If before it was administering a strong medicine during a critical illness, now it was conditioning after recovering from a serious illness. The power of the golden needles was much gentler and soothing.

Faint thunder rumbled, and continuous light rain fell.

Like the Awakening of Insects, when all things revived and flourished.

The tumultuous Xuanhuang Realm surprisingly presented a scene of vibrant life.

If not for the hidden, faintly discernible aura of a great formation.

Worthy of the name [Heavenly Physician], it had actually, in such a short time, relied solely on golden needles to forcefully restore the Xuanhuang Realms that had entered fusion. Making the Xuanhuang heavens and earth repeat its original appearance. What was even more commendable was that the heavens and earth themselves had not suffered any damage as a result.

Healing the Heavens as Heals a Man, the golden needles reversed life and death. Wanting to reach such a realm could not be accomplished solely through high cultivation level. It also required a full understanding of the essence of the world.

The Saint Emperor, who had once merged with the Heavens and had an extremely close connection with the heavens and earth, now knew in his heart. He would definitely not be able to reach the level of the Heavenly Physician.

"But even a figure like the Heavenly Physician cannot find the mastermind behind the scenes…"

The Saint Emperor's heart was extremely heavy.

Since returning from the void outside Great Qi, the Xuanhuang Realm felt increasingly ominous to the Saint Emperor.

Before, it was water boiling in a pot, but now it was only a line away from the water boiling.

Anytime that quality change might be achieved.

The Dharma Transmitter and Heavenly Physician sensed it as well, no longer holding back, and finally made their moves.

In the heavenly cities of each state, at the location where the statue of the Dharma Transmitting Heavenly Venerable originally stood. Now, regardless of whether the statue still existed, with spatial vibrations, a illusory giant Dharma body appeared, overlaying the original one.

Like points of light that lit up one after another, shining on a large part of the Xuanhuang Realm.

At the Five Elders Assembly, five different colored dots of light lit up at the same time.

Six colors, strung together into lines.

Like the meridians of the Xuanhuang Realm, shining brightly in broad daylight.

"Soul Sealing!"

"Realm Replacement!"

The Heavenly Physician's stern voice echoed through the heavens and earth.

The Dharma's body again practiced Dharma's Body.

The Heavenly Physician vaguely appeared on the top of the Dharma's body’s head.

Then his right hand pinched a seven-colored needle.

With a solemn expression, he pierced it into the Dharma Transmitting’s hundred meeting acupoint.

The Dharma's body instantly erupted with a dazzling seven-colored light.

Then, like melting, flowed like light towards the constantly flashing meridians of the Xuanhuang Realm below.

Silently, the seven-colored light looped a full circle the moment it flowed into the meridians of the Xuanhuang Realm.

After a moment of stillness, the seven-colored light flowed through the meridians again.

"Soul Sealing Realm Replacement?"

"Is the Heavenly Physician temporarily sealing the soul of the Dharma Transmitter, importing it into the Xuanhuang heavens

Chapter 1303: Looking Back and Reviewing

"Anchor at three years, peak of Jieli Mountain."

Li Fan, who was in seclusion, suddenly opened his eyes.

His state of mind was disturbed, and he could no longer maintain his calm.

He let out a long sigh, slowly rose, and walked out of the wooden house.

He stood at the cliff's edge, gazing into the sea of clouds, the mountain wind rustling his robes.

After a full half a day, Li Fan's state of mind finally calmed down.

In the past three years, this scene had not been the first time.

Unlike before.

When Li Fan successfully "returned to truth" to anchor 1 year ago, the experiences of past reincarnations still deeply affected him.

It was not a passive influence, like being caught in the True Immortal's web, but rather a problem with Li Fan's own mindset.

Even with the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra protecting him, he could not escape.

Whenever his mind quieted down, the scene of the cat treasure leaping out of the darkness and swallowing the True Immortal's phantom would suddenly emerge from the depths of his memory.

Breaking into a cold sweat, his mind became chaotic.

He could no longer maintain a state of tranquility.

"Cat treasure, cat treasure..."

Li Fan's gaze flickered, and he repeatedly muttered these two words.

The cat treasure, despite possessing powers such as item duplication, creature mimicry, and marrow cleansing, was only of white quality when fished out of the Fishing Pond.

The Fishing Pond was subtly the creation of an unnamed True Immortal who had comprehended the Dao of Fishing.

And how could the cat treasure, capable of deceiving the Fishing Pond, be simple?

The cat treasure's consumption of refined origin essence as food also indicated its extraordinary nature to some extent.

However, neither the Saint Emperor, who considered himself a player, nor Li Fan, who believed himself to be the strategist, had expected...

That the cat treasure would be such a terrifying creation.

Immortal energy could be wielded like True Immortals themselves. Even if it was just a phantom, it could effortlessly suppress the "Immortal Descent, All Things Return to Void" great array that shattered Xuanhuang Realm. In stark contrast, the three Taishang realm powerhouses of the Star Sea could barely survive within the immortal array even with their utmost efforts.

The gap between Taishang and True Immortal was immeasurable.

And the cat treasure, capable of swallowing a True Immortal's phantom in one bite...

Its true strength was unimaginable.

In the previous life, Li Fan "returned to truth" amidst the chaos of the Star Sea's instability and the crumbling of the high wall. The impact caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to perish.

At that time, Li Fan's clone in the immortal array's core, utilizing the array's residual power, vaguely sensed. The turmoil of the Star Sea was not entirely due to the crumbling of the high wall.

It was also caused by the sudden descent of some entity.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

This was the deeper reason why Li Fan could not truly calm his mind for the past three years.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

When the familiar scenery appeared before his eyes, Li Fan was almost exhausted, drenched in cold sweat.

Thinking of this, Li Fan drew his file, and the perfectly carved cat sculpture was instantly ruined.

Li Fan tossed it aside, took out another piece of wood, and began carving.

He was using wood carving to confront the deep-seated fear in his heart, in an attempt to eliminate the influence the cat treasure had on him.

It did have some effect.

The frequency with which Li Fan woke up from nightmares about the cat treasure had greatly reduced compared to three years ago.

However, Li Fan knew very well that it would take a long time to truly resolve this "inner demon."

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

In the final moments of the previous life, the Star Sea was in turmoil. The impact of the crumbling high wall caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to be unable to bear it and perish.

At that time, in the immortal array's core, Li Fan's clone, utilizing the array's residual power, vaguely sensed. The turmoil of the Star Sea was not entirely due to the crumbling of the high wall.

It was also caused by the sudden descent of some entity.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

When the familiar scenery appeared before his eyes, Li Fan was almost exhausted, drenched in cold sweat.

Thinking of this, Li Fan drew his file, and the perfectly carved cat sculpture was instantly ruined.

Li Fan tossed it aside, took out another piece of wood, and began carving.

He was using wood carving to confront the deep-seated fear in his heart, in an attempt to eliminate the influence the cat treasure had on him.

It did have some effect.

The frequency with which Li Fan woke up from nightmares about the cat treasure had greatly reduced compared to three years ago.

However, Li Fan knew very well that it would take a long time to truly resolve this "inner demon."

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

In the final moments of the previous life, the Star Sea was in turmoil. The impact of the crumbling high wall caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to be unable to bear it and perish.

At that time, in the immortal array's core, Li Fan's clone, utilizing the array's residual power, vaguely sensed. The turmoil of the Star Sea was not entirely due to the crumbling of the high wall.

It was also caused by the sudden descent of some entity.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

When the familiar scenery appeared before his eyes, Li Fan was almost exhausted, drenched in cold sweat.

Thinking of this, Li Fan drew his file, and the perfectly carved cat sculpture was instantly ruined.

Li Fan tossed it aside, took out another piece of wood, and began carving.

He was using wood carving to confront the deep-seated fear in his heart, in an attempt to eliminate the influence the cat treasure had on him.

It did have some effect.

The frequency with which Li Fan woke up from nightmares about the cat treasure had greatly reduced compared to three years ago.

However, Li Fan knew very well that it would take a long time to truly resolve this "inner demon."

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

In the previous life, during the final moments, the Star Sea was in turmoil. The impact of the crumbling high wall caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to be unable to bear it and perish.

At that time, in the immortal array's core, Li Fan's clone, utilizing the array's residual power, vaguely sensed. The turmoil of the Star Sea was not entirely due to the crumbling of the high wall.

It was also caused by the sudden descent of some entity.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

When the familiar scenery appeared before his eyes, Li Fan was almost exhausted, drenched in cold sweat.

Thinking of this, Li Fan drew his file, and the perfectly carved cat sculpture was instantly ruined.

Li Fan tossed it aside, took out another piece of wood, and began carving.

He was using wood carving to confront the deep-seated fear in his heart, in an attempt to eliminate the influence the cat treasure had on him.

The frequency with which Li Fan woke up from nightmares about the cat treasure had greatly reduced compared to three years ago.

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The frequency with which Li Fan woke up from nightmares about the cat treasure had greatly reduced compared to three years ago.

However, Li Fan knew very well that it would take a long time to truly resolve this "inner demon."

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

In the previous life, during the final moments, the Star Sea was in turmoil. The impact of the crumbling high wall caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to be unable to bear it and perish.

At that time, in the immortal array's core, Li Fan's clone, utilizing the array's residual power, vaguely sensed. The turmoil of the Star Sea was not entirely due to the crumbling of the high wall.

It was also caused by the sudden descent of some entity.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

When the familiar scenery appeared before his eyes, Li Fan was almost exhausted, drenched in cold sweat.

Thinking of this, Li Fan drew his file, and the perfectly carved cat sculpture was instantly ruined.

Li Fan tossed it aside, took out another piece of wood, and began carving.

He was using wood carving to confront the deep-seated fear in his heart, in an attempt to eliminate the influence the cat treasure had on him.

It did have some effect.

The frequency with which Li Fan woke up from nightmares about the cat treasure had greatly reduced compared to three years ago.

However, Li Fan knew very well that it would take a long time to truly resolve this "inner demon."

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

In the previous life, during the final moments, the Star Sea was in turmoil. The impact of the crumbling high wall caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to be unable to bear it and perish.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

In the previous life, during the final moments, the Star Sea was in turmoil. The impact of the crumbling high wall caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to be unable to bear it and perish.

At that time, in the immortal array's core, Li Fan's clone, utilizing the array's residual power, vaguely sensed. The turmoil of the Star Sea was not entirely due to the crumbling of the high wall.

It was also caused by the sudden descent of some entity.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

When the familiar scenery appeared before his eyes, Li Fan was almost exhausted, drenched in cold sweat.

Thinking of this, Li Fan drew his file, and the perfectly carved cat sculpture was instantly ruined.

Li Fan tossed it aside, took out another piece of wood, and began carving.

He was using wood carving to confront the deep-seated fear in his heart, in an attempt to eliminate the influence the cat treasure had on him.

It did have some effect.

The frequency with which Li Fan woke up from nightmares about the cat treasure had greatly reduced compared to three years ago.

However, Li Fan knew very well that it would take a long time to truly resolve this "inner demon."

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

In the previous life, during the final moments, the Star Sea was in turmoil. The impact of the crumbling high wall caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to be unable to bear it and perish.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.
