At that time, in the immortal array's core, Li Fan's clone, utilizing the array's residual power, vaguely sensed. The turmoil of the Star Sea was not entirely due to the crumbling of the high wall.

It was also caused by the sudden descent of some entity.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

When the familiar scenery appeared before his eyes, Li Fan was almost exhausted, drenched in cold sweat.

Thinking of this, Li Fan drew his file, and the perfectly carved cat sculpture was instantly ruined.

Li Fan tossed it aside, took out another piece of wood, and began carving.

He was using wood carving to confront the deep-seated fear in his heart, in an attempt to eliminate the influence the cat treasure had on him.

It did have some effect.

The frequency with which Li Fan woke up from nightmares about the cat treasure had greatly reduced compared to three years ago.

However, Li Fan knew very well that it would take a long time to truly resolve this "inner demon."

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

In the previous life, during the final moments, the Star Sea was in turmoil. The impact of the crumbling high wall caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to be unable to bear it and perish.

At that time, in the immortal array's core, Li Fan's clone, utilizing the array's residual power, vaguely sensed. The turmoil of the Star Sea was not entirely due to the crumbling of the high wall.

It was also caused by the sudden descent of some entity.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

When the familiar scenery appeared before his eyes, Li Fan was almost exhausted, drenched in cold sweat.

Thinking of this, Li Fan drew his file, and the perfectly carved cat sculpture was instantly ruined.

Li Fan tossed it aside, took out another piece of wood, and began carving.

He was using wood carving to confront the deep-seated fear in his heart, in an attempt to eliminate the influence the cat treasure had on him.

It did have some effect.

The frequency with which Li Fan woke up from nightmares about the cat treasure had greatly reduced compared to three years ago.

However, Li Fan knew very well that it would take a long time to truly resolve this "inner demon."

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

In the previous life, during the final moments, the Star Sea was in turmoil. The impact of the crumbling high wall caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to be unable to bear it and perish.

At that time, in the immortal array's core, Li Fan's clone, utilizing the array's residual power, vaguely sensed. The turmoil of the Star Sea was not entirely due to the crumbling of the high wall.

It was also caused by the sudden descent of some entity.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

When the familiar scenery appeared before his eyes, Li Fan was almost exhausted, drenched in cold sweat.

Thinking of this, Li Fan drew his file, and the perfectly carved cat sculpture was instantly ruined.

Li Fan tossed it aside, took out another piece of wood, and began carving.

He was using wood carving to confront the deep-seated fear in his heart, in an attempt to eliminate the influence the cat treasure had on him.

It did have some effect.

The frequency with which Li Fan woke up from nightmares about the cat treasure had greatly reduced compared to three years ago.

However, Li Fan knew very well that it would take a long time to truly resolve this "inner demon."

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

In the previous life, during the final moments, the Star Sea was in turmoil. The impact of the crumbling high wall caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to be unable to bear it and perish.

At that time, in the immortal array's core, Li Fan's clone, utilizing the array's residual power, vaguely sensed. The turmoil of the Star Sea was not entirely due to the crumbling of the high wall.

It was also caused by the sudden descent of some entity.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

When the familiar scenery appeared before his eyes, Li Fan was almost exhausted, drenched in cold sweat.

Thinking of this, Li Fan drew his file, and the perfectly carved cat sculpture was instantly ruined.

Li Fan tossed it aside, took out another piece of wood, and began carving.

He was using wood carving to confront the deep-seated fear in his heart, in an attempt to eliminate the influence the cat treasure had on him.

It did have some effect.

The frequency with which Li Fan woke up from nightmares about the cat treasure had greatly reduced compared to three years ago.

However, Li Fan knew very well that it would take a long time to truly resolve this "inner demon."

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

In the previous life, during the final moments, the Star Sea was in turmoil. The impact of the crumbling high wall caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to be unable to bear it and perish.

At that time, in the immortal array's core, Li Fan's clone, utilizing the array's residual power, vaguely sensed. The turmoil of the Star Sea was not entirely due to the crumbling of the high wall.

It was also caused by the sudden descent of some entity.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

When the familiar scenery appeared before his eyes, Li Fan was almost exhausted, drenched in cold sweat.

Thinking of this, Li Fan drew his file, and the perfectly carved cat sculpture was instantly ruined.

Li Fan tossed it aside, took out another piece of wood, and began carving.

He was using wood carving to confront the deep-seated fear in his heart, in an attempt to eliminate the influence the cat treasure had on him.

It did have some effect.

The frequency with which Li Fan woke up from nightmares about the cat treasure had greatly reduced compared to three years ago.

However, Li Fan knew very well that it would take a long time to truly resolve this "inner demon."

He also decided to take this opportunity to review and ponder thoroughly.

In the previous life, during the final moments, the Star Sea was in turmoil. The impact of the crumbling high wall caused many powerful cultivators who had survived the world-ending immortal array to be unable to bear it and perish.

At that time, in the immortal array's core, Li Fan's clone, utilizing the array's residual power, vaguely sensed. The turmoil of the Star Sea was not entirely due to the crumbling of the high wall.

It was also caused by the sudden descent of some entity.

Like a giant rock falling into a deep pool, stirring up countless ripples, it had stirred up monstrous waves in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, which had already been turbulent!

This was a major upheaval that the Utmost Darkness Star Sea had not experienced in ten thousand years since the severing of the immortal path.

In such a chaotic and perilous situation, due to his decisiveness and alertness, Li Fan had indeed successfully "returned to truth" and returned to Anchor Year 1.

However, the scenes he experienced during the return to truth this time were different from before.

The normal vision of returning to truth involved the surrounding scenery dimming, as if covered by a layer of mist, making it unclear. After returning to truth, all scenes would freeze, shatter, and fly into one's mind.

When facing extreme threats, such as when Xuanhuang was annihilated by a True Immortal's gaze in the Immortal Ruins, or when a faceless True Immortal sought him out. These powerful beings could move within the frozen scene surrounding the return to truth, but at a very slow pace, as if Li Fan and the space outside were in different time dimensions.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected, but the surrounding scenery, as if wrapped in fog, would flicker intermittently. It was like an old television signal losing its reception.

At that moment, Li Fan's mind was almost blank.

He had no means to counter; he could only await his final fate as if undergoing judgment.

Fortunately.

The return to truth was ultimately successful, and he, Li Fan, once again returned to Anchor Year 1.

But the vision Li Fan experienced in the previous life was completely different.

The scene outside the return to truth seemed to remain frozen as if unaffected,

Chapter 1304: Still Really Changed

The Changes Are Real (7K, Seeking Monthly Tickets!)

Li Fan should have been unable to embark on the path of cultivation. Originally, when traveling from Great Xuan to Azure Glass Island, the removal of the Immortal-Mortal Taint within his body almost completely severed his path to cultivation. Fortunately, with the double blessing of the Xuanhuang Heart-Cleansing Mantra and the Cleansing Spirit Pool, he was able to formally begin cultivating.

And as he shed his taint, the Xuanhuang Heart-Cleansing Mantra officially transformed into the Xuanhuang Heart-Tempering Mantra. The Xuanhuang Mantra thus became his unique Dao foundation, accompanying him throughout his cultivation.

The higher Li Fan's cultivation, the more the Xuanhuang Mantra Dao foundation expanded. Like pillars, it became an important part supporting Li Fan's cultivation. However, in the previous life, when Li Fan spread the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra on a large scale, the consequence was that these Dao foundation pillars... Became weakened due to excessive division.

His main body's Dao foundation was not only the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra but also included the [Returning to Truth] and the experiences gained from a hundred lifetimes. Therefore, the impact was minimal. However, this negative effect brought about by the separation was naturally amplified in his clones and divided spirits. The weaker the separated entity, the more evident it became.

It wasn't just him who was affected by the widespread dissemination of the Immortal Heart Mantra. Even the Immortal Heart Mantra itself became less effective because of this spread. This could be indirectly seen from the performance of the Azure Profound Army and the Great Qi Forbidden Army, who cultivated the Immortal Heart Mantra in the previous life, during the great battles. They barely managed to remain calm in the face of danger, but they were far from achieving the [Enduring a Thousand Lifetimes of Tribulation, Yet the Immortal Heart Remains Unchanged] as described in the orthodox Immortal Heart Mantra!

The difference became even clearer when Li Fan returned to the truth in this life and solely possessed the Immortal Heart Mantra once more.

"The Dao cannot be cultivated simultaneously..." "It seems that it's not just the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao suppressing the sudden evolution of cultivators. But rather, it's something that has been deeply imprinted in the depths of the Xuanhuang Realm, originating from some tradition in the Immortal Realm." "Hmm, perhaps it's not just about the Dao not being cultivated simultaneously. It's also closely related to the position of the Great Heavenly Venerate of Xuanhuang."

Undoubtedly, the Immortal Heart Mantra that Mister White passed on to the world to counteract the power of twisting the Xuanhuang's inverse principles, its origin should be from the Great Heavenly Venerate of Xuanhuang. The Great Heavenly Venerate of Xuanhuang, appointed by the Immortal Realm, wielded Immortal Artifacts and oversaw Xuanhuang.

Within the Realm of Xuanhuang, it could be said to possess unparalleled authority. However, this Great Heavenly Venerate of the Immortal Realm was not so easy to become. Not only was there a colleague of the [Overseer] type secretly restraining it, but inheriting the position of Great Heavenly Venerate also meant inheriting the Immortal Realm's constraints and punishments on the Great Heavenly Venerate of Xuanhuang.

After Returning to Truth to this life, when Li Fan reviewed everything, he finally remembered Sun Tianci, who was burned to ashes by the Fire of Heart Burning.

"Even though the Immortal Path is now severed, the Immortal Realm's countermeasures are still effective." "The Immortal Heart Mantra cannot be spread on a large scale, I'm afraid it's one of the Immortal Realm's various restrictions on the Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate."

Li Fan then recalled what happened after Sun Tianci successfully took office in the previous life. "The Golden Bell of the Great Sun, the Azure Nether Lantern of the Vast Void, the Purple Qi Dream-Weaving Shuttle, the Primal Chaos Five Elements Wheel." These four were the only remaining Immortal Artifacts of the Xuanhuang Realm's Great Heavenly Venerate heritage.

In addition, there was a condensed mass of Immortal Spirit Power, originating from those Immortal Artifacts that Mister White detonated. "After completing the Immortalfall Realm's test, there's still a probationary period before truly becoming the Great Heavenly Venerate of Xuanhuang." "Before the Immortal Path was severed, this probationary period was actually the time to wait for the Immortal Realm to review and appoint." "Now that the Immortal Path is severed, the Immortal Realm's appointment has become empty talk. However, according to the procedure set by the Immortal Realm, if there is no response from the Immortal Realm within three years, then the review is automatically passed. Generally speaking, as long as one doesn't encounter something like Sun Tianci, like the destruction of the Xuanhuang Realm. As long as one silently waits for time to pass, one can obtain the full authority of the Great Heavenly Venerate." "But before that..."

One cannot use the Immortal Artifacts in the Great Heavenly Venerate's legacy. This was one of the reasons why Li Fan's Divided Spirit easily persuaded Sun Tianci in the previous life. In the face of an oppressive Law-Transmitting Heavenly Venerable, the newly appointed Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerate simply didn't have the ability to contend with him.

"According to Sun Tianci, there are no artifact spirits inside these Immortal Artifacts bestowed by the Upper Realm. The Xuanhuang Heavenly Venerate of the Lower Realm has no Immortal Spirit Power and can only rely on the restrictions left by the Immortal Realm to expend the Immortal Artifact's own power to drive them." "In a sense, they are unabashed consumables. When Mister White collected them one by one, it's hard to say how many times these Immortal Artifacts had already been used. It's really hard to say how much power is left." "But after all, they are Immortal Artifacts. It's no different than letting treasures gather dust if they're not used in the Immortalfall Realm. In this life, they still have to be retrieved. Not to mention that there is also that mass of pure Immortal Spirit Power."

Having personally used Immortal Spirit Power to set up the world-destroying Immortal Array, Li Fan truly understood the power and transcendence of [Immortals].

Within his sea of consciousness, the Terminus Disintegration Disc radiated an extraordinary seven-colored light. Within the radiance, a true [Immortal Array] was being deduced non-stop. Immortal array birth, Immortal array operation, Immortal array destruction.

During the process of the All Things Return to Void Array destroying the world in the previous life, the Terminus Disintegration Disc collected sufficient array data. As if it had truly completed the transformation between Immortal and Mortal, it could now spontaneously deduce Immortal Arrays according to Li Fan's needs, just like deducing Mortal Arrays.

Even though the deduction speed was extremely slow and the load on the Disintegration Disc was extremely high. But under the orderly arrangement of the Disintegration Disc's simulated personalities, it would not affect Li Fan's normal cultivation.

Currently, the main direction of the Terminus Disintegration Disc's immortal array deduction was Immortal Array downgrading. At the cost of slightly reducing the array's power, they hoped to drive it with a slightly lower level of energy. The immortal and Mortal were different and there was no way to create Immortal Spirit Power on a large scale. Therefore at present this main route was best in theory. Even if he could harvest some from the Great Heavenly Venerate's legacy, it would not be enough to support Li Fan's plan in this life. But the Source Power Essence, which was infinitely close to Immortal Spirit Power, was almost inexhaustible for him. If he could achieve driving immortal arrays with Origin Power Essence, it would undoubtedly save a lot of trouble.

Even if Law Transmitter and Heavenly Physician returned to the Xuanhuang Realm, he could handle them easily. He would no longer need to create a Saint Emperor clone so laboriously to compete with them. In the previous life's doomsday world array, Li Fan had a clear understanding of the true strength of Law Transmitter and Heavenly Physician. With a baseline of established strength, he can consider himself familiar with how to deal with them.

"As long as I don't push them to the brink, with the Immortal Array as guarantee, it would be alright to invite them to have a good talk, right?"

A transparent shadow flashed before Li Fan's eyes after his main body was obliterated.

During the doomsday storm at that time he could observe a little bit.

However, he felt a faint familiar aura from that transparent shadow.

"There is an opportunity in this life, maybe I can verify it."

When True Immortals descended, everything in the Xuanhuang Realm was like ants. The Cat Treasure leaped out, and was able to swallow even the True Immortal's Mirage.

The gap between Xuanhuang Realm and the outer barrier became apparent. But that did not mean everything in Xuanhuang Realm lost its value. When Li Fan was Mortal Grand Tutor, the gap between himself and the Immortals of Xuanhuang was the same as the gap between Xuanhuang Realm and the star wall today.

However, after going through an iteration for more than hundred times, Li Fan had already made Xuanhuang a chess piece. What if those beyond the barrier were to somehow be obtained? If he could experience that, maybe there would be a way to reverse things.

He quickly suppressed the thought.

That said, these would come later. For now, the best course of action was to remain well-prepared. With that thought, he created a perfect statue. "This should it, right?"

In the file in his mind, the perfectly sculpted sculpture turned to ashes, and Li Fan threw it away.

Li Fan retrieved another piece of wood, and began creating.

He was making wood carvings to face the deeply embed fear in his heart, trying to push the Treasure Cat out of his mind. There was some effect.

The number of nightmares regarding the Treasure Cat were beginning to lessen, but he knew it would take some time to get past this. He also planned to reflect.

When it came to the end, the high wall collapsed, leading to the downfall of many powerful cultivators, and only the clone utilizing the array power was able to do something. How was there to say, his feelings were simply that with the great array, things were not entirely bad. It was the method to deal the Dao.

Though his cultivation might be slower, it was the best route. He could look into matters. It was almost 127 iterations from the start. That meant he'd gotten through more than one. Then, suddenly.

Anchor at three years, peak of Jieli Mountain.

The words entered his mind.

The state of mind he was in was disturbed to the point he could barely keep it together.

Then, he took his tools. A perfect statue came to be. Xu Fan and the others should be at their destination.

"Wait until I've secured my authority to find the others."

He was more mindful to the power now. He was able to touch upon aspects he had not before. Power was a tool that had its own applications. A sudden voice broke him from his train of thought.

"What did you see?"

"There are those that cannot be seen… If one looks too deeply, they risk…"

It came from further ahead. It was a place he knew well. He was now prepared. To set up the formation he had before.

Right, if the war was starting now, he'd best get moving. Sun Erlang.

"Looks like it's come faster than I thought."

That was too bad. He had not been able to find anyone else.

And, this time for sure… He needed strength.

"I need it, or I may not be ready at all."

The Sacred Army, the elite that would see the Sacred Dynasty rise for all that was coming. Then, just where should they start?

It wasn't as simple to just start moving. There were things to test. They needed time to be ready. Sun erlang's expression turned solemn.

"I won't give any order for us to throw our lives away. We will win. We will survive this."

And that would give them time. More than them, it seemed.

"Still not ready, hmm."

"I still need another."

What he needed was an anchor point. An understanding. A bond.

They all thought they had the answer.

Then, as it came to be, what would follow?

He could feel it. All of it getting closer

But no, wait.

He turned to the sky.

Now it was getting more and more interesting as everything unraveled.

"This has some kind of feel of an interesting game about to begin"

There was plenty of action to be had. Plenty to consider. He would do so and consider. And, make the plan, for it all. At that time just the path would be free.

"I will survive, right up to the very end."

His goal was set. He would take what must be gathered, and prepare to make the correct choice. Soon, the pieces for their side would be in effect. And in play. And then things would properly ramp up. That wasn't all that would happen.

Time enough remained. The chess pieces were being set. Or had they already been made? There had been some thought on the matter. Then, in another universe.

They may very well be more. He could try to gather them, but not just now, no.

"Right well, I need that power to make my way as well."

He was being a bit greedy, he thought. That was something to reign in at all. He had many of this to test. And as it came and went, there would need to be a time where it was right. The universe or the multi universe. He would need the means for it all. That said, and set…

Time could be of an essence here or there, to know something would need to come to play . In time. He thought, looking for this thing that might have been. His mind was on it. He could see it was so.

Even to those that had helped the past there were strings to pull. To cut things he need but would there really be an end at all? From the infinite. That was for all to see and know. For what really he thought or felt? That was up to him. There were limits though. So, he best not force any hand.

“It will have to be more than luck this time to be sure.”

With whatever tools he could acquire. He needed to be smart as hell.

It all started and ended with the core. The soul

"Right, who am I kidding… It's only luck so far."

And it would be so for a while to come. He needed it. And he needed to make use of it.

The situation became clear it would be best to consider it at all cost. He might be able to do things if they were ready now.

So, for now, he would put it away.

So, it seemed a test run was necessary. "That won't do at all."

The whole plan seemed to fall to pieces… But it could also work. So, all the pieces set. At last. Well, that was to set the chess that needed to be. Others, where doing their setting. Some as him, and others against. If all would end, it would be as fate may spin the wheel.

Still, there was so much to go from here. "It's not enough now, I need the strength first"

This was a long road indeed. Very long at that.

First. He needed what he needed. In time. He would.

He would think more on everything before doing what followed. The plan this time would be made to be more concise. He had the skill to do so. That, and he trusted none. So, it would be left to him. In its majority. Again. He didn't mind. This was simply what he had to do after whatever was to unfold. Too bad really.

These guys would be good to work with if they were not what he knew.

Time needed to move. Nothing was moving. Things and people, it was all getting odd. Then, from there he would be moving around. The plan started the moment he knew what next to do. Still, he felt there was little more than knowing the path ahead. More, he feared someone walking toward him. This world might have been big but it was small as compared to the rest.

"Well… In enough time, sure I'll get on it when it is done."

He laughed. These thoughts were running circles around his head.

"Now then, I want to end these thoughts"

And begin setting out.

He would keep some distance from people. But still watch. That seemed to be his only option.

With some words, whatever this was may actually hold still. To what it took to get out he would.

The thing with having a plan or not, was how far did all that go? No point in holding on to more. Still, there was time for all of what would be. All that said.

To where they were, the wind was calm. Right now it seemed time. A few steps forward and what was there to face but to trust himself. The best plan that could never be for one did not make the choice. He would. So what was needed?

A few things to be had. But first…

"Wait there"

He would need that guy on their side if what he thought it was. He wouldn't say things out loud. But it was what it was.

He would follow and help for now but there was a path.

After a long time the steps needed to come.

There needed to be something more to it than that. When to take or not was still something to weigh. But he had had the need to do so for a long time.

If nothing else he would wait.

To feel something and make whatever decision. The right, choice.

And whatever came after. That plan was his only tool. Now, if that much was done. Well then, he wait as he may and see to what would come.

Time seemed to freeze every step of the way as new revelations were being gained. Would that stop or simply pause for whatever might show itself when it may?

"Hah… Seems it wants that still, so there."

He shrugged.

A few steps away now until the point where he said.

So be it. The world.

It would tremble. It would be so.

And only a few more years until a turn. What would come of it? At all?

If the cycle changed with him then the results better had shown so.

For good this would be the last time. He would make for now. At once everything set the only path of hope would need take stride

As it was. So simple. That was what it needed to be. He was now at.

It. There was still an exit left. It was to find that one. Then be, it so.

All of the planning to come to this end all with that one goal in mind.

To become what must when even when the self disappears, the intent stands. He didn't even know if that made any sense. It didn't have to. It only happened. Was. Is now to be seen when what was always done might actually need to be so with no choice beyond?

Then again. Where was the choice that would actually change destiny?

Not by words, or deeds, but only by what has never been. That path would be his to take and see.

Then. He had the one. He had the time. Set, go.

Here there not. To be continued. That would be his.

The last step was to take the stage. When a final push had made all right at all. When just being, when all was put to what to be with not to choose when the heart must see.

He started carving again. His mind set. A new path he would now make.

There was an entity that was about to arise. That entity was him.

Now. With his purpose. Was just a moment. The entity opened his eyes to what was. All, must do so now.

"See? Ha… I've done it."

Again.

There the moment for him was. But to where it needed came and went to see this day set free again. He started once more.

A new test. A challenge. A path to see.

The plan began. In a different light for now!

He still needed the strength to keep it going. But he had to get up. So, one deep breath.

One, two for three, his purpose shown. What would come after?

He could hear. That was to have the choice or not.

The stage was set. One last time.

Here he stood now. As it should. His hand.

The power as he knew. Then knew no more to that which was his.

"This is the end"

He was off to see. What did stand by all the tests he had made as of yet?

This would be the mark he needed to climb across the walls of what he had known?

What came from a power.

He did not know. But would find out.

At all costs? Or for what? He couldn't say.

I want to do it. His hand he held now as new pieces for him appeared.

And what were they now? There and seen. The last pieces.

That, was all then.

With a smile he started, and began carving with. That and what else? What was known to only him? And where to test? So be it. Then. He would try.

Would see. All things.

With the plan. As of now set, no time was to waste. At least did he feel so. Here to where he wanted done. What steps might be to follow?

Then again, in what form must his purpose carry forth? I do not know, I will not pretend.

But must I see that, then here goes. All to do, it. All again.

Then what would be the next? If I knew maybe all was set. It was not. But that doesn't stop what must happen just there at all.

The last steps had been taken. The long nights and trials to be had.

Only what was right for he for now that one.

"Now begin carving."

He began moving once more to take that stage.

It must to be. For something. For now. The time, for it has stopped.

……

The words came to enter, the end of time,

It was not, that time will do so to try again.

Would he be strong enough to bare the weight?

“Let us see how that will go.”

【Detected new variable effects, you can now chose an extra attribute to retain?】

【Would you like to retain:

一the items you possess?

二The tier you have reached?

三The memories of that that has served you longest on your way.

Or

四- Give it up all, to move the wheel?】

李凡 thought everything needed as he thought was to be tested.

All the words was he as ever set the things that were going what can come or not.

This to him was what held up this time of when it finally all.

The things which came to. Make or do with. Would not all this to set before in line. These things to say. Not do that now but did it and there was more set more like it as well.

All thing to. Set or keep it so it will. Come so to let by whatever thing there was all.

Then so. Set so done. All too for one to to have knew things all. It all was set what that might set on too.

Then, came he, at all. With all these to see which things may had been done for too.

……

Chapter 1305

第1305章 计划启动（7K，求月票！）

“变量干扰么……”

李凡目光闪动，继续思索还真这额外的提醒。

“变量干扰，是相对于我既定的计划而言的。也就是说，这个【变量】，会直接影响到我既定的计划，使得我无法以期望的方式进行。”

“而还真这么想要吞噬的话，恐怕不是什么好事。”

“甚至有可能是会打破轮回平衡，给我带来无法想象的灾难。”

念及此处，李凡心中一定，眼神反而是更加的平静。

“倒要看看，这暗藏在高墙之外的，究竟是什么！”

“不入虎穴，焉得虎子！区区诱惑，就想让我改变策略，真是小瞧我了！”

说罢。

李凡深吸一口气，朝着

Chapter 1305: White Circle Falls to the Mortal World

White Circle Descends to the Mortal Realm

"When the real is treated as the false, the false becomes real."

"The change between truth and falsehood holds infinite mystery~"

Li Fan recited the words in his heart once more, filled with joy.

Although it only lasted for a moment, he had indeed "conjured" the Nascent Divinity cultivation of his previous life out of thin air.

However, as it was his first attempt at this great divine power, the cultivation that had been transformed flickered like a dream bubble, disappearing in an instant.

Li Fan was not discouraged by this, but remained exceedingly delighted.

To create something from nothing in the void, even legendary True Immortals might not be able to achieve that.

However, he was able to accomplish it in a preliminary fashion, with insight gained from multiple [Returning to Truth] simulations.

As the saying goes, everything is hard at the beginning. With this first success, in the future, he would surely become more and more familiar with wielding this divine power.

"Not just my own cultivation. The objects I have experienced and possessed, and even…"

"Each and every different person, the Xuanhuang Realm, the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, and the entirety beyond the High Wall. One day, all of them can be re-manifested with a single thought!"

Li Fan stood above the sea of clouds, savoring the sensation when wielding the Transformation of Truth and Falsehood, his heart surging.

It took a long time before he finally recovered from his epiphany.

Looking at the inheritance options on the Returning to Truth Panel, he first chose to inherit his cultivation.

The same scene replayed, with continuous rumbling in the sky above Great Xuan.

This was caused by the invisible infusion of Li Fan's Nascent Divinity cultivation into the small world.

However, compared to the scene when he inherited his cultivation in the previous life, Great Xuan Small World, due to its world transformation caused by the [Creation] True Immortal Seal character earlier, did not show any signs of being unable to bear the burden.

It merely had dense dark clouds and various strange phenomena.

"Hoo…" When the familiar power of cultivation returned to his body, Li Fan let out a long sigh.

Next, his gaze locked onto the second inheritance option.

The inherit cultivation option had become dim, leaving only options 1, 3, and 4.

Without hesitation, Li Fan chose to inherit items.

The items he possessed in the experiences of his previous life, including those of his divided spirits and his true body, all instantly appeared in Li Fan's mind.

Waiting for him to quietly select.

His gaze swept over them slightly, and after pondering for a moment, he finally settled on a plain-looking white circle.

Before it was fished up, the Saint Emperor had not completely separated from Li Fan's main body, so the white circle was also regarded as an item he once possessed.

After selecting and confirming, the light in his hand flickered, and finally condensed into a simple white circle.

It felt slightly cool to the touch. When divine sense swept over it, no fluctuations of spiritual energy could be sensed.

It seemed that because it was transformed by [Returning to Truth], there was no need to refine it to acknowledge its master. While holding the white circle, Li Fan already had a sense of being able to freely use it.

Furthermore, outsiders could not snatch it away.

Li Fan looked at the name displayed for the white circle on the Returning to Truth Panel.

"[Descended to the Mortal Realm]."

Stroking the white circle, Li Fan muttered these three words, but in his heart, he was thinking about the correct way to use the white circle.

"Go!"

Li Fan threw the white circle towards Mount Dissolution below.

With a thought, the white circle grew as it met the wind, instantly enveloping the entire mountaintop.

Then, it fell downwards.

When the white circle landed, the mountain that had been encircled along the way disintegrated and vanished inch by inch in front of Li Fan.

Turning into spiritual energy, it dissipated in Great Xuan's heaven and earth.

The thousands of feet of Mount Dissolution disappeared into thin air just like that. The innumerable creatures that inhabited the mountain uncontrollably fell from the air because of the mountain's sudden disappearance. If it weren't for the spiritual energy that rose from the white circle disintegrating Mount Dissolution to hold them back, Mount Dissolution would probably have been reduced to hell in an instant.

The area could now perhaps be called Dissolution Circle.

The earth was like being cut by a knife in one entire piece, smooth as a mirror.

The Mount Dissolution creatures who had lost their home frantically fled, driven by instinctive fear.

Before long, the originally vibrant Mount Dissolution had become a forbidden zone for life.

Li Fan took a long breath and absorbed all the spiritual energy obtained from the disintegration into his body.

This bit of spiritual energy was not even a drop in the bucket for the current him. Primarily, it was to analyze the spiritual energy of the [Descended to the Mortal Realm], and what the difference was from ordinary heaven and earth.

After careful tasting, Li Fan came to a conclusion.

There was no difference at all.

This spiritual energy even gave Li Fan an extremely familiar feeling, as if it was something that Great

Chapter 1306: The Changing Realm Between Immortals and Mortals

The Transformation Between the Mortal and Immortal Realms (7K)

The primary task of this life is to achieve the Dao by merging his soul with the Essence of Heaven and Earth of a Super Xuanhuang Realm. Before achieving this goal, it might be wise to avoid these two individuals.

"The 【Soul Sealing and Realm Replacement Technique】 is also mentioned in the Heavenly Physician's 【Mending Heaven Records】."

"A realm is like a person. Just as a person can undergo possession, so too can a world."

"However, there are two preconditions for successfully replacing a realm. First, the divine sense serving as the 'Realm Soul' must be incredibly strong. At the very least, it cannot be much weaker than the world's Heavenly Dao's original consciousness. Otherwise, during the brief process of realm replacement, the world itself will undergo an inward collapse. It would be a disaster comparable to the destruction of the world."

A transparent figure within the Dharma Transmitting body flashed in Li Fan's mind, and his gaze shifted slightly.

"Secondly, the performer must achieve complete suppression of the world. They must cause the world's consciousness to completely fall into slumber. If two consciousnesses exist simultaneously, it is highly likely to cause the world to split…"

"The Heavenly Physician, the Dharma Transmitter, and the five Heavenly Venerates of the Five Elders Council working together can indeed accomplish this."

Combining the contents of the 【Mending Heaven Records】 with the Heavenly Physician's textbook-like practical operation, a flash of insight suddenly appeared in Li Fan's mind.

"Soul Sealing and Realm Replacement… Now that the Heavenly Dao consciousness of the Great Xuan Small World has just been born, it is an excellent opportunity for me to try my hand."

Li Fan looked up, his eyes piercing through the earth, directly reaching the skies of Great Xuan.

As if pierced by a sharp arrow, a seven-colored vortex appeared in the sky. No one in Great Xuan, except for Li Fan, could perceive it.

Within this seven-colored vortex, the world's consciousness, like an infant, was slumbering.

Fearing that a rough action would disturb it, Li Fan carefully separated a wisp of divine sense, infiltrating and approaching it.

Then, he comprehended with all his heart.

In an instant, the rising and falling winds and clouds, the ebb and flow of the tides, the falling flowers and blooming flowers within the Great Xuan World, all sorts of worldly phenomena appeared before Li Fan.

It was as if these changes were happening on himself.

As his comprehension deepened, in addition to natural phenomena, the joys, sorrows, fears, and terrors, birth, aging, sickness, and death of the Great Xuan beings also began to appear in Li Fan's mind.

He felt the same as the Heavenly Dao.

This would be a rare opportunity for most cultivators in the world. Immersing themselves in it, calmly comprehending, it would not be difficult to grasp a single move or half a trick of earth-shattering great divine power.

However, Li Fan actively withdrew from this process of sudden understanding.

Maintaining a state of semi-consciousness, semi-enlightenment.

"Mimicry, Myriad Aspects of Living Beings!"

With a shift of heart, a semi-transparent figure of Li Fan then appeared within the starry vortex in the skies of Great Xuan.

All the comprehension gained from the Great Xuan Heavenly Dao was infused into it.

The semi-transparent figure gradually changed, as if rejuvenating, from the appearance of a middle-aged man, gradually becoming a newly born infant crying out to be fed!

The infant's style of acting was still as experienced as an adult.

Approaching the Heavenly Dao consciousness of Great Xuan which was soundly sleeping, it lunged forward and covered it…

Replacing it!

The Great Xuan Small World instantly fell into violent shaking.

The earth shook, and cracks like scars stretched out from the central starry vortex in the sky.

"Disintegration Disc! Deduction!"

Within Li Fan's sea of consciousness, the Terminus Disintegration Disc temporarily suspended its task of deducing the downgrading of immortal arrays, and instead fully calculated the adaptation of the Great Xuan mimicry personality.

After continuous improvement by the 【Mimicry, Myriad Aspects of Living Beings】 great array, the semi-lit, semi-dim, constantly flickering transparent infant finally became stable.

"Realm Replacement!"

Li Fan, located in the deepest part of the underground, gathered a golden needle in his hand. Then, he shot it towards the sky, the mimicry Great Xuan Heavenly Dao.

Right in the center of its brow, between its eyebrows.

The semi-transparent infant subconsciously let out a slight cry. With the first cry from the Heavens and Earth, the Great Dao was silent. No one in the world could hear it, but in an instant, it spread throughout the entire Great Xuan Small World.

From weak to strong, it became louder and louder. Finally, it became inaudible.

Within this cry of the mimicry Great Xuan personality, worldly anomalies also slowly disappeared, returning to their initial tranquility.

The wounds and vortices in the sky healed, and Li Fan could sense the mimicry personality that had replaced the nascent Heavenly Dao of Great Xuan.

Or rather, it would be more appropriate to describe it as a mimicry Heavenly Constitution.

The nascent Heavenly Dao consciousness of Great Xuan was not destroyed by Li Fan, but rather forcibly suppressed and sealed into slumber.

All slow growth of the Heavenly Dao's consciousness would be absorbed and synchronized to the mimicry Heavenly Constitution. This was to ensure the correct operation of Great Xuan's Heavenly Dao.

It was like nutrients to cultivate and strengthen the mimicry Heavenly Constitution. When the mimicry Heavenly Constitution could fully undertake the Heavenly Dao operation of the Great Xuan Small World, it would completely devour the Heavenly Dao consciousness that had been slumbering since its birth.

Completing a true transformation.

Li Fan carefully sensed the operation of the Great Xuan mimicry Heavenly Constitution. The mimicry Heavenly Constitution was his creation, and all the information it received, he could naturally sense as well. The current situation was as if there was a Heavenly Dao clone, helping him comprehend the Dao at all times.

Although it was only the Heavenly Dao of a small world, it excelled in being continuous, accumulating little by little.

Moreover…

"The first time doing it, the methods were a bit rough. If it weren't for the Terminus Disintegration Disc adjusting in time, I'm afraid the Great Xuan World would have been destroyed by my hands." Li Fan looked at the great ravines caused by the anomalies in the world on the surface of Great Xuan, slightly shaking his head.

"However, with this experience, the subsequent 【Soul Sealing and Realm Replacement】 of other small worlds will surely go much smoother."

Compared to the traditional Realm Replacement Technique in the Heavenly Physician's 【Mending Heaven Records】, Li Fan's improved version used 【Mimicry Heavenly Constitution】.

Originating from 【The Truth and Falsehood of All Things】 and the enlightenment of the Great Xuan Ancient World Protecting Immortal Array 【Nine Star Crimson Pearls】, perhaps only Li Fan in the world could perform this mimicry technique.

The mimicry Heavenly Constitution did not truly possess its own thinking, but merely operated mechanically, completely obeying its creator. Controlling it was more effortless.

More importantly, there were thousands of small worlds in the Xuanhuang Realm. If he used the original Soul Sealing and Realm Replacement Technique, just finding the divine souls of cultivators comparable to the Heavenly Dao consciousness of each world would take a lot of effort. But now, Li Fan himself could solve this problem alone.

Even if he manipulated a large number of small worlds, there was no need to worry about the risk of losing control.

"After these worlds are returned to Xuanhuang, the Heavenly Dao of the small worlds will also merge with the Heavenly Dao of Xuanhuang. Although the size is disproportionate, many ants can still kill an elephant. Coupled with my other methods at that time…"

A wonderful and insidious plan instantly arose in Li Fan's mind.

"Due to my current limited strength, I can only create mimicry Heavenly Constitutions on the scale of small worlds. When I advance further, in the future, I might be able to create mimicry Xuanhuang, or even mimicry Star Seas…"

As he gradually tasted the sweetness of enlightenment in 【The Truth and Falsehood of All Things】, Li Fan increasingly felt that this transformation of true and false was even more so his fundamental source of power than the specific methods of cultivation.

"It's a pity, this Dao is too profound. Even after a hundred lifetimes of reincarnation, I have only managed to comprehend a little. Moreover, this 【The Truth and Falsehood of All Things】 Dao is limited to those with 【Returning to Truth】 to comprehend, so it cannot be emulated."

Li Fan also faintly sensed that for the comprehension of 【The Truth and Falsehood of All Things】, the so-called talent and comprehension discussed in the ordinary cultivation world were useless.

To further explore its true mysteries, the most important thing was actually…

Chance.

Or rather, in more common terms, it depended on the mood of 【Returning to Truth】.

In the previous life, after Returning to Truth came into contact with the so-called 【New Variable Interference】, Li Fan discovered that his understanding of the changes in 【The Truth and Falsehood of All Things】 had obviously become much easier.

Although his own talent and understanding had not changed, it was as if he was closer and more easily touched it. Its mystery reached such depths.

"The Spreading of the Dao, Projections…" Li Fan also thought of the various statements of the Holy Emperor spreading the Dao and the衍法珏little Lori Dharma Jade, narrowmed

Chapter 1307: The Way of the Star Sea Gift

The true immortals used their script to describe the path of immortality. However, the path of immortality also had distinctions in its ranks.

What I saw before, Hungering, Chaos, Solitude, Return, were likely the most basic. That true immortal script which might represent 'Creation' was clearly above them.

And the 'path' represented by this mark hidden within the bodies of the You clan...

The change between mortal and immortal surpassed even 'Creation'!

And [Returning to Truth]...

Li Fan took a deep breath, forcing himself to calm down.

Even after [Returning to Truth] 125 times, and personally experiencing the grand power of resetting all things in the world with a single thought, he knew that [Returning to Truth] was almost beyond everything he knew.

But in his previous life, the process of [Returning to Truth] was interfered with by an unknown variable. Coupled with the terrifying power displayed by the Cat Treasure, which leaped out of the darkness, Li Fan couldn't help but feel a sliver of doubt about the ultimate limit of [Returning to Truth]. As he gradually came into contact with forces beyond the High Wall in the future, would [Returning to Truth] still be invincible like in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea's central region?

This discovery gave Li Fan a sense of reassurance.

The limit of [Returning to Truth] was far more unfathomable than he had imagined.

"The laws of the Xuanhuang Realm can be seen as a downward projection of the laws of the Utmost Darkness Star Sea. And the laws of the Utmost Darkness Star Sea are themselves a downward projection of the laws of the Immortal Realm."

"And [Returning to Truth] stands above everything. Reflecting from top to bottom, theoretically, it can replicate everything I come into contact with through the [False Becomes True] transformation."

"As long as my strength and comprehension are sufficient."

Li Fan recalled the sensation when he was writing that mysterious mark just now, lost in thought.

"This is merely the [False Becomes True] transformation. [Returning to Truth] is not just [False Becomes True]."

"There is also the previous [True Becomes False]!"

As his thoughts raced, Li Fan casually picked up a round stone nearby. Staring intently at the stone, he attempted to directly erase its existence through [True Becomes False].

However, each time he underwent [Returning to Truth], the surrounding world seemed to be shrouded in white mist, making it unclear. Therefore, Li Fan could not know how the process of [True Becomes False] was achieved.

"Perhaps during this life's [Returning to Truth], I can try to actively disperse the surrounding mist," Li Fan couldn't help but think.

"If I can gain enlightenment on this path, with the supreme power of [Returning to Truth], perhaps I can directly bypass a major realm and casually erase opponents..."

As his thoughts churned, Li Fan sorted through the mysterious symbols he had glimpsed by possessing You clan members over the past year, based on the remaining impressions.

Then, he handed them over to the Terminus Disintegration Disc for classification and application.

Simultaneously handling two Immortal Array related tasks, the Disintegration Disc's efficiency inevitably decreased.

"It seems it's time to upgrade the Disintegration Disc again. Pure sublimation triggered by Immortal Array data is ultimately limited by mortal physique."

"The nine initial Disintegration Discs of the Myriad Immortals Alliance are incomparable to the one in my hand. They can provide minuscule help. To completely transform into an Immortal Artifact Disintegration Disc, Immortal Spirit Power is ultimately needed..."

Li Fan pressed his slightly throbbing temples, which were swollen from overwork. After relaxing, he looked at the You clan members present.

They did not feel grief over the death of the person Li Fan possessed.

Instead, they felt exceptionally uplifted by their sacrifice to the great Dark Sea.

Seeing the You clan members' devout demeanor, Li Fan was deeply moved. With a wave of his hand, he instantly collected them all into his body, temporarily suppressing them.

After returning to the Great Xuan Small World, he would provide them with the best living conditions, allowing them to remain in Great Xuan and pray peacefully for the rest of their lives.

"This Small World cannot be wasted either."

The Small World where the You clan resided was even weaker than Great Xuan. Naturally, it had not nurtured a Heavenly Dao consciousness.

Li Fan found it much easier to proceed.

He created a Mimic Heavenly Constitution to directly replace the Heavenly Dao and maintain the normal operation of this Small World.

Then, using the same method, he silently grafted it onto the Xuanhuang Main Realm.

Practice makes perfect. This time, the Art of Healing Heaven went very smoothly.

With another Heavenly Dao clone from a Small World, threads of comprehension, like churning waves, surfaced in his mind from time to time. Even though its status was insufficient, this large influx of enlightenment inspirations could still provide Li Fan with some tangible insights.

"This Heavenly Dao comprehension is useless to me, but for other cultivators, it's a rare sight even in a lifetime." After returning to Great Xuan and settling the You clan members, and after a majority of them had converted their beliefs, Li Fan looked at the densely seated cultivators on the Great Xuan preaching platform, his heart stirred.

Buzz...

A platform emerged in mid-air, beneath the Cultivation Manual Directory Platform and above the disciples.

The platform was carved with scenes of all worlds, all spirits, and all things, yet it was like a living entity, constantly changing, lifelike.

If one looked closely, if they were lucky, they might occasionally spot a seven-colored speck of light within the stone carvings.

Those were the enlightenments from the Mimic Heavenly Constitution that Li Fan could not use. If the cultivators on the preaching platform were fortunate enough to comprehend them, rapid progress in their cultivation, and even the realization of unique divine abilities, would not be difficult.

"The beings on the preaching platform are all under my surveillance. Their inspiration is also my inspiration."

"Although their realm is low, the sparks of thought, magnified countless times, are still brilliant. Even if only one out of ten thousand provides me with inspiration, with the number of cultivators on this preaching platform, accumulating over time will be a considerable wealth."

"Moreover, if necessary, I can also mobilize the preaching platform and manipulate the thoughts of the cultivators on it, making them help me comprehend..."

Inside the preaching platform, a silver-white orb, like an eye, continuously absorbed the inner inspiration from different beings, gradually becoming somewhat eerie, as if coming alive, and slowly rotating around.

The Sacred Master's projection, after initially completing the preaching mission for Great Xuan, further divided a body and traveled to the next Small World.

This new body was not supported by Li Fan's main body's power. Instead, it was formed by the Sacred Master's projection absorbing the faith power from his disciples during his preaching, and then converging.

It was similar to the [Great Sun Emperor's Scripture], but instead of Great Qi becoming Great Xuan, and soldiers becoming students, the Sacred Emperor became the Sacred Master.

The initial stage of expansion would be delegated to these projections. When the act of preaching began to alarm the Myriad Immortals Alliance, or other hidden powerful beings in the Small Worlds, Li Fan would personally intervene to suppress and subdue them.

Before that, Li Fan still needed to prepare thoroughly for the future confrontation.

The You clan members whose faith had been altered by the division had already begun to provide Li Fan with initial Origin Force Essence.

Using this Origin Force Essence as bait, coupled with various threats and inducments, Li Fan, with practiced ease, pulled all his old acquaintances, including Bai, Qiao Gong, and Yin Shangren, into the alliance.

"A great change is about to occur in the heavens and earth. You all may not yet comprehend it. I will now discuss it."

On the Great Xuan preaching platform, Li Fan's main body replaced the projection and sat solemnly.

Below, Yin Shangren and the others listened to Li Fan's sermon.

Li Fan spoke of the revival of the Star Sea, and the resulting scenes of Xuanhuang's revival in the future.

The audience listened with a mixture of belief and doubt.

Li Fan smiled faintly and pointed to the sky, as if opening a vortex to the outside of the Star Sea.

"Everyone, please follow me."

Seven-colored divine rainbow appeared on his body as Li Fan invited everyone to enter.

The crowd exchanged glances, but in the end, they all entered Li Fan's protective rainbow.

A seven-colored light shot up into the sky.

Passing through the vortex in the celestial curtain, in the next moment, they appeared at the boundary of Xuanhuang.

Their momentum showed no signs of stopping, as if they intended to continue their rapid journey into the Star Sea of Xuanhuang.

The faces of the crowd immediately turned pale.

They all knew about the terrifying suction force outside the Xuanhuang Realm. If they left the protection of the Xuanhuang Realm, they might fall into it at any moment, their lives hanging by a thread.

But what happened next was far beyond their expectations.

The seven-colored rainbow light separated into different colors, drawing a curved arc in the Star Sea. It successfully led everyone away from the Xuanhuang Realm!

The crowd was utterly astonished.

Li Fan, however, continued to speed towards the depths of the Star Sea without stopping.

The desolation of the Star Sea filled everyone with sorrow, their eyes showing grief.

The dangers within the Star Sea made everyone's hearts tremble, their expressions growing solemn.

And Li Fan, like a prophet, was always able to navigate around the dangerous areas of the Star Sea, which made everyone look at him with admiration. They all speculated how many times Li Fan had traveled to the starry sky to be so familiar with it.

However, as they ventured deeper into the Star Sea, Li Fan's speed also slowed down.

He seemed to be discerning the direction as well.

Yin Shangren and the others had the right feeling. After all, in the previous life, when the Saint Emperor gained enlightenment from the center of the Star Sea, his connection with his main body had become increasingly faint.

Therefore, this journey to witness the revival of the Star Sea would be more difficult the further they went, requiring Li Fan to find his own path.

Fortunately, he was following a map.

Li Fan, relying on his innate senses, had already touched the origin consciousness of this Star Sea. However, in the previous life, the Saint Emperor had attracted the attention of the Star Sea's origin consciousness by using the [Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao] clone and his identity as a potential savior.

This life, Li Fan had not yet revealed himself, nor did he possess the qualifications to be noticed by the Star Sea.

Li Fan also had no intention of exposing himself to the Star Sea so early.

But this did not hinder Li Fan's subsequent plan.

"This should be the place." Sensing that it was almost time, Li Fan stopped and looked at the void ahead, sighing slightly.

Everyone heard his words and looked in the same direction with complex expressions.

In their perception, this area of the Star Sea was indeed different from before. It seemed brighter and warmer. But it was still far from what Li Fan had described as "revival."

It still appeared completely desolate.

However, since the other party had gone to such great lengths to bring them here, it was certainly not without reason.

Could it be that my comprehension is insufficient?

A hint of self-doubt flashed through everyone's minds.

Afterward, they all continued to observe with utmost solemnity.

Li Fan noticed the subtle changes in everyone's expressions and smiled without a word.

After a long while, he finally spoke, "Has everyone gained anything?"

In response, there was only silence.

Li Fan feigned a slight look of surprise, pondered for a moment, and then suddenly waved his hand.

He struck several beams of light into everyone’s sea of consciousness.

These were precisely the insights of the Saint Emperor regarding the power of the Star Sea's revival from the previous life.

Everyone’s eyes suddenly lit up.

Around them, subtle traces of life began to appear out of thin air.

Qiao Gong, Bai Hua, and the others had survived since the destruction of the Immortal Realm. Who among them was not a peerless genius?

Previously, because the Star Sea's consciousness was too vast and hidden beneath decay and desolation, they had not noticed.

But now, with Li Fan directly implanting the results of his enlightenment into their minds, they naturally sensed something.

"It's true!" Bai Hua was the most deeply moved.

"If I could control this power of revival, perhaps I could bring the Myriad Sheng Realm back..."

Yin Shangren stroked his head. The residual souls of worlds that he had devoured seemed to be attracted by this power of revival, wanting to emerge from his body.

For a time, everyone was immersed in the face of the vast power of the Star Sea.

Completely oblivious to the fact that Li Fan, who had guided their enlightenment, had already distanced himself from them for some unknown reason.

In fact, Li Fan even used a method close to an Immortal Array to temporarily conceal his traces.

He had a premonition that exposing his existence to the origin consciousness of the Utmost Darkness Star Sea too early would definitely not be a good thing.

"At least until I achieve Dao Integration and reach the pinnacle of the Mortal Realm," Li Fan looked at the enlightened individuals, his eyes flickering.

Everyone woke up at different times, immersed in their enlightenment. Qiao Gong was the first to awaken. His eyes darted around, as if he had thought of a brilliant idea and couldn't wait to return to the Xuanhuang Realm to experiment.

As for Yin Shangren, it seemed he spent a considerable amount of time resolving the residual world souls within his body.

However, to Li Fan's slight surprise, Bai Hua was actually the last to awaken.

From her gaze, Li Fan could feel the joy in Bai Hua's heart.

"Congratulations everyone, you have all gained something."

"The Star Sea is fraught with peril and should not be lingered in for too long. We should return as soon as possible," Li Fan said with a smile.

Everyone nodded in agreement, responding with the etiquette of disciples.

The journey was smooth, and everyone returned to the Great Xuan preaching platform.

As the saying goes, seeing is believing. Having personally experienced the Star Sea, everyone now fully believed Li Fan's words.

The revival of the Star Sea was imminent.

"Everyone, please understand that the desolation of the Star Sea will not be revived overnight."

"Xuanhuang, as the only surviving land in the current Star Sea, should become the source of the Star Sea's revival."

"Only by radiating life from here can we achieve twice the result with half the effort."

After listening to Li Fan's conclusion and pondering for a moment, everyone nodded in agreement.

"There is no greater merit than assisting a rising power."

"If we can contribute to the Star Sea's revival, and when the Star Sea recovers its former glory in the future, the benefits we will receive need not be said," Li Fan said calmly, looking at everyone.

Yin Shangren and the others were clearly tempted.

"Even if the immortal path remains closed, by borrowing its feedback, perhaps we can all advance to become the strongest in the Star Sea," Qiao Gong's eyes flickered with greed.

Chapter 1308: The First Change in the Xuanhuang Realm

"Indeed, how should it be done?" Yin Shangren's gaze was fervent as he pointed out the crux of the matter. Their strengths were actually quite balanced. The old method of achieving longevity, let alone helping the Star Sea recover, was insufficient even to alter the precarious situation of the Xuanhuang Realm. As if doused with a basin of cold water, everyone quickly composed themselves and looked in unison at Li Fan. Li Fan sat solemnly on the Preaching Platform, as if he had anticipated Yin Shangren's question long ago. He answered unhurriedly, "Do you all know that a world is like a person, and the Star Sea is also thus?" "If a person is ill, one prescribes medicine accordingly, and then stimulates acupoints and meridians." "The world and the Star Sea, after suffering calamity, can also be treated similarly..." A human-shaped light projection slowly appeared before everyone as Li Fan spoke. The important acupoints and meridians were all clearly marked. Li Fan made a gentle gesture, and the light projection suddenly transformed. It expanded, diffused, and finally turned into a faintly glowing yellow cloud. The original acupoints and meridians within the human body also followed the laws of evolution and were arranged in various parts of the light mass. Everyone had just returned from the outer void of Xuanhuang. How could they not recognize that this cloud represented the Xuanhuang Realm? As they focused their gazes, Li Fan made another gesture. The light mass expanded again, a thousandfold, ten thousandfold. A splendid scene instantly engulfed everyone, causing them to become lost within it. It was, in fact, a brilliant Star Sea. Everyone vaguely perceived that the spots within the Star Sea that occasionally flickered and emitted a unique radiance were precisely the acupoints and meridians that had previously been within the human body and world! "The transition from man to world, and from world to domain, should be thus!" Yin Shangren mused. The others also seemed to have attained enlightenment. Before they could examine further, Li Fan waved his hand, and the Star Sea instantly reverted, returning to the scene of the Xuanhuang Realm. "To revive the Star Sea first, one must revive Xuanhuang. To revive Xuanhuang, one must foster this place." On the miniature projection of the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan marked various locations. "For thousands of years, the Xuanhuang Realm has been consumed and plundered by cultivators. It should have long been completely depleted.
