However, fortunately, there was the Heavenly Venerate who transmitted the Dharma and continuously collected fragments of worlds from the Star Sea to nourish it. The remnants of worlds are like medicine; although Xuanhuang has consumed them, it has not yet fully absorbed them..." Those speckled marks, emitting a ruddy, crystalline radiance, seemed to contain infinite vitality and energy. The crowd, however, had already understood Li Fan's meaning within his discourse. Simply put, in one sentence: Help Xuanhuang digest the medicinal properties! Li Fan continued, "The Xuanhuang Realm has been weak for a long time and is in danger of not being able to absorb nourishment. Therefore, it needs to be guided and enticed, using acupoints to lead meridians, and points to encompass surfaces..." The sermon lasted for a full seven days and seven nights. After Li Fan's figure dissipated, everyone remained immersed in the principles of the unity of man, heaven, and medicine that he had expounded, deeply moved. It was Yin Shangren who was the first to regain clarity. "The remnants of worlds are like medicine; this metaphor is truly ingenious. Absorption, digestion, and merging into oneself. And that which cannot be absorbed will be completely discarded. These are what are called medicinal dregs..." Qiao Gong, distracted, offered a few perfunctory words and then excused himself. Bai Hua, however, frowned slightly, "Guiding Xuanhuang to digest the remnants of worlds is also not an easy task. The cultivators of Xuanhuang have been in opposition with the Heavenly Dao for so many years, and any action involving the power of the remnants of worlds could provoke the hostility of Xuanhuang's Heavenly Dao. Even if we are doing it for its own good." "That is why we must first resolve this misunderstanding and gain the trust of Xuanhuang's Heavenly Dao," Yin Shangren said, looking towards where Li Fan's figure had vanished. When he departed, Li Fan had said that before he lectured again, he would help resolve this matter. It was just that no one knew what method he would employ. As a soul from the remnants of worlds, Yin Shangren knew better than anyone how difficult it was to resolve the hostility of the Xuanhuang Realm. Seven days later, when Li Fan reappeared, he invited everyone to the sky above the Great Xuan Small World. Arriving here, Yin Shangren felt as if he had fallen into a swamp. Every movement he made faced immense resistance. His essence as a soul from the remnants of worlds offered no help in dissolving this hindering force. He couldn't even discern the source of this inexplicable resistance. Bai Hua and Qiao Gong also wore expressions of extreme solemnity, indicating that they too had sensed the extraordinariness of this place. "Everyone, allow me to introduce someone." Li Fan said with a smile. Then, a hunched old man with white hair appeared before everyone. The white-haired old man's strength was not particularly impressive, but the coffin on his back attracted everyone's attention. The churning resentment emanating faintly from the coffin caused Yin Shangren and the others to narrow their eyes. "This is fellow Daoist Xu Ke, a former disciple of the Beast Taming Sect. Due to a mission, he has been in hiding in this small world, meditating for thousands of years..." After briefly introducing Xu Ke's origin to everyone, Li Fan gestured with his eyes, and Xu Ke took down the coffin from his back. It was suspended in mid-air. As if sensing the watcher's temporary departure, the sealed object within the coffin instantly became more agitated. The coffin lid vibrated incessantly, as if the being imprisoned within would break free at any moment. "Do you all know what is sealed within this coffin?" Li Fan asked. Without waiting for everyone's response, he directly revealed the answer: "It is a strand of Xuanhuang's will." "However, this will has now been filled with negative emotions such as resentment, madness, and paranoia. It has already transformed into an undeniable evil thought of Xuanhuang!" "Today, we are going to purify this evil thought and return it to Xuanhuang!" Li Fan said solemnly. Xu Ke coughed lightly and added, "This evil thought intended to completely sever ties with the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao when it was separated back then. For the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, it is not merely like cutting off a piece of flesh. It is a being akin to a clone." "If we can return it and restore the previously missing part, it will definitely attract the favor of Xuanhuang..." "Of course, the prerequisite is that we can truly purify the evil thoughts within it." Xu Ke looked at Li Fan. Li Fan, on the other hand, was full of confidence. "It's merely an evil thought. With everyone working together, is there anything that cannot be purified?" Qiao Gong, having listened for a long time, became somewhat impatient after learning the true identity of the sealed object in the coffin. "How exactly should we proceed? I will definitely cooperate fully!" "What it hates is merely not leaving back then. Since that is the case, let's fulfill its wish and let it cross the High Wall back then!" As Li Fan spoke, a whisk suddenly appeared in his hand. He raised it high, then swept it down towards the coffin with force. The countless white strands of the whisk, like ten thousand meteors, plunged into the coffin. The coffin, which had been violently shaking, leaped up and then froze in mid-air. The white strands of the whisk emitted a dreamlike silver light. Within the silver light, countless different scenes flashed. They were all dream images injected by Li Fan. Although the dreams were different from each other, they all depicted the great terror and great destruction beyond the High Wall. The Xuanhuang evil thought, attached to Mr. Bai, successfully crossed the High Wall and escaped the Utmost Darkness Star Sea. Each time, it failed to survive for more than three breaths before dying from various unspeakable and unknown disasters. In the blink of an eye, the Xuanhuang evil thought had experienced tens of thousands of deaths in the illusions. Observing this, Qiao Gong muttered to himself, "Isn't this a bit too outrageous? Although the outside of the High Wall is unknown, it shouldn't be like this, right? Even an ordinary-looking cat can swallow it in one bite? This Xuanhuang evil thought, in terms of strength alone, is probably not much weaker than the cultivators of the ancient law. Can it really be tricked into going?" Xu Ke, who had been with the Xuanhuang evil thought for thousands of years, keenly noticed that the struggle within the coffin had indeed weakened, and he could not help but show joy. "It really works!" At this moment, Li Fan's voice also came from above, "Everyone can also help to depict dreams, no matter how bizarre or terrifying they are. As long as the Xuanhuang evil thought ultimately perishes, it will be fine." The whisk's light intensified, expanding to everyone's presence. At the end of the handle, a vortex faintly appeared. Yin Shangren and the others understood implicitly, and each poured their most terrifying imagined dream into it with their intents. Among these, Yin Shangren's depicted dream was the most bizarre and terrifying. Even with Li Fan's current experience, after observing it, he could not help but feel a shiver. Compared to it, the illusions woven by Qiao Gong, Bai Hua, and Xu Ke were much more common. Qiao Gong's dream mostly involved the destruction of worlds, becoming a puppet, and the difficulty of distinguishing between reality and illusion. Bai Hua's dream was related to the withering of life and the freezing stillness of all things. Under the continuous baptism of different terrifying dreams, the Xuanhuang evil thought had already undergone a qualitative change. "Is it really so terrifying outside the High Wall?" "If I had known, I shouldn't have left the High Wall in the first place. Even if I could only survive, it would be better than dying instantly!" Thoughts like these accumulated within the Xuanhuang evil thought with each ended dream. Although each was like a barely noticeable scratch, the speed of dream generation and iteration was too fast. In every moment, hundreds of thousands of dreams disappeared and reappeared. More importantly, these dreams were not just ordinary dreams. They were infused with a trace of Li Fan's understanding of [False Becomes True], making them top-tier illusory formations in the world. From the outside, one might wonder why people within the formation could not distinguish between dreams and reality. But only by being truly within the formation could one personally feel the power of the [False Becomes True] illusion. Li Fan looked at his masterpiece with an kwietnia sense of pride in his heart. "It is derived from [Cloud Water Illusory Dream Technique], but its effect is far superior to the original version." "Coupled with the amplification of the illusory formation... even if it's not an Immortal Array, it's better than an Immortal Array." As the dreams continuously iterated, the Xuanhuang evil thought sank faster and faster. Initially, it would occasionally express doubt and resistance. Later, all its doubts disappeared. All that remained was endless regret and fear. Looking at the trembling Xuanhuang evil thought in the formation, Li Fan knew that this dish was finally ready to be served. "Rise!" Li Fan extended his hand forward, grasping the giant whisk in mid-air. Then, he stirred it slightly. The myriad silver-white strands of the whisk also stirred within the coffin, like sharp blades, incessantly slicing the Xuanhuang evil thought, which had completely given up resistance, into countless small pieces. The sealed coffin also began to become ethereal as the evil thought disintegrated. Li Fan gently waved the whisk, and a portion of the silk threads, carrying a part of the dismembered Xuanhuang evil thought, floated towards Yin Shangren's presence. "Fellow Daoist, please!" Yin Shangren first bowed, expressing his gratitude to Li Fan. Then, he solemnly accepted the divided Xuanhuang evil thought before him. Li Fan then distributed a portion to Qiao Gong. Like slicing a cucumber, in a short while, Li Fan had completed the division of the Xuanhuang evil thought. Everyone present had a share. Li Fan himself also had a share, even more than others. However, Yin Shangren and the others naturally had no objections. "Go!" Manipulating the giant whisk, Li Fan's expression was solemn as he tossed it towards the sky. It tore through the firmament, opening a passage to the Xuanhuang Realm. "Vast and boundless, let the soul return~" Li Fan chanted softly. And without Li Fan needing to do much more, the moment the passage was opened, the consciousness of the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao had already noticed the existence of the Great Xuan and its own will that had been separated in the past. Within the passage, a great booming sound continuously echoed, as if the consciousness of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao was about to descend. "Let the soul return!" Li Fan pointed to the void. The purified and divided strand of Xuanhuang evil thought before him flew towards the passage. Its speed rapidly increased, and in a flash, it disappeared from everyone's sight. Next, Yin Shangren and the others followed suit. After about half a day, the Xuanhuang evil thought, which had been scattered for many years, finally fully returned to the Xuanhuang Realm. The passage closed, and all strange phenomena vanished. Xu Ke looked at the completely ethereal and disappeared sealed coffin, a sense of loss filling his heart. Qiao Gong, however, frowned slightly. "Is that it? Will this be in vain?" Li Fan smiled faintly. "Everyone, rest assured. Xuanhuang will not forget those who have contributed." "However, it will take time for Xuanhuang to digest. Before receiving the rewards, everyone only needs to wait patiently." Li Fan's figure faded away with these words, leaving behind a group of people with various expressions. Yin Shangren looked at Xu Ke and inquired about Mr. Bai. Xu Ke, who had been somewhat bewildered, immediately became spirited. The two of them, hitting it off, began to reminisce. Bai Hua and Qiao Gong, on the other hand, were somewhat at odds with each other and went about their own business. They were all waiting for the rewards from the Xuanhuang Realm that Li Fan had spoken of. Meanwhile, within the Xuanhuang Realm. Li Fan's true body, in hiding, quietly observed the changes in the Xuanhuang Realm. If the absorption of Immortal Spiritual Energy caused changes in the mountains, rivers, and surface of the Xuanhuang Realm, then after absorbing its lost will, the changes in the Xuanhuang Realm occurred silently within the world itself. Only cultivators who were very familiar with the operation of the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao could perceive it. "To compare with us cultivators, it's like the strengthening of the soul and divine sense." "The first to benefit will be the laws of the Xuanhuang Realm, that is, the longevity of Xuanhuang..." Li Fan sensed several vast consciousnesses sweeping across the world. Some of them were quite familiar. "Hmph, I'll let you taste a bit of sweetness first. In the end, you'll have to spit it all out!" The vast consciousnesses searched several times but could not find the reason for the inexplicable changes in the Xuanhuang Realm. They could only give up. Li Fan sneered inwardly and paid them no mind, continuing to carefully sense the changes in the Xuanhuang Realm. Unlike the changes of world destruction that he had comprehended, these were subtle transformations.

Chapter 1309: First Encounter in the Land of Harmony

The cataclysmic changes that befell the Xuanhuang Realm were the extreme transformations it underwent naturally to protect itself upon sensing its impending doom. These were all evolutions where certain aspects were pushed to their absolute limits.

For example, the "Heaven and Earth Turning to Ice, All Things Frozen into Stillness" variation that Li Fan used in his previous life to masquerade as a cultivator who had merged with the Dao. It was no weaker than the ordinary elemental spirits of ice found in the Xuanhuang Realm, and in fact, was stronger than most of them.

The World-Ending Changes were often filled with destructive and offensive power. Because they typically only manifested when the Xuanhuang Realm faced imminent destruction, their appearance in the world inevitably provoked a reactive response from the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao. The consequence was that the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao would instinctively become wary and distrustful of those who possessed these World-Ending Changes, just as Li Fan was experiencing now.

In contrast, the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, after absorbing its own severed malevolent thoughts, underwent changes akin to being infused with immortal energy, a full-scale resurgence. However, the changes were specifically reflected in the foundational laws of the Xuanhuang Realm.

The anomalous longevity changes were set aside for the moment. The various restrictions the Xuanhuang Realm imposed on cultivators also became more stringent with the internal resurgence of the Xuanhuang Realm.

The bottleneck of the Heavenly Tribulation, the inability to cultivate multiple laws simultaneously, and the strange phenomena that appeared in the sky after a cultivator's demise.

These laws, intimately connected to a cultivator's progress, were undergoing silent and rapid transformation.

Cultivators would find it even harder to break through; the phenomena in the sky after death would record more information about the cultivator's life; the judgment standards for different laws would become stricter, and the total number of cultivation techniques in the world would inexplicably decrease.

Furthermore, Li Fan vaguely sensed that the efficiency with which the Xuanhuang Realm absorbed and converted the Dao foundations returned by cultivators after their deaths, as well as the fragments of worlds, was slowly increasing with its internal strengthening.

A faint grinding sound, like digestion, could be heard throughout the heavens and earth, imperceptible to ordinary cultivators.

In the Xuanhuang Realm, cultivators practiced by devouring heaven and earth. As the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao's power suddenly expanded, it was bound to drive the rapid advancement of cultivators within it.

Foundation Establishment battling Golden Core, Golden Core defeating Nascent Soul. In the near future, this might become commonplace.

For those cultivators who had already advanced, to escape this predicament, they would either have to dissipate their cultivation and start anew, or find a way to break through to the next major realm as quickly as possible.

Otherwise, these cultivators who did not “grow” with the Xuanhuang Realm would soon become obsolete.

…

Witnessing all the earth-shattering changes within the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan merely observed and did not interfere to extract any benefits. Although the growth of the Xuanhuang Realm had not yet reached Li Fan’s requirements, it was enough to provide him with inspiration.

"This is a transformation of the Dao. Those who align with the Dao shall live; those who lose the Dao shall perish. It is thus for the Xuanhuang Realm, for the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, and perhaps it was thus for the Immortal Realm in ancient times," Li Fan mused inwardly.

He recalled Sun Erlang's experience in the Illusionary Realm of the True Fruit in his previous life.

"I wonder what rewards they will gain this time when they journey to the Land of Ultimate Bliss?"

Within the Formation Platform, the silver-white eye rotated slightly, and the images of Sun Erlang and his two companions suddenly appeared within it.

Although they were only at the pinnacle of Golden Core cultivation, they were fortunate to have been taught the Great Dao by the Sacred Master. Whether it was the Myriad Immortals Alliance or the Five Elders Association's defensive formations, they were like laid bare to them.

They advanced unimpeded, traversing the Human Dao Heavenly Realm, and finally reached the so-called Land of Ultimate Bliss.

At first glance, it seemed no different from other regions of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Yue Zhenwei, the eldest among the three, surveyed their surroundings, a hint of confusion in his eyes: "Are there fewer people here than in other parts of the Five Elders Association?"

Sun Erlang nodded: "Indeed. And they all seem listless. However they look, they have nothing to do with the word 'Bliss'."

Wang Xuanba, however, said nonchalantly: "Who cares? Isn't our purpose here to search for Dongtian Worlds needed to break through to the Nascent Soul stage? Naturally, the fewer people, the better!"

Sun and Yue felt his reasoning made sense. Everyone should do what is within their capacity. The secrets of the Land of Ultimate Bliss were naturally not something that mere Golden Core cultivators like them could uncover.

Thus, they continued to conceal their tracks, employing the secret techniques taught by the Sacred Master, searching for traces of Dongtian Worlds within the Land of Ultimate Bliss.

However…

Ten days passed, and they found nothing.

The expressions of the three began to turn grim.

"This is impossible. We've practically scoured this Qiuxi Prefecture, and we haven't found a single Dongtian World?" Wang Xuanba exclaimed incredulously.

"Either the Sacred Master's secret technique is flawed, or..." Yue Zhenwei's complexion was also grim.

Sun Erlang continued: "It is likely that there are no Dongtian Worlds in the Land of Ultimate Bliss. Or perhaps, what we are seeing now is not the true Land of Ultimate Bliss, but merely an empty shell. The legendary Dream Realm is its true location."

"What should we do next?" Wang Xuanba scratched his head. "We can't just enter the Dream Realm and steal things, right? Why don't we go back to the Human Dao Heavenly Realm and take a look? Although it's more heavily guarded there, its territory is also larger. As long as we are careful, borrowing a few Dongtian Worlds should not be a problem."

Sun and Yue both nodded.

The three quickly reached a consensus and intended to withdraw from the Land of Ultimate Bliss.

But what filled them with inexplicable horror was that they were returning along the same path they had come, yet upon reaching the boundary of the Land of Ultimate Bliss, the scenery they saw had changed.

The white mist barrier that spanned heaven and earth, serving as the natural dividing line between prefectures, had vanished. Before them lay an endless, boundless desert that stretched as far as the eye could see.

"This..."

The three stood at the edge of the desert, scooping up some yellow sand from the ground and rubbing it between their fingers.

"It's real," Sun Erlang clenched his fists and said in a deep voice.

Wang Xuanba still refused to believe it. He took a step forward and sank into the quicksand: "How could this be? It was fine when we came, but suddenly we can't go back? We didn't even get lost!"

"I fear we have unknowingly entered the true Dream Realm of the Land of Ultimate Bliss," Yue Zhenwei, the most composed among the three, stated.

He gazed into the distance at the desert, not detecting any signs of life within it.

"It's best not to venture into this desert. Let's try another direction."

The three traversed Qiuxi Prefecture once more. On another of its borders, they again encountered a completely different scene.

Rushing water thundered down from the heavens. The moment it landed in Qiuxi, it transformed into light and shadows, dissipating into nothingness.

Not far away, there was indeed a water world suspended in the sky.

Not only were there many creatures swimming within it, but one could even faintly discern various underwater structures.

"Why don't we try this place? We can't leave anyway," Wang Xuanba suggested.

"Let's observe further," Yue Zhenwei carefully examined the surroundings. He noticed that although there were living beings in this water world, the civilization that built the underwater structures was composed of squirming octopuses.

They seemed to possess their own language and writing, ruling this underwater world.

But regarding the three of them, Sun Erlang, who were observing from mere inches away, they seemed utterly oblivious, as if existing in different worlds.

Temporarily leaving the water world, the three continued to search along the border of Qiuxi Prefecture.

Finally, in the southwest corner, they discovered a third bordering prefecture.

In the prefecture not far away, a large rock stood by the sea.

It was exactly the same as the giant rock by the sea in the Shi Lin Prefecture they had seen before.

"Excellent! We've finally found an exit!" Wang Xuanba exclaimed with excitement.

Just as he was about to rush forward, Sun Erlang stopped him.

"Be careful! Something feels wrong!"

As Sun Erlang spoke, two figures appeared one after another above the giant rock by the sea.

The first figure was in a sorry state, appearing heavily injured.

The second figure, while clearly faster than the first, seemed to be enjoying the thrill of the hunt, maintaining a specific distance between them. This gave the fleeing figure the illusion that they could escape with a little more effort, but in reality, they could never break free.

If it were a normal pursuit, the three wouldn't have been so surprised. However, the one pursuing the human cultivator who was fleeing in panic was actually a demon with a human body and a dog's head!

As the human cultivator was about to escape the Shi Lin Prefecture and enter the Congyun Sea, the dog-headed demon finally grew impatient and ended its hunting game.

Its hand transformed back into a dog's paw, firmly grasping the human cultivator. Witnessing the human cultivator's screams of despair and agony, the dog-headed demon laughed heartily.

Then, seemingly satisfied, it opened its mouth, ready to devour the human cultivator.

"Vile beast! Stop!" In their youthful and passionate prime, how could Wang Xuanba bear to witness such a macabre scene of man-eating before his very eyes?

Sun and Yue couldn't stop him in time. A giant gray-white axe, exuding an ancient aura, broke through the boundaries of the two different territories and appeared before the dog-headed demon.

However, the dog-headed demon seemed to have been expecting this.

A sinister and excited glint appeared in its eyes. It casually tossed aside the human cultivator it had in hand, its prey now, and even disregarded the giant gray-white axe that was about to strike its head, charging directly at the three of them.

As the dog-headed demon moved, its location, the Xuanhuang Shi Lin Prefecture, simultaneously underwent a mutation. It instantly devoured the territory of Qiuxi Prefecture, engulfing the three of them, Sun Erlang, in its embrace!

As if a dream had manifested into reality, the world of the dog-headed demon and the world of Sun Erlang's trio merged!

*Clang!*

Wang Xuanba's giant gray-white axe struck the dog-headed demon's nape, but only produced a clang of metal on metal! A full-powered blow, capable of splitting mountains, couldn't even break the dog-headed demon's skin!

Wang Xuanba let out a cold snort, but remained fearless: "Did you think grandpa's axe was just sharp?! Relying on your physically strong body to endure the hit? A beast is a beast!"

The dog-headed demon seemed to understand Wang Xuanba's words, and its expression shifted slightly. Only then did it notice a glaring gray scar extending from its nape upwards, rapidly engulfing the demon's dog-like head.

Moments later, the gray-white head crumbled into dust and scattered into the air.

"Be careful!"

Yue Zhenwei and Sun Erlang's voices rang out simultaneously.

As Wang Xuanba reveled in his triumph, the dog-headed demon, having lost its head, surprisingly moved again.

Its body flickered, and it appeared before Wang Xuanba.

Its dog-like paw transformed into a black streak of light, instantly piercing Wang Xuanba's heart.

"Xuanba!" Sun Erlang's eyes blazed with fury.

A blade filled with malevolent energy arrived belatedly, stirring up boundless black winds that directly engulfed the dog-headed demon.

However, in just a moment, the dog-headed demon's flesh and blood were completely scraped away by the black winds, leaving only a ghastly white skeleton.

But this skeleton exuded an extraordinary golden radiance.

"Something's wrong..." Yue Zhenwei's expression shifted subtly, yet he remained unaware. A figure silently approached him from behind. It was none other than the human cultivator the dog-headed demon had been pursuing earlier!

A mocking smile played on his lips. He looked at Yue Zhenwei with greedy eyes. His aura erupted, completely contradicting his previous injured appearance. His neck elongated, and his head flew out, directly swallowing Yue Zhenwei's head into its belly.

Alas, Yue Zhenwei's attention was fully focused on the dog-headed demon and Sun Erlang. Caught off guard by the sneak attack, he perished instantly!

"Ahhh! You deserve to die!" With two companions fallen, Sun Erlang's eyes turned bloodshot.

Veins bulged on his body, and a black energy enveloped him.

His pupils were completely consumed by blackness. Disregarding everything, Sun Erlang flew directly towards the long-necked demon.

However, he was tightly held back by the golden skeleton from behind.

The golden skeleton cackled, "This trick is so effective, always luring a few fools into the trap."

Sun Erlang's rage intensified.

"Aaaargh!"

A roar echoed through the heavens and earth.

A black storm suddenly erupted from his Dantian.

It was several times more terrifying than the black blade wind from before.

It directly swallowed the golden skeleton that had been cackling.

"Damn it! What is this..."

Before he could finish speaking, the golden skeleton, along with Sun Erlang, disappeared into the black storm.

The long-necked demon, however, made no move to rescue him.

It watched with relish, all the while chewing on Yue Zhenwei's corpse.

Not long after, the black storm completely dissipated.

And the corpses of Yue Zhenwei and Wang Xuanba had both become the long-necked demon's meal.

…

"Ah!"

Sun Erlang's group suddenly awoke from their nightmare, cold sweat dripping from their foreheads. After a moment, they finally regained their senses from the terrifying experience.

"I died?"

"I didn't die?!" Wang Xuanba exclaimed, still in shock.

Sun Erlang fell into deep thought.

Yue Zhenwei, being the most composed, surveyed their surroundings.

"It seems we are still in the Five Elders Association's Qiuxi Prefecture, where we were previously trapped."

"However..." Yue Zhenwei looked up at the sky. "The entire world seems to have become dimmer?" he stated uncertainly.

"It's not an illusion. Our world has indeed become as if night has fallen," Sun Erlang observed for a while and agreed.

"But our cultivation realms haven't changed... Wait, what is this?!" Sun Erlang's voice suddenly rose several octaves.

"Sun Erlang, Golden Core Completion, Deaths: 1."

"Land of Ultimate Bliss Experience Level: 1."

"Bliss Coins: 100."

Sun Erlang read out the lines of text that had inexplicably appeared before him, his expression deeply shaken.

"I have it too," Wang Xuanba called out, having discovered something.

"Wait, that's not right! Why are my Bliss Coins zero?"

"Where did your hundred come from?" Wang Xuanba asked, utterly bewildered.

Chapter 1310: Demonic Beasts Secretly Swallow Spirits

"Before dying, I took that bastard with me. These 100 Worry Coins should be the reward for killing him." Sun Erlang was not foolish; with a brief recollection, he deduced the origin of the Worry Coins on him.

"That said, what exactly did we just experience?" Wang Xuanba shivered, instinctively touching his chest as if the pierced wound still existed. "Was it a dream? But the feeling of dying was too real," Wang Xuanba muttered.

Sun Erlang stared at the lines of text before his eyes, attempting to find more useful information. But alas, apart from the text itself, there was no other explanation.

"It seems we have to figure it out ourselves," Sun Erlang's expression was grim.

At this point, Yue Zhenwei suggested, "Why don't we go back to the border where we encountered the dog-headed beast and see the situation?"

"The strength of those two beasts is actually similar to ours. As long as we are vigilant and don't get ambushed, we should be fine."

"Alright! I also want to get revenge on them! I died too miserably just now!" Wang Xuanba's eyes glinted with ferocity.

The three once again set off towards the border of Qiuxi Prefecture. On the way, Sun Erlang discovered that the cultivators they encountered seemed to be more numerous than before. Moreover, they were no longer listless; instead, they gathered in groups of three to five, as if discussing something.

Wanting to get closer and eavesdrop, Sun Erlang and the other two found that these people did not communicate using sound or divine sense, but through a communication method they could not observe.

"Perhaps we can ask them for information," Wang Xuanba looked at the five cultivators gathering not far away, who seemed to be only at the Middle Innate Stage, his eyes flickering.

Yue Zhenwei stopped him, "Xuanba, don't be rash! If my guess is correct, these people should be like us, able to resurrect. Those who don't fear death, trying to get anything out of them with brute force won't work..."

"Let's go to our target location first!" Sun Erlang also grunted.

Wang Xuanba nodded, then shifted his gaze. In this life, both Sun and Wang were young and skilled, having learned their craft on the Dao Revelation Platform. They were already arrogant and impetuous. After leaving Great Xuan, the formations they encountered were all easily broken. Thus, their pride grew even more. It was only after being tricked and ambushed by the beasts that they became somewhat restrained.

Arriving at the location where they had previously "perished," the scene they saw surprised the three: "Why is the world on the other side different from the last time we saw it?" The giant rock scene by the sea in Stone Forest Prefecture had disappeared, replaced by a sword forest filled with murderous intent. Ten thousand decaying swords were thrust into the ground, swaying with the breeze.

*Buzz...* Perhaps due to being too close, at the moment the swords in the sword forest trembled in unison, Sun Erlang seemed to hear a coordinated sword cry. Sun Erlang's heart trembled, and he instinctively dodled his head. An invisible sword qi, slicing past his cheek, grazed off a piece of skin. Ignoring the pain on his face, Sun Erlang retreated rapidly. Only when the sense of crisis faded did he stop. Undoubtedly, if he hadn't dodged just now, more than just a bit of flesh would have been taken.

"This world seems more dangerous than the three we encountered last time?" Yue Zhenwei frowned and speculated.

Next, the three roughly scouted all the worlds bordering Qiuxi Prefecture. A sword forest, a deep valley. And another place that seemed to be the location of a demonic sect. Within it gathered no less than a thousand malevolent cultivators. Looking from afar, one could see these demonic cultivators devouring humans, tormenting people for pleasure, and refining artifacts with human bones. The hellish scene made Wang Xuanba's blood boil, wishing he could rush over immediately and sweep away all the demonic sects. However, Wang Xuanba was impulsive, not stupid. He ultimately did not act rashly, only spitting fiercely at the opposite side.

The three gathered again to discuss: "Should we first inquire about the local customs from the native cultivators here, or venture into another world?"

"The cultivators of the Land of Worry-Free Land clearly know some rules that we are unaware of. If we ask rashly, we might expose our identities with the first word." "It's possible life is not in danger, but we might be kept here forever."

"Let's try soul extraction? Saint Master has taught us about this. Although we haven't formally used it on cultivators, I think we can give it a try," Wang Xuanba was eager to try.

"Don't forget, we are likely in a dream right now. Soul extraction might not work."

After a period of silence, the three decided to try.

"Find a lone cultivator, one with weaker strength." "First, knock him unconscious."

The three searched Qiuxi Prefecture for more than half a day before finally finding a suitable target. This person appeared to be only at the Early Innate Stage and seemed to have been separated from his teammates for some unknown reason, anxiously searching.

"Attack!" With a thunderous roar, the three killed their final attacks simultaneously on the Innate cultivator. Black whirlwind, gray giant axe, and Yue Zhenwei's purple-qi long sword. However, what caused the three to be utterly dumbfounded was that their combined full-power strike, capable of heavily wounding a Nascent Soul cultivator, actually caused no damage to this Innate cultivator!

The Innate cultivator's figure flickered, and all attacks missed. He looked at the three of Sun Erlang with disbelief, unconsciously taking a step back. At the same time, Sun Erlang noticed that the lines of text that had always been displayed before him flickered. There were no other changes. Only the number of Worry Coins turned to zero. Sun Erlang's face twitched. Wang Xuanba also instantly transmitted, wailing, "Why can't Worry Coins be negative? 100 were deducted!" Yue Zhenwei's expression was also very grim, "Mine too." During the brief moment they were communicating, a white light suddenly emerged from the attacked Innate cultivator. The white light swallowed him, and finally, with a look as if they were idiots, the Innate cultivator vanished on the spot.

"..." The three from Great Xuan looked at each other in silence, facing each other. "It seems this is also a natural restriction within the Land of Bliss. We are of the same kind as these cultivators. And those monsters we encountered before, including those in the border worlds, are perhaps another kind. Cultivators cannot attack each other, and will even be punished. But killing monsters in the border worlds will have rewards, including Worry Coins..." After a brief period of dejection, Sun Erlang quickly regained his spirits. Based on their experiences, he made recollections and summaries.

"We cannot determine the consequences of having too many deducted Worry Coins, but we had best not try. Let's go to the border worlds first and earn back the negative Worry Coins."

At this point, the three had given up the idea of soul extraction. They couldn't even get close, so how could they extract souls!

With their stomachs full of frustration, after deliberation, and guided by their instincts, they finally chose the demonic sect world, which seemed the most dangerous among the three border worlds.

"Although that hellish place seems to have many enemies, how powerful can cultivators who refine artifacts with ordinary human bones really be?" "Their spells are also crude. They might scare ordinary people, but they can't withstand my axe!" Wang Xuanba declared confidently.

"However, we still need to be careful. After all, we've died once. I have a hunch that the number of deaths might be even more important than Worry Coins," Yue Zhenwei said, looking at the constantly flickering characters before him with a solemn expression.

After the three decided on their plan, they moved back-to-back and charged into the demonic sect world. Inside the demonic sect world, ten thousand demonic cultivators were stunned by the arrival of this trio from the sky. After a moment of愣, they shouted in languages incomprehensible to Sun Erlang and swarmed them. Blood mist filled the air, and countless resentful souls wailed. It looked terrifying.

"Die, you bastard!" Suddenly, a gray giant axe, exuding an ancient aura, broke through the boundaries of the two different territories and appeared before the dog-headed demon. However, the dog-headed demon seemed to have expected this. A sinister and excited glint appeared in its eyes. It casually tossed aside the human cultivator it had in hand, its prey now, and even disregarded the giant gray-white axe that was about to strike its head, charging directly at the three of them. As the dog-headed demon moved, its location, the Xuanhuang Stone Forest Prefecture, simultaneously underwent a mutation. It instantly devoured the territory of Qiuxi Prefecture, engulfing the three of them, Sun Erlang, in its embrace! As if a dream had manifested into reality, the world of the dog-headed demon and the world of Sun Erlang's trio merged!

*Clang!* Wang Xuanba's giant gray-white axe struck the dog-headed demon's nape, but only produced a clang of metal on metal! A full-powered blow, capable of splitting mountains, couldn't even break the dog-headed demon's skin!

Wang Xuanba let out a cold snort, but remained fearless: "Did you think grandpa's axe was just sharp?! Relying on your physically strong body to endure the hit? A beast is a beast!" The dog-headed demon seemed to understand Wang Xuanba's words, and its expression shifted slightly. Only then did it notice a glaring gray scar extending from its nape upwards, rapidly engulfing the demon's dog-like head. Moments later, the gray-white head crumbled into dust and scattered into the air.

"Be careful!" Yue Zhenwei and Sun Erlang's voices rang out simultaneously. As Wang Xuanba reveled in his triumph, the dog-headed demon, having lost its head, surprisingly moved again. Its body flickered, and it appeared before Wang Xuanba. Its dog-like paw transformed into a black streak of light, instantly piercing Wang Xuanba's heart.

"Xuanba!" Sun Erlang's eyes blazed with fury. A blade filled with malevolent energy arrived belatedly, stirring up boundless black winds that directly engulfed the dog-headed demon. However, in just a moment, the dog-headed demon's flesh and blood were completely scraped away by the black winds, leaving only a ghastly white skeleton. But this skeleton exuded an extraordinary golden radiance.

"Something's wrong..." Yue Zhenwei's expression shifted subtly, yet he remained unaware. A figure silently approached him from behind. It was none other than the human cultivator the dog-headed demon had been pursuing earlier! A mocking smile played on his lips. He looked at Yue Zhenwei with greedy eyes. His aura erupted, completely contradicting his previous injured appearance. His neck elongated, and his head flew out, directly swallowing Yue Zhenwei's head into its belly. Alas, Yue Zhenwei's attention was fully focused on the dog-headed demon and Sun Erlang. Caught off guard by the sneak attack, he perished instantly!

"Ahhh! You deserve to die!" With two companions fallen, Sun Erlang's eyes turned bloodshot. Veins bulged on his body, and a black energy enveloped him. His pupils were completely consumed by blackness. Disregarding everything, Sun Erlang flew directly towards the long-necked demon. However, he was tightly held back by the golden skeleton from behind. The golden skeleton cackled, "This trick is so effective, always luring a few fools into the trap." Sun Erlang's rage intensified.

"Aaaargh!" A roar echoed through the heavens and earth. A black storm suddenly erupted from his Dantian. It was several times more terrifying than the black blade wind from before. It directly swallowed the golden skeleton that had been cackling. "Damn it! What is this..." Before he could finish speaking, the golden skeleton, along with Sun Erlang, disappeared into the black storm. The long-necked demon, however, made no move to rescue him. It watched with relish, all the while chewing on Yue Zhenwei's corpse. Not long after, the black storm completely dissipated. And the corpses of Yue Zhenwei and Wang Xuanba had both become the long-necked demon's meal.

…

"Ah!" Sun Erlang's group suddenly awoke from their nightmare, cold sweat dripping from their foreheads. After a moment, they finally regained their senses from the terrifying experience. "I died?" "I didn't die?!" Wang Xuanba exclaimed, still in shock. Sun Erlang fell into deep thought. Yue Zhenwei, being the most composed, surveyed their surroundings. "It seems we are still in the Five Elders Association's Qiuxi Prefecture, where we were previously trapped." "However..." Yue Zhenwei looked up at the sky. "The entire world seems to have become dimmer?" he stated uncertainly.

"It's not an illusion. Our world has indeed become as if night has fallen," Sun Erlang observed for a while and agreed. "But our cultivation realms haven't changed... Wait, what is this?!" Sun Erlang's voice suddenly rose several octaves. "Sun Erlang, Golden Core Completion, Deaths: 1." "Land of Ultimate Bliss Experience Level: 1." "Worry Coins: 100." Sun Erlang read out the lines of text that had inexplicably appeared before him, his expression deeply shaken.

"I have it too," Wang Xuanba called out, having discovered something. "Wait, that's not right! Why are my Bliss Coins zero?" "Where did your hundred come from?" Wang Xuanba asked, utterly bewildered.

Chapter 1311 (Continued)

"The Xuanhuang Realm's laws can be seen as a downward projection of the Utmost Darkness Star Sea's laws, and the Utmost Darkness Star Sea's laws are also a downward projection of the Immortal Realm's laws."

"And 'Return to Reality'... is almost above all things. Reflecting from top to bottom, theoretically, it can replicate anything I come into contact with through the 'True Becomes False' transformation."

"As long as my power and understanding are sufficient."

Li Fan recalled the feeling of writing that mysterious trace, thoughtfully saying,

"This is only the 'True Becomes False' transformation. 'Return to Reality' is not just 'True Becomes False'."

"There is also the previous transformation of 'False Becomes True'!"

As his thoughts moved, Li Fan casually picked up a nearby round stone. Staring intently at the stone, he attempted to erase its existence directly through 'False Becomes True'.

However, each time the Return to Reality process occurred, the surrounding real world seemed to be shrouded in white mist, making it impossible to see clearly. Thus, Li Fan could not know how the 'False Becomes True' process was actually realized.

"Perhaps this time when I return to reality, I can try to actively dissipate the surrounding mist." Li Fan couldn't help but have this thought.

"If I can gain insights into this path, with the supreme authority of 'Return to Reality', I might be able to directly leap over a major realm and arbitrarily erase opponents..."

As his thoughts churned, Li Fan sorted out the residual impressions of the mysterious symbol he had gained from possessing the You Clan members over the past year.

Then, he handed them over to the Ultimate Separation Disc for categorization and application.

Simultaneously handling two tasks involving immortal arrays, the Ultimate Separation Disc's efficiency inevitably declined.

"It seems it's time to upgrade the Ultimate Separation Disc again. Purely relying on immortal array data for sublimation is ultimately limited by mortal physiques."

"The nine initial Separation Discs of the Myriad Immortals Alliance are already completely different objects from the one I hold. The help they can provide is minimal. To completely transform into an immortal artifact Separation Disc, Immortal Spiritual Power is ultimately required..."

Li Fan pressed his slightly bulging forehead due to the excessive work. After relaxing, he looked at the You Clan in this realm.

They did not grieve for the death of the person Li Fan possessed.

Instead, they were greatly inspired by the sacrifice of their people to the great Sea of Darkness.

Seeing the You Clan's devout appearance, Li Fan was deeply moved. With a wave of his hand, he instantly absorbed them all into his body, temporarily suppressing them.

After returning to the Great Profound Small World, he would provide them with the best living conditions, allowing them to stay in Great Profound and pray wholeheartedly for the rest of their lives.

"This small world should not be wasted either."

The small world inhabited by the You Clan was even weaker than Great Profound, and naturally had not yet birthed the consciousness of the Heavenly Dao.

This made Li Fan's task easier.

He created a simulated Heavenly Dao consciousness, directly replacing the Heavenly Dao, to maintain the normal operation of this small world.

Then, using the same technique, he silently grafted it onto the main Xuanhuang Realm.

Practice makes perfect. This time, the Heavenly Physician's technique of "Mending the Heavens Record" went very smoothly.

With another simulated Heavenly Dao consciousness as a clone, subtle insights, like surging waves, frequently appeared in his mind. Although the level was insufficient, this large volume of enlightenment inspirations could still provide Li Fan with some tangible inspiration.

"This Heavenly Dao insight is useless to me, but to other cultivators, it is a rare opportunity that they may not encounter in a lifetime." Returning to Great Profound and settling the You Clan, after converting a large portion of them to his beliefs.

Li Fan looked at the dense crowd of cultivators sitting on the sermon platform in the center of Great Profound, and a thought occurred to him.

Humming...

A platform suddenly appeared in the sky, located below the directory of cultivation techniques and above the disciples. The platform was carved with the myriad scenes of the world, myriad spirits, and myriad things, yet it was like a living creature, constantly changing and lifelike.

If one looked closely, and if they were lucky, they would occasionally spot a seven-colored spark within the stone carvings.

Those were the insights of the simulated Heavenly Dao that Li Fan could not use. If any cultivator on the sermon platform were fortunate enough to decipher them, it would not be difficult for them to rapidly advance their cultivation or even comprehend their own unique divine abilities.

"The beings on the sermon platform are all under my surveillance. Their inspirations are my inspirations."

"Even though their realm is low, the sparks of thought, magnified countless times, remain brilliant. Even if only one out of ten thousand can provide inspiration to me, with the number of cultivators on the sermon platform, the accumulated wealth will be considerable."

"Moreover, if necessary, I can also control the sermon platform and manipulate the thoughts of the cultivators on it, making them help me comprehend..."

Inside the sermon platform, the silver-white sphere, like an eye, occasionally absorbed the inner inspirations of different beings from the sermon platform, becoming somewhat strange, as if it had come alive, and subtly rotated outwards.

The Saint Master's phantom, after initially completing the sermon mission in Great Profound, further divided a body and headed to the next small world.

This newly formed body was not supported by Li Fan's main body's power. Instead, it was formed by the Saint Master's phantom absorbing the belief power of his disciples during the sermon, accumulating it.

It was similar to the "Heavenly Emperor's Qi Codex," except that the Great Qi became Great Profound, the soldiers became students, and the Saint Emperor became the Saint Master.

In this initial phase of expansion, these phantoms would act as proxies. Once the sermon began to attract the attention of the Myriad Immortals Alliance or other powerful beings hidden within the small worlds, Li Fan would personally intervene to subdue and conquer them.

Before that, Li Fan still needed to make thorough preparations for the future conflict.

The You Clan who had their beliefs altered by faith began to provide Li Fan with Origin Force essence.

Using this Origin Force essence as bait, coupled with various other inducments, Li Fan, very skillfully, drew in familiar faces such as Bai Hua, Qiao Gong, and Yin Shangren into his alliance.

"A great change is about to occur in heaven and earth. You all may not perceive it. I will expound upon it today."

Sitting in the void, Li Fan, the Saint Master's true form, spoke solemnly.

Below, Yin Shangren and others listened to Li Fan's sermon, their faces filled with skepticism.

Li Fan was lecturing on the resurgence of the Star Sea, which would lead to the recovery of the Xuanhuang Realm in the future.

They listened with mixed belief and disbelief.

Li Fan smiled slightly, pointing to the sky, as if opening a vortex leading to the outside of the Star Sea.

"Esteemed sirs, please follow me."

His body shimmered with seven-colored rainbow light, and Li Fan invited everyone to enter.

The crowd exchanged glances, but ultimately, they all entered Li Fan's rainbow light protection.

The seven-colored light shot up into the sky.

Passing through the vortex in the sky, in the next moment, they suddenly appeared at the border of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Based on the momentum, it seemed they had no intention of stopping, as if they were still heading towards the Xuanhuang Realm's starry sky.

Everyone's faces turned pale.

They all knew about the terrifying suction force outside the Xuanhuang Realm. Once they left the protection of the Xuanhuang Realm, they might fall into it at any moment, their lives in peril.

But what happened next far exceeded their expectations.

The seven-colored light separated into different hues, drawing a curved arc in the starry sky, successfully leading everyone away from the Xuanhuang Realm!

Everyone was utterly astonished.

However, Li Fan continued to fly rapidly towards the depths of the starry sky.

The desolation of the starry sky evoked memories and sorrow in everyone.

The dangers within the starry sky filled them with trepidation and solemnity.

And Li Fan, as if he were a prophet, was able to navigate around the dangerous areas of the starry sky, earning their admiration.

They all speculated how many times he must have traveled the starry sky to be so familiar with it.

However, as they ventured deeper into the starry sky, Li Fan's speed began to slow down.

He seemed to be discerning the direction.

Yin Shangren and the others' feelings were correct. After all, in the previous life, when the Saint Emperor was comprehending the Dao in the center of the starry sky, his connection with his main body had become tenuous.

Therefore, this journey to witness the resurgence of the starry sky, the further they progressed, the less memory they could draw upon, and the more Li Fan had to find the path himself.

Fortunately, they were following a map of sorts.

Relying on a vague sense of guidance, Li Fan had already touched upon the primordial consciousness of this starry sky. However, in the previous life, the Saint Emperor had achieved this by embodying the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao and acting as a potential savior of the Star Sea, attracting the attention of the Star Sea's primordial consciousness.

In this life, Li Fan had not yet revealed himself in a way that warranted the Star Sea's attention.

However, this did not hinder Li Fan's subsequent plan.

"This should be the place." Sensing that they had reached the appropriate location, Li Fan stopped and gazed into the void ahead, sighing softly.

Everyone followed his gaze, their expressions complex.

In their perception, this part of the starry sky did indeed feel different from before, seemingly brighter and warmer. However, it was still far from the "resurgence" that Li Fan had spoken of, appearing rather desolate.

Yet, since he had gone to such lengths to bring them here, he must have a reason.

Could it be that my comprehension is insufficient?

Everyone present immediately harbored doubts about themselves,

And then continued to observe with utmost solemnity.

Li Fan saw the subtle changes in their expressions and smiled silently.

After a long while, he finally spoke, "Have you all gained anything?"

His response was silence.

Li Fan feigned a slight surprise, pondered for a moment, and then waved his hand.

He sent several beams of light into everyone's sea of consciousness.

These were precisely the Saint Emperor's insights into the resurgence of the Star Sea in the previous life.

Everyone's eyes suddenly lit up.

Around them, faint traces of life emerged from nowhere.

Qiao Gong, Bai Hua, and the others, having survived countless calamities in the Xuanhuang Realm, were all exceptionally talented.

Previously, because the Star Sea's consciousness was too vast and hidden beneath the desolation and destruction, they had not perceived it.

But now, with Li Fan directly imparting his enlightenment results into their minds,

They naturally perceived something.

"It is indeed so!" Bai Hua was the most deeply moved.

"If I could master this power of resurgence, perhaps I could rejuvenate the Myriad Sheng Realm..."

Yin Shangren rubbed his head. The residual souls of shattered realms within his body seemed to be attracted by this power of resurgence, wanting to emerge from his body once more.

For a time, everyone was immersed in the magnificent power of the vast Star Sea.

Without noticing, Li Fan, who was guiding them, had subtly moved some distance away from them.

In fact, Li Fan had used a technique close to an immortal array to temporarily conceal his presence.

He had a premonition that revealing his existence to the primordial consciousness of the Star Sea too early would not end well.

"At least until I achieve the limit of mortals after completing my Dao integration." Li Fan watched the individuals comprehending the Dao, his eyes gleaming.

Chapter 1312: Immortal and Mortal Miasma Exterminates Immortals

"Lingering Realm Great Wall... How could such an anomaly appear on the fringes of the Star Sea?" Qiao Gong exclaimed in disbelief.

"No wonder the worlds annihilated back then vanished without a trace; they all gathered at the foot of the High Wall? Lingering realms stretching endlessly, what sort of power could create such a spectacle?" Bai Hua's face was also filled with shock.

Both of them had survived the destruction of the Star Sea and personally witnessed countless cultivation worlds fall into desolate silence. Therefore, compared to others, they could profoundly understand the awe-inspiring nature of the Lingering Realm Great Wall that stretched beyond sight.

"I seem to..." As if recalling a memory buried deep within his mind, Yin Shangren pressed his forehead, about to speak but stopping himself.

Li Fan glanced at him and didn't press further. Instead, he solemnly added, "Beyond the Lingering Realm Great Wall, there is another ring of Artifact Remnant Great Walls serving as a barrier. These two, guarding the High Wall, echo each other and form a formation. This journey ahead is more perilous than going to the center of the Star Sea, and it's even highly possible to perish..."

Li Fan's gaze swept over everyone, "Whether you go or not is entirely your decision."

"I will give you half a year to consider. Do not blindly chase after higher-level power. Simply by returning the Profound Yellow malevolent thoughts, even if you do nothing further, you will receive ample benefits when the Great Profound Realm completes its ascension." His figure slowly vanished as he spoke.

Qiao Gong and the others had varied expressions.

Indeed, the moment they witnessed the spectacle of the Lingering Realm Great Wall, their hearts were shaken, and they felt a desire to see it for themselves. However, Li Fan's words served as a reminder.

In this Star Sea, wonders often accompanied immense power. Immense power, in turn, implied danger.

This was true for the Lingering Realm Great Wall, and equally so for the Immortal Ruins.

Furthermore, prompting the Great Profound Realm to absorb and digest its power only required three to four fragments of lingering realms as medicinal catalysts. It wasn't necessary for everyone to venture forth.

If this endeavor proceeded smoothly, there would be plenty of opportunities in the future to contribute to the Great Profound Realm's ascension.

With these thoughts in mind, everyone began to ponder.

Li Fan observed the subtle shifts in their expressions, his eyes filled with understanding. Through countless lifetimes of reincarnation, Li Fan had come to know the natures of these individuals intimately. At a glance, he could discern their general thoughts.

"Walking towards the Dao is the innate instinct of a cultivator. Yet, this path is fraught with peril and arduous. Inner fear and aversion are even greater hindrances to progress."

"How difficult it is to touch upon the so-called [Dao]..."

Watching Qiao Gong and the others make their choices in the face of life, death, and the pursuit of the Dao, strands of realization welled up in Li Fan's heart.

Waiting for the celestial souls of the Super Profound Yellow Realm to merge with the Dao did not mean that Li Fan's cultivation journey would halt in the interim.

"Breathing, speaking, and acting are all forms of cultivation."

"The myriad thoughts of all living beings are like Dao scriptures."

On the Preaching Platform, within the Great Profound Realm, the thoughts and wills of countless beings poured into Li Fan's mind like countless stars, each shining with a unique brilliance, and were perceived by him.

They transformed into a force that propelled the grand wheel of Li Fan's cultivation forward.

His intention to be a teacher of heaven and earth in this life was not a whim.

In his previous life, the Saint Emperor, during his preachings, had mentioned the concept of [Resonating Dao for Longevity], which allowed one to comprehend the true meaning of resonating Dao through reversing Dao echoes.

Li Fan, through repeated attempts at [False Becomes True], had subtly confirmed the young girl's conjecture regarding the Saint Emperor's new method of deduction.

Dao's projection from top to bottom indeed made it easier to grasp Dao itself.

Without projection, the Great Dao remained hidden in the nine heavens, unseen. One could only rely on cultivation and enlightenment to seek Dao's traces and then deepen their understanding step by step.

Though the Great Dao was manifold, how difficult was it for ordinary cultivators to glimpse the true face of Dao?

True Immortals in the Immortal Ruins, despite having the rudimentary铭道 [Hunger] character as an aid, still meditated for millennia without breaking through.

This illustrated the difficulty of comprehending the Dao.

If True Immortals found it so arduous, what of those below True Immortals?

Among the vast multitude of beings, Li Fan's situation was exceptionally unique. Possessing [Return to Reality], he was akin to standing at the very end of this grand Dao, with the ultimate truth of [Dao] almost within his grasp. Therefore, the seemingly impossible miracle of [False Becomes True] could be performed even with a cultivation level of only the Nascent Divinity stage.

Regarding the True and False transformations involved in [Return to Reality], Li Fan had previously only been able to comprehend them gradually by strengthening the "bond" with [Return to Reality].

However, with the gradual deepening of his understanding of [False Becomes True], and after his prior contact with that mysterious symbol hidden deep within the You Clan members' bodies,

Li Fan faintly sensed that he could use methods of analogy and inference to deduce the progress of the True and False transformations by starting from other Dao traces.

The Dao projected itself across myriad realms, forming all existence.

Everything within the Great Profound Realm, be it matter or consciousness, could be considered a projection of Dao.

However, being at the very end of the projection, it was almost an impossible task to trace the Dao from the bottom up.

Yet, as the sole surviving land within the Star Sea, the Great Profound Realm had already gathered countless impossibilities.

For instance, the Eternal Remnants, singular existences that resonated with the Dao.

In this life, Li Fan had previously visited the Tianyang Cave dwelling at the bottom of the Cyan Cloud Sea. He had collected the Tianyang Ancient Bones, which contained Eternal Remnants, but had tried various methods without success in sensing the Dao resonance within them.

However, Li Fan would not abandon his research on Dao resonance. Instead, he turned his attention to finding a lesser substitute for Eternal Remnants.

In the 119th life, Li Fan had used the Faceless True Immortal statue as a guide to create the mortal world's "Network of Red Dust Compassion True Immortals." Among its countless followers, only Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi's intentions shone with exceptional brilliance.

Even within the Origin Power Essence network, they were exceptionally conspicuous.

They were undoubtedly [Seekers of the Dao with Utmost Sincerity].

Previously, Li Fan believed this was merely due to their inherent character. To Li Fan himself, it held no other benefit. But now, Li Fan discovered that Kou Hong and the two others' sincere pursuit of the Dao might very well be the nascent form of Eternal Remnants.

In other words, if they could be guided appropriately to deepen their pursuit of the Dao, upon Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi's deaths, there might be a probability of birthing [Eternal Remnants].

"I cannot utilize Eternal Remnants myself, but can I not utilize their lesser substitutes?"

This discovery from Kou Hong and the two others inspired Li Fan. Coupled with the need to merge the celestial souls of the Super Great Profound Realm with the Dao, and on the spur of the moment, he became the "Teacher of Heaven and Earth" in this life.

On the Preaching Platform, the myriad intentions of beings from the Great Profound Realm gathered, like stars in the sky, each shining with a different intensity.

Those who were distinct would receive Li Fan's special attention.

Unfortunately, he had not yet found anyone who could potentially ascend to Eternal Remnants.

However, Li Fan believed that once the Preaching Platform eventually expanded to encompass the entire Great Profound Realm, besides Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi, there should be others who could provide surprises.

As for Kou Hong and the two others, their current experiences were still somewhat lacking compared to their past selves as utmost sincere seekers of the Dao. Taking them as disciples would instead hinder their pursuit of the Dao. Therefore, Li Fan had not yet interfered with them, and had even added extra difficulty to their cultivation.

He would wait for the opportune moment when their efforts bore fruit before reaping the rewards.

"Dao's projection forms myriad realms; there will always be beings within the worlds whose existence resonates with Dao's traces."

"These are the materials I can use to enhance my comprehension of the [True and False Transformations]."

Having personally experienced the power of [False Becomes True], Li Fan had decided to prioritize promoting this matter as the second highest priority, second only to self-preservation.

As for realms, cultivation, and treasures.

Things that could be acquired in every reincarnation were simply incomparable.

"However, I believe these brilliant intentions of living beings, like Eternal Remnants, can only be comprehended once. I wonder how many individuals in the entire Great Profound Realm can surprise me."

Li Fan's divine sense swept across the land, observing the Great Profound citizens who were still ceaselessly arriving at the central Preaching Platform. He nodded slightly.

His figure flickered, and the next moment, Li Fan had already left the Great Profound Small World.

He arrived at Qiling Prefecture in the Great Profound Realm.

In the vast, empty underground space, an invisible, eerie aura permeated.

Even with Li Fan's current cultivation, he had gathered sufficient Origin Force Essence for protection before daring to enter.

A golden thread of light formed a protective formation, separating Li Fan from the terrifying power within this underground space.

"My guess was correct. This ancient Immortal-Mortal Blight has also undergone an evolutionary transformation along with the Great Profound Realm," Li Fan concluded after careful observation.

In the 119th life, a famine occurred in Qiling Prefecture, and the ancient Immortal-Mortal Blight sealed here leaked out, causing widespread devastation. Accumulated over thousands of years in this underground space, this ancient Immortal-Mortal Blight seemed to have undergone a mutation, becoming even more powerful than its initial version.

The Immortal-Mortal Blight was created by Mr. Bai against the principles of heaven and earth, yet it was also a part of the principles of heaven and earth.

As this life's Great Profound Realm began its evolution towards becoming a Super Profound Yellow Realm, the ancient Immortal-Mortal Blight in this underground space was also accumulating the power for transformation.

"Mortal can also slay Immortals..."

Li Fan extended his hand, and the golden protective formation opened. An invisible force seized the opportunity to infiltrate and began to erode Li Fan's palm.

His brows furrowed. After merely a moment of observation, Li Fan decisively severed his entire arm.

Then, Origin Force Essence re-formed the protective barrier, blocking the erosion of the Immortal-Mortal Blight.

"Interesting."

In the time it took to breathe, Li Fan's severed arm had already regrown.

As for the arm that remained in the ancient Immortal-Mortal Blight, it was completely consumed by the surrounding invisible forces.

Not even a bone remained, only a pile of fine sand-like residue.

A rare spark of excitement flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

Among his bindings under [Return to Reality], there was an item called [Ten Thousand People's Essence Blood], condensed from tens of thousands of condemned criminals.

However, the power of the Immortal-Mortal Blight contained within this Ten Thousand People's Essence Blood was inferior to this enhanced ancient Immortal-Mortal Blight.

"If the Super Profound Yellow Realm completes its final transformation, to what extent will the Immortal-Mortal Blight here be enhanced?"

In Li Fan's deductions, the power of the Star Sea's resurgence, the Immortal Spiritual Power from the Great Heavenly Venerate's legacy, and the remnants of various realms within the Star Sea...

These forces, all working together, were sufficient to elevate the Great Profound Realm to a level infinitely close to the Immortal Realm.

Or, in a sense, this Super Profound Yellow Realm was a newly ascended Immortal Realm. It was just a notch weaker than the ancient Immortal Realm that had already been destroyed.

"At that time, even if 'slaying Immortals' is not fully possible, being able to inflict heavy damage might be achievable."

"More importantly, this ancient Immortal-Mortal Blight can continuously strengthen itself as the Great Profound Realm grows. Its inherent nature of [Mortal Slaying Immortals] dictates its significant role."

"One day, when I have the capability to truly elevate the Great Profound Realm to an Immortal Realm, then this Immortal-Mortal Blight will become a genuine immortal-slaying weapon!"

With this thought, Li Fan's gaze towards the invisible forces within this vast space changed.

From Xuan Tianwang's past encounter, and some clues gleaned from those exploring beyond the High Wall,

It could be inferred that achieving immortality within the Star Sea might involve facing unimaginable dangers.

And the birth of an Immortal Domain might attract attention, but since it would not be Li Fan's main body, even if crises arose, it would provide Li Fan with ample time to react.

Ascending to immortality oneself, versus facilitating the Great Profound Realm's ascension to an Immortal Domain – which was harder?

Unless one was insane, everyone would undoubtedly choose the latter.

But for Li Fan, the conclusion was the opposite.

"The Great Heavenly Venerate's legacy, the Immortal Spiritual Power within the Immortal Artifacts, these are all resources that I can repeatedly utilize infinitely."

"Furthermore, there are all sorts of other materials and powers within the entire Star Sea."

Li Fan's thoughts raced rapidly.

"Perhaps it's feasible."

"I simply need to wait until the end of this life and observe how much the Super Profound Yellow Realm, which I have facilitated, falls short of the legendary Immortal Realm before making a final judgment."

The transformation of this ancient Immortal-Mortal Blight had opened up Li Fan's perspective.

Within the Great Profound Realm, countless materialized laws existed.

Once the Great Profound Realm ascended, these materialized laws would also undergo a corresponding elevation.

"The entire Great Profound Realm can be viewed as my weapon against Immortals."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

There was a distinction between mortal and immortal.

However, if this mortal were backed by an entire Immortal Realm, the ultimate outcome might be different.

"The situation beyond the High Wall is unclear."

"Using the realm as a foundation might make it easier to investigate."

Li Fan cautiously set up formations around this underground space,

Preventing others from discovering the Immortal-Mortal Blight sealed here.

"Continue to grow. When you reach your limit, it will be time to forge swords."

After ensuring everything was foolproof, Li Fan finally departed.

"If the plan is feasible, then it is time for me to collect some anchors."

"Things that can slay Immortals, naturally, the more the merrier."

Thinking this, Li Fan quietly arrived in the void of the Five Elements Great Blessed Land in Tianling Prefecture.

At this point in time, the Five Elements Great Blessed Land had not fully descended.

It was an opportune moment to absorb and replenish the conditions for anchors: a nascent blessed land.

However, Li Fan had already used the Five Elements Great Blessed Land for charging once before. He was unsure if [Return to Reality] would react again.

Skillfully, he entered the black and white intertwined gestation space.

Li Fan concentrated his mind, perceiving the sensations transmitted by [Return to Reality].

"It's somewhat difficult to swallow, but edible nonetheless."

After a long time, Li Fan opened his eyes, his expression somewhat peculiar.

He calmed his mind, and his divine sense instantly enveloped the entire Five Elements Great Blessed Land.

After a period of time...

The blessed land inexplicably vanished.

And another anchor that Li Fan could utilize became available.

Li Fan felt a premonition that one more time, and [Return to Reality] would truly lose its appetite.

Unlike before, when he consumed blessed lands that had already descended, the Five Elements Great Blessed Land was still undergoing gestation.

Its sudden disappearance naturally caused spatial anomalies.

Chapter 1313: The Great Formation of Floating Crossing

Countless black and white lines instantly came alive, altering their original trajectories and flying towards Li Fan. They were like tentacles, aiming to entangle and restrain him.

This place was called the "Root of Heaven and Earth," the location where the Five Elements Great Grotto-Heaven was gestated. Black and white lines crisscrossed, like a colossal weaving machine, knitting the Xuanhuang world. Not only the Five Elements Great Grotto-Heaven, but also the initial mountains, rivers, and blessed lands of the Xuanhuang Realm were born from here. It was the origin of the world, the confluence of laws, the beginning of creation.

When Li Fan first witnessed this magnificent spectacle, he could only marvel at the wonders of creation and seize this rare opportunity to comprehend the fleeting fragments of primordial laws within the Root of Heaven and Earth. Now, after over a hundred reincarnations, Li Fan saw many things he couldn't perceive before.

For instance, though faint and almost integrated into the entire space of the Root of Heaven and Earth, there were still… man-made traces, influencing the overall operation from the foundational level.

Facing the instinctive attacks of the countless black and white lines within the Root of Heaven and Earth, Li Fan did not dodge or evade. He allowed them to deeply penetrate his body. Under normal circumstances, a cultivator who met such an attack here would soon have their own body, also composed of countless lines, disperse and dissolve, vanishing completely within this space.

But at this moment, an inexplicable immense force existed within Li Fan's body, firmly anchoring his own lines. No matter how the Root of Heaven and Earth tried to absorb him, he remained immobile!

Naturally, the anchor that held Li Fan immovably in place was the sliver of [Transformation of Truth and Falsehood] he had comprehended. Almost all creations originating from the Xuanhuang Realm struggled to resist the attacks of the Root of Heaven and Earth, which returned to their origins. However, the [Transformation of Truth and Falsehood], stemming from [Return to Reality], was far beyond what the Root of Heaven and Earth could analyze and differentiate.

Instead, scattered gray imprints spread deep into the Root of Heaven and Earth along the countless lines inserted into him. These were not the world-destroying True Immortal script, but rather countless divine senses that Li Fan had differentiated, intending to use this attack to probe the mysteries of the Root of Heaven and Earth.

Innumerable scenes flashed before his eyes. In the void, light flickered and pulsed. Each change in brightness represented tens of billions of interweaving lines. From nothingness to existence, from darkness, worlds were being born.

*Boom!* Just as Li Fan's mind was immersed in observation, the mysterious scenes abruptly shattered. It turned out that the Root of Heaven and Earth had sensed Li Fan's intent to invade. All the lines inserted into Li Fan instantly faded, dissolving and disappearing. Li Fan's connection with the Root of Heaven and Earth was severed.

Even more so, the lines that were weaving creations in his vision slowly retreated into the void, becoming impossible to observe. The light suddenly brightened; Li Fan had been repelled by the Root of Heaven and Earth and returned to the Xuanhuang Tianling Prefecture.

"A pity."

"The instinctive crisis reaction was still swift."

Though he said this, he didn't feel much regret. Li Fan narrowed his eyes, recalling the "man-made traces" he had glimpsed just now. Probing the details of the Root of Heaven and Earth was merely a guise; Li Fan's true objective was to attract its attention, thereby enabling him to sense more of the hidden imprints.

The imprints were both new and old. If the new traces could be dimly discerned with Li Fan's current strength, then the old imprints were difficult to distinguish. He could only rely on the familiar aura he had glimpsed before to instinctively sense their existence.

The age of the imprints was relative. Even the new traces were thousands of years old.

"The Five Elements Great Grotto-Heaven was the work of the Yi Shi Sect. To counter the tribulations of world-ending calamity, they guided the generation of laws within the Xuanhuang Root of Heaven and Earth."

"With the Five Elements complete and flowing harmoniously, a realm was formed. Every time a Five Elements Great Grotto-Heaven was gestated, it was a great depletion for the Xuanhuang Realm. It was like a mortal woman giving birth; normally, one would be the limit. However, within the Xuanhuang Realm's Root of Heaven and Earth, the Yi Shi Sect's guidance remained. Thus, this gestation process would never cease..."

Li Fan's eyes gleamed as he understood the origin and reason behind the new traces. He pointed a finger forward, and even though he felt a powerful repulsive force, Li Fan still used his own strength to forcefully push his way back in. It was as if he had poked a hornet's nest; the countless black and white lines within the Root of Heaven and Earth instantly surged. They all rushed towards Li Fan, as if determined to fight to the death.

This time, Li Fan no longer played the role of a target. As his figure flickered, he evaded the attacks of the Root of Heaven and Earth, using his finger as a knife to sever the imprints left by the Yi Shi Sect one by one.

*Humming...* The Root of Heaven and Earth vibrated in response. It must have understood Li Fan's intentions. The previously enraged lines turned gentle. Returning to its original state, it became calm once more. In the flash of an eye, Li Fan had destroyed all the traces imprinted by the Yi Shi Sect within the Root of Heaven and Earth. From then on, no new Five Elements Great Grotto-Heavens would be gestated in the Xuanhuang Realm. After all, Li Fan planned to promote the birth of a Super Xuanhuang Realm, and the gestation of the Five Elements Grotto-Heavens was a genuine depletion of the Xuanhuang Realm's power. Li Fan naturally would not allow such a thing to continue.

Not only the Five Elements Great Grotto-Heavens, but also other unnecessary grotto-heavens within the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan would prevent their appearance, accumulating power for the Xuanhuang Realm. The repulsive force from the Root of Heaven and Earth had completely disappeared, allowing Li Fan to examine the ancient, almost imperceptible old traces more carefully.
