The ascension of Xuanhuang to Immortality is indeed not easy. He originally thought that by following the plan step by step, he could achieve his goal. But after all, the difference between Immortals and mortals is like the difference between heaven and earth. As the plan slowly progressed, various problems emerged. Fortunately, Li Fan had enough capital to deal with them one by one, so he felt no anxiety.

While Li Fan was contemplating, the Xuanhuang Realm experienced a brief period of tranquility. Just like its original historical trajectory. But this rare tranquility was soon broken again. The reason was that someone had crossed the Horizon Distance Array and returned from the foot of the high wall.

Sensing the anomaly, Li Fan temporarily put away his thoughts. The returnee was Bai Hua. She looked somewhat battered. Her originally pure glazed body was now covered with scratches. Light and shadow flickered unstably, as if on the verge of extinguishing.

"Saint Master..." Seeing Li Fan appear before her, Bai Hua let out a sigh of relief.

"What happened? After I returned, I couldn't find traces of you all. The Remnant Realm Great Wall also fell into turmoil, and the accumulated residual True Immortal power poured down..." Li Fan asked with a solemn expression. While inquiring, he didn't forget to emit a strand of Origin Force essence to heal Bai Hua's injuries.

The effect of Origin Force essence was immediate. Nourished by it, Bai Hua instantly regained her spirits. She first cupped her hands in thanks, and then said with some indignation: "That Yin Shangren, I don't know what madness he was suffering from. He rushed towards a certain point of the Remnant Realm Great Wall without regard for our dissuasion."

"It's one thing for him to not value his life, but shortly after, the anomaly erupted instantly. We were caught off guard and were affected by the residual True Immortal power, scattering us."

Bai Hua suppressed her anger: "I was lucky. I happened to collide with the Remnant Realm Great Wall. Although I suffered some minor injuries, I ultimately saved my life."

"Fellow Daoist Qiao Gong, I'm afraid he wasn't as lucky." Bai Hua's expression turned grim. "I personally saw him drifting towards the high wall."

"In my opinion, the danger is high..."

After hearing Bai Hua's account, Li Fan fell into silence.

"What about Xu Ke?" Li Fan asked again. Xu Ke had always had great luck, so he should have been able to escape danger.

"The situation was too chaotic at the time, and I didn't see him. However, on my way back, I did see the communication mark he left behind."

Chapter 1331: Sunken Land of the Utmost Darkness

"The mark should have been left by Xu Ke recently. However, I searched the vicinity but couldn't find his trace. The residual True Immortal power became increasingly fierce, and I couldn't endure it any longer, so I had no choice but to return through the teleportation array," Bai Hua said, still somewhat shaken.

The principle of the Horizon Distance Array was actually different from ordinary teleportation arrays, but the effect was the same. Bai Hua habitually called it a teleportation array, and Li Fan did not correct her.

He began to follow the traces he had left on the few people earlier, sensing their current location and condition. Xu Ke and Qiao Gong were indeed still alive. However, Qiao Gong's situation was even better than Xu Ke's. Xu Ke's aura flickered erratically, clearly indicating that he was surviving with great difficulty in the aftermath of the True Immortal residual power. Meanwhile, Qiao Gong's situation was surprisingly stable, as if he was not affected by the turbulent Star Power at all.

As for Yin Shangren... The mark he left behind had completely disappeared. "As expected, there's something strange. Not to mention that with his current strength, he wouldn't be able to detect my methods. Even if he vaguely sensed it, based on my actions earlier, he should have treated it as my care and wouldn't have actively removed it."

The border of the Star Sea, the Remnant Realm Great Wall, and the high wall were all unfamiliar territories to Li Fan. Letting these individuals with great luck who had survived the primordial calamity explore the way was Li Fan's original intention. This sudden outbreak of reverberating Star Power had merely accelerated the process.

Li Fan decided not to concern himself with them for the time being. He would ask them for details when they returned. He understood the temperaments of these people very well. Nothing major would happen. "Don't worry, they are all safe and have each had their own encounters."

Hearing Li Fan say this, Bai Hua's expression became somewhat subtle.

Without paying attention to Bai Hua's thoughts, Li Fan handed over another ball of Origin Force essence: "Don't go to the teleportation array for now. Wait until the storm subsides." "However, with the True Immortal residual power blowing, the teleportation array needs maintenance periodically. Otherwise, once it's damaged, it will require another trip to re-establish it, adding many variables. This task will be entrusted to you."

Along with the Origin Force essence were various pieces of information related to maintaining the Horizon Distance Array. Bai Hua nodded in understanding and soon became engrossed in this profound formation knowledge. Although it only involved the basic unit structures of the great array and not its core parts, it still captivated Bai Hua.

After arranging for Bai Hua, Li Fan gazed into the Utmost Darkness Star Sea. "The impact of the reverberating Star Power will reach the vicinity of the Xuanhuang Realm in about half a month. Just like in his previous life, the entire world will be shaken violently."

"It would be a pity to let this powerful force go to waste."

Having witnessed the scene of the Utmost Darkness Star Sea from a higher dimensional perspective, and having personally seen a minor world ascend and then fall, shattering into pieces, Li Fan gained a new understanding of the residual True Immortal power accumulated and sealed by the Remnant Realm Great Wall.

"The True Immortal power triggered by the 'Hunger' script attained by the True Immortal meditating in the Immortal Ruins, as it expanded outwards, encountered the obstruction of the high wall. Accumulating over time, it gathered beneath the high wall, forming a relative highland due to the accumulation of the True Immortal power's 'potential'."

"Because it is merely a simple accumulation of power, it cannot maintain stability."

"On one hand, it will fall to lower places. On the other hand..." Li Fan narrowed his eyes, as if seeing the magnificent scene beneath the high wall again.

"Under normal circumstances, this True Immortal power should have slowly returned to the Utmost Darkness Star Sea. But for unknown reasons, the Remnant Realm Great Wall formed beneath the high wall, firmly blocking this True Immortal power."

"Allowing it to form a peculiar stable state. Now, this stability has been broken."

"The True Immortal power is pouring down, like a surging flood, slowly flowing into the low-lying Utmost Darkness Star Sea, raising the entire Star Sea..."

A flash of enlightenment crossed Li Fan's mind. The rapid recovery of the Star Sea in his previous life might have been driven by this event.

"What I need to do now is to find a way to intercept and temporarily store this flood."

"For future use when the Xuanhuang Realm ascends."

This was undoubtedly a massive undertaking. To achieve perfection within the short span of half a month was impossible. Li Fan could only do his best.

The location of the Xuanhuang Realm was very special. Outside the Immortal Ruins. Because of the presence of the True Immortal meditating within the Immortal Ruins, from the perspective of the overall altitude distribution of the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, the Xuanhuang Realm was undoubtedly near the highest peak. In fact, due to its proximity, it was already slightly situated at a higher ground. Like the surrounding slopes of a mountain rising from the ground.

"Therefore, like an invisible barrier, the Xuanhuang Realm naturally faces less impact."

"And what I need to do is to create a low-lying area and then guide the True Immortal power to accumulate there as much as possible."

Li Fan nodded slightly. He had personally experienced the journey of ascension. To ascend and approach immortality, one only needed to continuously stimulate energy and elevate their own potential. But regarding how to create a low-lying area... Li Fan currently had no clues. However, when he overlooked the Utmost Darkness Sea from the high point of the Remnant Realm Great Wall and the main control core of the Utmost Darkness Sea, he had indeed seen lower-lying areas in the Star Sea compared to normal regions.

"Let's go and see first."

Li Fan acted decisively. He went to Ou Shangtian and generated some more True Immortal flesh and blood. Looking at Ou Shangtian, whose face was already as pale as thin gold, Li Fan frowned slightly. "It seems that finding True Immortal remains is imminent."

Li Fan suppressed the thought for the time being. The Origin Force essence transformed into protective golden armor. The wooden sword phantom unsheathed, and in an instant, he had left the Xuanhuang Realm, speeding through the Utmost Darkness Star Sea.

While rapidly flying towards the target area in his memory, he also contemplated the changes in altitude. When the wooden sword left a certain area of the Star Sea, Li Fan seemed to sense something. He returned and stopped in the void, observing carefully. "Indeed, this is a natural low-lying area."

"But if I hadn't seen the scene of high and low altitudes before and observed it from an elevated perspective, I might not have discovered its peculiarity."

"It looks no different from other areas in the Star Sea."

Li Fan frowned. Rays of divine sense flew out, exploring various parts of the area separately. The result was the same as his perception. This low-lying area seemed to show no difference from normal regions due to its low potential.

Standing there for more than half a day, still making no progress. Li Fan suddenly realized something. He controlled his physical strength and spiritual power, flicked his finger, and shot out a sword qi. It was merely an imitation of a Nascent Soul stage cultivator's attack. The sword qi hissed as it flew past, tearing open a rift in the space. Although it vanished instantly and the rift quickly returned to its original state, Li Fan still saw it.

"So that's how it is."

"This low-lying area has become fragile."

Li Fan suddenly understood. It wasn't just the space itself. But all the conditions that maintained the existence of this space had significantly weakened compared to normal Star Sea regions. "The Xuanhuang Realm's cultivators in this region would be like True Immortals. They could destroy the world with a glance, and it would save a lot of effort."

Li Fan felt the fragility of this low-lying area. "Its potential, compared to the Xuanhuang Realm, is not much different. But in terms of concrete phenomena, it is so obvious!"

Li Fan mused in silence. "If it were even lower, lower to the extreme, what would happen?"

A question jumped out. Li Fan's thoughts drifted. However, this place was already the lowest point in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea. Li Fan's question currently had no ready answer for reference.

The date of the reverberating Star Power's impact was drawing closer, and Li Fan's thoughts returned to the present. "With my current understanding, I still cannot figure out the specific reasons for the formation of these low-lying areas."

"But it doesn't prevent me from using them first."

When Li Fan was an official in Great Xuan, he had personally inspected and designed blueprints, carried out water conservancy projects, and benefited the region. To him now, the project of channeling True Immortal power towards the low-lying areas was essentially no different from water conservancy construction.

"This low-lying area is a natural reservoir."

"What I need to do is to divert the True Immortal power here!"

"The first step is to prevent this low-lying area from absorbing the attracted True Immortal power, otherwise it will only lead to the rise and disappearance of the low-lying area..."

"Origin Force essence does not dissolve in True Immortal power, making it an excellent material."

A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan's eyes. Then, an endless stream of Origin Force essence, like a long cloth, erupted from him. Just a thin layer was used for isolation. Under Li Fan's manipulation, it quickly covered the entire low-lying area. Golden light dispersed, and the Origin Force essence dissipated into the darkness, seemingly no different from before. But Li Fan knew that compared to before, a qualitative change had occurred here.

"Next, we need to expand the inlet of this low-lying area as much as possible."

"At the same time, continuously strengthen the isolation layer at the bottom of the low-lying area."

"Origin Force essence is running out, so I can only trouble the Ghost Tribe for now."

Li Fan's divine sense moved, and the Ghost Tribe members raised in the Great Profound Minor World all sensed something. They all woke up from their slumber. Then they knelt and prayed piously, without eating or drinking. The Origin Force essence slowly became abundant again, while Li Fan, using the elevated perspective, looked down upon this area. The irregular boundary was not large in scope. If it were to truly encounter the True Immortal residual power, the amount that could be gathered might be extremely limited.

"How to divert the flow?"

After some thought, Li Fan had an idea. The wooden sword phantom flickered continuously. In the following days, Li Fan set up numerous Ascension Arrays in the vast Star Sea around the low-lying area.

As the True Immortal flesh and blood was consumed too quickly, Li Fan had to return to the Xuanhuang Realm again. Ou Shangtian was already on the verge of death, and even the Kun Qian bone hand showed fine cracks. It seemed impossible to generate True Immortal flesh and blood in a short time. However, enough materials were finally gathered.

The formations were arranged according to the plan. Li Fan felt the impending impact of the reverberating Star Power and waited silently.

"Currently, I have not found a way to anchor the state after ascension."

"But a short-term burst can create peaks and change the direction of the True Immortal power. This is achievable."

"According to my precise calculations, the True Immortal power in this vast surrounding Star Sea will all be diverted here."

Buzz...

As Li Fan expected, the reverberating Star Power, like a surging tide and a terrifying storm, arrived as scheduled. With resolute eyes, Li Fan activated the Ascension Arrays one after another. In the void not far from the Xuanhuang Realm in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, a miraculous scene appeared.

Invisible to ordinary people. Only those who had ascended to a peak and looked down from above could glimpse it. Numerous low peaks suddenly rose, blocking the surging True Immortal power. Although these peaks quickly fell after rising, they truly collided with the surging True Immortal power. The low peaks rumbled and fell. The True Immortal power, after repeated collisions, changed its flow direction. All of it surged towards the low-lying area designated by Li Fan.

Whoosh, whoosh, whoosh...

It started as a gentle breeze. But as more and more True Immortal power was diverted, the roaring True Immortal power here became even stronger than the initial outbreak point beneath the high wall. Li Fan had to hide within the wooden sword phantom, relying on the profound meaning of [Transformation between True and False] to evade the influence of the True Immortal power.

Watching the low-lying area gradually fill up, even with Li Fan's composure, he couldn't help but feel a sense of pride. "What True Immortals can do, I can also do now!"

"Even if it's a bit more troublesome, as long as I master the specific method, I can replicate it countless times in the future!"

Just like being blocked by the Remnant Realm Great Wall beneath the high wall. Numerous amounts of True Immortal power piled up in the low-lying area. Due to the isolation of Origin Force essence and the inherent special nature of this place, it did not cause the "potential" of space itself to rise, but only continuously accumulated power. It was like another Immortal Ruins, slowly appearing before Li Fan's eyes.

The wooden sword phantom flickered, flickering on and off. The suction force grew stronger and stronger, as if truly facing a True Immortal in the Immortal Ruins. Li Fan frowned, controlling the phantom, and left the range of the low-lying area. Upon leaving the low-lying area, Li Fan immediately felt the massive suction force gathered within decrease significantly. It was as if they were no longer in the same world.

The surge of True Immortal power continued. Finally, when the low-lying area was completely filled, the overflowing tide began to sweep towards other areas of the Star Sea. However, with such a large reservoir, the power of the storm had been significantly reduced. Especially since this reservoir was located in front of the Xuanhuang Realm, the beings in the Xuanhuang Realm hardly felt any of the resulting upheaval.

In this life, the Myriad Immortals Alliance members, who had also received the warning message from the Dharma Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, looked at each other. "The tremor that the Heavenly Venerate mentioned shouldn't have arrived yet, right?" "It's definitely just the prelude; the main event is yet to come!"

Chapter 1332: Again Poisoning Mo Ruibin

However, after waiting for a long time, the Dharma Transmitters of the Myriad Immortals Alliance never waited for greater turmoil in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Had the Heavenly Venerate misjudged? No matter how unbelievable it was, the Dharma Transmitters eventually had to accept this fact.

But out of reverence for the Dharma Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, none of them dared to openly discuss it, let alone proactively inquire with the Dharma Transmitter Heavenly Venerate.

They could only attribute the reason to the Heavenly Venerate's deep concern for the common people of Xuanhuang, and even minor tremors were worth warning about, as a tremor had indeed occurred.

Unbeknownst to the beings of the Xuanhuang Realm, a vast amount of True Immortal power had quietly accumulated outside the void.

Li Fan stood before the filled low-lying area, sensing the faint suction, and nodded with satisfaction.

This time's harvest was even greater than expected. The existence of the natural low-lying area served as a near-perfect container for the True Immortal power.

Coupled with the sealing formation Li Fan had set up at the edge of the area, the anomaly here could be perfectly concealed.

Li Fan was confident that even if the Dharma Transmitters meticulously investigated, they would not discover anything unusual here if they merely flew through.

"With the current accumulation, the plan for the Super Xuanhuang Realm has a greater chance of success."

The power triggered by the True Immortal meditating on the 'Hunger' script in the Immortal Ruins was naturally different from pure Immortal Spiritual Power and could not be directly absorbed by the Xuanhuang Realm.

However, Li Fan could channel this vast power through the Ascension Array as a driving force for the Xuanhuang Realm's ascent, thereby greatly reducing the consumption of True Immortal flesh and blood.

Otherwise, with the output from Kun Qian's bone hand alone, even if Ou Shangtian was completely drained, it would be impossible to construct enough Ascension Arrays.

"Like a lake suspended in the sky, like the ruins of the Immortal Realm."

After gazing for a long time, Li Fan finally shifted his gaze away from the low-lying area.

He temporarily concealed the area with a formation.

"Next, we need to find a way to anchor the world's altitude."

"Otherwise, we'll have to resort to risky measures and force out the Heavenly Immortal Souls before the Xuanhuang Realm's Immortal Fall. The situation will change instantly, and anything could happen. We might fail at the last moment..."

"The output of True Immortal flesh and blood and Origin Force essence must also be increased simultaneously."

To act like a True Immortal in a mortal body naturally comes with many constraints.

Although Li Fan, with his accumulations from multiple reincarnations, could find various peculiar substitute powers, they were not Immortal Spiritual Power itself.

As he got closer to his goal, everything became increasingly troublesome.

Li Fan currently had no clue on how to temporarily anchor the world at a high altitude.

Setting aside the meditating True Immortal in the Immortal Ruins, from the elevated perspective, apart from the Remnant Realm Great Wall at the foot of the high wall, the peaks in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea were mostly gathered in the depths of the Xuanhuang Realm's Utmost Darkness Sea.

Of course, there were also naturally formed peaks in the Star Sea.

Like the low-lying area here, they were not something Li Fan could currently research and comprehend.

"Next, we'll proceed with two strategies simultaneously."

"At the foot of the high wall, and in the Utmost Darkness Sea... both need to be analyzed concurrently."

"As for the high wall, perhaps we can leave it to the Profound Immortal Boat. Their ability to research and utilize True Immortal scripts means those Immortal Boat elders are definitely capable. As for the Utmost Darkness Sea..."

The image of Mo Rubin, the Dharma King of the Xuan Tian Sect, immediately appeared in Li Fan's mind.

"Coincidentally, through the exchange with the Immortal Boat, I have already mastered the [Reveal] script. Perhaps it's time to awaken Mo Rubin."

One of the functions of the [Reveal] script is to reveal the connections between all things.

Mo Rubin's cultivation techniques were all inherited from the Azure Nether Pearl.

If possible, perhaps by relying on the [Reveal] script, he could follow the clues and find the Azure Nether Pearl or even traces of King Xuan Tian.

"This person, Mo Rubin, cultivates the [Myriad Tribulations Undying Demonic Heart Immortal Art]. Multiple personalities can be switched almost at will. Furthermore, he is meticulous and cunning."

"But King Xuan Tian is his fatal weakness..."

Li Fan's figure flickered, and in an instant, he returned to Xuanhuang and arrived beneath the Dao Platform.

The giant net woven by Origin Force essence was sealing the sleeping Mo Rubin and Ji Yuzhen's primordial souls.

Li Fan did not awaken Ji Yuzhen, the female Dharma King.

Although he had already absorbed most of her memories and understood her better, this female Dharma King felt more dangerous to Li Fan than Mo Rubin.

Relatively speaking, Mo Rubin, with whom he had interacted for several lifetimes, was easier to handle.

Flicking his finger, the wooden sword phantom unsheathed, and Li Fan took Mo Rubin to the void outside the Xuanhuang Realm.

Then, he slowly withdrew the sealing golden net.

Exposed to the cold and silent Utmost Darkness Star Sea, Mo Rubin instinctively sensed danger and slowly woke up.

Almost the moment he regained consciousness, Mo Rubin noticed Li Fan standing not far away.

"Hmm? I remember before I fell asleep, I was..."

Mo Rubin was initially confused, then he pondered for a moment and roughly guessed the culprit behind all this.

"What does Daoist friend intend to do?"

Mo Rubin sized up Li Fan, his words full of vigilance.

A mirror-like boundary, hidden in the darkness, silently materialized and locked onto Li Fan.

This was a divine ability from the Myriad Tribulations Undying Demonic Heart Immortal Art, which could replace the figure reflected on the other side of the mirror, turning it into a new demonic heart added to oneself.

As long as they were enveloped by it, regardless of their cultivation level, they would be unable to escape.

This was Mo Rubin's confidence, inherited from the Immortal Realm.

However, Mo Rubin soon sensed something was wrong, and his expression changed slightly.

The mirror had indeed enveloped Li Fan.

But there was no trace of Li Fan on the other side of the mirror!

It was as if the person before him was merely an illusion that did not exist in the real world!

Contradictorily, the unrestrained life force emanating from Li Fan clearly indicated his reality!

The [Transformation between True and False] was even above the [Creation] True Immortal script, naturally beyond Mo Rubin's comprehension.

At this moment, this Dharma King of the Xuan Tian Sect only knew that he had encountered a very troublesome enemy.

After trying several more times and still being unable to lock onto Li Fan, he decisively gave up.

Silently, he retracted the mirror boundary divine ability.

"Daoist Mo need not be nervous. If I truly intended to harm you, why would I have awakened you intentionally?"

"The Myriad Tribulations Undying Demonic Heart Immortal Art is not truly indestructible. I have at least three or four methods to break it," Li Fan said with a slight smile and a soft voice.

These words were like thunder to Mo Rubin.

The Myriad Tribulations Undying Demonic Heart Immortal Art was a cultivation technique personally taught to him by King Xuan Tian, and few people knew about it.

Yet Li Fan had revealed the heavenly secret in one sentence... wωω ●●￠ ○

"Who exactly is Daoist friend?"

Mo Rubin asked with a solemn expression.

Li Fan did not answer directly but instead asked: "Does Daoist friend know how long you have been asleep?"

His attention had been fully drawn to Li Fan before.

Now, reminded by Li Fan, Mo Rubin counted on his fingers and his body trembled.

"Ten thousand years have passed, and everything has changed. If Daoist friend is interested, why not listen to me tell you the story of these years?" Li Fan said sincerely.

Mo Rubin pondered, then nodded.

Thus, Li Fan began to narrate the story of the destruction of the Tian Xuan Sect, the rise of the Ten Great Sects, the subsequent calamities, the near-destruction of the Xuanhuang Realm, the sudden emergence of the Dharma Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, and the division of power between the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders' Council.

Mo Rubin's expression constantly changed.

"These insects of the Ten Great Sects deserve to die!"

From beginning to end, Mo Rubin could only utter this single sentence.

During other times, he listened attentively.

With his demonic heart immortal art's keen perception of the emotions of those around him, Mo Rubin was eighty percent sure that the other party was not lying.

"The members of the Ten Great Sects inherited the legacy of the Xuan Tian Sect and also had the true teachings of the Great Master, so they would not be easily destroyed. Some of them had already left the realm before the calamity fully erupted."

Li Fan shook his head slightly.

"Left?"

Mo Rubin narrowed his eyes.

"They didn't leave the Xuanhuang Realm, but crossed the high wall to go beyond it!" Li Fan said with certainty.

Mo Rubin's reaction was unprecedentedly intense: "Beyond the high wall? Impossible!"

Li Fan had long anticipated Mo Rubin's response: "Daoist friend, please watch!"

With a gentle wave of his hand, an image of a sky-piercing sword erupting with boundless light, tearing through heaven and earth, and soaring away appeared before Mo Rubin's eyes.

"This was the scene when the Heavenly Sword Sect forged the Realm-Breaking Divine Sword and left the realm. Although I'm not sure if they succeeded, such might should indicate more than just escaping the Xuanhuang Realm, right?" Li Fan asked.

Mo Rubin stared intently at the endlessly repeating image.

"This Realm-Breaking Divine Weapon is merely a mortal artifact. How could it cross the high wall? It's simply laughable!"

Mo Rubin refused to change his stance.

"The divine weapon was forged by refining [Primordial Essence Gold] with countless sword intent Dao embryos, supplemented by countless heavenly materials and earthly treasures..." Li Fan said unhurriedly.

Mo Rubin interrupted Li Fan: "Just these? No matter what heavenly materials and earthly treasures, as long as they are products of the Xuanhuang Realm, they cannot have this effect."

"What if... a strand of pure Immortal Spiritual Power were added?" Li Fan asked again in a deep voice.

"!!!"

Mo Rubin's head shot up, staring at Li Fan.

"Immortal Spiritual Power?"

His expression and tone were completely different from before.

After a long silence, Mo Rubin said faintly: "If the core of this Realm-Breaking Divine Weapon truly contained Immortal Spiritual Power, then it's indeed possible to cross the high wall with this..."

"That's it." Li Fan said inexplicably.

Did the Realm-Breaking Divine Weapon forged by the Heavenly Sword Sect back then truly contain Immortal Spiritual Power? Li Fan didn't know.

However, the forging of the divine weapon by the Heavenly Sword Sect was instructed by Mr. Bai.

Mr. Bai inherited the legacy of the Great Heavenly Venerate and had even returned from the high wall.

How could he not know that ordinary mortal materials could not cross the high wall? If they failed, they would collide with the high wall and undoubtedly perish.

Given Mr. Bai's character, how could he do something that would lead to a futile sacrifice?

Therefore, in his previous life, after learning the weight of the Great Heavenly Venerate's legacy from Sun Tianci, Li Fan developed this conjecture: Mr. Bai had once divided a portion of the Immortal Spiritual Power obtained from detonating the Immortal Artifacts and gave it to the Heavenly Sword Sect, successfully helping them complete the plan to escape through the realm.

Because compared to the remaining four Immortal Artifacts such as the Great Sun Golden Bell, the amount of Immortal Spiritual Power obtained from detonating the other nine Immortal Artifacts was indeed too little.

It was less like being consumed and more like being divided.

It was even uncertain whether other sect members, besides the Heavenly Sword Sect, were on that Realm-Breaking Divine Weapon back then.

Faced with Li Fan's explanation, Mo Rubin was silent for a long time, and then couldn't help but curse: "Damn it, he only cared about his own escape and ignored the common people of Xuanhuang!"

Mo Rubin had the confidence to curse like this.

Back then, King Xuan Tian, who was already a half-immortal, could absolutely escape alone.

But it was precisely for the sake of taking his homeland, the Xuanhuang Realm, with him that the long Star Crossing plan and subsequent twists and turns occurred.

Hearing Mo Rubin say this, Li Fan also went with the flow and shifted the topic to King Xuan Tian.

"King Xuan Tian's character was noble, like the sun shining through the ages, peerless in the world. Not to mention these rats of the Ten Great Sects, even after ten thousand years, no one has appeared to inherit his aspirations. The Xuanhuang Realm has persisted until now only because its inhabitants sought self-salvation." Li Fan couldn't help but sigh, lamenting.

Hearing Li Fan praising King Xuan Tian so much, Mo Rubin's perception of him gradually changed.

However, he did not immediately let down his guard.

"To be honest, I wish to follow King Xuan Tian's ambition, save the Xuanhuang Realm from dire straits, and help it cross the high wall to escape this Utmost Darkness Star Sea."

"For this, I have poured all my effort and wisdom for half my life. When my lifespan is nearing its end, looking back, I find that in the vast Xuanhuang Realm, there is not a single person worthy of trust or companionship." Li Fan's tone conveyed a hint of desolation.

Mo Rubin, after careful observation, also discovered the fact that Li Fan's lifespan was nearing its end.

His pupils contracted sharply.

Li Fan continued: "By chance, I discovered the deeds of the heroes of the ancient Xuan Tian Sect, and my heart was greatly moved, considering them as confidants."

"I even searched for traces of any possible survivors and finally found you, Fellow Daoist, who was in slumber..." Li Fan looked at Mo Rubin, revealing a look of contentment.

Mo Rubin felt a complex mix of emotions surge within him.

However, being cautious by nature, he suppressed these emotions and began to ponder the credibility of what the other party had said.

"The matters of the Xuan Tian Sect happened over ten thousand years ago. How do you know about them?" Mo Rubin asked.

"In a circular mountain, amidst blooming flowers, I discovered the fragmented soul of Ji Yuzhen." Li Fan replied truthfully.

"Although it's just a hodgepodge of countless memory fragments, I can still glimpse the past events of the Xuan Tian Sect."

Mo Rubin's expression trembled: "Ji Yuzhen? Is she still alive?"

Li Fan shook his head slightly: "Only a remnant soul remains."

Mo Rubin was about to say something more, but suddenly stopped.

After a moment of silence, he looked directly at Li Fan and said, "Back then, the Xuan Tian Sect suffered a great upheaval. Brothers died or were injured, and contact was lost. There might even have been traitors among us..."

"Honestly, besides King Xuan Tian, I trust no one."

Li Fan nodded, expressing understanding: "In fact, I awakened you also because I wanted to find King Xuan Tian."

Chapter 1333: The Heavenly King's Mysterious Disappearance

"These past few years, in pursuit of the heroes of the former Xuan Tian Sect, I've scoured the ends of the earth, leaving almost no corner of the Xuanhuang Realm unsearched. While I've been fortunate enough to find some traces of the Dharma Kings, I've yet to discover any clues relating to King Xuan Tian himself. Yet, I can hardly believe that with King Xuan Tian's peerless cultivation back then, he has truly perished..." Li Fan said with utmost sincerity, his face etched with earnestness.

Mo Rubin listened quietly, his expression unreadable.

"Tens of thousands of years have passed, and the situation in the Xuanhuang Realm grows increasingly perilous, teetering on the brink of falling into the Immortal Ruins. If not for the numerous arrangements King Xuan Tian left behind back then, it likely wouldn't have held on until now!"

"The arrangements from back then?" Mo Rubin narrowed his eyes.

"Precisely, the Star Crossing Great Array!" Li Fan exclaimed with deep emotion. "Built upon the foundation of an ancient immortal array, it manifested near-immortal power through mortal means! It's a shame the array is already incomplete..."

Li Fan stated gravely, "Reactivating the Star Crossing Great Array might be the only means of saving the world. This array is profoundly mysterious; even after ten thousand years since its construction, I cannot fully comprehend it."

Mo Rubin snorted, "That's only natural. Immortal Realm inheritances, how could mortal cultivators possibly fathom them!"

Li Fan agreed, nodding in concurrence, "First, the Ten Great Immortal Sects collectively fled, followed by ten millennia of strife and calamity, leading to the extinction of countless legacies. Now, the standards of arrays, artifacts, elixirs, and talismans in the Xuanhuang Realm, compared to ten thousand years ago, have not only failed to progress but have also declined significantly!"

"To reconstruct and restore the Star Crossing Great Array, finding King Xuan Tian is our only hope! But as I mentioned before, there isn't even the slightest shred of a clue! My lifespan is nearing its end, and I simply cannot wait any longer. In my utmost desperation, I had no choice but to awaken you, fellow Daoist."

Li Fan observed Mo Rubin's pensive expression and continued with a heavy tone, "From the residual memories of Ji Yuzhen's soul, I also learned of the existence of traitors within the Xuan Tian Sect back then. Therefore, making this decision was an act of great courage on my part. I feared entrusting this to the wrong person, which could lead to unforeseen consequences for King Xuan Tian. Hence, I chose to awaken you in the void outside the Xuanhuang Realm, far from its borders..."

"When the Ten Sects attacked the Xuan Tian Sect back then, where were you, Daoist friend? In Dharma King Ji's memories, you were always by King Xuan Tian's side!" Li Fan's tone gradually turned solemn.

Seeing that the cultivator from this later generation was actually interrogating him, Mo Rubin did not get angry. Frowning slightly, he recalled the events of that year, as if transported back to the day that changed the fate of the Xuanhuang Realm.

"At that time, I was guiding the core cultivators of the Ten Sects into the depths of the sect." Mo Rubin's words were astonishing.

Li Fan's eyebrows twitched, but instead of becoming agitated, he quietly awaited further explanation.

Mo Rubin seemed slightly surprised by Li Fan's composure. He nodded slightly and continued, "At that moment, Brother Xuanyuan had already detected those within the sect with impure intentions, who were colluding with the Ten Sects and plotting against us."

"At that time, Brother Xuanyuan was undergoing a breakthrough and decided to play along, luring the snakes out of their holes..."

Mo Rubin paused, taking a deep breath. "The plan was proceeding smoothly; I had successfully gained the trust of the Ten Sects. And I led them to quietly break through the protective barriers of the Xuan Tian Sect's headquarters..."

A hint of regret flickered in Mo Rubin's eyes.

"However, those barriers could only serve to delay them. The true killing blow was Brother Xuanyuan's strength after his breakthrough, and the killing array he personally set up. Actively dismantling and dispersing them actually lessened their vigilance. It was just that we didn't anticipate..."

"Flee quickly!"

It was as if King Xuan Tian's final transmission from back then echoed in his ears. Mo Rubin instinctively clenched his fist.

"I heard Brother Xuanyuan's message telling me to flee quickly, and I knew something must have gone wrong. So I accelerated towards the direction where Brother's aura had vanished..."

"That was not the agreed-upon ambush location, nor was it Brother Xuanyuan's usual cultivation retreat. It was merely the hall where the Faceless Immortal statue was displayed. Brother Xuanyuan had ordered it sealed earlier. For some reason, Brother reappeared there."

"By the time I was the first to arrive, Brother had completely vanished. And that statue..." Mo Rubin suddenly fell silent.

Hearing Mo Rubin's account, Li Fan's heart was profoundly shaken. However, he feigned ignorance, "The Faceless Immortal statue, what is that? And why was it sealed by the Xuan Tian Sect? After the Ten Immortal Sects unified the Xuanhuang Realm, they erased everything related to the former Xuan Tian Sect. Dharma King Ji's residual memories also seem to lack any mention of this Faceless Immortal statue."

Mo Rubin looked up, observing Li Fan, and after some thought, finally explained, "The Faceless Immortal is a True Immortal who saved Brother Xuanyuan's life. When Brother Xuanyuan first arrived in the Immortal Realm, before he could condense his True Immortal body, a calamity descended. If not for the casual rescue by this Faceless True Immortal, he might have perished in the Immortal Realm back then."

Li Fan slowly nodded. Then, he couldn't help but ask with complete bewilderment, "It seems this Faceless True Immortal was a good person. Why did the Xuan Tian Sect later order the sealing of his statue, appearing to be full of wariness towards him?"

Mo Rubin let out a cold snort, "A good person... He was no ordinary person, but a complete True Immortal. The same matter, from the perspective of a mortal cultivator and a True Immortal, would elicit entirely different attitudes! Initially, Brother Xuanyuan erected the Faceless Immortal statue, firstly to express his gratitude for the life-saving kindness. And secondly, to attempt to establish contact with this True Immortal whom he met only fleetingly."

"If we could obtain the help of this senior True Immortal, saving the Xuanhuang Realm would undoubtedly be much easier..."

Mo Rubin's expression grew progressively grim as he spoke, "However, Brother Xuanyuan soon realized he was mistaken. The attitude of True Immortals towards mortal beings can only be described as indifferent!"

"The Faceless Immortal could casually save Brother Xuanyuan because Brother Xuanyuan had already ascended the immortal path; even if he hadn't condensed his True Immortal body yet, he was a true 'Half-Immortal.' He was of the same kind. But for mortal beings... even for the inhabitants of an entire world, even if it were just a gesture, the Faceless Immortal was utterly unwilling and disdainful to act!" Mo Rubin spoke with cold hatred.

"He even went so far as to persuade and warn Brother Xuanyuan..."

Mo Rubin was filled with indignation. Li Fan couldn't help but narrow his eyes and quicken his breathing, feigning righteous indignation.

"The distinction between Immortals and mortals is like the chasm between heaven and earth. But no matter what, aren't Immortals also ascended mortals? To stand by and watch while they perish, with such indifference!"

Mo Rubin continued, "As the saying goes, those with different paths cannot plan together. After their opinions diverged, Brother Xuanyuan no longer contacted this True Immortal and sealed the statue. He even planned to recast the Xuan Tian statues in various locations."

"However, before he could act, the drastic change had already occurred."

"According to what you're saying, Daoist, it's highly likely that King Xuan Tian met his unfortunate end at the hands of the Faceless Immortal?" Li Fan asked with feigned shock.

"A True Immortal personally intervening, even with King Xuan Tian's peerless demeanor, it would be difficult to survive, right? No wonder I haven't found any trace of him for so many years..." Li Fan pretended to suddenly understand, then adopted a crestfallen demeanor.

Mo Rubin frowned, interrupting Li Fan's self-muttering, "Although the Faceless Immortal had some differences in ideology with Brother Xuanyuan, there was no reason for him to resort to killing."

"Moreover, True Immortals, though powerful, could not possibly kill Brother Xuanyuan in an instant," Mo Rubin stated with certainty.

"Brother Xuanyuan was already a Half-Immortal upon reaching the Immortal Realm. Before executing the 'luring the snakes out of their holes' plan, he told us that after battling with the Great Dharma Master, he achieved another breakthrough. Even if he wasn't a true Immortal in the ancient sense, he possessed enough strength to traverse the high wall himself."

Li Fan's heart trembled once more, "Then what exactly was it that caused the ever-advancing King Xuan Tian to disappear inexplicably?"

Even as he spoke those words, Li Fan's mind couldn't help but recall the scene from his previous life: the Cat Demon unexpectedly appearing at the end, devouring the True Immortal phantoms in one gulp, and then whisking away the True Immortal from the Immortal Ruins in an instant.

The two situations were remarkably similar!

"Could there be some connection between them?"

"But the incident in Xuan Tian happened more than ten thousand years ago. Furthermore, based on my previous speculation that the time flow outside the high wall might be inconsistent, if it were indeed someone from beyond the high wall who acted, it would have been tens of thousands, or even hundreds of thousands of years ago for them..." Li Fan found this line of reasoning somewhat flawed.

"However, looking at it this way, the methods of the powers beyond the wall for hunting True Immortals have indeed improved significantly. King Xuan Tian, not being a True Immortal, managed to send a warning message when facing misfortune. But that True Immortal from the Immortal Ruins, who was a True Immortal of the Immortal Realm, and had cultivated in the Immortal Ruins for ten thousand years, perhaps reaching the realm of the Nameless True Immortal, yet his fate was even more dire." A sense of dread surged within Li Fan.

Faced with Li Fan's inquiry, Mo Rubin could only remain silent.

If he knew the answer, he wouldn't have been filled with such trepidation, as if he had lost his backbone, when being chased by the Ten Immortal Sects.

"Although I'm not sure what terrifying existence caused King Xuan Tian's disappearance, I am certain that Brother Xuanyuan is still alive in this world." Mo Rubin stated with firm conviction after a long silence.

"Oh?" Li Fan raised his eyebrows, finding Mo Rubin's confidence difficult to comprehend.

After carefully choosing his words, Mo Rubin continued, "Back then, when I rushed to the scene after Brother Xuanyuan disappeared, the hall displaying the Faceless Immortal statue had already been damaged."

"And that Faceless Immortal statue..."

"Had startlingly grown a face!"

"The statue had fallen to the ground, its head severed mid-air, rolling to the side. But the face of the lone, fallen statue head was exactly like Brother Xuanyuan's!"

Mo Rubin uttered words that left Li Fan utterly astonished.

The scene from that year flashed through Li Fan's mind.

"This..."

"What happened again?" Li Fan asked, full of bewildered confusion.

Mo Rubin said grimly, "Initially, we all believed the Faceless Immortal had harmed King Xuan Tian. But later, during our escape, I felt a growing sense of unease. The reason is precisely as I've said before."

"Later, I ventured back and found a surviving Xuan Tian statue. I attempted to use the method Brother Xuanyuan taught us to re-establish contact with this Faceless Immortal..."

Li Fan gasped, "Daoist friend, your actions truly treated your life as nothing!"

Ignoring Li Fan's praise, Mo Rubin continued, "True Immortals generally pay no heed to us mortal ants. As expected, my first attempt at communication yielded no response."

"However, I didn't give up. I persisted continuously, for a full three years, initiating communication every moment!"

Upon hearing this, Li Fan immediately understood Mo Rubin's implication.

"Even if they disdain to acknowledge ants, if ants persistently pester them, True Immortals will surely be enraged and descend punishment. Based on my understanding of the Faceless Immortal, He indeed possessed the ability to do so."

"But strangely, He did not. It was as if it were merely an ordinary stone statue, with no response for three whole years."

"Thus, I deduced that after that day, not only King Xuan Tian, but even that Faceless Immortal, was severely wounded!"

"The reason the Faceless Immortal statue bizarrely manifested Brother Xuanyuan's face, and even had its head severed..."

Li Fan interjected with disbelief, "Could it be that the Faceless Immortal intervened and helped King Xuan Tian escape a calamity?"

Mo Rubin nodded, "This is also why I firmly believe Brother Xuanyuan is still alive. Although our paths differ, based on what Brother Xuanyuan had hinted at in the past, his relationship with this Faceless Immortal was actually quite good."

"Moreover, they are, after all, of the same kind. With a precedent of mutual assistance, saving him again is not impossible."

Li Fan remained silent for a long time.

After a prolonged pause, he shook his head and denied, "This is merely your speculation, Daoist friend."

"I originally thought that the opponent King Xuan Tian encountered back then, at most, would be another Half-Immortal. If a True Immortal, or even a stronger existence, intervened, the possibility of King Xuan Tian surviving would be exceedingly slim!" Li Fan said with a hint of dejection.

"Based solely on your guesswork, it is difficult to convince others."

Mo Rubin hesitated for a long time, then finally said in a deep voice, "It's not just baseless speculation. There's a subtle connection with Brother Xuanyuan that informs me, telling me Big Brother is still alive in this world."

Mo Rubin's words were vague and ambiguous. Li Fan wanted to press for more details, but Mo Rubin refused to elaborate.

"The Azure Nether Pearl?" Li Fan couldn't help but guess in his heart.

"Alright, since you are so certain, I will trust you this once!" Seeing that he could not elicit more information, Li Fan pretended to ponder for a long time before finally relenting.

"Anyway, I don't have much time left to live; this is just a last gamble."

"Observing your words and actions, Daoist, you are certainly not one of the traitors from the former Xuan Tian Sect. Perhaps we can cooperate to find the whereabouts of King Xuan Tian." Li Fan stared intently at Mo Rubin.

"You know a great deal about King Xuan Tian, but you are unfamiliar with the current Xuanhuang Realm. Ten thousand years have passed, and landscapes have drastically changed. The arrangements left behind by the Xuan Tian Sect might have also disappeared with the upheaval of mountains and rivers. I have already scoured the entire Xuanhuang Realm these years and can directly lead you to the areas worth investigating, greatly increasing the efficiency of our search."

"Furthermore, the remnants of the Ten Immortal Sects have now formed the Five Elders' Council, controlling half of the Xuanhuang Realm. Without my cooperation, even if you possess considerable strength, Daoist, you will inevitably encounter many troubles."

Chapter 1334: True Immortal You Resuscitates

Facing Li Fan's suggestion, Mo Rubin did not immediately respond. He remained silent, deep in thought for a long time.

Gazing at Li Fan, his eyes fell upon his long, streaked-with-white hair. Perhaps it was due to Li Fan's sincere words and his genuinely approaching end of lifespan, that Mo Rubin finally nodded in agreement: "There is no reason why not."

Li Fan nodded joyfully, "Excellent! With your assistance, Daoist brother, we will surely achieve twice the results with half the effort!"

"If that's the case, let us return to the Xuanhuang Realm first!"

The phantom of the wooden sword was unsheathed, and Li Fan extended his hand, inviting Mo Rubin to enter.

Initially, Mo Rubin paid it no mind, but after personally entering the phantom's range and experiencing its incredible speed, his expression finally shifted slightly. His gaze towards Li Fan changed once more.

Finally, witnessing with his own eyes how the phantom's protection allowed them to ignore the suction of the Immortal Ruins and smoothly descend into the Xuanhuang Realm, Mo Rubin could no longer contain himself and said, "It seems, Daoist friend, you are truly one of the most remarkable individuals of this era."

Li Fan gave a wry smile and shook his head, "While I can be unrivaled in one era, I cannot suppress all eras. Moreover, even with all sorts of divine abilities, lifespan will eventually reach its limit, won't it? This divine ability is simply beyond the decree of heaven."

Mo Rubin opened his mouth, but said nothing more.

At this moment, they had descended into the Xuanhuang Realm. Mo Rubin's divine sense swept across the world silently. Upon seeing the vast regions, expanded countless times, and the towering white mist barrier between heaven and earth, even this well-traveled Dharma King of the Xuan Tian Sect couldn't help but show a flicker of astonishment in his eyes.

After a long while, he sighed with emotion, "If I hadn't truly sensed the residual traces of the Star Crossing Great Array, I would never have been able to connect this magnificent world before me with the Xuanhuang Realm of ancient times."

"After ten thousand years, the changes in the world have reached this point!"

Li Fan nodded, "When the world is on the verge of destruction, the changes in all things occur hundreds or thousands of times faster than usual. Observing these changes, their speed is like lightning, their swiftness like light. This is the Dao of Heaven saving itself..."

As Li Fan spoke, he casually conjured an illusion.

Within the ball of light, the Xuanhuang Realm was plunged into chaos, yin and yang disordered; stars dimmed, mountains and rivers trembled; plants withered, birds and beasts fled. It was a scene of imminent apocalypse.

At the critical juncture of life and death, the Xuanhuang Realm indeed gave rise to various reactive changes. Ice freezing and heat dissipating, time flowing and ebbing, heavenly punishment and earthly destruction...

Mo Rubin was momentarily mesmerized.

At a crucial moment, Li Fan let out a light cough and retracted the illusionary ball of light.

Mo Rubin felt a sense of wistful loss surge within him. He faintly sensed that the scene within the ball of light seemed to genuinely contain the principles of the evolution of heaven and earth. For any cultivator, it was an unimaginable treasure. However, Li Fan had only displayed it for too short a time, and Mo Rubin couldn't comprehend much. Moreover, as a Dharma King of the Xuan Tian Sect and a revered elder awakened from ancient times in the Xuanhuang Realm, Mo Rubin did not shamelessly ask Li Fan to display it again.

"Perhaps after we successfully find Brother Xuanyuan and become more familiar, then..." Mo Rubin couldn't help but think.

"Of course, the reason the Xuanhuang Realm has become what it is today, besides the natural changes of the Dao of Heaven, is also due to the clandestine actions of the Transmitting Dharma Heavenly Venerate," Li Fan continued to speak truthfully.

"This Transmitting Dharma is likely a Venerate from the former Heavenly Law Realm. When the Heavenly Law Realm was destroyed, Transmitting Dharma sought to use the only surviving Xuanhuang Realm in the Star Sea for reincarnation..."

"This Transmitting Dharma has cultivated in the Star Sea for thousands of years, their strength unfathomable, perhaps having reached the limits of mortality. I cannot defeat him!"

"We must act cautiously and guard against this person. Transmitting Dharma will not let go of any existence that threatens his revival of the Heavenly Law Realm," Li Fan sighed, offering a kind suggestion.

"This Transmitting Dharma is actually quite decent. It's just a pity that he is destined to be on the opposite side of the Xuanhuang Realm." Mo Rubin observed the incongruous remnants of other worlds within the Xuanhuang Realm, deep within the world, and his belief in Li Fan's words grew stronger.

"What a pity..." In truth, Mo Rubin held a certain degree of goodwill towards this powerful figure who, in name, had overthrown the Ten Immortal Sects. However, upon seeing the scene of the Xuanhuang Realm being dismembered and reshaped, and hearing Li Fan's hushed narration, that already faint goodwill vanished instantly.

"Rest assured, we will act discreetly. Until we find Brother Xuanyuan, we will not confront this Transmitting Dharma Heavenly Venerate." Mo Rubin's gaze constantly swept across the heavens and earth, as if sensing for some trace.

After a long while, he frowned, "It seems the Star Crossing Great Array is indeed severely damaged. We can only sense faint residual aura, and cannot manipulate it."

"Partly due to the passage of time, and partly because during the ten thousand years ago when the Ten Immortal Sects manipulated the Star Crossing Great Array to capture other cultivation worlds, continuous battles ensued. The array was increasingly damaged, yet the cultivators of the Ten Sects were incapable of repairing it, which ultimately led to the array's complete destruction..." Li Fan said slowly.

"At the very least, according to my investigation, that's how it happened." Seeing the sharp glint flash in Mo Rubin's eyes, Li Fan shrugged, speaking with complete honesty.

"How could those useless beings from the Ten Sects possibly manipulate the Star Crossing Great Array?! Unless..." A dangerous aura suddenly emanated from Mo Rubin.

Li Fan subtly shifted his position, agreeing, "It must have been a Dharma King who betrayed the sect and revealed the manipulation method to the Ten Sects."

Mo Rubin's brow furrowed deeply, but he did not respond. After a long silence, he shook his head and said, "Not necessarily. Perhaps they were interrogated after being captured by the Ten Immortal Sects."

Li Fan was somewhat surprised by Mo Rubin's attitude upon hearing this. Because he knew that King Xuan Tian had entrusted the manipulation methods of various sub-arrays of the Star Crossing Great Array to different Dharma Kings separately, to prevent unforeseen accidents. Mo Rubin was responsible for the Spirit Gathering Ascension Array, the Sea of Darkness. As for Ji Yuzhen, she was responsible for the Horizontal Golden Chain. Perhaps sensing Li Fan's emotions, Mo Rubin began to explain his reasons for actively defending them: "Back then, Brother Xuanyuan revealed to me that Ji Yuzhen and Luo Yichen were in charge of the Star Locking Golden Chain..."

"Among the twelve of us, anyone could have betrayed us, except for those two. They would not." Mo Rubin stated with conviction.

Li Fan pondered, "In Dharma King Ji's memories, she deeply adored King Xuan Tian. As for Luo Yichen..."

Mo Rubin nodded, "Indeed, it was only after her heart was set on Brother Xuanyuan that Luo killed all her myriad consorts. From then on, she devoted herself solely to one person."

Li Fan shook his head even more vigorously, "King Xuan Tian entrusted the same task to these two women. This was a foolish decision!"

"Daoist friend thinks too much. The two of them have a very good relationship with each other." Mo Rubin chuckled dismissively.

Li Fan did not elaborate further. While chatting casually, they decided on the first location to search for King Xuan Tian's whereabouts. It was within the Sea of Darkness. Their exploration followed a similar path to Li Fan's in his previous life. After some difficulty, and with Li Fan feigning extreme surprise, they finally reached the central core of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Array. First, they were horrified by the True Immortal corpse in the depths of the Sea of Darkness and the faintly stirrings of the True Immortal's will to survive. Regaining his senses, Mo Rubin paused slightly, "Hmm? It seems someone has been here not long ago!" Li Fan's heart was startled. He hadn't expected that Mo Rubin, despite Li Fan's efforts to conceal his tracks during his previous visit, could still detect it. However, he remained calm, his face showing a hint of pleasant surprise, and quickly asked, "Is it King Xuan Tian?" Mo Rubin did not doubt the person beside him. After all, this array seal was the formidable Immortal Array 'Spirit Gathering Ascension,' and it was not easy for ordinary individuals to break through and enter. "However, there are indeed traces of predecessors who entered this place before. Although they couldn't reach the True Immortal corpse at the very core..." "The people of the Ten Immortal Sects died here. They were likely lured by someone and then killed by the True Immortal's will to survive." "Could it be Elder Cui?" Cui Zhiyuan was another Dharma King who jointly managed the Spirit Gathering Ascension Array with him. While thinking this, Mo Rubin re-examined the traces of this array's activation and still felt something was amiss. "It doesn't seem like the restrictions were directly activated, but rather a forceful breakthrough without damaging the immortal array. Using brute force to overcome ingenuity..." "Furthermore, after the fact, the array was improved to seal the True Immortal's will and prevent intrusion." Mo Rubin pondered for a long time, ultimately finding the identity of this intruder unfathomable. Li Fan, of course, saw his confusion but did not kindly reveal the events involving the Transmitting Dharma Heavenly Venerate in his previous life. Mo Rubin agonized for a while longer before finally deciding to set this matter aside for now. He began to search for King Xuan Tian's trace within the Sea of Darkness. The Spirit Gathering Ascension Array, like a circular observation deck, suddenly illuminated within the Sea of Darkness. Faint fluctuations emanated from it, spreading rapidly through the Sea of Darkness. After a full half-incense stick of time, Li Fan finally sensed these fluctuations returning. Mo Rubin's expression was impassive as he awaited the results of the complete search. It was evident that King Xuan Tian was not present in this Sea of Darkness. Li Fan saw Mo Rubin's brow furrowed deeply again and couldn't help but comfort him, "We'll head to the next location then." Mo Rubin shook his head, "I never expected to find Brother Xuanyuan so easily." "I just feel that this Sea of Darkness is somewhat... off." Li Fan's heart stirred, "What do you mean?" "The Sea of Darkness was established upon the remains of a True Immortal. Although the True Immortal has completely perished, they were, after all, True Immortals. Their methods are far beyond the imagination of us mortal cultivators." "For instance, the 'will to survive' that naturally arises upon sensing a living being's intrusion. The Dark energy accumulated here, compared to back then, seems to have undergone subtle changes," Mo Rubin's expression was rather solemn. Li Fan followed Mo Rubin's gaze and looked into the boundless darkness. Mo Rubin continued speaking in a deep voice, "When a True Immortal perishes, the Dark energy is masterless. But this power was generated utilizing the True Immortal's remains. While everything was dormant, it was fine. But precisely because a sliver of the True Immortal's will to survive was agitated..." "Perhaps under the influence of this will to survive, the Dark energy has become different." Li Fan feigned extreme shock, "The abilities of a True Immortal are so terrifying? What specific changes are you referring to regarding this Dark energy?" Mo Rubin: "It's not clear yet. But one thing is certain: it is evolving in a direction that favors the True Immortal's revival. Even if complete resurrection is impossible, the trend will surely exist." "Perhaps when this Dark energy in the Sea of Darkness encounters life forms useful for the True Immortal's revival, it will launch a similar attack, just like the corpses you saw on the way. Their life essence was completely drained, becoming nourishment for the True Immortal's revival..." "Fortunately, after the transformation by the Spirit Gathering Ascension Array, the Dark energy is far less influenced by the True Immortal's remains than the True Immortal's will. Things are not as bad as I imagined." Li Fan deeply agreed, "The energy accumulated in this Sea of Darkness is already so immense. If it were to break free, it might devour the Xuanhuang Realm in an instant... becoming nourishment for the True Immortal's revival..." Mo Rubin cast a deep look at the Sea of Darkness and nodded in agreement, "If left unchecked, there might be such a day in the future." Li Fan asked curiously, "If, I mean hypothetically, the entire Xuanhuang Realm were used as nourishment, could it truly revive an Immortal's corpse?" Mo Rubin turned to look at Li Fan, remaining silent for a long time. Li Fan's eyes held no malice, only pure curiosity about the unknown. Mo Rubin pondered for a long time, then said, "Just based on energy levels. The current Xuanhuang Realm should be sufficient. After all, it has absorbed so many merged cultivation realms, even if they are only fragmented remnants..." "The living beings of the world may be destroyed, but their origins still remain." "But even if revived, it would likely only be an empty shell, a walking corpse, without its own true consciousness..." Li Fan nodded slowly, "A True Immortal's body is still an extremely formidable existence. If one could possess it, wouldn't it be possible, in a sense, to achieve True Immortality in this era?" Mo Rubin smiled at Li Fan's whimsical thought and did not take it seriously. After failing to find King Xuan Tian in the Sea of Darkness, the two decided to head to the second location: the Eye of the Celestial Beast. "The Eye of the Celestial Beast can not only probe the Star Sea but also monitor the Xuanhuang. It exists independently of the Xuanhuang Realm, connected only by an esoteric link. If the Celestial Beast were still alive, we could reach it directly. But now that the Celestial Beast is dead, reaching it will require some effort," Mo Rubin explained. Afterward, he accompanied Li Fan to Jiushan Prefecture. Looking at the nine continuous mountain ranges standing tall between heaven and earth, a hint of sadness flashed in Mo Rubin's eyes. Then, just like in his previous life, he found the immortal artifact's white jade flagpole within the underground ruins. "This is..." "An immortal artifact?" Li Fan feigned great shock. Mo Rubin was dismissive, "The Immortal Spiritual Power is depleted, leaving only the shell of an immortal artifact." "However, using it to travel to the Eye of the Celestial Beast is not difficult." Mo Rubin used the white jade flagpole as the central core and began to prepare the formation. "During my search for King Xuan Tian, I also encountered some fragments of immortal artifacts. However, they were all like this white jade flagpole, with their Immortal Spiritual Power exhausted. Some were even shattered as if they had suffered immense calamities." "Back then, what kind of calamitous scene did King Xuan Tian witness in the Immortal Realm? It was so catastrophic that even the Immortal Realm could not escape?" Li Fan mused, inquiring as he prepared. Mo Rubin, who was preparing the flagpole, paused slightly, as if lost in memory.

Chapter 1335: The Calamity of the Immortal Realm's Dissipation

"Regarding this question, it's not just you and I. Even the ancient Xuanhuang Realm, everyone who knew that Brother Xuanyuan ascended to immortality and then returned from the Immortal Realm, was immensely curious." Mo Rubin said with deep emotion.

"However, no matter what methods they used to inquire, Brother Xuanyuan never revealed the details. He merely spoke vaguely of a terrifying calamity in the Immortal Realm."

"Even we, his Dharma King brothers, and Ji Yuzhen, whom Brother Xuanyuan trusted the most, were not told."

"It wasn't until Brother Xuanyuan achieved a breakthrough and decided to implement the 'luring the snakes out of their holes' plan that he briefly mentioned the calamity in the Immortal Realm."

"He called it the 'Dao Annihilation'. Although he didn't describe the specific scenes of the Dao Annihilation calamity to us, just these two words sent chills down our spines. All of us Dharma King brothers saw a fleeting look of fear in Brother Xuanyuan's eyes..."

"Dao Annihilation." Li Fan savored these two words, and gradually, an uncontrollable chill spread through his heart. He recalled the fragmented memories he had glimpsed within the True Immortal's flesh and blood.

Broken voices echoed from the towering figure above the True Immortal. "Qionglang Star Domain... Annihilation... Guarding..."

Li Fan mused, "This word 'annihilation' likely refers to the 'Dao Annihilation' calamity. The Qionglang Star Domain suffered a calamity, requiring True Immortals to be dispatched to guard it, or perhaps to guard other star domains to prevent future occurrences?"

Li Fan secretly speculated, "As expected, the calamity that led to the destruction of the Immortal Realm had precursors. The Immortal Realm must have attempted various self-rescue measures, but ultimately could not prevent the spread of the Dao Annihilation calamity."

New questions arose in Li Fan's mind. Did the Dao Annihilation calamity only target and appear in the Immortal Realm? After the destruction of the Immortal Realm, did the Dao Annihilation calamity disappear without a trace? Or, one day, would it reappear in the lower Star Sea? What was the relationship between the Dao Annihilation calamity and the erosion disaster Li Fan had witnessed in the Boundless Mirror and the ruins of the Yishi Sect?

The uncontrolled surge of True Immortal script power swept across the Star Sea, bringing destruction to a vast expanse. Starlight dimmed, transforming into the Utmost Darkness Star Sea. But... life had not been completely extinguished. Not to mention the still vibrant Xuanhuang Realm, even the seemingly dead Star Sea retained its consciousness. With the passage of time, its eventual revival was almost a certainty.

"The destructive calamity encountered by the Utmost Darkness Star Sea is likely on a completely different level than the Dao Annihilation calamity." The word 'annihilation' conjured in Li Fan's mind the image of everything being utterly obliterated under the calamity.

"Perhaps not even fragments of the world would remain," Li Fan felt a shudder run through him.

As Li Fan's thoughts drifted, Mo Rubin continued, "Brother Xuanyuan had instructed that knowing the details of the Immortal Realm's calamity would be more harmful than beneficial to us."

"He even advised us to avoid recalling its name as much as possible, because it might take the opportunity to manifest as a nightmare or a heart demon. Even if we haven't seen its true form, it can still exploit our vulnerabilities."

"He only told us the name 'Dao Annihilation' to instill a basic sense of prevention." Mo Rubin's expression was grave. "If we don't know its name, even if we encounter its signs for the first time, we wouldn't recognize its true nature. But if we know its name, even the first glimpse of its manifestation will trigger a premonition in our hearts."

"In fact, Brother Xuanyuan encountered this world-ending calamity as soon as he arrived in the Immortal Realm. He learned various details about the Dao Annihilation calamity later through his interactions with the Faceless Immortal."

"Enough. Let's not discuss this matter further." Mo Rubin abruptly stopped speaking.

While he was speaking, the formation of the white jade flagpole was prepared. Mo Rubin's expression became solemn as he formed hand seals. The white jade flagpole rose, emitting a halo of light that enveloped them both. "Go!" Similar to Li Fan's phantom wooden sword, the white jade flagpole aimed at the sky, adjusting its direction. Then, the flagpole body exuded specks of white light, accumulating power for a few breaths before shooting towards the sky with Li Fan and Mo Rubin. Although its speed was slightly slower than Li Fan's sword shadow divine ability, the refined, aggressive intent imbued within it, capable of breaking through all obstacles, was something Li Fan's divine ability lacked. The light column formed by the flagpole's passage was extremely thin, with no energy leakage, thus not attracting the attention of Xuanhuang Realm cultivators. Li Fan, inside the flagpole, watched the scenery of the Xuanhuang Realm rapidly recede. Even the suction of the Immortal Ruins only slightly slowed their speed. Mo Rubin, meanwhile, focused on manipulating the flagpole, occasionally dodging areas where True Immortal remnants gathered. Calculating that the white jade flagpole would not collide with that basin filled with True Immortal remnants, Li Fan patiently waited. After flying through the Star Sea for about the time it takes to burn an incense stick, the white jade flagpole suddenly halted. The light dispersed, forming a bubble-like sphere that enveloped them. Then, it violently collided with an invisible barrier layer in the void. The white light bubble perfectly acted as a buffer, dissipating the impact force. Li Fan and Mo Rubin had arrived within the Eye of the Celestial Beast.

"Ah!" A scream immediately echoed in the relatively small area. It wasn't from Li Fan or Mo Rubin, but from Han Zhong, a cultivator Li Fan had seen before who had erroneously entered the Eye of the Celestial Beast due to the teleportation array mishap in Jiushan Prefecture. Trapped for a long time, Han Zhong had already lost hope of escaping. Only the instinct for survival kept him clinging to life. Now, seeing other living people, he first let out a cry of excitement.

Before he could say anything more... Mo Rubin's expression changed slightly. He directly unleashed a black light that struck Han Zhong's body! Alas, Han Zhong's eyes were filled with disbelief as he vanished into nothingness inexplicably!

"Daoist brother you..." Li Fan feigned astonishment. Mo Rubin, however, first conducted a highly cautious inspection, ensuring that no fragments of Han Zhong remained. Only then did he explain, "Although I don't know why this cultivator appeared here, he has already been contaminated."

"It's best to be cautious and prevent infection by rashly coming into contact with him." Li Fan's expression softened slightly, still puzzled, "Contaminated?"

Mo Rubin looked around as he spoke, "It's a very troublesome ailment. Even Brother Xuanyuan found it quite difficult to resolve."

"It should be related to the calamity in the Immortal Realm..."

"However, it's generally very difficult to encounter in the Star Sea. This place is the Eye of the Celestial Beast, so the possibility of contamination is higher."

"The concentration of this ailment in the lower Star Sea is extremely low. It was like this ten thousand years ago, and after ten thousand years, I also investigated it while traveling in the Star Sea. It seems there haven't been any significant changes. But the Eye of the Celestial Beast observes vast Star Domains. When the scale is magnified to a certain limit, even if the concentration is extremely low, it will truly reveal itself." Mo Rubin said, setting up several restrictions around them. These seemed specifically designed to counter this void-borne ailment.

Li Fan pondered Mo Rubin's words. "This ailment, due to the expansion of the observation area, its infection probability has increased... Doesn't that mean that just observing it can lead to transmission?" Li Fan was startled.

Mo Rubin nodded, "Precisely. This is also why I eliminated him without a second thought. Fortunately, the probability of this ailment spreading through ordinary means is low, and I've checked just now. There's no leakage. This place is safe for now."

"Such a peculiar mode of transmission, and related to the Immortal Realm's calamity..." Li Fan appeared worried. "What happens after infection? I didn't see any anomalies in that trapped cultivator just now?"

Mo Rubin conjured several more restrictions. The 'transparent bubble' that had originally tightly encased them, barely large enough for two or three people, slowly expanded as if inflating.

"There were no anomalies because the ailment was still latent within him and hadn't erupted yet. If you came into contact, you would understand its horror. The upper limit of one's spirit and life origin would be reduced. The degree of reduction would deepen with the severity of the infection. In the end, although not dead, one would become as fragile as a piece of paper."

"Even a gentle breeze could blow away your soul. Of course, before that, you would have to endure the various agonies brought about by the reduction of your life origin's upper limit." Mo Rubin sighed with some emotion, "Imagine, others' soft whispers sound like thunder in your ears, even causing your soul to ache and tear. An ordinary touch feels like being violently struck, leaving your flesh and blood mangled..."

"The normal world becomes a doomsday where terrifying calamities unfold ceaselessly in your eyes. At that point, death might be a form of release."

"But because of this ailment, before being reduced to the absolute limit, in order to maintain its propagation, it would instead sustain the host's life. Unable to live, yet unable to die..." Mo Rubin shook his head slightly. "Speaking of which, this ailment is indeed quite troublesome."

Li Fan said this, but his mind flashed back to the scene in his previous life where the Heavenly Physician used a jade bottle to collect the black energy emanating from the deceased Han Zhong. "It would be troublesome if this spread in the Xuanhuang Realm," Li Fan remarked in an odd tone.

"Ten thousand years have passed, and this ailment has hardly spread at all. Even if it has a tendency to spread in the lower realms, the time required would certainly be extremely long," Mo Rubin said casually. His attention was focused on the Eye of the Celestial Beast.

"This transparent space is the Eye of the Celestial Beast? It seems Xuan Tian is not here either." Li Fan expressed some regret.

Mo Rubin shook his head, "This is just an observation point of the Eye of the Celestial Beast. Do you know, little insects in the world are composed of countless small eyes forming a true eye? The Celestial Beast is also like this."

Li Fan suddenly understood. As Mo Rubin continued to cast spells, the transparent bubble shook violently and shrank, as if trying to expel them both.

*Pfft!* The bubble burst, and Li Fan felt a momentary dizziness. The next moment, they were in a strange space. It was like one of countless bubbles floating on the sea. On the arc-shaped boundary, countless identical scenes of other bubbles flashed. Li Fan could even vaguely see himself and Mo Rubin in some of the bubbles outside. However, the appearances, clothing, expressions, and movements of the other 'selves' were all different from the true self. Yet, there was a strange sense of familiarity. Countless 'mes', their gazes intersecting, gave Li Fan a very peculiar feeling.

"It's just a distortion caused by the simultaneous observation of countless Eyes of the Celestial Beast."

"As long as we remain true to ourselves, we will not be deceived." Mo Rubin seemed accustomed to this strange scene. He surveyed their surroundings, seemingly searching for something among the myriad bubbles.

"Brother Xuanyuan did not pass down the method for manipulating the Eye of the Celestial Beast array. Fortunately, I've been here a few times before. I can only slowly search using this archaic method." Mo Rubin said with some helplessness.

The number of Eyes of the Celestial Beast in this place seemed infinite. They appeared to be extremely close to each other, yet also infinitely far apart. Divine sense couldn't lock onto them; one could only observe with the naked eye. Moreover, the countless bubbles were not static. Occasionally, like waves lapping at the shore, countless bubbles simultaneously underwent irregular diffusion, changing their positions. This made most of the previous observations useless. Despite the arduousness, Mo Rubin did not show any frustration, focusing intently on his observation. At the same time, he did not forget to remind Li Fan, "Within the Eye of the Celestial Beast, laws are almost self-contained. You don't need to worry about your lifespan running out. Even if you stay here for ten thousand years, you won't age and die."

"If your end of lifespan comes and you truly don't want to die, you can also hide in here. While it doesn't guarantee immortality, prolonging your life for a few thousand more years should be no problem."

Li Fan nodded. "This Celestial Beast is truly remarkable."

"It is said that its size is comparable to a prefecture of the Xuanhuang Realm. Could it be that King Xuan Tian brought it back from the Immortal Realm?" Li Fan inquired.

Mo Rubin nodded as Li Fan had expected. "Yes and no. Back then, Brother Xuanyuan thought it was merely a dead object, an ordinary jade pendant. Unexpectedly, after encountering water, it actually developed a living aura."

"After careful nurturing, it grew larger and larger, and its combat power also increased exponentially."
